4dc2eaff46e23e4b.title: Marketing Apprentices
4dc2eaff46e23e4b.description:
Location: Peterborough with some home working
Role: Permanent, full time
Commencing: Summer 2022
We have a fantastic opportunity for someone looking to start their career within Marketing. As a Marketing Apprentice, youll be an important part of our wonderful marketing team who place emphasis on teamwork in a fun and professional environment
This role would suit an outgoing and enthusiastic individual, with a can-do attitude and a creative mind. You should be passionate about marketing and the customer experience, be open to learn and develop your skills.
The role comes with an opportunity for you to gain a BA (Hons) Digital Marketing degree qualification, it is fully funded and will be delivered part time over 4 years. You will have a protected 20% of your working week to focus on your study. You will also receive 1-2-1 mentoring to gain practical knowledge and training across the full marketing mix, both online and offline, allowing you to apply what you learn. Upon succesful completion of the apprenticeship we hope to offer you a full time role as Marketing Executive.
Your Job will be:
Supporting our marketing team to do the following:
Creation of social media content
Building landing pages and updating the website
Researching and writing blogs
Supporting with internal communications
Event support
Running email campaigns
Helping to manage leads and contact information within our CRM
Creative campaign asset/image creation using Adobe Creative Cloud suite
Compiling marketing reporting
Designing online marketing campaigns to help promote the business
Other administrative duties to support the practice where required
Working closely with the sales, presales, product team and the wider business
Desired Personal Qualities:
First and foremost, were looking for someone with a passion for Marketing, the desire to learn new skills and progress in their career.
Someone with confidence and energy that can bring their ideas to life and form great working relationships with our internal and external stakeholders.
This opportunity would suit someone who is looking for a fast paced and exciting environment where they can develop their skill set as a Marketer.
Candidates should also:
Be able to work independently and as part of a team
Be highly organised and an ability to multitask
Have excellent attention to detail and time management skills
Be proactive and take initiative
Be creative, yet analytical
Have excellent written and verbal communication skills
Be able to work to tight deadlines and prioritise workload
Degree Entry Requirements
If you are under 24 youre expected to have at least 200 points at A-level or NVQ level 3 (or equivalent), and Maths and English GCSEs (or equivalent) at grade C/4 or above.
If over 24 years and you have relevant work experience but no traditional qualifications after GCSE, or if you have other professional qualifications (e.g. ILM, CMI), we still encourage you to apply as all applications are considered on an individual basis.
About Data Interchange
Data Interchange is a global leader in providing expert EDI and eBusiness solutions. For more than three decades we have been creating connections between businesses and have helped thousands of satisfied customers all over the world to do business electronically. While people trust us for our technical capability and specialist EDI experience, it is our approach that really sets us apart. Data Interchange was founded on the idea of finding brilliantly simple solutions to the challenges businesses face every day. Your place of work will be:
Data Interchange
Rhys House
Minerva Business Park
Alwalton
Peterborough
PE26FT
Why work at Data Interchange?
As well as great rates of pay, we reward our people with a benefits package that includes individual training budget, enhanced annual leave and pension contributions, Private Healthcare, subsidised gym membership, cycle to work & tech scheme, life insurance, fresh fruit, soft drinks and a games room!
Feel like you fit this role, but do not meet all the requirements? We strive for fresh perspectives, so if you can demonstrate how your attitude and other abilities might make up for any gaps, we would welcome your application!
Data Interchange is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion, or belief.

026a322321029244.title: Head of Brand and Content
026a322321029244.description:
Hours: 35 hours
Salary: £53,066 per annum
Type of Employment: Permanent
Department and Location: Marketing and Communication, Hybrid working – London Office W1T
Line Manager: Director of Marketing and Communications
Direct Reports: Brand & Design Manager, Content Manager, Story Manager
Teenage Cancer Trust is looking for a Head of Brand and Content to bring our story to life across all of our marketing and communications activity.
This is your opportunity to make a difference to the lives of young people facing some of the toughest moments in their lives by leading a dynamic team creating impactful content in words, pictures, video and audio. You’ll also lead the creative development of our brand – one of the most exciting and ambitious in the charity sector.
Before Teenage Cancer Trust kicked off in 1990, there was no specialist care and support for young people with cancer. 30 years later, that’s all changed. But, as we emerge from the pandemic, young people with cancer need us more than ever.
That’s where you come in. As Head of Brand and Content you’ll oversee the creation of our cancer information for young people; our graphic design, film and photography; and our storytelling function, which ensures young people’s authentic voices are heard.
You’ll ensure we stand out from the crowd and always seek creative opportunities to bring our brand to life.
We’re looking for an experienced professional who can fulfil the multiple demands of this key role while being a visible and inspiring leader in the Marketing and Communications function and across the wider organisation.
In return, you’ll experience a motivating and energising role in a charity with a great culture and big ambitions to do all we can for young people with cancer.
Applications to be received by: Wednesday 16th March
First Stage Interviews: Week commencing 28th March
Second Stage Interviews: Week commencing 04th April
Job Description
MAIN PURPOSE OF THE JOB
Responsible for the Brand and Content functions at Teenage Cancer Trust.
Lead the creation and implementation of a content strategy including the planning, creation and evaluation of compelling, dynamic content and stories in a variety of media and formats.
Support the Director in the development of the brand strategy and lead on the creative development of the brand.
Lead the development of high quality, clinically accurate and age appropriate information for young people with cancer and their families.
Provide engaging and motivating leadership, coaching, management and development of direct reports.
Raise the profile and ensure the credibility of the Marketing and Communications team across the organisation at all levels, championing content creation and providing professional advice and expertise across the charity.
ROLE FOCUS
Strategy and Leadership
Responsible for leading the development and delivery of the charity’s information and content strategies.
Lead on the development of innovative creative content in a variety of formats to raise the profile of Teenage Cancer Trust and to support key campaigns.
Lead on development of information for young people with cancer, working closely with clinical colleagues.
Working closely with services colleagues, oversee the development of young people’s stories, including the stewardship and safeguarding of storytellers.
Design and deliver team operational plans with budgets, forecasts, activities and targets that are credible, achievable and appropriate.
Develop training and best practice guidelines on content creation and develop these skills across the charity, including processes to maintain consistency across platforms.
Support the development of strategies, tools and applications to increase supporter conversion, engagement and retention, using a thorough understanding of our audiences.
Contribute to the development of the digital engagement strategy.
Contribute to the development of the brand marketing strategy and lead on the creative development of the brand.
Relationships
Plan and resource projects working closely with the Head of Digital and Head of Marketing.
Manage and develop the Brand & Content team, coaching them and supporting their learning and continuous professional development.
Build strong relationships across the team to ensure integration and take joint accountability and responsibility across tasks identified by the Director of Marketing and Communications.
Build and maintain excellent working relationships with all stakeholders sharing skills, knowledge and experience as content expert for the charity, and ensure the content team is positioned as the creative authority within the charity.
Work closely with colleagues during the project planning process to ensure marketing and communications is integrated and there are sufficient resources to meet demands especially at peak times.
Budget and Resource
Manage the content team budget including budgeting, forecasting and phasing of spend.
Provide advice and input into the development of the central marketing budget.
Procure, develop and maintain positive cost-effective working relationships with third party creative and design suppliers/agencies/ partners, negotiating contracts and SLAs.
Develop business cases for future investment in the function.
Risk and Governance
Develop processes to ensure all creative work and content developed is in line with brand and charity messaging and that other teams understand and adhere to these processes.
Responsibility for anticipating, managing and successfully concluding issues related to ownership of content.
Reporting and Evaluation
Provide impact and outcome reports to the Director of Marketing and Communications as well as other key stakeholders.
Keep up with new developments in brand development, digital communications, information provision and content marketing, and identify gaps that Teenage Cancer Trust could exploit and deliver initiatives to capitalise on these.
OTHER DUTIES
Carry out the duties of post in accordance with Teenage Cancer Trust policies and procedures.
Work closely with the Safeguarding Lead, Young Person’s Lead and Story Manager to ensure young people are stewarded appropriately and the use of their stories is appropriate and safe.
Undertake any other duties that are commensurate with the post as requested by your manager.
DISCLOSURE AND BARRING CHECKS
This role will involve some supervised interaction with young people and access to the CARE database. It also manages the Story Manager who is involved in regulated activity and is therefore subject to an Enhanced DBS check.
KEY RELATIONSHIPS
Internal: Director of Marketing and Communications, Deputy Director of Communications and Campaigns, Head of Digital and Head of Marketing. Leadership network, all stakeholders commissioning work from Marketing and Communications. Heads of services, Funded staff including Youth Support Coordinators and influencers.
External: Suppliers.
Person Specification
Essential Criteria
Experience
Experience of working at a strategic level in content creation, including audio-visual content, within a high profile or innovative brand.
Experience of creative brand development including experience in brand refreshes, sub-brand development, content development and marketing strategies.
Experience of developing, implementing and evaluating content strategies which have created shifts in the awareness, engagement and income generating capacity of an organisation.
Experience of creating clinical information to high standards.
Experience of working with people sharing their personal, sensitive stories to support a cause or organisation
Experience of translating organisational and marketing objectives into creative and content planning and delivery.
Experience of successfully motivating, leading and developing high performing creative and content teams, including setting clearly defined objectives and managing poor performance.
Experience of working with a range of stakeholders while project managing and delivering successful campaigns.
Experience and understanding of accessibility in accessing content and the importance of diversity and inclusion in storytelling.
Demonstrable success in project management.
Experience of developing tender documents and decision-making on the use of external agencies, consultants and suppliers.
Knowledge and know how
Good knowledge of design for traditional and digital channels.
Understanding of brand management and development in a digital context.
Skills
Excellent communication skills with the ability to succinctly convey information in a compelling way, verbally and in writing.
Proven ability to build relationships at a high level, work constructively and collaboratively and secure buy-in, negotiate, influence and build credibility.
Proven ability to think creatively with significant experience of encouraging creativity and innovation amongst colleagues.
Ability to prioritise and deliver high quality work with minimum supervision, to be able to multi-task under pressure and bring people along on key decisions.
Exceptional problem solving and decision making skills with a good mix of evidence based decisions balanced with pragmatism, innovation, flexibility and common sense.
Financially astute, numerate and analytical with proven track record of developing and managing departmental budgets.
Highly proficient in all MS Office packages and general understanding of Adobe creative software.
Personal Qualities
Positive, can do attitude.
Calm under pressure.
A natural collaborator.
Values
Commitment to the philosophy, ethos and values of Teenage Cancer Trust.
How to apply:
To apply please send your CV along with a short supporting statement of no more than 500 words. Refer to the person specification and succinctly outline:
Your experience
Your knowledge and know how
Your skills and personal qualities
Applications to be received by: Wednesday 16th March
First Stage Interviews: Week commencing 28th March
Second Stage Interviews: Week commencing 04th April
We are committed to working towards ensuring Teenage Cancer Trust is a diverse and inclusive place to work. We welcome applications from everyone regardless of race, age, gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, faith or disability. We want you to have every opportunity to demonstrate your skills, ability and potential. Please contact us if you require assistance or adjustment so that we can do our best to make the application process work for you. Please contact hr@teenagecancertrust.org
At Teenage Cancer Trust we're committed to delivering a service to teenagers and young adults with cancer that is embedded in safeguarding and safe working practice guidance. In line with our safeguarding approach this role is subject to a DBS check (Disclosure and Barring Service).
For information on how we collect, store and process personal data please refer to our privacy policy: https://www.teenagecancertrust.org/about-us/privacy-policy
Location
Remote, United Kingdom
Salary
£53,066 per annum
Job Type
Permanent
Date Posted
March 2nd, 2022

1a85a84af220aa1d.title: Specialist Global Marketing Procurement: Assets, Influencer & Partnerships
1a85a84af220aa1d.description:
The Specialist, Global Marketing Procurement Assets, Partnerships & Influencers manages strategic transaction management initiatives for global and key operating unit activities.
The bullseye of the role is to ensure we are partnering closely with the business to identify best ‘fit for purpose’ partners and assets to support the business strategy and managing a team of talents to ensure excellent negotiations, contract management and ability to drive incremental value and extended ROI from all partnerships
The role reports to the Global Director, Marketing Procurement Assets, Partnerships & influencers and supports a significant portion of the global $600m+ of marketing spend. The candidate will be a partner to the marketing community.
Responsibilities
 Transaction Management
Manage negotiations for a large and varied portfolio of multi-million dollar sports, entertainment and other marketing relationships and projects.Synthesize business terms and incorporate legal protections into a binding agreement. Understand and evaluate terms and contract language proposed by counterparties to determine items that are and are not negotiable.Explain to clients the obligations owed and benefits due the Company under its contractual relationships such that clients understand and appreciate the implications that such relationships may have on the Company's strategic decisions and conduct.Track usage terms and expiration dates of all assets with related third-party permissions/rights.Work collaboratively with Marketing, Legal, Finance and other key partners to consolidate work streams and drive efficiency and effectiveness.
Responsible for inputting into & improving upon existing processes and systems using significant conceptualizing, reasoning, and interpretation.
Qualifications and Requirements
7+ years of total business experience.
3+ years of Business Affairs, Legal, or other relevant transaction management experience (such as with other major consumer-products company or professional firm providing services to such company).
Strong knowledge of professional sports sponsorship across teams, strong knowledge of Affiliate, Promotion, Licencing & content deals ( Netflix, Hulu, Disney, Google etc.), ideally strong knowledge of emerging partnership programs with music, e-sports / gaming.
Ability to understand long-term implications of business decisions and balance immediate needs against those precedent-setting implications.
Knowledge of business partners (such as customer, bottler, service agent, supplier) in their context: industry trends and competitive pressures, strategies and plans, organizational structure, decision-making process, contacts, technology infrastructure and systems.
Ability to work as part of a virtual global team to collaborate across geographic and organizational boundaries to deliver better business results and share best practices
Ability to use data and apply robust analytics to model various business scenarios and analyze resulting cost, impact, risks, and benefits to inform and recommend business solutions.
Ability to build trusted relationships quickly.
Ability to convince others within and outside of the organization to agree/accept new concepts, practices, and approaches impacting subfunctional/business strategy.
Travel: Up to 20%
Skills:
Global Sourcing; Category Management; Procurement Procedures; Budget Management; Competitive Market Analysis; Contracts; Microsoft Office; Buyer Representation; Communication; Supplier Relationship Management; Low Cost Country Sourcing; Problem Solving; Marketing Capabilities; Sourcing; Negotiation; Technical Category Procurement; Supplier Financial Analysis; Economic Cost Drivers; Continuous Improvement (CI)
Our Purpose and Growth Culture:
We are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors – curious, empowered, inclusive and agile – and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. When we collect your personal information as part of a job application or offer of employment, we do so in accordance with industry standards and best practices and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.

99b162edc671cbb2.title: Health Care Compliance Specialist ESO & GCSO
99b162edc671cbb2.description:
Closing date for applications - Friday, March 18th
The Health Care Compliance Specialist Janssen Pharma HCC ESO & GCSO will support the Janssen EMEA Strategy Organisation (ESO) and Global Commercial Strategy Organisation (GCSO) in managing Health Care Compliance program transactions for the Health Care Compliance organization.
The Health Care Compliance Specialist supports planning, trainings, assessments, monitoring and other varied HCC program functions.
In this role, The Health Care Compliance Specialist will share time to support the Janssen EMEA Strategy Organisation (ESO) and Global Commercial Strategy Organisation (GCSO)
This position reports to the HCC Snr. Mgr. Janssen ESO.

Qualifications
Required:
Administration experience required.
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills, including formal presentation skills required.
Strong ability to use analytical skills and work in a detailed manner.
Demonstrated experience in prioritizing needs and implementing system or process enhancements preferred.
Preferred:
Experience in Compliance, Finance, Auditing, Sales and Marketing, Medical Affairs, Legal, Pharmacovigilance, Regulatory or Quality experience in the Medical Device or Pharmaceutical industries.
Knowledge and experience in the application of web-based reporting tools, website maintenance and/or knowledge of SharePoint is a preferred.
Deals well with ambiguity and demonstrates strong organizational, process and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently in a virtual environment.
Ability to work well in teams and effective time management skills are crucial.
Candidate will possess a high standard of work ethic and professionalism to co-workers and customers.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
The Health Care Compliance Specialist will work with the ESO and GCSO HCC teams on various support activities which may include but not be limited to the following:
Developing, organizing, implementing, and tracking training, maintain employee certification and training attendance records.
Carrying out day-to-day tasks such as data collection, analysis, and reporting, collect and provide metrics to support the HCC program.
Supporting new procedure and policy harmonization and implementation.
Support the implementation of HCC Pharma Goals and Objectives, strategy & plan.
Support the Third-Party Due Diligence process, assist in the red flag management process.
Support the HCC teams in the Risk Assessment processes to identify future trends, risks, process gaps & inconsistencies impacting the HCC program.
Support the execution of the HCC Monitoring Plan.
Occasionally assisting in coordinating preparations for Testing and Audits.
Support the HCC teams in managing day-to-day inquiries, unplanned deviations.
Provide general admin support to the HCC teams.
Lead or participate in projects.
Improve working methods.
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE:
BA/BS, advanced degree or equivalent preferred and a minimum of 2 years business experience
5% travel is possible

COMMENTS: This position description is an outline of the major recurring responsibilities of the job. It is not intended to be all-inclusive of the work to be performed. Other related job objectives, special assignments and less significant responsibilities will typically be performed by the incumbent(s).

c8a42d96bfd4857a.title: Apple Growth Marketing- Test Automation Specialist
c8a42d96bfd4857a.description:
Summary
Posted: Feb 7, 2022
Weekly Hours: 35
Role Number:200338941
The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionised entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple Growth Marketing, and help us leave the world better than we found it! The Growth Marketing Operations team in Apple Services is looking for a Test Automation Specialist who will be responsible for design, creation and execution of End to End automated tests and framework. This role will place you in a dynamic environment with some of the most passionate, creative individuals in the industry. You will take accountability for improving the test coverage and efficiency through the implementation of automated tests. The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated individual with experience implementing innovative solutions that drive higher quality across the integrated software solutions delivered by the team.
Key Qualifications
5 - 7+ years in Quality Assurance and/or User Acceptance Testing with proven track record in test automation for end to end systems
Expertise in Python with a focus on writing test automation scripts
Developing automation scripts for End to End scenarios and maintaining the automation suites
Hands-on experience with Selenium, Appium, and Javascript (Node.JS) to automate testing
Experience with tools like Charles, GIT, Jenkins etc.
Good understanding of software build tools and CI/CD integrations
Experience with design and creation of test automation frameworks and tools - with specific focus on End to End Test and On Device mobile testing
Experience with front-end, API and back-end test automation scripting and execution
Experience with automation of data analytics and data reporting across multiple systems
Experience with testing activities across the entire lifecycle of the project from inception to delivery
You’ve worked closely with in-house QA/UAT teams to resolve bugs and delivered solutions to operations planning, retrospectives, and release readiness
Description
The ideal person will bring experience in online services (SAAS), test automation on mobile devices and a strong background in data testing. Your primary focus will be to design, build, maintain and implement automation scripts to enable higher efficiencies in testing. Create and maintain automation frameworks that are scalable and extensible to meet the needs of the organization Work on design, development and maintenance of automation test scripts Design and develop technical solutions for validation of data across multiple applications and dashboards Extend existing test automation or create new scripts to provide a high level of test coverage across existing functionalities and new features Design and build of automation frameworks for End to End testing across mobile, web, and API based systems You understand and have developed automation scripts to improve testing efficiencies (including associated reporting showing performance of script)
Education & Experience
BA/BS preferred, or equivalent work experience
Additional Requirements
Apple’s most important resource, our soul, is our people. Apple benefits help further the well-being of our employees and their families in meaningful ways. No matter where you work at Apple, you can take advantage of our health and wellness resources and time-away programmes. We’re proud to provide stock grants to employees at all levels of the company, and we also give employees the option to buy Apple stock at a discount — both offer everyone at Apple the chance to share in the company’s success. You’ll discover many more benefits of working at Apple, such as programmes that match your charitable contributions, reimburse you for continuing your education and give you special employee pricing on Apple products.
Apple benefits programmes vary by country and are subject to eligibility requirements.
Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Apple is a drug-free workplace

4a26617173d05bdb.title: Full Time Sales Consultant - Bicester Village UK
4a26617173d05bdb.description:
Christian Dior Couture offers more than a beautiful brand to our clients; we invite them to be part of the heritage, to share our passion for luxury and to be part of the Dior family. We look for the same desire in our employees, to have enthusiasm and passion about being part of the House of Dior.

We are currently seeking a Sales Consultant with an expertise in luxury sales to join our Bicester Village boutique, to develop client relationships and to become a specialist in Dior couture.


Responsibilities:

To greet, serve and advise customers giving the highest standard of customer service at all times.
- Develop loyalty with our customers by building relationships with customers through a 1-2-1 personal shopper style approach to sales.

To demonstrate product knowledge on all categories and to have an awareness of current advertising & marketing campaigns, new launches and promotions.
Introduce add-on sales and achieve maximum sales potential in line with individual and departmental targets
To deal effectively with customer complaints by liaising with the line manager when necessary.
Ensure a knowledge of sales targets and [department/boutique] performance on a daily and weekly basis
Follow all stock management procedures
Support the team to maintain the highest standards of housekeeping and display within the [department/boutique]
To be conversant with selling systems, cash and credit and exchange procedures.
To maintain the highest standards of housekeeping and retail standards within the store
Take all actions necessary to maximise security and prevent theft of product
To ensure that the Department operates in accordance with the Company administration systems and procedures to minimise losses
Participate in team meetings and make a positive contribution
To carry out any additional duties as directed by the management team.

Profile
Experience Required:
Previous experience within luxury fashion
Excellent communication and relationship building skills
An existing client book (preferred)
A passion for Christian Dior and our collections
Strong knowledge of fashion and trends
Fluency in a second language (preferred)

ef26077ee2b26998.title: Regulatory Submission Specialist
ef26077ee2b26998.description:
Salary: £Competitive + excellent benefits (bonus, life cover, healthcare etc.)
Location: Flexible (any UK office), hybrid or remote, fully remote
About the role
You will manage clients' medical-legal regulatory (MLR) review processes to enable the successful planning and approval of promotional pharmaceutical messaging. This includes the submission, retrieval, and distribution of documents for review and revision. As the authority on all things regulatory, you will understand key milestones in project delivery process and work with internal and external stakeholders to ensure required activity is met in a timely way prior to moving onto the next milestone. You will also engage with the MLR coordinators to ensure adherence to their submission guidelines and best practices.
About Fishawack Health
Fishawack Health is the leading global commercialization partner for the modern life science era. Established in 2001 and headquartered in the UK, the organization is powered by a 1,300+ globe-spanning pack of strategic, creative, and scientific experts. We empower healthcare professionals and patients with the knowledge they need to live better lives.
Our core operating units—Medical, Marketing, Market Access, and Consulting—bring together best-in-class capabilities from around the world. We empower our pharmaceutical, biotech, and medical technology clients to navigate the most complex of ecosystems, helping them on an effective path to develop, launch, and grow their brands, services, and portfolios.
Our internationally recognized, award-winning teams collaborate across operations in the UK (Brighton, Fleet, London, Knutsford, Manchester, Oxford, and Sale), Ireland (Dublin), USA (Chicago, Evansville, Minneapolis, New York, Philadelphia, San Diego, Scottsdale, and St. Louis), Greece (Athens), and Singapore.
What you’ll do
Own all promotional submissions on assigned accounts, ensuring accurate and timely regulatory submissions for distribution
Master submission software (Veeva Vault PromoMats) and processes for assigned accounts
Communicate review timelines and expectations clearly to teams
Carefully verify file specifications to ensure adherence to client and agency standards
Link, tag, annotate, and manage error-free submissions to ensure timely approval decisions
Provide regular status updates to team in a timely manner, including downloads and distribution reviewed submissions
Maintain harmonious relationship with client promotional review coordinators, supporting preferred vendor status
Adhere to, and help develop, standard operating procedures
Manage reference documents within the brand folder on the server, ensuring an organised, trusted reference library accessible to team members
Assist in populating and maintaining a claims matrix for each assigned brands
About you
Ideally 4-years' post-secondary education or equivalent experience
Previous experience in the preparation of complex deliverables in other regulated fields (i.e., scientific, medical, finance, or legal)
Data and document management experience preferred; must be computer literate
Proficiency in the use of MS Office, specifically Word, PowerPoint, and Excel Proficiency in Veeva or other MLR software is preferred
What we can offer
We offer a creative, supportive environment with a uniquely diverse career structure, where you will be able to develop and tailor your career towards your preferred route. Our Fuel50 talent experience platform will enable you to pick and map a career journey across the organisation, providing you with the option to progress within different areas of your team or beyond. Our Pack Academy provides a broad range of training delivered live and on-demand, which supplements on-the-job training and project team-led initiatives. We also offer a generous company pension, private medical insurance, various employee wellbeing initiatives, plus many other excellent employee benefits.
We encourage all applicants to read our company Privacy Policy before applying to a role.

6086a8a4f184cae1.title: Receptionist & Events Specialist
6086a8a4f184cae1.description:
What does a UKOC Ambassador & Events Specialist do?
The UKOC (Operations Centre) is responsible for the production and supply of Bacardi’s Scotch Whisky and Gin, including DEWAR’S®, ABFERFELDY® and BOMBAY SAPPHIRE®.
The UKOC Ambassador & Events Specialist is a varied role providing our guests with a seamless experience to our site, conveying the quality of our product as well as our heritage and culture. Additionally, this role will lead key internal and external engagement activities for the UKOC, such as managing our onsite bar and fostering a strong relationship with our commercial partners and the community. You will spearhead initiatives such as our annual Founders Day celebrations, CSR events, Reward & Recognition activities, and branded workwear refreshes.
This role is responsible for running and managing the reception area and activities but flexibility on core activities will be key. The role will also help assist with in-house events and be responsible for the mailroom and conference areas.
About You
You will have experience and background in a front of house reception, be well organised, able to prioritise workload in an ever-changing environment and possess excellent communication skills. You will have a proactive and can-do attitude with the ability to respond quickly and effectively. With excellent interpersonal and customer service skills, you welcome visitors to our site in line with our values and culture. You will be able to build strong relationships with primos at all levels of the organisation.
You will have experience in an administrative role and be proactive and willing to learn new tasks, always looking to execute to a high level and improve processes. You will have strong organisational skills and be able to multitask varying priorities
This would be an ideal position for a graduate who is looking for an entry into Communications, Marketing, or HR.
Hours: Monday – Thursday 8 AM – 4:30 PM; Friday 8 AM – 12 PM
Please note, this is an onsite role that is not eligible for remote working.
Responsibilities
With our Consumer at the heart, your key focus will be to:
Be the face of our brands as the first person visitors meet onsite. Create a 5-star experience for visitors to our site by welcoming them to our local site and keeping a FOH
Core front of house duties, e.g. welcoming guests and informing the local contact of their arrival, answering phone, responsibility of managing meeting rooms and relevant catering options, complete opening and closing procedures, assisting all visitors in administration needs like taxi bookings, offering/collecting PPE, refreshments, communications for Visitors (e.g. Safety video; visitor maps) etc.
Act as a local brand ambassador, driving the communication of the quality and authenticity of the brands and their intrinsic values. Brand Advocacy and Brand Connections. Actively seek out opportunities to increase JDSL/UKOC profile within Bacardi and community.
Responsibility of the on-site company bar area including completing stock checks, bar displays, and organising events such as masterclasses and mixology sessions.
Responsible for the co-ordination and implementation of inhouse events and brand/heritage initiatives such as Founder’s Day, Back to the Bar, and Back to the Shelf
Lead Reward and Recognition initiatives for the UKOC – including the Above and Beyond programme / Reward & Recognition Committee, the Spot Recognition programme for managers, and promoting/tracking metrics for the Cheers platform
Coordinate Branded Workwear refreshes with the aim of building brand pride in our organisation. Seek and incorporate primo pride and ensure products reflect quality of our brands
Ensure the conference areas reflect the standards required and liaising with the relevant business areas to facilitate visitors to attend tours as required.
Ad-hoc Administrative support within the HR team such as:
Reward & Recognition, Product Allowance, and gift issues
Issuing / mailing and supporting relevant comms e.g. bulk mailers
Raising purchase orders
Managing mailroom and stationary orders
Support audits
HR Metrics & reporting
Ad-hoc communications on Dewar’s Connection
Support engagement initiatives across the business and any other tasks as set
Skills and Experience
The Skills & Experience needed to create your legacy
Have experience and background in a front of house role.
Be well organised and possess excellent communication skills.
A good background and knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) is needed.
Experience of SAP would be advantageous.
The following experiences are preferred:
Bachelors Degree in HR, Business Management, Marketing or equivalent
Personal Qualities:
High energy and flexibility
Role model for 3 F’s culture (Fearless, Founders’ Mentality, and Family)
A warm and welcoming manner and ability to interact in an engaging and professional manner with all levels.
Be pro-active with the ability to respond quickly and effectively in a changing environment.
A customer care attitude and strong sense of excellence in service (“a ringing phone cannot be ignored”).
Able to prioritise workload and meet tight deadlines.
A passionate ambassador of our site, people and brands. An interest in expanding their remit and role to ensure that all visitors have a 5-star experience.
Our culture
We share the passion and entrepreneurial flair of our founder and are guided by our three culture pillars - Fearless, Family and Founders, they inspire our Primos to be the best they can be and drive us forward in all we do. But what does this mean? Being Fearless; means adopting an agile mindset, being comfortable trying new things and taking risks. We are empowered to question, challenge and innovate. Family; We treat each other, and our communities, like Family. Always.
 Founders; The spirit of entrepreneurship is at the heart of everything we do. We see the business as if it’s our own. We do the right thing for the business and we all take accountability for our work.
When you join Bacardi, you become part of our family and gain more than just a job.
Disclaimer: Bacardi is an equal opportunity employer that values workforce diversity. Diversity is core to our business: by embedding diversity into all aspects of our culture, we maximize the opportunity to achieve sustainable business success and growth. The duties and responsibilities described in the role profile might not be a comprehensive list.

1734b975662c22c6.title: Social Media Marketing Specialist
1734b975662c22c6.description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a Social Media Marketing Specialist to join our Marketing team and have real impact working for a fast-paced, growing, ambitious business. Rackspace Technology is looking for a dynamic, innovative, Social Media Marketing Specialist to grow its social audiences, connect with target markets, and power its social selling opportunity in alignment with the wider EMEA marketing and sales strategy.

You will plan and implement creative organic campaigns which engage our target audiences and grow our social presence. They will deliver programs to drive the amplification of content and the execution of social selling across the Rackspace community. They will work with the Global Social Marketing Manager and EMEA/Regional marketing managers to align to broader campaign motions and to publish content such as news, events, launches, campaigns, customer stories and PR via Rackspace social channels. Consistently using best practices, their mission will also include educating Rackers on how Social Media applies to their role and finding ways to motivate them to use it to achieve their goals.
The successful candidate must have excellent communication and organisational skills, a passion for engaging and growing social audiences, a creative and innovative approach, a strong understanding of the power of connected sales and marketing and the determination and passion to succeed within a fast-paced organisation.

In summary we are looking for a social media evangelist to empower EMEA rackers to become social sellers in the own right and drive the persona of Rackspace Technology on social as a partner for innovation.
Community Management
Establish direction for storytelling for the EME audience leading to a defined content strategy
Create and adapt written and visual content for specific social media channels which speaks directly to the target audience, grows the Rackspace following and yields more leads. i,e,by industry, segment or persona,
Triage inbound communications and determine appropriate methods to address questions and comments
Respond to and/or escalate support issues according to established processes
Organic Social campaigning
Manage and aggregate content from key stakeholders . i.e. demand generation, PR, events, global campaigns to ensure a joined up approach to market through organized campaign launches and form into an EMEA social strategy/content plan
Manage local agency relationships contributing to the organic social campaigns
Understand and analyse social media data to draw actionable insights and make informed decisions
Continually test new strategies, content, campaigns and ideas, and refine the social strategy based on results.
Social Listening
Look for campaign opportunities and growth initiatives (i.e. tactful newsjacking and hashtag adoption) by tracking industry news and trends and understanding what new methods are emerging on social media networks.
Identify industry influencers from media, industry bodies, partners, advocates and government and develop a plan to influence them via our social content.
Execute social listening to track sentiment relating to Rackspace Technology, our competitors and our target market, find opportunities to re-tweet and amplify positive sentiment and opportunities for Rackspace Opinion. Using social listening tools, evaluate and analyse data to discover insights and trends affecting Rackspace
Social Selling
Act as Social Selling enabler by championing the use of GaggleAMP and Sales Navigator amongst the sales teams and senior stakeholders. Monitor and report on usage and share individual success stories.
Act as an advisor to marketing, HR, support, and other business units in planning and managing social selling campaigns on Twitter / LinkedIn and any other channels
Key Requirements
Knowledgeable of and a demonstrable passion for social marketing
Experience of using relevant social media platforms
Experience conducting social listening
Understanding of social selling methods and the ability to motivate sales and senior stakeholders to use them
Experience and proficiency creating, managing, and coordinating organic social campaigns
Experience of community management communicating brand messages and values through social media
Excellent writing, copy editing, and grammar skills
Experience writing and optimising social content that maximize engagement and demand generation
Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced, matrixed team
Experience handling and responding to customer inquiries/complaints using social media
Understanding of social media metrics and how to capture,analyse and report them.
#LI-SB1

About Rackspace Technology
We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world’s leading technologies — across applications, data and security — to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.

More on Rackspace Technology
Though we’re all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. We welcome you to apply today and want you to know that we are committed to offering equal employment opportunity without regard to age, color, disability, gender reassignment or identity or expression, genetic information, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity status, military or veteran status, nationality, ethnic or national origin, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or any legally protected characteristic. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

1fb21dd34e7c133d.title: Performance Marketing Specialist
1fb21dd34e7c133d.description:
Here at Direct Line Group, we recognise the importance of flexibility, not only in our personal lives but also in the way we work. Our mixed model way of working offers a 'best of both worlds' approach combining the best parts of home and office-working, offering flexibility for everyone.
We’ve ditched the daily commute for a virtual first approach. If you do come into the office, there are exciting workspaces and zones you can use, depending on the type of work you are doing
How much you’ll be in the office depends on your role, and we’ll consider the flexible working options that work best for you. Please get in touch with the team to discuss.
What we're looking for:
Educated to Degree level and/or professional qualification preferably with a maths or science-based background
3+ years digital marketing experience in an agency or client side in house role ideally with hands on experience of delivering paid search campaigns
Strong analytical, communication skills, & commercial awareness are essential
Strong experience with data, analytics systems, ad servers and other 3rd party tracking technologies
High level of stakeholder management and demonstration of industry expertise
Strong influencing skills, attention to detail, creativity, strong relationship skills, tenacity and the ability to quickly prioritise high volumes of work
Ability to present ideas and opportunities with a view of securing commitment quickly on channel development initiatives
What you'll be doing:
This role is a great opportunity to join an agile organised client-side performance marketing team and help the strategic delivery of performance marketing across a range of channels. The primary focus of this role will be within the PPC specialism but will also be largely responsible for affiliate marketing and has the potential to be involved in delivery of Paid Social, Email, DM & VOD.
The team have a responsibility for delivering circa 50% of marketing driven sales & a big internal focus from the business for driving performance and leading on the trading conversation. The successful candidate will have excellent digital skills and drive incremental benefit to a business with progressive ideas and optimisation techniques. They will also be confident with delivering numerical understanding and relating that to our business and customer actions.
This role is to work hand in hand with our Paid Search agency across selected Direct Line Group brands and products. Defining and driving the strategy and optimising the channel performance to deliver & exceed, the agreed volume and efficiency targets. We also deliver affiliate marketing in-house so the candidate would quickly gain exposure to managing affiliates & affiliate performance directly.
This role predominantly requires strong hands on performance channel management & measurement using web analytics, data studio dashboards & integration with econometrics to optimise delivery and update internal stakeholders on progress and market considerations. An agile & adaptable attitude is essential, with a great grasp of digital trends and innovation that we can leverage.
What we'll give you:
We're always encouraging internal development and you'll have access to loads of learning opportunities, events and conferences to build your industry knowledge. DLG has received numerous accolades for our working culture over the last few years, and this is because of the dedication and passion we have for developing our colleagues; a place where you can truly build a long-lasting career

dfc079ec57e0fcd7.title: Marketing Specialist
dfc079ec57e0fcd7.description:
i2 has been a market leader in Intelligence analysis for over 30 years, being a core capability for the worlds leading organisations in the National Security, Defence, Intelligence and Commercial space. The i2 Marketing Specialist will be responsible for the owning i2’s digital presence, using their creative and copywriting skills to communicate the value that i2 can bring to it’s customers.
Responsibilities
Generate engaging marketing material for use via multi-channel marketing
Plan, prepare and manage the publication and distribution of marketing materials
Oversee design, content and updates to the website(s)
Organise marketing events, exhibitions, virtual conferences etc
Work with Sales and Product management to build compelling marketing campaigns
Represent the company at marketing/sales events
Analyse the impact of marketing campaigns and prepare measurement reports
Recruit and manage junior marketing/digital marketing resource
Qualifications
Proven success in a senior marketing role with ability to engage customers to drive sales
Experience of marketing enterprise software or in the public sector
CIM qualification an advantage
Proficient with corporate productivity and web presentation tools
Experience working with Salesforce.com or similar CRM
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively
Strong understanding of various routes to market including sales through a strong channel partner ecosystem
EO Statement


i2 is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. i2 is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

99c8836e6d1ec1c0.title: PSO Marketing Specialist
99c8836e6d1ec1c0.description:
Company Description
Meet Unit4. We’re a fast-paced growth cloud company, changing the game in ERP for mid-market people-centric organizations. We’re on a mission to turn 40 years of conventional legacy ERP software on its head and re-write the industry.
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
Job Description
Unit4 is seeking a Marketing Specialist who will be responsible for monitoring, reporting on and partially executing global campaigns through various activation channels. Targeting private sector industries with a focus on Business & Professional Services, Architecture, Engineering and Construction, Financial Services, IT & Software Services and Marketing, for a B2B SaaS Cloud solution. Able to report on multiple performance metrics into senior leadership, you will report to the go-to market lead and work closely with the Content Marketing Specialist for your target industries.
We are looking for an individual who is analytical, very structured and organized, a multi-talented marketing professional who enjoys a broad variety of tasks. You need to work with marketing teams across the globe to succeed, so collaborative skills are a must. Ultimately this role is focused on ensuring our sales teams reach their targets within our Professional Services business.
Responsibilities will also include, but not limited to:
Collaborate with regional teams to deliver global campaigns to drive leads, MQLs and opportunities
Analyse and report on campaign results, ROI and customer data. Drive improvement initiatives such as campaign optimization
Monitor A/B tests across channels to continuously optimize campaign and channel performance
Monitor and communicate progress toward quarterly and annual goals
Communicate key programs and assets to internal stakeholders including product management, sales, partners and business development
Create industry specific performance reports monitoring multiple metrics
Qualifications
Minimum 3 years experience ideally in a B2B software company
Hands-on Marketo experience highly desirable
Strong data and analytical skills
Experience of CRM and BI tools highly desirable
Expertise in both traditional enterprise sales process and SaaS sales models ideal
Experience with marketing ERP, HCM and FPA solutions highly beneficial
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Team player who can effectively collaborate across borders and culture
Additional Information
Join Unit4 and you’ll be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the ERP cloud software space today.
A culture built on trust. That’s why we offer our people an uncapped time off policy and remote working opportunities. We focus on results, not how many days you work or where that work takes place
One of the most lucrative commission plans in the industry and a range of market-leading benefits
World-class sales tools and a pipeline development engine in the form of a global BDR team.
On-going monthly learning & development opportunities
Work, learn & be inspired by some of the best talent in the software space
Talent program for high performers. Each year we provide a platform for high potential talent to accelerate their careers!
Committed to corporate social responsibility with our Act4Good initiative, our global movement to do good, and a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society
Diversity4U. Helping our people thrive starts with a safe and inclusive work environment. We launched our Diversity4U program that builds on our “be genuine” value

d67f07652b4c0c57.title: Marketing Specialist
d67f07652b4c0c57.description:
Exciting Opportunity for a Global Organization
Creative freedom given to successful candidate
About Our Client
Over the past 2 years this business have gone from strength winning contracts with some key organizations in the UK. They have continued to ensure that their level of service has been market leading to keep them ahead of competitors. This sole position requires someone who's looking to express their creative ideas and experience within the business to build the brand internally and externally. Due to this being a new role, you will be given great freedom to carry out your idea in a way that will greatly enhance the companies image.

The Marketing Specialist will be expected to:

Innovative brand ambassadorship to drive corporate identity in appearance, demeanor, values and ethics

6ea6404bace622cb.title: Email Marketing Specialist
6ea6404bace622cb.description:
We have great people here and are looking for more. Come join us - you will love it!
The Email Marketing Specialist will support essential marketing initiatives with the Email Marketing Manager. This role has intimate working knowledge of email marketing best practices, marketing automation systems, coding experience, and understands CRM and Marketing Automation relationships. This role will work closely with Marketing teams to help bring their campaigns to life through email and ensure optimal performance and execution.
Job Description:
Work closely with Vertical Marketers and Integrated Marketing Managers to build HubSpot campaigns, email assets, landing pages, forms, and workflows.
Build and Monitor reports across various email campaigns to ensure they’re functioning properly and troubleshoot areas where program health and deliverability are impacting program results.
Drive email Best Practices and consistency within the team to adhere within CAN-SPAM, CASL, and GDPR Guidelines.
Collaborates with Vertical Marketers, Integrated Marketing Managers, Digital Marketing, Marketing Operations, and other internal stakeholders to create best in class experiences via email.
Create and maintain marketing email segments for deliverability, cleanliness, optimal engagement, and performance.
Proofread emails for clarity, grammar, and spelling
Assist in the creation of compelling and mobile responsive templates and modules
When needed, provide overflow support to the broader marketing operations team.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree
2-5 years of proven experience as an Email Marketing Specialist; Experience designing, building, and launching successful email engagement programs, specifically nurture programs and drip campaigns
Strong understanding and hands on experience with Marketing Automation platforms; HubSpot certification preferred
Deep technical knowledge of email best practices and a/b testing methodologies within HubSpot or similar Marketing Automation platforms
1+ years' experience with Salesforce, Tableau, and Excel; Advanced Excel a plus
Knowledge of SEO/SEM and Google Analytics
Hands on experience with HTML/CSS and content management systems
An ability to work under tight deadlines
Outstanding communication skills – written and verbal
Problem-solver with strong analytical skills, strategic thinking, and operational acumen
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Follow us:
www.instagram.com/sterlingcheck
www.linkedin.com/company/sterlingcheck
www.facebook.com/SterlingCheck/

7f227087c6bed65e.title: Digital PR Specialist
7f227087c6bed65e.description:
As the world’s first B Corp certified Google Premier Partner, we are looking to bolster our incredible team with an Outreach/Digital PR Strategist.


We are looking for an outgoing and creative Digital PR Specialist to work in our Digital Marketing team. You will be working alongside our digital strategists to help develop digital outreach and PR strategies to drive awareness and engagement of a wide range of clients.
You’ll develop relationships with journalists and create and pitch compelling content to key media and publications. You’ll love to experiment with new ways of communicating stories, have a strong team ethic and a burning desire to get brands talked about online.
You’ll work closely with our digital strategists to develop compelling quarterly campaigns to sell to relevant journalists, editors and bloggers to help increase the visibility of our client's brands.
This role can be at our Norwich HQ or remote.
Proven experience in digital PR and outreach essential
Agency experience an advantage but not essential
Strong writing skills a bonus but not essential (we have dedicated content writers in-house)

High-level of online proficiency essential
A proactive, positive attitude and willingness to make things happen
Creative thinking and excellent research skills and an ability to create unique stories and compelling campaign ideas that really stand out and attract coverage

Experience across various verticals with both larger brands and small businesses would be beneficial, however not essential. Above all, we are looking for someone with a great personality, with an edge that makes them stand out from the crowd
Excellent communication skills for outreach and pitching (over the phone, and in-person)
Be able to analyse a company, product, content piece or raw data to find a story and hook
Be full of ideas about how even the most seemingly boring of companies can get mainstream media coverage
Great organisational and time-management skills
Track record of SEO strategies and tactical success
Proven link building experience
In return, we will offer you:
Extremely competitive salary
Work for the world’s first B Corp certified Google Premier Partner
25 days holiday as a basic, with more earned through continued service (effectively 29 days with bonus days off below)
Extra days off at Christmas
Birthday holiday off
Trees planted and extra carbon offset every Selesti work anniversary
A highly experienced, award-winning team to work with and learn from
Constant career progression with work time allocated for training
Workplace pension scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Carbon positive workplace
Christmas and Summer parties
Access to paid-for private counselling & a nutritionist
Time off for your children's birthday
Volunteer time
Flexible working - nobody will tap their watch if you prefer to start late or finish late because you love the gym before work. Our focus is on your ability to deliver for the business and our clients, not your ability to keep strict working hours.
B Corp member discounts

Planet-first digital for brands with purpose

We're a values-led B-Corp that encourages putting people first, honesty, curiosity and leadership.
Selesti is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We want to be a workplace with a diverse mix of talented people who want to thrive and do their best work.
If this sounds like the perfect role for you, please get in touch by sending your CV and cover letter to us.

d2b002e099c56dca.title: Sales Specialist - DePuy Synthes CMF - North West
d2b002e099c56dca.description:
For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) have been part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Our commitment to respect the dignity and diversity of all is embedded in our Credo.
We know that the success of our business depends on having the best talent in a workforce that reflects the diverse markets we serve around the world and an inclusive culture that values different perspectives and life experiences
That is why we in the UK are working to create an inclusive environment where diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences are valued and each and every one of our people feels that they belong and can reach their potential. No matter who they are.
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Johnson & Johnson means “You Belong”!

Who are we?
Profound Change Requires Boldness. Johnson & Johnson is the largest and most broadly-based healthcare company in the world. We’re producing life-changing breakthroughs every day and have been for the last 130 years. The combination of new technologies and your expertise enables amazing things to happen. Teams from J&J’s consumer business are crafting digital tools to help people track the health of their skin. Those working in medical devices are 3-D printing artificial joints personalized for each patient, while researchers in pharmaceuticals use AI to discover lifesaving drugs. Imagine what the rest of our team of 134,000 people at 260 companies in more than 60 countries across the world is accomplishing. We redefine what it means to be a big company in today’s world.

Johnson & Johnson – DePuy Synthes CMF
DePuy Synthes is the largest, most innovative and comprehensive orthopaedic and neurological business in the world. DePuy Synthes offer an unparalleled breadth and depth of products, services and programs in the areas of joint reconstruction, trauma, spine, sports medicine, neurological, craniomaxillofacial, power tools and biomaterials.

We have an exciting role within our team as a Sales Specialist supporting the North West region.

Purpose of the role
Achieve agreed objectives and sales targets as outlined in the annual performance cycle.
Within allocated geographical region, interact and promote products to key customers and stakeholders in secondary care.
Manage territory through the development of comprehensive business plans. Focus on highest value opportunities to grow and develop new business including taking competitor share and the adoption of new technologies whilst maintaining key customers and core business.
Manage and develop accounts and own the relationship between the Company and the customer, ensuring efficient alignment of all efforts to maximise impact of all activities driving growth.

What to expect:
You will build strong networks of relationships that enable the identification of mutually beneficial opportunities to sell key technologies in the surgical procedural environment.
Presenting brand value propositions and value-added customer solutions to positively influence buying behaviours.
Thereby analysing and interpreting account strategies and plans utilising key systems and data, both internally and externally, where appropriate to gain a broad understanding of the business environment and insights in to account needs.
Partner with Professional Education to develop and maintain associated KOL relationships as well as championing the effective use of the Company’s comprehensive Professional Education offering.

Who will you be working with:
Reporting into the Regional Sales Manager, you will work closely with the following people:
Marketing
Professional Education
Commercial Excellence
Strategic Capabilities
Customer Services

Qualifications

Who are we looking for?
To excel in this role, you will have a proven track record in Surgical Sales
Influencing and business partnering skills – understands stakeholder’s requirements, ability to analyse requirements and develop strategies that drives the adoption of technologies and become a trusted business advisor providing solutions
Ability to build trust with customers by asking probing questions that helps the customer achieve their objectives, acting in a consultative manner
Effectively utilise the Company’s selling tools (Integrity Selling)
Maintain deep clinical expertise in procedure and product knowledge

What type of mark will YOU make?
By joining Johnson & Johnson you will find boundless opportunities to craft your path & amplify your impact inside & outside our walls. And with our commitment to be the world’s healthiest workforce you can strengthen your body as well and your mind. When you work at Johnson & Johnson you can touch over a Billion lives worldwide every day. And when you apply your talent to our collective purpose there’s no end to the lasting impact we can make together. And that changes everything.

What’s in it for YOU?
It’s important to us that you feel you can bring your whole self to work; at Johnson & Johnson we provide an environment for you to fulfil your career aspirations as well as promoting your physical and mental wellbeing. As part of our offering, you will receive a competitive compensation and benefits package as well as benefits that can be tailored to what is valuable to you throughout different stages of your life. Examples of this include: online Digital GP, private healthcare, Retail Vouchers, Discounted & Subsidised Gym memberships and you can get to support community projects as part of our global Corporate Social Responsibility programme.

The Marketing Automation Specialist will act as a subject matter expert to ensure end-to-end delivery of email communication to Wealth Management clients and advisors.
You will maintain a campaign calendar and work with internal stakeholders to gather requirements, develop templates, filter audiences and deploy messages within the Salesforce Marketing Cloud ecosystem. The role requires an understanding of marketing automation best practices including GDPR laws. Through optimization and A/B testing, you will continually improve the Wealth Management email experience to a best-in-class standard. You will manage relationships with marketing partners and deliver a high level of business performance, employee engagement, and a superior client experience.
What will you do?
Develop and QA email templates with dynamic content ensuring they render correct across defined email providers and devices
Segment audiences in data extensions using AMPscript
Schedule and deploy email campaigns and journeys
Maintain reporting metrics and dashboards
Develop and QA email templates with dynamic content ensuring they render correct across defined email providers and devices
Maintain a campaign calendar with stakeholders
Troubleshoot ad-hoc deliverability issues
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Proven experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud or similar email marketing platforms
Experience with email development using HTML and ampscript
Understanding of GDPR requirements

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. a8c3d29435ea91e4.title: Digital Marketing Specialist
a8c3d29435ea91e4.description:
Digital Marketing Executive
Britvic - Plenish
London - Hybrid Working
At Britvic we’re on a journey to become the most dynamic soft drinks company.
As one of the UK’s leading players in the FMCG market we pride ourselves on setting
high standards, being courageous and pushing ourselves to think outside the bottle.
About this Role
This is an exciting opportunity to join one of the UK’s fastest growing plant-based drinks brands. As a truly omnichannel brand that’s evenly split across online (a significant D2C business as well as major online retailers) and in-store (national grocery & OOH), this is a demanding role that requires a combination of customer-centric thinking & cutting-edge digital marketing. It’s hard work but lots of fun as you constantly seek to keep us one step ahead of the competition through a combination of brilliant digital marketing and best-in-class CRM.
As a stand-alone business unit that plugs into the full breadth of Britvic’s resource & expertise, you’ll work within a close knit cross-functional Plenish team that works in an agile way to scale fast. A growth mentality is key – on both a personal and commercial level.
Responsibilities:
Own the implementation of the digital marketing strategy to build brand awareness & consideration, drive trial/conversion & promote retention of high value customers
Work closely with the E-Commerce Manager to implement key acquisition & retention initiatives for D2C across both paid (social, search, affiliates) and owned channels (CRM, rewards/loyalty programmes, advocacy, influencer)
Work closely with the Senior Brand Manager on brand digital marketing campaigns (paid social, VOD, digital display, online content partnerships)
Work closely with Head of Content & Community on always-on owned channel activation plans (owned social, on-site content, social partnerships, influencer)
Day-to-day management of all Plenish’s social media channels, email marketing (defining & targeting different cohorts, test & learn campaigns) & affiliate programme
Bring insight from each of these channels & collaborate with the e-Commerce Manager/Senior Brand Manager to inform & amend our strategy
Develop & implement creative content across those channels (writing social posts & emails, briefing the designer on key visual content, collaborating with media agencies on asset banks etc)
Skills & Experience:
2-3 years experience working in digital marketing for a D2C brand
Experience in CRM/email, affiliates & paid social essential. Paid search experience desirable.
Budget control, performance monitoring and CPA/ROAS management experience desirable.
Good with data & experienced in analysing platform data (especially email) to reveal insights and inform channels plans. Experience in audience segmentation and targeting high desirable
Experience in implementing, monitoring & reporting on test and learn processes
Familiarity with Klaviyo & Woocommerce desirable but not essential
Key Behaviours:
Great team player, working together to deliver great results (We’re stronger together)
Creates respectful relationships with colleagues built on openness, honesty and trust (We Care)
Works with the highest standards of integrity and with great pride (We’re Courageous)
Constantly challenges ways of working for continuous improvement (We own it)

We’re committed to providing equal opportunities to all applicants and employees – in fact, this is at the heart of our company culture and values, and we welcome applications from candidates with diverse backgrounds.

bdb30cb2c55f3efc.title: PPC Performance Marketing Specialist
bdb30cb2c55f3efc.description:
Permanent
Full Time
Salary
Excellent
Country
U.K
What you will be doing...
Reporting to the Performance Marketing Lead, the PPC Performance Marketing Specialist will join a team which plan, manage and optimise budgets that drive over 50% of all bookings on the web platforms across our business. The PPC Team work in close partnership with Google and Microsoft enjoying the numerous benefits of these close relationships.

Hands on PPC experience is essential for this role, you will plan, develop and implement large-scale campaigns across Google and Bing and work closely with the teams managing Paid Social, Programmatic, Aggregators, Affiliates and App. You will also alongside the wider marketing teams including Data Science, Content, Brand, CRM and Studio to make sure creative is consistent and campaigns are performing to an effective ROI.

Key responsibilities will include:
Plan and implement large-scale PPC campaigns, making recommendations on account performance and dealing with large scale budget changes on an ad-hoc basis.
Large campaigns = lots of insightful data – get the opportunity to make informed data-driven decisions on your performance marketing activity.
Produce and send reports to the wider Performance Marketing Team and senior business stakeholders
Identify opportunities that can support new growth/efficiencies for the business.
Staying fully up to date with all platforms and their key features.
Communicate with a wide variety of stakeholders, both internally (up to CEO) and externally – the role is a highly visible one in an important team
Working closely with the Data Science team across industry leading attribution and audience projects.
Test the latest betas and product releases with Google & Bing
Work alongside specialist in related teams with exposure to Facebook, Instagram and Skyscanner amongst others
Be part of a big, exciting, and vibrant wider marketing team
The successful candidate will:
Have at least 6 months hands on PPC experience
Bring strong experience of working in a Digital Marketing environment
Be a highly proficient user of MS Office, with advanced knowledge of Excel
Effectively communicate and influence at all levels
Bring robust numerical and data analysis skills, with the ability to provide actionable recommendations.
Have experience using our key platforms, including any of the following: SA360, Google Ads, Microsoft Bing, GA4, Campaign Manager, Facebook, AWIN, DV360 and the wider Google product suite.
In return, we offer an excellent salary and benefits package with fantastic opportunities for progression in a growing business. This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting forward-thinking business. We operate scheduled leisure flights to holiday destinations in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands and to European Leisure Cities from our 10 UK bases.

Help us to send our all-important customers on their well-deserved holidays with Jet2.com and Jet2holidays!!
