58409f31ddb59399.title: Corporate Sales Specialist, Chrome OS
58409f31ddb59399.description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
Experience managing the sales cycle for accounts

Preferred qualifications:

Ability to view the big picture and the minutiae, demonstrating excellent attention to detail and analytical skills
Excellent organizational and project management skills
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills
About the job
Chrome helps organizations empower their employees, serve their clients, and create what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Chrome OS and browser products are engineered for security, reliability, and speed, delivering a truly modern OS to companies worldwide. Our teams are dedicated to helping our end users and partners see the benefits of our technology come to life.
As a Corporate Sales Specialist focused on Chrome, you will work with Sales Engineers, Deployment teams, and certified partners to introduce Chrome to our customers. You will help our prospective customers and partners understand key technical features and solve business and technical challenges, ensuring they maximize the benefits of these products in their workplace. You will also liaise with Channel Management, Product Management, Marketing, and Engineering teams to help further develop mid-market plans. As part of this team, it will be key for you to keep up-to-date on industry trends and propose enhancements to our platforms.
Responsibilities
Refine and implement go-to-market strategies for Chrome solutions for the region.
Work toward strategic business goals and optimize all leads and opportunities.
Prepare and deliver product messaging to highlight the value of Chrome for the workplace.
Execute partner enablement, including trainings, briefings, and joint customer workshops. Travel to customer sites for conferences and meetings as needed.
Gather customer and partner feedback to aide product development.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

688dd28f4e167016.title: Investment Specialist - Equities
688dd28f4e167016.description:
About the opportunity
The role will require a strong understanding of the strategies covered and the portfolio managers’ investment process. It will involve conducting/commissioning in depth fund analysis (e.g. performance attribution, competitor analysis, liquidity analysis, risk exposure, macro sensitivity, revenue exposure, style biases…) to better understand the funds’ biases and sensitivities, and better manage clients’ expectations and explain performance patterns.
It will be your responsibility to provide informative responses to queries within the agreed timescale, either through your own knowledge or through information sourced from elsewhere in the company. The role will also involve the writing and timely distribution of fund updates, tailored as appropriate for different types of clients, as well as drafting press articles on behalf of portfolio managers. Playing an active (and in some cases leading role) in projects which will enhance our investment proposition, systems enhancement, the development of portfolio management tools, product restructuring and strategic marketing.
The expansion of Fidelity’s capabilities into areas such as systematic investing and total return brings greater complexity to the team’s work - the Investment Specialist plays an active and integral role in supporting these areas of our businesses, together with the team’s more ‘traditional’ core offering. The Investment Specialist is assigned specific areas of coverage, where they will become expert, however, the demands of the business mean that team members must be prepared to operate cross franchise to meet the evolving demands of / cyclical nature of our business to balance the workload across the more demanding IS role.
Key Responsibilities
Understand each fund’s investment approach, characteristics and key selling points.
Work closely with Investment Directors, both pro-actively suggesting ideas for fund updates as well as sourcing information in response to client queries.
Tailor and edit content provided by Investment Directors to reinforce core fund messages and make it appropriate for onward distribution.
Write and distribute fund updates including key portfolio changes and stock stories, and ensure compliance requirements are met.
Ensure timely and relevant response to client investment queries.
Work closely with Product Specialists in India to ensure timely, high-quality, reporting and presentation updates
Review, and contribute to, RFP content for new opportunities/mandates
Understand the key barriers to sale for priority products and deliver solutions through effective communication.
Understand which information is relevant to client-facing personnel and ensure effective distribution.
Be proficient in understanding how to extract and interpret technical fund information from company IT systems.
To be familiar with and adhere to the requirements of Fidelity’s code of ethics and disclosure rules.
Experience and Qualifications Required
Good investment knowledge, preferably CFA
Strong communication and excellent writing skills
Language skills, preferably fluency in European Language(s)
Excellent attention to detail
Strong technical skills
Ability to work with data sets, proven analytical skills
An independent thinker
An initiative taker
Positive/can do attitude
Ability to prioritise all projects and work quickly to meet demanding deadlines
Strong team player
Proactive approach
Good knowledge of Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Ability to source information from within company systems.
Eager to learn
Experience of Bloomberg, Thomson Reuters Eikon/Datastream or FactSet would be a plus.
This is an SMCR role
About you
About Fidelity International
Fidelity International offers investment solutions and services and retirement expertise to more than 2.56 million customers globally. As a privately-held, purpose-driven company with a 50-year heritage, we think generationally and invest for the long term. Operating in more than 25 locations and with $783.6 billion in total assets, our clients range from central banks, sovereign wealth funds, large corporates, financial institutions, insurers and wealth managers, to private individuals.


Our Workplace & Personal Financial Health business provides individuals, advisers and employers with access to world-class investment choices, third-party solutions, administration services and pension guidance. Together with our Investment Solutions & Services business, we invest $567 billion on behalf of our clients. By combining our asset management expertise with our solutions for workplace and personal investing, we work together to build better financial futures.


Our clients come from all walks of life and so do we. We are proud of our inclusive culture and encourage applications from the widest mix of talent, whatever your age, gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, social background and more. We are a disability-friendly company and would welcome a conversation with you if you feel you might benefit from any reasonable adjustments to perform to the best of your ability during the recruitment process and beyond.


We are committed to being a truly flexible employer, encouraging and trusting our people to perform their role in the way that works best for them, our business, our colleagues and our clients. We offer the maximum possible flexibility over where and when you work for all, considering your role and any local regulations. We call this new approach "dynamic working".

Find out more about what we do, our history, our new approach of "dynamic working" and how you could be a part of our future at https://careers.fidelityinternational.com/about-us
Applying to this Job Role: Please note you are only required to upload your CV/Resume to the application screen.

677d32578994f1fb.title: Senior Lecturer in Marketing
677d32578994f1fb.company: University of the West of England
677d32578994f1fb.description:
Job description
About us: The Marketing Events & Tourism (MET) subject group sits within the Department of Business and Management and are seeking someone who can contribute fully to departmental activities, including , research, teaching and external engagement.


The focus of this role is to deliver outstanding learning outcomes for our students though exceptional teaching and learning on academic programmes within the department and also to engage in, research. knowledge exchange or other activities that enhance and inform teaching design and curriculum development.


We deliver an innovative practice-led curriculum where research informs teaching practice at UWE Bristol and have a range of well-established stakeholder engagement activities regionally, nationally and internationally.


About you: Candidates should hold a postgraduate qualification, or extensive industry experience in a relevant discipline, and be committed to teaching and research. The post holder will join a vibrant and growing Marketing & Events team comprising 39 academic members of staff, and will be expected to make a significant contribution to teaching activities of the group at undergraduate and postgraduate levels.


We particularly welcome applicants with emerging research profiles, or industry experience and proven ability to teach and lead in the areas of:

Service Design, Customer Relationship Management, and International Business.


The nature of the subject group's teaching means that candidates should be confident, outgoing and comfortable working as part of a teaching team on large modules as well as independently on specialist marketing modules. Candidates should also demonstrate ability to use innovation within teaching via their use of learning technologies or other engagement methods.


This post is based at our lively Frenchay campus where we have invested in the latest facilities and resources to give both our staff and students access to everything they need to succeed – with £300m having been invested recently on new state-of-the-art learning spaces and accommodation while incredible new facilities continue to be developed to enhance our offer even further.


Frenchay campus has excellent transport links; as well as being located near the motorway network we are within walking distance of two train stations, our bus terminus connects us to the local bus and metrobus network and we also have a range of cycling and changing facilities, making our campus the ideal place to work for those commuting to Bristol.

Why UWE Bristol?

We are one of the largest providers of Higher Education in the South West with 32,000 students, 250,000 alumni and 4,000 staff from across the globe. We are both globally connected and regionally embedded, with a strong network of employer and partner connections.


We have a lot to be proud of at UWE, our achievements include scoring above sector average for student satisfaction, we are ranked 36th in The Guardian Best UK Universities 2022 and 39th in the latest Times Higher Education 'Table of Tables'.


We are an ambitious and values led university. We're focused on solving future global challenges through outstanding learning, world-leading research and a culture of enterprise and we are looking for people who share our core values to help us achieve those aims.


With inclusivity as a core value, UWE Bristol recognises the power of a truly diverse university community. We support and celebrate the diversity of our staff and students as a key driver for innovation and success, promoting pathways and achievements to inspire and generate confidence and ambition.


In addition to progressive pay rates, UWE Bristol offers a wide range of employee benefits including:

a generous holiday allowance of 35 days pro rata
up to 12.5 bank holiday/closure days per year
flexible working
excellent defined benefit pension schemes
access to employee assistance programme
ongoing learning and development opportunities
family friendly policies and wellbeing support initiatives
onsite nursery at our Frenchay Campus.
savings on purchases via Wider Wallet scheme
option to participate in the cycle to work scheme


Further information


If you would like an informal discussion about this opportunity please contact email: tracy.hunt-fraisse@uwe.ac.uk


This is a full time post, and is full -time working on a 100% contract.


This post is available on a job share basis.

Interviews are scheduled for 15 December 2021.


The University will be implementing a hybrid way of working once restrictions from Covid 19 end therefore you will be expected to work on campus for part of your working week. Exact days will be agreed with your line manager.


We particularly encourage applications from Black, Asian, Multiple Heritage or Other Minority Ethnic candidates as we are currently under-represented in these areas within UWE Bristol however all appointments are made on merit.


Proud to be part of a vibrant, multicultural city that celebrates diversity, we’re always on the lookout for talented people from all backgrounds to join us. Our people are our strength, and diversity enhances our creativity and leads to better decision-making and problem-solving. Bring your talent and ambition to our growing staff community of over 4,000 individuals and find yourself in a stimulating and supportive environment where you’ll thrive. Add your individuality to ours to help set us apart.


We are able to sponsor qualifying candidates for this role under the Home Office Skilled Worker visa route. Please read our Skilled Worker Guidance to assess if you will be eligible to be sponsored under the criteria.


Please also refer to the Home Office Right to Work Checklist which provides details of which documents are acceptable to prove your right to work in the UK. Should you be shortlisted you will be asked to produce your right to work documents at your interview.

bf68340c90a75c82.title: Digital Marketing Specialist EMEA
bf68340c90a75c82.description:
Company Description
At Western Digital, our vision is to power global innovation and push the boundaries of technology to make what you thought was once impossible, possible.
At our core, Western Digital is a company of problem solvers. People achieve extraordinary things given the right technology. For decades, we’ve been doing just that. Our technology helped people put a man on the moon.
We are a key partner to some of the largest and highest growth organizations in the world. From energizing the most competitive gaming platforms, to enabling systems to make cities safer and cars smarter and more connected, to powering the data centers behind many of the world’s biggest companies and public cloud, Western Digital is fueling a brighter, smarter future.
Binge-watch any shows, use social media or shop online lately? You’ll find Western Digital supporting the storage infrastructure behind many of these platforms. And, that flash memory card that captures and preserves your most precious moments? That’s us, too.
We offer an expansive portfolio of technologies, storage devices and platforms for business and consumers alike. Our data-centric solutions are comprised of the Western Digital®, G-Technology™, SanDisk® and WD® brands.
Today’s exceptional challenges require your unique skills. It’s You & Western Digital. Together, we’re the next BIG thing in data.

Job Description
The Digital Marketing Specialist EMEA role will be responsible for planning and execution of the digital marketing campaigns, in line with the strategy developed by the EMEA Digital Hub and regional marketing teams. It includes digital advertising campaigns development, execution, and reporting.
This role will be responsible for the in-depth analysis of campaign performance, benchmarks, data insights and analytics in relation to campaigns run by the EMEA team as well as wider advising ecosystem, including trends, issues, and opportunities within the digital marketing discipline.
The role requires candidates who are business oriented, working comfortably with cross functional teams (sales, business marketing, regional marketing, product marketing, Marcoms, etc) and agency partners.
Will report to a Sr. Marketing Manager EMEA.
Domestic and international travel may be required.
The Responsibilities
Execute digital campaigns against the EMEA marketing plan and digital strategy, ensuring alignment with the sales funnel and based on the analysis of data and insightsWork with the EMEA Digital Hub agency to brief, launch, optimise and report on Pan-EMEA digital campaigns each quarter across multiple media channelsProvide in-depth analysis of the digital marketing campaigns reports; draw and share insights on performance that will be used for strategy recommendation, including conversion data from ad spend trackingWork with cross functional teams (BU, Marcoms, regional teams, etc) and regional agencies to leverage and /or create the best content for digital campaign objectives; manage assets localizationWork closely with the EMEA regional marketing teams on coordination of the retail partner spend split and campaign links for all campaigns each quarterCoordinate LinkedIn ad placement for the Devices and Enterprise businessAlign with the WD Store team on digital marketing objectives and coordinate ad spendProvide campaign briefing / snapshot slides and distribute reporting slides along with insights and strategic recommendations to respective stakeholdersProactively put budget proposals for each quarter in line with strategy and delivering highest ROIManage budgets; process campaigns POs and invoices according to WDC financial processesRun and analyse monthly reports, lead monthly performance reviewsCreate monthly & quarterly sales and marketing team update presentations as well as ad hoc reports for specific campaigns and peak seasonsProvide updates for the monthly Digital Hub calls with the respective regionsPotential to grow within the job and, as the business grows further, to take on added responsibilities (e.g., programmatic in-house solution etc.)Build cross-functional team relationships and work across all departments to ensure paid channels are fully utilised as part of the brand marketing strategyContinually monitor advertising trends; provide insights and recommendation for WDC strategy

Qualifications
Must Have
Experience of the media planning and media buying processTechnical knowledge of digital marketing advertising platforms
Skills & QualificationsThorough knowledge of digital marketing trends and proven ability to design bespoke campaigns based on required goals (awareness, consideration, or conversion) and consumers’ path-to-purchaseTechnical knowledge of digital marketing advertising platforms such as Google (Display & Paid Search), SEO, social media channels (Facebook, LinkedIn, etc), and programmatic advertisingProven track record of having sole ownership and financial responsibility of projects.Budget management, allocation, and trackingCopywriting and content creationExperience in managing agency partnersExperience in digital marketing reporting, including creating reports & presentationsHighly numerate and able to use numbers effectively both internally in managing the business and externally in negotiatingProven strong data interrogation and analytics skillsAdvanced level ExcelExperience managing different markets as well as product categories and cultural awareness/regional knowledge is an advantageAbility to multi-task, prioritise and meet deadlines and work well in a team settingExcellent oral and written communication skillsAbility to build and nurture strong cross functional team relationshipsAbility to multi-task, prioritise and meet deadlines and work well in a team setting2+ years’ experience with digital advertising (Amazon Advertising, Google Ads, Bing Ads, Facebook Ads…)Fluent English required, additional foreign languages are an advantageBachelor’s Degree in Business or Marketing or equivalent. Must be technically literate and proficient
Additional Information
Western Digital thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. We are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution.
Western Digital is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. Please contact us at staffingsupport@wdc.com to advise us of your accommodation request. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

dd260971d1b1cdec.title: Technical Marketing Specialist
dd260971d1b1cdec.description:
JOB TITLE Technical Marketing Specialist

LOCATION Leatherhead
ABOUT UNILEVER
Unilever is one of the world’s leading suppliers of Food, Home and Personal Care products with sales in over 190 countries and reaching 2 billion consumers a day. Unilever has more than 400 brands found in homes around the world, including Persil, Dove, Knorr, Domestos, Hellmann’s, Lipton, Wall’s, PG Tips, Ben & Jerry’s, Marmite, Magnum and Lynx. Faced with the challenge of climate change and the need for human development, we want to move towards a world where everyone can live well and within the natural limits of the planet. That’s why our purpose is ‘to make sustainable living commonplace”
In September 2020, Unilever announced the intention to build a new sustainable campus site in Kingston, London to house the employees who currently work in 100 Victoria Embankment in Blackfriars, Lever House in Kingston, Unilever House in Leatherhead and Graze in Richmond. We are creating our own Unilever sustainable, agile work environment, purposefully bringing us together in our own Unilever ecosystem. The campus is due to be completed in December 2023 and will consist of two interconnected buildings, as well as landscaped surrounding areas.
JOB PURPOSE
TRESemmé, Dove, TIGI, Love Beauty & Planet and V05; are among the world’s most recognisable Hair Care brands developed by Unilever’s Global Development Centre in the North West of England.
Hair Care is a fast paced and innovation driven category with a high degree of consumer engagement. With an energising purpose, Beauty that Cares for People, Society & our Planet: Making Beautiful Hair a Force for Good , it offers talented people the opportunity to shine, make a real impact to the lives of consumers lives and to the business, as well as to learn and grow.
This role is an amazing opportunity to be part of the team that develops product claims and communications for our superior products and technologies.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Deliver outstanding communication ideas for our Hair Care products and Brands.
Gather technical support for product claims and develop technical narratives on multiple projects.
Develop new methodologies and tools to create new & exciting consumer and product insights for new claims and communications.
Work with brilliant, inspiring and diverse global teams.
Be the crucial link between global and local marketing, technical & legal teams to balance and manage different needs and ambitions.
Create striking technical communications, visuals and live demos that bring technologies and innovations to life.
Understand the needs and attitudes of our consumers, in order to connect with them with relevance and in the Bbrand tone-of-voice.
ALL ABOUT YOU
Great people skills; building and maintaining relationships with an ability to be persuasive and assertive when necessary.
Preferably a degree in a physical or social science. Some chemistry background would be great; curiosity in the latest innovation and technology is essential.
Claims, consumer research and/or product development experience.
Excellent presentation skills and an ability to describe science and technology in a compelling and impactful way to a variety of audiences.
Strong analytical skills and an ability to interpret data to pull out key insights.
Project management and problem solving skills.
Our team is at the forefront of developing and supporting the planet positive Hair Care stories of tomorrow for our brands. An enthusiasm or some experience for sustainable beauty is highly desired.
WHAT WE OFFER
Not only do we offer a competitive salary, but also our pension scheme, an annual bonus, a free gym, a staff shop and shares. You’ll get the opportunity to work directly with our renowned and exciting brands in a flexible and agile environment. We strive to achieve a family-friendly culture and to, above all, create possibilities for all.
Diversity at Unilever is about inclusion, embracing differences, creating possibilities and growing together for better business performance. We embrace diversity in our workforce. This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity.
Recruitment Fraud:
Cyber criminals advertise fake job adverts with prestigious employers as a way of stealing information or even defrauding individuals out of money.
In the most sophisticated cases, they will set up fake websites, which have a similar address to companies like Unilever. They even conduct fake telephone interviews and then offer candidates a role with the proviso they pay a fee for background checks or to cover work visa costs. These types of attacks are becoming more common as more people are looking for employment in the economic climate.

3177d5cc72c4a5cd.description:
*Work from anywhere on the planet! Our HQ is in London but we have teams working remotely all over the world.*
Do you have previous creative content production experience?
Are you looking to join a dynamic & forward-thinking marketing agency, specialising purely in Crypto/NFT projects?
Confident you have what it takes to work with some of the best Crypto brands in the world?
If so, you’re in the right place!
CryptoPR is THE market-leading crypto marketing agency. We are aligned with some of the best clients and projects currently (and soon to be!) on the market, and our rapidly growing team requires a Youtube Marketing Specialist, as we continue in our quest to dominate this industry.
We are looking for a creative and experienced Youtube Marketing Specialist to help execute curate, commission and schedule Youtube content in accordance to our CryptoPR clients social media strategies.
You will be part of the fast-growing team and get an opportunity to learn from some of the best people in the industry!
Here’s a flavour of what you’ll be doing in a normal week:

Develop specific channel growth plans for YouTube
Provide regular reporting on Youtube performance, with recommendations on how to optimise and grow our Youtube influencer inventory.
Maintain Youtube Influencer relations to collaborate with our client.
Manage all influencer communications on behalf of our clients.
Work closely with the marketing team to rank and optimise clients' videos on Youtube.
Help develop clients YouTube presence and consolidate video assets across multiple platforms.
Brainstorm with team to build a video editorial calendar that incorporates persona-driven, high engagement pieces.
Develop video assets that help increase brand awareness and social following; track analytics to prove success.
Organise internal and external video shoots. Write scripts, research necessary topics, coordinate props, setup equipment, etc.
Edit videos to be posted on YouTube and social media.
Work with the SEO team to apply appropriate analytical tactics to increase engagement

You’ll be a great candidate if:

You have a minimum 3 years of creative content production experience with evidence of success in previous roles.
Ability to multitask several creative projects simultaneously.
Work under pressure to meet tight deadlines.
Be a creative thinker, articulate and persuasive and able to communicate initiatives and outcomes to a broad range of stakeholder groups, at all levels of business.
Exceptional organisation and planning skills.
Excellent attention to detail.
A team-oriented individual who is happy to work independently as required.
Trustworthy, reliable and punctual at all time.
"What’s in it for me" we hear you ask?
 A brilliant opportunity to grow your career & work with a fun, fast-paced & growing company, prepared to let you shine

 An entrepreneurial environment where you learn more every day (we more than welcome and support people with their own projects)
 Build an organisation right from the "beginning"
️ Personal responsibility with a ton of autonomy
✈️ Truly remote working (Work anywhere in the world)
️ 33/30 free paid days
 Market leading remuneration and bonuses + revenue/profit shares available
 A budget for your professional development and ongoing learning
 An international team with over 35 nationalities
About us:
Based in Central London, but adopting a flexible and remote approach; Finixio is a Lead Generation and Affiliate Marketing company, building websites appealing to audiences worldwide. Our sites cover news, education, comparison and reviews, within the following exciting niches:

Cryptocurrency
Forex & Online Trading
Stocks & Shares
Personal Finance, Loans, Banking
Cyber Security & Software Technology
Casino & Online Gaming
Health & Nutrition
As part of a wider group, Finixio was formed in 2018 and is currently home to over 50 Websites / Brands - with more in the pipeline. It is a fantastic time to join our team of specialist digital marketers. With proven track records in our respective fields - we are well funded, highly profitable (yes, already!), and primed for significant growth.

Marketing Director
Are you looking for an exciting new challenge? Are you an experienced marketing professional with skills across retail and digital? Are you ready for the next step in your marketing career? Yes? Then we may have just the right role for you…
We are regarded as the trusted decorating and DIY retail brand in London, selling paint, tools, plumbing, electrical and woodwork materials throughout our 32 stores, serving the trade and retail customers. We are looking to develop our marketing to grow sales within retail stores, increase our trade customers and improve our online presence.
At Leyland SDM, we are proud of our specialist DIY and Decorating product knowledge we provide. We’re looking for a highly skilled Marketing Director to help us promote our offerings, and identify what consumers want so we can create more.
You will have the chance to set strategy and drive growth in the business, by building on our USP and brand. We want you to build a dynamic team to support you in achieving the business goals.
As the Marketing Director you will be responsible for overseeing the development and implementation of marketing strategies for Leyland SDM, as well as overall enhancing the brand image and our identity.
We are looking for somebody who has:
Strong marketing experience both on and offline
Held senior marketing roles, ideally in a retail / multi-site business environment
Marketing qualifications – either degree or CIM Diploma
Grown and managed a strong team
Built and managed effective relationships with external agencies to achieve good return on investment
Driven strategy including the development and implementation of marketing and content plans

Excellent leadership, communication, and decision-making skills

100’s of retail discounts available through our flexible benefits portal
Apply Now!

d5fc33271c1773db.title: Marketing Intern
d5fc33271c1773db.description:
Who is Moog?

Headquartered in the US with a global reach, Moog Inc is a world-leading integrator of precision motion control systems for industrial, medical, aerospace, and defense applications.

Over the last 65+ years, our engineers have developed the capability to design and manufacture the most advanced products for application where precise control of velocity, force, acceleration, and fluid flow are critical. Moog Inc is split across operating groups: Industrial Group, Aircraft Group plus Space and Defense Group.

This Internship is available at Moog Industrial Group and is based at our Tewkesbury facility. Moog Industrial Group provides high-performance motion control solutions combining electric, hydraulic, and hybrid technologies to help performance-driven companies develop their next-generation machines. Typical Industrial applications include Motorsport, F1 & Automotive; Power generation; Industrial motion control; Simulation & Test solutions; Oil & Gas.

We are proud that our people and products represent a culture where the opportunity to solve a challenging control problem is always welcomed.

We strive to foster a close relationship with our Interns from day one so that they can return to the business where possible as a member of our Graduate Engineering Program.

Marketing Internship at Moog Industrial Group

We are looking for an individual who has digital marketing skills, technical interest/acumen, and an interest in developing an understanding of the industrial emerging, evolving and established market trends in the UK and Europe. Working alongside the marketing and business development teams to create and develop pertinent market intelligence sufficient for us to deep dive into identified markets and see if Moog can Make the Impossible, Possible in terms of delivering customized Moog Products and Solutions.
The individual will also have a desire to put those findings into practice by helping to create, deliver and evaluate global Focused marketing campaigns to reach out to the identified markets with the guidance of the Marketing Communications Specialist and BDM Team which can deliver rapid intelligence, and therefore will need to have a good understanding of the relevance of digital marketing tools, specifically appreciate the benefits of LinkedIn Sales Navigator and the importance of engaging with a CRM.
Here are the skills and qualifications that will suit this internship

Understand how to communicate and be able to be empathetic to the needs of our customers
Rapid self-starter
Excellent analytical skills
Organizational skills
Ace Verbal and written communication skills.
Digital Marketing Skills / Awareness
Technical awareness would be advantageous in this position
Ability to use Microsoft office
Team player
Be able to keep it simple

Next Steps

For your application to be considered please apply with a CV and Cover Letter via our Careers Page
You must include your predicted grade for your degree, and where possible each grade attained for your completed modules thus far (our top tip is to go the extra mile and tell us all about your hobbies and projects which are relevant for this Internship!)
The selection stages include a video interview and an in-person interview/assessment center (guidelines permitting).
All placements are available to penultimate/final year students and the paid internships will start between August and September 2022, for a duration of 12 months.

You Matter at Moog – Our Mission and Vision

At Moog, we believe in the people who work for us. As part of our investment in our people, we make diversity, equity, and inclusion a priority. Our goal is to create a culture where we value, respect, and provide fair treatment and equal opportunities for all employees.

Moog aspires to be a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company where employees are empowered to bring their whole, authentic selves to work every day.

By recognizing and celebrating our differences, we cultivate an environment that’s the right fit for every person inside of it. Moog is a place where employees are empowered to bring their whole, authentic selves to work every day.

It is our core belief that if we take care of our employees, they will take care of our customers, partners, shareholders, and communities where we live and work.

You Can Do This

Once you apply for a position with Moog your CV will be held on our central recruitment management database. If you would prefer that your details are not retained by Moog, please contact us via the following email address: ukcareers@moog.com

d0081180f718f7c1.title: Communications and Marketing Specialist
d0081180f718f7c1.description:
Description
ABOUT OQC
At Oxford Quantum Circuits (OQC) we are building quantum computers to enable life-changing discoveries: from new drug modelisation to longer-lasting battery technology and portfolio optimisation. We are developing a cloud based quantum computer service – Quantum Computing as a Service (QCaaS) – to help our customers improve their operations and trailblaze new commercial and scientific approaches.
Our team is composed of 40 people with various backgrounds in quantum physics, nanotechnologies, hardware, and software as well as in operations, business development, recruitment, etc. We are all bound by the desire to put OQC at the forefront of the quantum revolution and build a technology with practical applications in mind.

ROLE OVERVIEW
We are looking for a Communications and Marketing Specialist to help us develop, execute, and monitor communications and marketing strategies across our traditional and digital channels. This will include market research, content creation, new product launches, social media, and sales enablement. You will be an integral part of our company’s ability to increase brand awareness and customer satisfaction.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Ensure brand awareness and credibility across all channels
Assist with all internal and external communications and marketing campaigns
Design, write, proofread, and edit creative and technical content (branding, advertising copy, graphic designs, promotional materials, etc.) across different mediums (newsletter, email, social media, website, digital campaigns, blogs, press, etc.)
Ensure the growth and drive traffic, month on month, of our social platforms and website
Assist with the launch of new products (from market trends to sales enablement)
Develop campaigns to ensure customer satisfaction
Implement and track the success of our marketing strategies, share regular reports showing achievement of critical metrics (including campaign results, conversion rates, and online traffic) in order to improve future marketing strategies and campaigns
Conduct market research
Brainstorm, detail and enforce branding guidelines
Help with the coordination of events such as trade shows or conferences

REMUNERATION
£35,000 - £50,000 pa., based on experience.
We also offer multiple benefits, from private medical insurance to Employee Assistance Cash Plan, from cycle to work to gym and fitness memberships. All our employees also participate in our ESOP. For more info, visit https://apply.workable.com/oqc/
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS
3+ years of experience in digital marketing and/or communications
At least 1 year of experience in marketing or comms agency
Hands-on experience with marketing tools (incl. software and applications, social platforms, analytics, design & graphics tools)
Skilled at writing and editing content with an attention to detail
Demonstrated experience with product launches and/or integrated marketing campaigns
Experience with website builders (WordPress a bonus), knowledge of SEO a bonus
Experience with branding
Experience with market research
Outstanding organisational and project management skills, and ability to multitask
Excellent analytical skills and a knack for marketing-related data
Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced and quickly changing environment
Self-starter with a creative mind

LOCATION & TRAVEL
OQC’s office is located in Shinfield, Reading. There will be a requirement for occasional travel throughout the UK and elsewhere abroad for conferences, meetings and engineering visits.

APPLY NOW
As part of our application process we ask that you also provide us with a cover letter outlining why you think you would be a good fit for the role and what attracts you to OQC. Applications without a cover letter including this information will not be considered.
We look forward to hearing from you!
At OQC we are not just hoping you’ll fit in our culture. We aspire to thrive, as a company and as people, thanks to your diversity of thought and background. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing our team members with a work environment free from discrimination, where everyone is treated with respect. Our employment decisions are based on business needs, talent and merit and all our colleagues share in the responsibility for fulfilling our commitment to diversity. It is a fantastic time to join our team of specialist digital marketers. With proven track records in our respective fields - we are well funded, highly profitable (yes, already!), and primed for significant growth.

30410a5c251e2746.title: CRM Specialist - Rider
30410a5c251e2746.description:
Why Deliveroo?

When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting great food to your house in less than half an hour. Awesome right? But behind the scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challenges and an enormous opportunity ahead of us. It began with our founder Will, arriving in London over 5 years ago and finding it almost impossible to order great food, despite the wealth of incredible restaurants in the city. Fast forward 5 years and we operate in 13 countries with over 50,000 riders who deliver orders from 50,000 restaurants in over 200 cities worldwide.

We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We are providing people with limitless access to different cuisines and restaurants, turning cooking from a chore to a choice, and giving people the freedom to eat what they want, when they want, where they want it.

We work with riders, restaurants and consumers. We operate one of the most complex three sided marketplaces in the world and we do this in real time. Millions of customers and thousands of restaurants and riders rely on us to match them within milliseconds. The algorithms behind that marketplace are the secret sauce that allows us to deliver our orders in under 30 minutes.

And we're just getting started

The scale of the opportunity ahead of us is immense. The global food market is valued at £7.7 trillion but only 1% of it is currently online. Contrast that with the digital disruption of countless other industries - from banking and travel to retail and communications - it's clear that our journey in the food sector has only just begun. We are already a multi-billion pound company that is more than doubling in size every year. Deliveroo came top in the FT's' list of Europe's fastest growing 1000 companies in 2018, and we were the first company ever to win Deloitte's 'UK Top 50' two years in a row. Yet most of the extraordinary value this company will generate lies ahead of us.

The Role

As a CRM Specialist for the rider central marketing team, you are the voice of Deliveroo when speaking with our riders, globally. Reporting into the Rider Senior CRM manager you'll initiate, build, proof, send and approve targeted campaigns across our customer segments, including campaigns that support and enhance our overall marketing calendar. Overall you'll be laser focused on creating campaigns and working across other rider initiatives that are relevant to our riders, and contribute to our KPI's of increasing rider hours worked. You will be focused on utilising the right channels at the right time and that ultimately deliver a meaningful impact to our riders, since they are at the core of the business. You'll sit within the Central CRM team, but work closely with teams from across the whole business, including our Rider Operations teams.

You'll be a passionate and technical marketer, who consistently puts the rider at the centre of their decision making and campaign execution. You'll be the kind of person who can't wait to look at your metrics soon after a send, and you'll get excited about new ideas, new channels and new campaigns. You'll work well with others and arrive at kick-off meetings for a new campaign full of ideas, based on what we've learnt through data and your own inspiration.

To Do All Of This, You'll

Collaborate with the wider rider operations, marketing and engagement teams to create multichannel, dynamic and data driven campaigns.
Coordinate and be responsible for the end-to-end delivery of emails, push-notifications and in-app messages executing in a timely and effective manner
Create, deploy and own local experiments to develop CRM best practises
Be comfortable with data targeting, segmentation & analysis - pulling it, manipulating it and interpreting it
Proactively communicate with stakeholders to ensure workloads & deadlines are managed efficiently (we love Slack channels for everything)
Drive test & learn strategies to optimise email templates, content and customer initiatives creating email best practice and making recommendations across the business
Support the Rider Senior CRM manager with other rider initiatives and to analyse and track key segments for future growth and commercial planning
Conduct post campaign reporting, pulling out the most interesting lessons and using these to guide your future ideas

Must Haves

Bachelor's Degree (Marketing or Business preferred) or strong relevant experience
A minimum of 1 years email application experience
Highly computer literate with:
HTML familiarity (ability to understand where changes need to be made)
Email deployment experience (Braze experience preferred)
Data visualisation tools (Looker experience preferred)

Life at Deliveroo

We are a small team, with very large impact, seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, we're always looking for new ideas and we're very transparent about the decisions we make and why we make them.

There are so many questions we need to answer and plenty more we haven't even encountered. How do data and technology help restaurants to grow as consumer habits change? How can we predict what someone wants to order for dinner long before the idea has even crossed their mind? At Deliveroo these are just some of the tough problems we are solving - and there is no challenge that cannot be yours. No solution is owned by a particular team, which means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous.

Benefits And Diversity

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth, time away and relocation.

In 2018 we announced our decision to give every employee equity in the company. We did this because we wanted all of our employees, regardless of location, level or role to be owners and because we believe that this is the right thing to do. We believe this helps build a culture where everyone is committed and able to share in the company's success.

We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing start-up's around.

c3b73e98255c789c.title: Patient Care Specialist
c3b73e98255c789c.description:
Role Summary
The Dexcom Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems are aimed at people with diabetes who need to monitor their blood sugar levels.
A strong predictor of success for the Patient Care Specialist is the ability to inspire, listen and asses the needs of patients. Communicate effectively on the phone, in person and through web-based communications (webinars, Skype, etc.) and execute strategies that efficiently engage and educate our patients.
Responsible for providing training, education and ongoing support around the Dexcom CGM system. Achieve key performance metric goals, blending customer service and problem-solving skills with an understanding of the patient experience, to achieve customer retention and experience goals. Ensure all compliance and regulatory measures are being strictly adhered to and deliver quality and timely patient care and customer service.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Your main responsibilities will be to:
Have a good understanding of Continuous Glucose Monitoring, Dexcom CGM products and competitive CGM products.
Be able to provide outstanding patient-centric customer service.
Have strong verbal (especially phone skills) and written communication.
Record patient enquiries by documenting inquiries and responses in patients' accounts.
Be point of contact for HCP enquiries around product and concerns
Assist Patients with identifying and overcoming concerns
Communicate with sales field rep to identify Patients that may need additional support and direct to appropriate group for intervention
Work with marketing and other internal departments to develop the correct materials for training customers
Measure the success of the efforts through monitoring Patient retention and Patient satisfaction ratings
Provide face to face training to HCP’s or patients where it is not appropriate to use online methods
Required Qualifications/Experience:
To perform this job successfully, you must be able to perform each essential duty to a satisfactory standard. The successful candidate will have:
Registered Health Care Provider (nurse qualified) or Dietitian – mandatory
Educated to a minimum of Diploma level. Preferably with a degree or evidence of degree level study.
Minimum 3+years’ work experience in a Patient centred environment
Excellent communication skills
Demonstrated high level of performance
Good diabetes knowledge
Preferred Qualifications: (Optional)
Certificate in Diabetes Care
Trained and skilled in telemedicine
Extensive knowledge of Dexcom products and therapy
Must be available for interview week beginning 28th March

f29b3abd89f37896.title: Head of Marketing and Communications
f29b3abd89f37896.description:
Hybrid working, 2 days in the office
Salary banding: £55,000 - £60,000
Moving Ahead is a specialist inclusion, diversity and development organization dedicated to advancing workplace inclusion. Founded in 2014 by Liz Dimmock, a social entrepreneur who wanted to bring her leadership, development and consultancy experience to bring about positive workplace change. To date, we have reached more than 35,000 individuals across more than 300 organisations.
We have three core pillars to our work and how we create change.
Design and delivery of structured mentoring programmes; both cross-company and internal
Design and delivery of development programmes (inclusive leadership, women’s development, keynotes and masterclasses)
Research and consultancy – partnering with organisations in how to effective long-standing systemic change.
Our key clients include: Google, The Guardian, Tesco, Santander, The Armed Forces, Mastercard, EY, The London Stock Exchange, Cisco, Phoenix Group, TSB and the NHS.
We are looking for a Head of Marketing and Communication to join our team and lead the strategic marketing communications and operational delivery of activity for the organisation. You will define and drive the brand to a range of stakeholders, tailoring messaging and developing marketing campaigns and activity. Building and leading a new marketing team, you will be key to further developing our brand proposition and to providing marketing direction across the organisation to support the three key areas of work.
As part of the senior leadership team, you will work closely with our CEO and senior leadership team. You will have multiple internal and external stakeholders and responsibility for small but growing marketing and communications team. Your key responsibilities will include:
Managing the brand to ensure consistent communication of the organisation’s mission and values across all channels and will ensure that the integrity of the brand is maintained and promoted at all times
Developing and overseeing the delivery of a corporate communications strategy to build the organisation’s brand and reputation.
Developing a stakeholder engagement strategy to maximise relationships with clients, investors, partners and intermediaries.
Providing a new structure and framework in terms of branding and marketing from which your team can develop marketing activity to support the organisation’s activities, including market research, sales collateral and advertising.
Identifying and effectively utilise a range of channels to deliver successful results including above the line, direct and digital marketing.
Monitoring and measuring the effectiveness of all marketing/communications activity.
Managing the marketing budget.
Building and leading a new marketing team; contributing to the development of a positive culture and high performing team through leading, coaching and supporting to ensure high employee engagement.
Upholding and promoting Moving Ahead values and philosophy and act as ambassador for the organisation
Keeping up to date with diversity and inclusion topics and themes.
About you
We are looking for a candidate who has experience in a similar role as a Head of or Senior Marketing Manager with line management responsibilities. You will be an expert at delivering tailored messaging to a range of audiences and markets with the ability to manage multiple stakeholders.
You will have a proven track record of strategy development and operational delivery. You will be data led; know the data we need as a business, make it happen, and report on it.
What we offer
Flexible and agile working
25 days annual leave and bank holidays
Pension scheme
Coaching and development to support you in your role and progression
Opportunity to attend learning and development session with high profile and world class speakers and facilitators
Exposure to some fantastic clients in FTSE-250
Belonging to a small, growing and talented team with a genuine respect and support for one another
Will consider part time.

1f0abee0261cb6a4.title: Customer Support Specialist
1f0abee0261cb6a4.description:
We’re on a mission to build the world’s greatest social bank. We believe that banking needs to change for the better. When money is used correctly, it can transform our daily lives and positively impact the planet.
We’re a varied team of experienced tech, customer experience, marketing, legal and banking professionals and we’re looking for highly motivated and inquisitive people who want to understand customer behaviour and how to deliver the best customer experience.
As a Customer Support Specialist, you'll be the first point of contact for our customers and you’ll be helping solve any queries and help troubleshoot any problems.
Put simply, our Customer Support Specialists are the digital face of Kroo!
We believe our people and culture are what makes Kroo different, so we’re keen to promote people development within the company so you’ll also get the chance to broaden your skill-set and experience. We work in cross-functional collaborative teams, so you’ll also work alongside our product teams and developers to improve the customer experience on a day-to-day basis as well as the wider organisation.
The Kroo is growing and we’d love to hear from you if you’re interested in joining us in our journey.
Here's what you will be doing:
Provide and maintain exceptionally high levels of customer service via live chat, email, phone and social media
Be the first port of call for customer complaints and concerns to make sure that they're treated fairly
Show proactiveness and ownership skills to solve customer problems
Proactively spot patterns in the frustrations or hopes of our customers, seeing where we can change our processes, tools or product to serve them better
Identify customers who might be vulnerable and ensure we support them when needed
Work closely with our financial crime team to act as the first line of defence to help spot and investigate trends
Understand, prioritise and escalate customers' feedback and feature requests to the product team
Support other members in the Operations team by being a point of contact and mentoring new joiners
Requirements
We’re looking for someone who:

Has front line or back office banking experience
Has experience in customer service in the financial services industry
Is interested in how technology can improve people's lives
Enjoys the startup environment
Is customer focused
Has a high level of organisation
Has excellent written and verbal communication skills
Has a high level of empathy and the ability to connect with other people
Benefits
What we offer:
33 days holiday (including public holidays). In addition, you’ll also get your birthday on us
Options in our company scheme
Personal Health days
Access to our workplace pension with a 3% employer contribution
All the equipment you need to work effectively, usually a Macbook Pro as standard
Access to a modern, bustling office in Holborn, Central London with a free gym
High degree of autonomy with support from an experienced and supportive team
Room to grow and excel within a fast paced, high grow growing start-up
An ethically conscious company that is truly trying to change the what's most broken about the industry
Office/remote working
Currently the majority of Kroo is working fully remotely. Working remotely has changed many of our lives for the better and we are behind continuing the benefits of flexibility once restrictions are lifted. At the same time, we have a beautiful office in Holborn, which, when used for the right things, can be a useful and powerful tool. Currently we see a blended model of working 1-2 days a week in the office, so candidates that are able to travel in occasionally are the best fit for our current working practices.
Diversity
We are firmly committed to creating and maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace in which all employees are valued, respected, safe, supported, and listened to without judgement or prejudice. These principles apply to all, regardless of race or ethnicity, age, gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, sexual orientation, mental or physical ability, religion, appearance, political beliefs, educational background, class, and position or tenure within the company. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are central to the direction we take at Kroo, and are considered across all aspects of our business.

fa4ada263e2c8b83.description:
Career Area:
Marketing / Sales / Product Support
Compensation Grade:
22
Job Description:
Job Title: Marketing Specialist
Salary: Competitive, depending on experience
Benefits offered with the role:
Competitive salary
Free on-site parking
10% annual bonus
Contributory share scheme - Caterpillar will match 50% of employee's contribution
Contributory pension scheme - Caterpillar will double employee's contribution up to 6%
CAT Advantage High Street Discount App
Location : Larne
Relocation/ Sponsorship: No
Flexible working arrangements will be considered for this role, in-line with the needs of the business.
 Who is Caterpillar? What do we do?
Caterpillar is a world leader in construction and mining equipment—creating innovative, cutting-edge products
and services that help our customers build the world around us. With that level of impact comes the platform
to care for the world, we work in. That’s why we lead sustainable green initiatives to preserve the environment,
help reduce poverty with the Caterpillar Foundation and stay involved in the communities we help build.
What will Caterpillar do for you?
From day one, you’re set up to thrive at Caterpillar: helpful training, relatable mentors, global experience, competitive salary package, work-life balance and the growth opportunities you expect with a Fortune 100 company.
Company Overview:
With 2020 sales and revenues of $41.7 billion, Caterpillar Inc. is the world’s leading manufacturer of construction and mining equipment, diesel and natural gas engines, industrial gas turbines, and diesel-electric locomotives. Since 1925, we’ve been driving sustainable progress and helping customers build a better world through innovative products and services. Throughout the product life cycle, we offer services built on cutting-edge technology and decades of product expertise. These products and services, backed by our global dealer network, provide exceptional value to help our customers succeed. We do business on every continent, principally operating through three primary segments – Construction Industries, Resource Industries, and Energy & Transportation – and providing financing and related services through our Financial Products segment. Visit us at caterpillar.com or join the conversation on our social media channels at caterpillar.com/social-media.
Without our team of talented, bight and driven individuals, we wouldn’t be the Caterpillar we are today. Now, this is your chance to join our team and do work that matters. We want you to help us enable customer success, make progress possible around the world and help our communities grow and thrive. We are looking for a dynamic, organized individual to join our Strategic Procurement Division (“SPD”) accounting team.
Job Description:
As a Marketing Consultant within the FG Wilson team you will join a dynamic team of professionals working on promoting the FG Wilson brand, products and services to generate brand awareness, leads and contribute to market leadership.
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Social Media Content Management
Manage and develop FG Wilson social media platforms through creative content creation to support lead generation and brand awareness campaigns.
Campaign management and execution
Develop a marketing strategy for campaigns that promote the features and benefits of the FG Wilson product range to key target audiences. Lead and execute the marketing campaigns using key tactics which will include: website, SEM, SEO, digital marketing, online and offline advertising and social media promotion.
New Product Introduction
Collaborate within a cross-functional team of subject matter experts to create and execute the marketing plan for new products being introduced to the FG Wilson product portfolio.
Dealer Collaboration
Collaborate with key Dealers to ensure awareness of campaign plans and facilitate access to marketing collateral to support Dealer marketing plans. Work with the FG Wilson sales team and dealers to create customer stories and testimonials to generate awareness and consideration of FG Wilson brand and product offering.
Essential criteria:
A Degree (or equivalent) in Engineering, Marketing, Business or Communications
Strong level of relevant experience
Excellent organisational skills and ability to manage multiple projects at once
Ability to collaborate well with others, for example team members, subject matter experts, dealer sales and marketing teams
Creative thinking
Ability to influence others and gain acceptance of ideas
Desirable Criteria:
Social media content creation
Digital campaign marketing experience
NB. The panel cannot make assumptions when shortlisting therefore please demonstrate your qualifications and experience on your CV relevant to the criteria outlined.
Pending the number of applications, the criteria for the position may be enhanced to facilitate shortlisting.
Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO).
The panel cannot make assumptions when shortlisting therefore please demonstrate your qualifications and experience on your CV relevant to the criteria outlined.
Pending the number of applications, the criteria for the position may be enhanced to facilitate shortlisting.
