185eba1848768bad.title: Product Marketing Specialist
185eba1848768bad.description:
Our growth in 2021 has been phenomenal – despite the pandemic, people are still looking for love and we're helping thousands of people around the world get married every month. We're scaling our Marketing Team so we can achieve our goal of being the number one dating and marriage app in the world! There's a long way to go and we're looking for an ambitious product marketing specialist to help us take our brand to the next level.
Position
Full-time
Location
London, UK
Salary
£40,000-£45,000 + equity

We're looking for
Someone with a track record helping app businesses launch products, and improving post-install KPIs such as retention and revenue
This role is perfect for someone who's already worked on product marketing strategies in the past, but wants more ownership of what it looks like end-to-end
You're a hands-on type who'll get into the weeds of things to deliver tangible results
We're growing rapidly in Europe, MENA, and South Asia - so you'll need to have experience working on international projects
You're organised and structured, but can be flexible to the fast-paced environment of a startup like ours.
Requirements
2+ years of product marketing experience (preferably app or similar tech)
Strong analytical skills and comfortable turning data into action
Eligibility to work in the UK without a visa
Strong time management and project management skills
A strong writer who is effective at getting their point across succinctly
Good project management and communication skills. You will need to work with multiple stakeholders, both internal and external
Eager to learn, you'll bring passion to the exciting future we are building.
Day to Day
This is a truly cross-team role - you'll work with marketing, data science, commuinity and engineering to increase adoption of features, revenue and reduce churn
Run experiments to improve conversions at key stages of the user journey - using in-app messaging, emails and even changes to the app itself
We particularly want to highlight and promote safety features in muzmatch - you'll help us tell this story and empower our members to date safely
Monitoring and reporting on key KPIs, making sure the work being done alines to the team's quarterly goals
Work closely with UI/UX teams to help them refine existing features and develop new ones
Work closely with brand and PR to launch new products in exciting ways
We all strive to be champions for our customers, but you'll have a special responsibility to make sure the whole team understands our members
You'll be the conduit between marketing, customer support and engineering
You'll be our expert in all things online dating - the person we turn to understand our direct competitors (Muslim dating & marriage) and indirect competitors (mainstream dating apps)
Why muzmatch?
Work at an exciting and high-growth tech startup that's thriving and growing quickly
Meaningful equity - you'll get a slice of the pie and share in the success we're all building together
Learning Fridays - company-wide, one day a month is dedicated to your self learning and development
Monthly online yoga sessions
We're well-funded and have the budget to run exciting projects
Work with talented startup and technology professionals who can help you learn great skills for your marketing career
Regular company socials – including hikes, games nights, go karting, and dinners
Mostly remote - We come in once a week to bounce ideas around and grab food together
We'll kit you up with the latest gear and home office furniture if required
Monthly catch ups - we're all here to look out for each other during these strange times
Our team is incredibly diverse with people from all walks of life
33 days of holiday (including bank holidays)

e469b26c658ecd1c.title: Email Marketing Specialist
e469b26c658ecd1c.description: This global organisation based in London are seeking an experienced marketer who has a solid background in and a passion for, creating global email campaigns.They are responsible for delivering communications to varied markets across the works and therefore need someone motivated and highly used to advising on audiences, segmentation, and generally taking responsibility for the delivery of large and often complex campaigns. There was also be the need to influence and guide key stakeholders both in the UK and overseas when it comes to monitoring the success of communications and the ability to interpret the relevant analytics and present them in accessible formats is essentialCandidates will have had considerable experience working on large email campaigns and be comfortable with the technology used to create these. They will be used to advising on areas such as brand, best practice and be comfortable delivering guidance to a wide variety of stakeholders.This needs a self-motivated and practical individual who enjoys having responsibility for leading team success and who is able to utilize technology to best advantage.If you are interested in applying for the role of Email Marketing Specialist, then please send us a full Word version CV, along with a note of your current and expected salary. Please don’t forget to include your contact details as we’d like to be in touch quickly.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £32,000.00-£35,000.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:London, EC2M 6TX: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)Education:Bachelor's (preferred)Reference ID: EMSI0703

18243f87814e72a3.title: Email Marketing Specialist (Remote UK)
18243f87814e72a3.description:
This is a remote position and is open to candidates throughout the UK.

JOB SUMMARY
The Email Marketing Specialist is a keystone member of the Consulting team. This role reports directly to the Manager of Consulting, and is an independent contributor who will be working toward greater breadth of skills and client-facing experience.
The Email Marketing Specialist has experience and expertise concerning every aspect of email marketing, including:
Strategy and workflow development
Campaign setup and deployment
Template creation and refinement
Copy creation
List segmentation and maintenance
Reporting
Proposal creation
Additionally, the Email Marketing Specialist has a strong knowledge of numerous email marketing platforms, and the ability to learn and master new platforms as needed. These include:
Hubspot
Pardot
Mailchimp
Marketo
Campaigner
ActiveCampaign
The Email Marketing Specialist has the ability and willingness to lead on projects, including both client work and internal Brafton initiatives, and will work proactively and autonomously to achieve success.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS & KEY SUCCESS FACTORS
The focus is generally on task execution and consultancy project support. Tasks and responsibilities may include (but are not limited to):
Executing on assigned deliverables, with the close supervision and support of the Manager of Consulting.
Working under deadline to produce quality, on-brand and on-spec work.
Collaborating with other team members as part of the Consulting team's deliverable peer-review process.
Collaborating closely with other consultants and colleagues to understand our prospects' and clients' needs, as well as the details of each assigned task.
Communicating on live projects with all involved team members to ensure clarity and adherence to deadlines.
Ensuring that everything we deliver is in-line with the client's expectations and meets our internal standards for quality.
Assisting other team members with information synthesis, formatting, and report proofing, as directed by the Manager of Consulting.
Additionally, this role may work toward:
Exploring and developing new service offerings, with the support of managers and senior colleagues.
Working to understand and gain insights into industry trends and standards around data analysis and reporting, email marketing, lead generation, design best practice and content marketing in general.
Collaborating with senior members of staff to develop strong in-house knowledge stores, policies and processes.
Working closely with Brafton's development team, CMS, production teams and other departments, as is helpful, toward the timely and successful completion of these tasks.
SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s degree preferred
Minimum two years of relevant work experience preferred
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Exceptional writing skills
Comfort and efficacy with spreadsheets
Knowledge of the evolving digital search landscape and content marketing
Technical knowledge of most CMS
Knowledge and experience with marketing automation tools and SEO tools and platforms.
TIME BREAKOUT:
70 per cent independent contributor email marketing work
20 per cent internal or client-facing communications
10 per cent misc.
Some travel may be required for on-site client meetings, once travel becomes safe and feasible again.
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY | E-VERIFY: Brafton is an Equal Opportunity employer. In addition to US & UK law requirements, Brafton complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfers, leave of absence, compensation and training.

10376d7da3e23245.title: Marketing Executive, Specialist Events
10376d7da3e23245.description:
About Us
Across the FT Group, our people are united by a mission to deliver world-class information, news and services to our global audiences. We're a digital-first organisation made up of journalists, technologists, product managers, event planners, strategists, commercial and finance experts, marketing and communications specialists - and much more. Our strength is in our employees.
Our commitment to diversity and inclusion in the workplace
At the FT, we aim for employees across all regions to have a voice so that diverse perspectives are heard and valued. We believe that a supportive workplace is one where employees feel they can be themselves at work and have the flexibility they need to meet their personal needs. We'll continue to remove barriers for all, and in particular barriers facing employees from underrepresented groups.
FT Live
Financial Times Live (FT Live) is the conferences and events division of the Financial Times newspaper and its group publications. Our mission is to bring our global executive audiences the very latest in knowledge and opinion, and connect them to one another.
FT Specialist comprises 17 brands, providing niche audience groups with information that helps them make better decisions and operate more effectively. These brands cater to the needs of fund management professionals, financial advisers, banking professionals, economic development professionals, US corporate boards and personal investors through a range of publications, websites, services and events. Amongst our industry-leading brands with huge scope for growth and development: The Banker, Investors’ Chronicle, fDi, FTAdviser, PWM and Pensions Expert.
The Role / Position Overview
Work with the Senior Marketing and Project Manager to create and deliver targeted through-the-line event marketing campaigns, maintaining, developing and enhancing the FT Specialist audience to drive reader registrations, deliver insight, build brand awareness and meet the delegate requirements of the FT Specialist portfolio of events.
This role will build on existing relationships - and create new relationships - with the FT Specialist audiences. You will be responsible for ensuring that we achieve growth in our delegate numbers by promoting our events in a targeted and compelling way, across appropriate print and digital channels. You will work closely with internal stakeholders to brief and build campaigns and event websites, seeking to increase the revenues that we derive from delegates as well as delivering an audience that reflects the quality and seniority expected of FT Specialist events.
This role will form part of the FT Specialist events team, which forms a key part of FT Live’s growth strategy. Success in this role will be defined by your ability to deliver campaign support across our portfolio of events (ranging from building and maintaining event websites, briefing creative promotional collateral, overseeing campaign delivery across print and digital channels, managing client comms, identifying relevant delegate prospects, and reporting on campaign performance and preparing post-event reports).
Key Responsibilities
Work closely with the Senior Marketing and Project Manager to plan, implement, manage and analyse all event marketing campaigns
Meet and exceed weekly, monthly and annual delegate targets across the portfolio
Work with colleagues in the editorial, content, design, operations and commercial teams to develop event propositions, advise on format and delegate profiles, and ultimately bring the events and their promotional campaigns to life
Work with an exceptional eye for detail to brief in creative artwork and campaign collateral
Oversee the creation and delivery of event campaigns - across social, email, print and digital channels
Handle consumer data sensitively and in a GDPR-compliant manner, and work with new and existing databases to build targeted audience data sets
Manage, where appropriate, sponsor communications
Liaising with the conference production and marketing team, to develop an understanding of the event program, theme and audience profiles.
Provide weekly and monthly reports and forecasts as required, and monitor the overall performance of campaigns to optimise best practise
Research and engage with prospective delegates, providing a clear articulation of our event proposition, and obtaining new registrations
Work closely with other parts of the FT Specialist marketing team and the wider FT where appropriate to ensure collaborations are carried out to drive quality reach
Ensure all activities fully support the wider FT brand proposition and deliver “through the line” integration of communications and messaging. Understanding of wider brand purpose and how events feed into this is essential.
Required Skills / Experience
Ability to manage multiple projects effectively and efficiently, ensuring all deadlines are met. Demonstrable experience of working at high volume and fast pace is essential.
Self starter and a quick learner with high energy and initiative - ability to manage up, down and across the organisation
Experience across social (paid and organic), website or CMS management and email delivery platforms desirable
A confident copywriter with experience in email campaign creation and delivery
Impeccable eye for detail in written and numerical work
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Demonstrate practical focus on campaign reporting and analysis
Demonstrate capability with Microsoft Office Suite, in particular Excel (including formulas, charts, graphs etc)
Experience with handling external client comms is desirable but not essential
Happy to communicate with our audience via multiple channels (face-to-face, over the telephone and by email)
1-2 years experience in similar role or industry.
What’s in it for you? Our Benefits
Our benefits vary depending on location, but we are committed to providing best in class perks across all our offices as well as an inclusive environment to develop your career. Examples of our benefits include; generous annual leave allowances, flexible working (including working from home), medical cover, enhanced maternity & paternity packages, subsidised gym memberships and Giving Back opportunities. Full details of our benefits can be found here.
Further Information
The FT is committed to providing an inclusive working environment for all. We are an equal opportunities employer who seeks to recruit and appoint the best talent regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We also promote flexible working and will consider specific requests around flexibility for all roles where it can be accommodated. Please let us know if you require any adjustments as part of the application process or to enable you to attend an interview. If you would like to discuss your requirements, or have any questions, please contact a member of our HR team who will be happy to help.
#LI-NE1

33dc19a65c43c4fb.title: PR, Social and Content Marketing Specialist UKIE - UK Remote
33dc19a65c43c4fb.description:
Who We Are:
Vista’s Customer Experience and Marketing organization serves, inspires and delights customers – and helps others in our organization do the same. From the simplest interaction on our website to how people take in our advertising and communications, we are obsessed with delivering value. We know our customers’ needs, and we strive to exceed their expectations. Touching every element of the business, we’re here to grow and build the Vista brand, reach new audiences and offer the best possible experience for every customer.
What You Will Do:
Lead PR activity for the UK and Ireland in partnership with the global PR team. Lead the day-to-day relationship with our UKIE PR Agency and work alongside the central PR team to achieve global brand objectives for PR.
Lead the UKIE organic social media strategy, seeking opportunities for extending current social media activity beyond the centrally managed activities and optimising our current social activities in the UK and Ireland.
Explore the creation of locally run social media accounts to showcase local UKIE activities and activations.
Build and execute the UKIE influencer strategy in collaboration with global team, leading the relationship with the UKIE influencer agency.
Develop a UKIE content marketing strategy and execute it in partnership with the applicable channels and the creative teams as well as finding opportunities for exciting local content.
Maintain and update content on our Ideas & Advice blog and Newsroom.
Build measurement, KPIs and tests to understand and drive our activities in this domain. Run the reporting on activities and drive understanding of how these activities improve customer engagement, awareness and brand perception.
Your Qualifications:
At Vista, we value the experiences that individual team members add to our culture. Please don't hesitate to apply even if you don't meet the exact qualifications, we look forward to learning more about you!
2-5 years’ experience in a similar role with a background in PR, journalism, content marketing or social media marketing in a fast-moving organisation
Validated understanding of how quality content drives engagement
Experience working with a PR agency
Excellent English written and verbal communication skills
Analytical skillset to build, test and measure aspects of programme
Experience in social media tools, influencer platforms, Google Analytics and PR reporting platforms
Nice to Have:
Experience in juggling multiple projects and liaising with a range of internal and external stakeholders
Fluency in another language other than English
Why You'll Love Working Here:
Being at Vista means that you don’t see work as just a building, a desk or a manufacturing floor. You see it as a chance to take a step forward in your career journey – and your life. We strive to give you everything you need to learn, grow, and succeed. Through innovation, collaboration, and perpetual exposure to what’s next, we’re always pushing boundaries and broadening our horizons. We embrace the chance to operate outside of our comfort zone to discover what we’re capable of. Some might call that a challenge; we just call it another great day at work.
Vista has received numerous recognitions including a perfect score of 100 on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation’s 2021 Corporate Equality Index (CEI) naming us a Best Places to Work for LGBTQ Equality. We also earned a place as one of the best remote-first workplaces in the U.S. and on the Boston Best Places to Work list from Built In. In addition, Vista’s CEO, Robert Keane, was recently honored with Comparably’s Best CEOs award, listing him among the top CEOs according to employees. Vista offers numerous support systems including Employee Resource Groups like Pride, Mosaic, and Women in Technology, and special interests communities to foster awareness, respect, and inclusion within the workplace.
We're Remote-First:
In 2020, Vista adopted a Remote-First operating model and culture. We heard from our team members that having the freedom, autonomy and trust in each other to work from home and, the ability to operate when they are most productive, empowers them to be their best. Vista also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together when it's safe to do so and when in-person collaboration will deliver the best results. Currently we are enabled to hire remote team members in over 30 US States as well as several countries in Europe, including Spain, Germany, UK, Czech Republic, the Netherlands and Switzerland.
About Us:
As an e-commerce powerhouse, Vista creates customer value (and delight) through accessible, cutting-edge technology. We are the marketing partner to millions of small businesses around the world. For more than 20 years, we have helped small businesses look and feel credible through high-quality marketing products and solutions that include signage, logo apparel, promotional products, face masks, flyers, postcards, business cards, websites and digital marketing. With Vista, small businesses are able to create and customize their marketing with easy-to-use digital tools and design-templates, or by receiving expert graphic design support. In 2020, Vista acquired 99designs to expand its design offering via a worldwide community of more than 150,000 talented designers to make it easy for designers and clients to work together to create designs they love. Vista is focused on making great marketing and design accessible to every small business owner, allowing them to create a cohesive brand image for use in-store, online and on-the-go.
Equal Opportunity Employer:
Vista, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.

409566f91755be4b.title: Field Marketing Specialist
409566f91755be4b.description:
We’re building a different kind of IT company, one that meets our customers and our own team on their turf, on their terms. We’re growing fast right now and you can be part of it with all the opportunities to add value that come with that. Curious? Great! That’s what we like in a Softie!
Our Softies are a diverse and globally distributed team that are on a mission to change the future of data infrastructure with task-specific hardware and open source. We aim to do all the hard work so that our customers can adopt the best open source has to offer in a bulletproof and resilient way. Our team thinks differently, working as an integrated but globally dispersed team of experts in hardware manufacturing, firmware, software, infrastructure and everything in between.
As a Field Marketing Specialist you'll be critical in supporting our Marketing group in developing and executing channel partner-oriented marketing initiatives and enabling partners with localized SoftIron-led campaign activity. You'll work closely with our Business Development & Channel leaders and Sales Account Managers to facilitate co-branded marketing activity as initiated by partners. We support our partners on the ground, locally, and this role will include traveling about 20% of the time. You'll need to be ready, willing and able to travel freely within your home country of the US or UK, and internationally.
You'll work for the Director of Marketing, and on a day to day basis work closely with the VP of Channel & Business Development. Your activities will include to:

Develop multi-channel, “Globally Distributed, Locally Embedded” brand awareness and lead generation campaign plans designed to support and enable partners in taking our solution to their market
Prepare and maintain an activity and communications calendar to ensure proactive & timely communication with partners
Support channel partners in developing their own marketing plans to grow their business with us

Create and send regular communications with partners
Brief Creative Service teams to develop collateral that can be shared with, and co-branded by, partners - or creating custom co-branded material for specific initiatives
Maintain and optimize our partner portal with support from Marketing Operations to deliver a quality partner experience and encourage engagement
Set or attend regular meetings with SoftIron stakeholders to ensure alignment with business plans & objectives
Help to plan, execute and attend key field initiatives such as events to support SoftIron’s own, or co-hosted partner events
Report on the success of channel marketing initiatives and make recommendations for improvements

About You

A positive and proactive attitude with a focus on team success is essential
Given the remote nature of the role, you must be self-motivated with a high degree of accountability
You're comfortable within a fast-paced and dynamic environment - adapting your work day to suit the global nature of our company and your role

You're highly organized with the ability to manage and deliver multiple ongoing projects
Confident to engage and quickly forge strong working relationships with a variety of internal and external stakeholders in order to plan and deliver on campaign activity
Great written and verbal communications skills
High attention to detail with the ability to initiate and deliver projects from end to end


Benefits
We pay competitively in the market in which you want to be located, and provide an attractive benefits package including significant share options in our fast growing, mid-stage start-up.

Location
We operate globally and also have some pretty cool offices worldwide. Time travel (aka time zone optimization) is one of our super powers and we use this to our best advantage in setting up teams and how we work. To best complement our team and customer needs, this role is based in either the US, UK, Germany or Czech Republic. Because you'll be travelling around 20% of the time, you'll also need to be based close to an international hub airport.
Recruitment agencies
We work with like-minded companies across all of our business. We’re not into vendor lock-in of any type, we don’t do the hard sell and we treat time and attention as valuable resources. Recruitment agents, please don’t send us unsolicited resumes or CVs unless we’ve asked you to work with us on the role - it just shows us you’re not our type.

ec3b3a78a02edd43.title: Content Intern
ec3b3a78a02edd43.description:
E-COMMERCE CONTENT ASSISTANT – X-DIVISION
12 MONTHS INTERNSHIP

We’re Coty, a global leader in beauty. We’re #1 in the world for Fragrance and #3 in the world in Colour Cosmetics with a portfolio of brands that have been known and loved for generations.

Our iconic portfolio of more than 77 brands are sold in over 150 countries around the world. We believe in beauty with a purpose and brands that inspire, no matter where they are in the world. We have some of the most well-known brands in the categories of Fragrances, Colour Cosmetics and Skin & Body Care including Gucci, Chloé, Calvin Klein, Burberry, Marc Jacobs, Sally Hansen, philosophy, Adidas, Rimmel, Max Factor, COVERGIRL and the list goes on and on!

Coty is committed to building a workforce that is as diverse as the communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and experiences helps us build better products, better serve our users, and build a diverse and inclusive workplace.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Sitting within the e-Commerce team, this role will work specifically on Online Content across the Consumer Beauty and Prestige Beauty divisions. The scope of the role will include day-to-day support and admin of the Content team who deliver content support and strategy to our Retail Sales teams. The role offers the opportunity to work on the online go-live preparation of new launches as well as the revamp of existing products across retailer sites. The role will allow the candidate exposure to brands such as Lacoste, Rimmel, Calvin Klein and Max Factor and the opportunity to communicate with stakeholders both internally and externally. The role sits as a hybrid of sales and brand, with a first priority of driving sales as well as respecting key brand equities and guidelines.

Support the Content Specialists across the preparation of content readiness for new product launches on retailer websites and social channels – potential end-to-end ownership of some launches including image collation, copy correcting, ordering artwork, briefing agencies.
Working with brand (locally and globally) to understand brand priorities and deliver relevant content to Sales teams and retailers that support business growth.
Own the existing product image update process – the packaging of our products is constantly changing and requires upkeep and external communication across all retailer digital channels.
Own the creative images expiration process – identifying on sites where brand imagery has/will be expiring and will need to be removed, communicating this to retailers and following up until content is removed.
Support the Content Specialists in maintaining the online content within local internal and external platforms – managing local product assortment catalogues and adding/updating/removing content as necessary.
Work with third party design agencies on bespoke retailer needs and briefs including banners for site promotions.
Work with our digital marketing team and Content team to understand brand media activities and work on our third-party platform on the creation of brand campaign retailer landing pages, set up unique links for each digital channel, analyse the data from the reports and share learnings with the Content and Sales teams to guide future planning.
Maintain a view of external competitor and x-category executions across digital channels that could help us develop new and interesting pieces of content and communications that resonate with customers and helps drive sales. Sharing this with the team and owning recommendations and builds.

WHAT YOU WILL BRING:
Passion for brands and beauty Excellent execution/eye for detail every time – able to work methodically and focused whilst remaining flexible and proactive Passionate about digital - has good knowledge of online shopping and is digitally savvy. Candidate needs to be native to online shopping themselves, and ideally in beauty. Confidence in communicating internally and externally both in-person and virtually. Excellent communication skills both written and verbal and ability to build strong working relationships Can-do attitude and able to work quickly with haste and vigour Motivated to manage projects both in/externally with colleagues and agencies Good knowledge of Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint and preferred (though not critical) knowledge of Photoshop Ability to work with autonomy, use initiative on areas of specific responsibility plus work effectively to deadlines Strong team player with ability to effectively listen, contribute and influence Positive, energetic, and eager to grow

WHAT WE BRING:
Growth & Digital
Our purpose is simple and compelling – we drive growth for Coty. We partner with the Divisions to recommend and shape our growth strategy, identify new business opportunities, share best practices in marketing, sales and digital, build capabilities, and look for new ways to innovate and redefine beauty industry norms.

Marketing & Sales
We drive growth, brand equity and customer loyalty with innovative products, digital campaigns, events, partnerships and online (& in-store) executions. Our work covers the digital world across all categories and brands. We aim to be gamechangers in the beauty industry, winning the hearts and minds of consumers around the world.

974417f3c2d6d49f.title: Research and Development Marketing Executive
974417f3c2d6d49f.description:
Company description:
Green Jellyfish is an established company committed to helping businesses grow and succeed by being smarter about their finances.

Within the smallest companies right through to multi-national corporations & across a broad spectrum of different sectors, exciting developments happen every day. Most businesses engage in some form of innovation every day, but don’t realize that it could fall under the Government's Research & Development umbrella.

Although the R&D Scheme has been in place since 2000, many business operators do not realize that they are eligible for significant Corporation Tax relief. This is where we come in. Our primary role is to create awareness of the scheme in order that our highly specialized and experienced R&D tax credit team can advise clients accordingly. We know exactly what qualifies and what doesn’t.

Our team is also highly skilled in the art of finding great deals thanks to the extensive network of providers we work with.

In fact, relationships are at the very heart of what we do here.

https://www.greenjellyfish.co.uk/what-is-rnd/

Job description:
We are currently expanding our working from home successful network marketing team who are calling small to medium businesses within the UK & then arranging a suitable time for one of our R&D Tax Specialists to call back & explain how the government scheme may benefit their business.

No actual selling is involved so previous experience is not required, but you will need natural charisma, good communication skills, great organization, tenacity, and a truly positive can-do attitude. In short, you need to be a clear, confident communicator that can engage people primarily via telephone conversation & also email & LinkedIn correspondence.

We are looking for ambitious, hardworking individuals who want to work in a stable, happy working environment with excellent career progression prospects and to be paid generously for their endeavors.

Applicants must:
Have a clear, friendly, and professional telephone manner. Polite, well-spoken, and able to communicate with clients up to senior management/director level.
Easily and confidently demonstrate a flexible, creative approach to communicating with prospects.
Understand that attention to detail is critical & and that an ability to listen whilst maintaining control is paramount.
Be capable of handling objections and thinking outside the box.
Understand the importance of quality over quantity.
Be goal orientated, self-motivated, and methodical.
Our current team members have all joined us from a variety of previous roles in retail, hospitality, banking, insurance, direct sales & marketing and are all very glad that they did.

So, if you are looking for a fresh challenge in an interesting & exciting role with superb progression prospects this could be just the job which YOU have been looking for!

Expected start date: March/April 2022

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Remote working

Salary: £21,000.00-£25,000.00 per year.

Additional pay:
Bonus scheme.
Commission pay.
Performance bonus.

Benefits:
Casual dress.
Company events.
Company pension.

Schedule:
Monday to Friday.

ec5256fb1575973a.title: PPC Specialist
ec5256fb1575973a.description: A little bit about usStashbee buzzed onto the scene in 2017 with one vision in mind: to put the world’s unused space to good use. Our co-founders David & Anthony both had subpar experiences as customers of self-storage, and asked themselves “what if there was a one-stop shop for space?”. A way to connect those with spare space to anyone in need of it. More choice, a variety of locations, a wider range of prices, coated with a simple and smart user experience, served alongside impeccable customer service.That’s what we’re building here at Stashbee. A tech enabled global community connecting people with space to those who need it. Stashbee is the simplest, smartest, most sustainable way for anyone to share and fill storage space.Today, we have millions of square feet of space on our platform, making us the fourth largest storage provider in the UK. We’ve empowered our Host community to earn millions of pounds from their unused spaces by connecting them with Renters who need it. Our spaces have been used for everything: household items stored during moves and refurbishments, stock for businesses on the up, classic cars, movie props… We’ve even stored several tonnes of chocolate! We’ve now expanded beyond garages to provide parking, shipping containers and many other space types.Our ambitions are huge and we’re just getting started. Dare we say… watch this space.The Stashbee teamAstute, ambitious and accessible, we’re a driven and talented team who are passionate about reaching our full potential. We come from a variety of professional and personal backgrounds and believe that helping each other grow is the path to business growth. We set ourselves challenging goals, are not afraid of hard work, and are obsessed with learning by doing. We hold ourselves to high standards, we speak our minds, and we believe in accountability and integrity. We’re not afraid to disagree, and we prioritise done over perfect. We’re fundamentally changing how people share and use space, and we’re having a lot of fun doing it.What the role involvesWe’re looking for a PPC Specialist to help us on our exciting and ambitious growth journey. You will be responsible for driving Stashbee’s Paid Advertising results so that we can grow faster and cheaper. You’ll find, test and grow new Paid Marketing channels, developing and executing our marketing strategy, and continuously improving the way we engage, acquire and retain our customers across all our Paid Media channels. Reporting to our Growth Lead, you’ll play a critical role in scaling Stashbee. What you’ll be doing:Defining, owning and executing our marketing strategy working closely with co-founders, the Growth Lead, the wider Stashbee Team, and marketing to ensure we reach our ambitious growth goals.Identifying and implementing new initiatives to drive sales, Host signups, and overall customer engagement. You’ll bring plenty of creative thinking to the table, focusing on the whole customer journey from initial awareness to loyal customer, trialing different paid marketing channels and owning initiatives from idea to execution.Optimising funnel conversion rate by constantly testing, learning and optimising the journey for each of our customersBeing the brand custodian, ensuring our new brand work is brought to life and resonates with both our internal and external audiencesEstablishing and reporting on KPIs. You’ll provide weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting on our Paid Ad marketing performance. You’ll work with team members across Stashbee to ensure that this is providing useful insights that inform smart business decisions.Owning Stashbee’s Paid Ads marketing budget, you’ll be responsible for our overall spend and ROI. You’ll be proactively identifying both tactical and long term opportunities for growth, providing the business case, driving them through to execution, and identifying key lessons learned.Who we’re looking forWe’re looking for a passionate marketer to join our team. If the following sounds like you, we’d like to hear from you:You are a brilliant interpersonal operator with a bias for action (“done better than perfect”). You have a track record of identifying new growth opportunities, and managing and influencing stakeholders to make excellent decisions and get things done quickly and effectively.You have a voracious hunger to learn and add to your existing ‘T-shaped’ marketing skill set.You must be resourceful. The startup world requires that we work well with constraints and under time pressure. You ask questions of yourself and others like “how can we 10x this?” Or “surely there’s an easier way?” And those questions lead to resourceful answers.You’re a strong copywriter and have a real knack for figuring out the exact right phrasing that gets people clicking and signing up.Demonstrable understanding of the wider Digital Marketing landscape (Affiliate, SEO, Paid Social, Social, Referral etc)Proficient in use of Excel to create reports and work with large data setsAbility to build strong collaborative internal & external relationshipsYou have flexibility in adapting to fast-changing priorities and a fast-paced work environmentYou have strong organisational skills, with the ability to keep on top of a number of threads of work at once and hit the ground running. You also understand how to prioritise tasks and focus attention based on potential impact/outcome.You are commercially minded, analytical, and have a good eye for detail.You are an optimistic realist with ambitions to take a start-up with early product-market-fit all the way from ‘early traction’ to ‘global household name’.You have a growth mindset and a track record of delivering impressive results quickly, creatively, and with limited resources.You think big, but test small and frequently. You’re able to identify, test and scale new opportunities for growth/reduced CPA.You have proven experience and success in owning and executing PPC marketing plans. In particular you will have executed multiple successful paid campaigns, and are comfortable with ambitious targets.You have solid experience using a range of tools to assist in the successful delivery of KPIs. You can demonstrate a track record of using analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, Mixpanel, Heap etc), market insight / planning tools (e.g. SEMrush, SpyFu, Google Keyword Planner, Google Trends, iSpionage), SEO tools (Ahrefs, Moz), and so on.An independent thinker and executor. The rest of the team is always at hand to help out or bounce ideas off of, but we’re looking for someone with an endless stream of innovative ideas that can help us increase our ROAS.Experience relating to online platforms or double-sided marketplaces will be highly valued, e.g. using Supply/Demand information to inform decisions, looking at key marketplace health metrics to ensure we have the right amount of each customer type (Host & Renter) to get the most out of spend.You are both highly data literate and perceptive of customer needs/desires. This means being obsessed with measurable targets just as much as you are with the customer’s mindset. On one hand, you have top notch Excel / analytical skills, and are proficient in drawing insight from large data sets to drive business decisions. On the other, you’re able to get to the core of what motivates and deters our customers, and use that insight to make smart marketing choices.Compensation and BenefitsCompetitive salary + share optionsFlexible working with office space in Second Home SpitalfieldsLaptop/tech subsidy schemeSubsidised training/professional apprenticeships25 days of holidayPension plan (Nest)Childcare vouchersWe'd love to hear from you via our digital video interview process here: https://app.willotalent.com/common/671d6fd34fce443e8317d1d90b36e7d7Work RemotelyYesJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £35,000.00-£40,000.00 per yearBenefits:Casual dressChildcareCompany pensionWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayReference ID: ppc-specialist

33b22575e62b7c94.title: ESG Product Marketing Specialist
33b22575e62b7c94.description:
Role Overview
Neuberger Berman believes that material environmental, social and governance characteristics are an important driver of long-term investment returns from both an opportunity and a risk mitigation perspective. Firmwide principles guide our ESG approach; but investment teams execute ESG research, engagement and portfolio decisions for their strategies. The Product Marketing Manager – ESG & Impact is responsible for driving narrative and collateral development for the firm’s ESG investment priorities. This role reports functionally to the Global Head of Product Marketing, and works closely with the ESG & Impact Investing team.
Responsibilities
Distilling complex investment and ESG concepts quickly and incisively across equities, fixed income, alternatives, real estate and multi-asset strategies to refine delivery of ESG messages and develop marketing collateral
Leading the creative process by which core messages are created and shaped
Driving collateral development across multiple communication types: presentations, external and internal websites, thought leadership, talking points, sales guides, investment communications, etc.
Working across all client types, in partnership with Sales and Channel Marketing teams, to support sales activities across Institutional, Intermediary and Private Wealth Management channels
Maintaining expert knowledge of the ESG investing and regulatory landscape
Managing an ESG Investment Communications specialist and work closely with other members of the broad Product Marketing team to enhance their collateral and provide guidance/mentorship
Requirements
Undergraduate degree, and minimum of 10+ years of direct or related experience
Strong investment background and acumen, covering one or more asset classes
Experience in ESG, sustainability or impact and proficiency in ESG and sustainability data, frameworks, reporting, and industry best practices
Strong applied creativity (i.e., the ability to both generate and implement messaging frameworks and ideas)
Outstanding communication skills, including writing and creating presentations
Deep understanding of client experience
Excellent interpersonal skills; ability to interact with all levels of staff including senior management
Motivated self-starter with excellent attention to detail and quality
Excellent proficiency with PowerPoint and Excel
Qualifications
Advanced degrees / qualifications in investment management (e.g. CFA, CAIA) a big plus
Neuberger Berman is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. The Firm and its affiliates do not discriminate in employment because of race, creed, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship status or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, or federal laws, rules, or regulations. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact onlineaccommodations@nb.com .
Learn about the Applicant Privacy Notice .

a02575e2a81b3421.description: Salary: Up to £33,685Location: Cobalt / RemoteJob Reference Number104/22About the RoleReporting to the Marketing Manager, Mortgages & Intermediaries you will be responsible for developing and delivering marketing communication campaigns to grow our direct mortgage category. The role will work closely with all areas of marketing as well as product development, customer outcomes and our branch network.Key duties to include:Execution of the mortgages marketing plan to support business targets.Design, project manage and execute campaigns to acquire, engage and retain new mortgage customers.Utilise insight / data to segment and size the mortgage opportunity in the region / nationally to improve strategy, campaign effectiveness and partner communications.Develop relevant and effective content that will be used across channels e.g. branches, web, social and events.Development of onboarding and in life marketing communications to existing mortgage customers, to support retention targets.To ensure that all mortgage marketing materials and promotions are up to date, compliant and that records are kept of compliance sign-offs.Act as a key contact within Marketing Communications for key internal stakeholders e.g. product marketing, mortgage distribution, branch network.About YouWe are looking for candidates who will bring their passion, experience and skills to help maximise growth from our retail savings category. The ability to multi-task, collaborate effectively and manage a high volume of work is also essential.About UsNewcastle Building Society is the North East’s largest Building Society whose purpose “Connecting our communities with a better financial future” inspires and directs our activities.The Marketing Communication team plays a key part in helping to connect with customers in a meaningful way by creating communications and activities that promote our brand, our purpose and relevant products to existing customers and new prospects. The team is responsible for marketing management, digital services, brand and creative services and data & insight.This is a unique opportunity to take your career to the next level – right here in the heart of the beautiful North East. As part of Newcastle Building Society you will be working in an exciting, friendly and fast-paced workplace (with flexible home working too), with great opportunities for self-development and career progression where you can realise your potential and do your best work.In addition to your salary you receive the below benefits:25 days holiday allowance (rising to 30 days with length of service) + bank holidaysCorporate bonus schemeWorking from home supplement upon joiningSubsidised event ticketsGenerous pension schemePerformance-related payVolunteering daysFlexible working hoursJob Type: Full-timeSalary: £33,685.00 per year

84accf410ac76e81.description: The world is opening up and the demand for pilots is increasing, there is no better time to join our amazing team at Leading Edge Aviation. We’re looking for candidates with marketing experience, and a curiosity for aviation would be fabulous too!You will be joining our expanding team based at Oxford Airport, and you will be part of the journey which delivers world class flight training to the future pilots of the world.If you are interested tell us why you're right for the job in less than 20 words, or maybe you've got an idea for something more creative... e78a1fa6a1576a51.title: Associate Marketing Specialist
e78a1fa6a1576a51.description:
Granicus is the largest cloud solutions provider for government and provides technology that empowers government organisations to create better lives for the people they serve. By offering the industry’s leading cloud-based solutions for communications, content management, meeting and agenda management, and digital services to over 5,500 public sector organisations, Granicus helps turn government missions into quantifiable realities. Come see the impactful work we’ve done on communities across the country (and world!): https://granicus.com/success-stories/

If you are a methodical, driven, creative and analytical, comfortable producing content and conducting data analysis, then we have the perfect role for you. Granicus is seeking an Associate Marketing Specialist with excellent organisational skills, attention to detail, the ability to prioritise tasks in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, and a keen interest in building a career in Marketing.

The Associate Marketing Specialist will report to the UK Marketing Manager and work closely with the Business Development teams to help execute the marketing plan, create content, manage campaigns, generate demand, track performance, and use data to enhance initiatives. This position will be based in our London office, or remotely within the UK.

What You'll Do:

Support the UK Marketing Manager in executing the Marketing Plan
Contribute ideas and concepts for marketing programs designed to promote and grow the Granicus brand
Work effectively with internal and external stakeholders to progress programs that are impactful to Granicus
Play a key role in organising webinars, conferences, trade shows and other events, taking the lead on specific projects where required
Assist in building programs and messaging for different personas
Partner with cross-functional teams to create and edit content, write copy for ads, briefs, emails, presentations, press releases, marketing materials and create other content
Manage social media pages by posting updates and responding to comments and messages
Manage aspects of key marketing systems (marketing automation, CRM) used to generate, distribute, and report on the marketing funnel and its impact on sales pipeline and bookings
Monitor projects and campaigns to optimise performance based on industry best practices
Produce, analyse and maintain metrics reports on marketing and sales activities, effectiveness, and business impact
Maintain contact data quality
Perform other relevant duties as required
Skills & Requirements
Who You Are:

You ideally have a degree in marketing, communications, or general business
You have a strong interest in software marketing, government communications or high-touch sales
You possess some understanding of Account Based Marketing (ABM) best practices
You ideally have an understanding of key marketing systems, such as Salesforce and Zoom Webinars
You are a self-starter that requires minimal supervision and has the business acumen to prioritise projects and workload
You are an excellent communicator with great written skills – You know a good subject line from a great one
You have great organisation and project management skills, and understand how to manage the priorities of multiple stakeholders in a complex environment
You possess the ability to work well in a fast-paced environment where functioning autonomously and collaborating as part of an international team are equally important
You are a self-starter with the curiosity to expand the scope of assigned projects and tasks as needed
You are passionate and/or experienced in working with public sector entities


*Starting rate may vary depending upon location and/or experience*

ca7c3c9930f63c9d.title: Senior Marketing Integration Manager
ca7c3c9930f63c9d.description:
Are you interested in developing and orchestrating innovative multi-channel marketing programs for the LEGO brand across Western Europe?
If you are highly collaborative, have a bias for action and have experience in integrated marketing communications across channels, you can help craft the LEGO Group’s marketing programs!
Core Responsibilities
Work cross-functionally with key collaborators to gear the owned / earned / shared / paid (OESP) activities towards sales and brand impactOrchestrate and align implementation of multi-channel campaigns across local marketsSupport Regional Brand Managers to prepare integrated briefs, identify relevant channels specialists to attend briefing sessions and ensure an integrated response to briefWork with Global and Local Marketing Managers, OESP, to provide support and maintain an editorial calendar across channels and touchpointsDrive continuous improvement of the OESP planning process by elevating local/regional insights to globalDrive the marketing efficiency agenda through a systematic and structured review of channel performance
Play your part in our team succeeding
The Western European Marketing Team helps to shape the global marketing agenda, translates it into regional priorities and builds regional frameworks for execution. It covers the functional areas of digital marketing, trade marketing, media management, marketing planning, marketing performance, brand management and PR & events.
Do you have what it takes
Proven campaign management / marketing project management experienceExperience with coordination of a diverse panel of collaborators and leading cross-functional marketing projectsAbility to establish relationships, inspire and empower others to adopt new ways of workingExperience and passion for building effective multi-channel marketing campaignsExperience working with other brands, either as a brand manager or in an agency capacityA holistic and continuous improvement attitude
Join the global LEGO® team
What’s in it for you. Here are some of what to expect:

Family Care Leave – We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellness – We want you to be your best self, so you’ll have access to the Headspace App and lots of wellbeing initiatives and programmes run by local teams where you are based

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus – We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached, you’ll be rewarded through our global bonus scheme.

Your workplace – Our offices will be your primary workplace with flexibility to work from home during your working week. Your People

Leader will discuss the principles of our hybrid work model, role eligibility and frequency with you.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong!

The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of e.g. race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity.
The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.
Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.
Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.

Bringing it to life
“I am inspired by the ability of the LEGO brand to ignite a desire for kids to learn through play. Being part of the Marketing community enables me to contribute in my own way to making this happen.” - Marketing Planning & Performance Director.

ac273367f83a6c5d.title: Marketing Communication Specialist
ac273367f83a6c5d.description:
Job Title
Marketing Communication Specialist
Job Description
WHAT IS AXIS?
Axis is not just a company - Axis is a culture, Axis is a way of life. The employees here are innovative, dedicated, and energetic and that’s just the beginning. Our employees are the driving force of the company and seek to move it forward towards the goal of being number one in our industry. We encourage our employees to work hard and play harder. We allow and promote independent thinking; we seek to act as one, to be always open, and to think big!
WHAT WILL YOU DO

The position of Regional Communication Specialist at Axis Communications is responsible for driving our marketing communications across our various stakeholder groups in Northern Europe This position is responsible for the delivery of our annual communication calendar, advertising programme and campaign calendar This position will be based in our regional headquarters in Luton with some occasional travel (est. 25%).
JOB QUALIFICATIONS
We are looking for a proactive and creative team player with strong marketing knowledge and experience in a similar marketing position You will have degree in marketing or similar professional qualification. You have excellent organisational skills and are an exceptional project leader with ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously. Experience of working with marketing automation would be an advantage.
Key Responsibilities Include
Management of social media presence and effectiveness
Creation, monitoring and development of the regional communication calendar ensuring targets and deadlines are hit.
Own and drive our internal communication programme across northern Europe
Manage the regional prescence on Axis.Com
Own and manage marketing campaigns for Northern Europe
Presenting marketing updates and campaigns to internal and external stakeholders.
Be the main point of contact with the Global communications marketing team to ensure consistency of approach for Axis globally
WHAT CAN AXIS DO FOR YOU?
In Axis you will work in an international organisation with bright and proactive people in an open minded and innovative culture. You will have the opportunity for international travel and work in an organisation committed to developing the careers of its employees. This is a fantastic opportunity to join the Northern Europe marketing team
READY TO ACT?

If you wish to apply for this opportunity please apply to Dominic Jones, Regional Marketing Manager
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2022-03-10

a022217443c99f3a.title: Ethicon Sales Specialist WC&H East of Scotland
a022217443c99f3a.description:
For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion have been part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Our commitment to respect the dignity and diversity of all is embedded in our Credo.
We know that the success of our business depends on having the best talent in a workforce that reflects the diverse markets we serve around the world and an inclusive culture that values different perspectives and life experiences
That is why we are working to create an inclusive environment where diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences are valued, and each and every one of our people feels that they belong and can reach their potential. No matter who they are.
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Johnson & Johnson means “You Belong”!
Who are we?
Profound Change Requires Boldness. Johnson & Johnson is the largest and most broadly-based healthcare company in the world. We’re producing life-changing breakthroughs every day and have been for the last 130 years. The combination of new technologies and your expertise enables amazing things to happen. Teams from J&J’s consumer business are crafting digital tools to help people track the health of their skin. Those working in medical devices are 3-D printing artificial joints personalized for each patient, while researchers in pharmaceuticals use AI to discover lifesaving drugs. Imagine what the rest of our team of 134,000 people at 260 companies in more than 60 countries across the world is accomplishing. We redefine what it means to be a big company in today’s world.
Johnson & Johnson – Ethicon
Ethicon is devoted to shaping the future of surgery by advancing innovation, addressing the most pressing healthcare issues and improving lives every day. Our product portfolio includes energy devices, wound closure, endo-mechanical, cardiothoracic, gynae, urology, thyroid and biosurgery surgical devices.
We have an exciting and challenging role within our team as a Wound Closure Sales Specialist covering East of Scotland.
The Sales Specialist will be responsible for growing as well as supporting and defending sales in existing accounts across their designated territory.
Purpose of the role
Achieve agreed objectives and sales targets as outlined in the annual performance cycle.
Focus on working with a broad range of NHS Stakeholders: Clinical and Non-Clinical. Identify and interact with key customers and stakeholders within the NHS and Private accounts within designated territory.
Manage the designated territory through the development of comprehensive business plans. Focus on highest value opportunities to grow and develop new business including taking competitor share and the adoption of new technologies whilst maintaining key customers and core business.
Manage and develop accounts and own the relationship between the Company and the customer, ensuring efficient alignment of all efforts to maximise impact of all activities driving growth.
Collaborate across J&J Medical Devices to work effectively with the Integrated Account Teams to work together with our customers.
Qualifications
What to expect:
You will need to build strong networks of relationships that enable the identification of mutually beneficial opportunities to sell key technologies in the surgical procedural environment.
Presenting brand value propositions and value-added customer solutions to positively influence buying behaviours.
You will analyse and interpret account strategies and plans utilising key systems and data, both internally and externally, where appropriate to gain a broad understanding of the business environment and insights in to account needs.
Partner with Professional Education department to develop and maintain associated KOL relationships as well as championing the effective use of the Company’s comprehensive Professional Education offering.
Who Will You Be Working With
Reporting into the Regional Sales Manager, you will work closely with the following people:
Medical Device Sales teams within your region
Marketing
Professional Education
Commercial Excellence
Strategic Capabilities
Customer Services

Qualifications
Who are we looking for?
To excel in this role, you will need to:
Have a proven track record in Surgical Sales, Influencing and business partnering skills.
Understand stakeholder’s requirements and be able to analyse requirements and develop strategies that drives the adoption of technologies and become a trusted business advisor providing solutions.
Demonstrate the ability to build trust with customers by asking probing questions that helps the customer achieve their objectives, acting in a consultative manner
Effectively utilise the Company’s selling tools (Integrity Selling)
Maintain deep clinical expertise in procedure and product knowledge
What type of mark will YOU make?
By joining Johnson & Johnson you will find boundless opportunities to craft your path & amplify your impact inside & outside our walls. And with our commitment to be the world’s healthiest workforce you can strengthen your body as well and your mind. When you work at Johnson & Johnson you can touch over a Billion lives worldwide every day. And when you apply your talent to our collective purpose there’s no end to the lasting impact we can make together. And that changes everything.
What’s in it for YOU?
It’s important to us that you feel you can bring your whole self to work; at Johnson & Johnson we provide an environment for you to fulfil your career aspirations as well as promoting your physical and mental wellbeing. As part of our offering, you will receive a competitive compensation and benefits package as well as benefits that can be tailored to what is valuable to you throughout different stages of your life. Examples of this include: online Digital GP, private healthcare, Retail Vouchers, Discounted & Subsidised Gym memberships and you can get to support community projects as part of our global Corporate Social Responsibility programme.
Johnson & Johnson is a supporter of equal opportunities and is a proud member of Disability Confident.
We respectively request Government Officials to identify themselves as such on application; for the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. If you decide to apply for the position, any personal data which you provide shall be processed by Johnson & Johnson. Your personal data shall be processed for the purposes of recruitment, recruitment policy and selection.

fcb97328f7072c90.description:
Position Summary:
Key position on the Commercialization team under Divisional Marketing. You will be leading impactful commercialization programs, working closely other Senior Leaders across the Division. Enabling divisional STRAP development, actively supporting our divisional wide marketing programs, from planning to execution. We need a person who is passionate about our customers and about working with both Marketing and Sales teams across the globe. The ideal candidate has good level of project management skills, data driven, detailed oriented, and with an ability to understand the big picture.
Have ownership of a specific global commercialization program. This position will work closely with the peers and Marketing leaders as they plan and craft this program. This role will also closely work with Vertical Marketing and Product Marketing teams, throughout the process. There is also a need to coordinate with Regional Marketing teams and Sales leadership to drive execution for this program. This includes leading execution across the regions, handling costs, supervising revenues and pipeline associated with programs.
Responsibilities:
It is a newly formed team and you will have the ability to help us define the processes and operating rhythm, and connection points throughout the organization.
Builds operational program management plans and tactical marketing plans for specific campaigns in collaboration with cross-functional teams, and successfully owns the execution of those plans
Responsible for the roll-out and overall management of global marketing programs to support pipeline growth, marketing strategy, and revenue growth
Collaborate with key partners including product marketing, product management, regional marketing commercial, business unit leaders and other marketing personnel to drive program management
Programs will be large scale, sophisticated, multi-channel projects across brand, creative, insights, media, PR, field and channel marketing. Develops a deep understanding of each of these groups, the role each plays, and the dependencies in the development of coordinated marketing campaigns
Measure and report on projects/campaign and progress against goals; root cause, counter measure
Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:
BA in Marketing, Business, or related field. MBA is desired
3+ years Marketing or Commercial experience
Experience leading global and sophisticated projects are a differential
Analytical approach and detailed oriented
Customer centric with a strong orientation towards growth
Strong leadership skills including the power to influence leadership and peers at all levels
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Strong project management and problem-solving skills
Ability to travel 10-15% of the time

c6bb6ad47900ccea.title: Customer Assistant - Specialist
c6bb6ad47900ccea.description:
Job Specification


Customer Assistant - Specialist


Booths is more than just a well-loved store. It is a family. It is about the People, the Product and the Place. We have been a family-run business since 1847 and joining our team really does feel like joining a caring, supportive family. You feel special and each day we all work together to be the difference.

Our Dream is to be loved by our customers for inspiring and nourishing their desire for excellent food and drink.

We believe in buying, making, selling and marketing the best food and drink.
So, as a Customer Assistant, you will already be a natural when it comes to customer service however, with our bespoke training you will become an expert in delighting our customers with our warm northern welcome and creating a magical shopping experience for our customers.

Working in one of our departments your day will be filled with a variety of interesting tasks, from checking stock and keeping records to looking after health and safety and food hygiene. Our customers will be your main focus and everything you do will be with their shopping experience in mind. If they are happy, then we are happy - and that is what Booths is all about. You do not need retail experience to join our family but you do need to be the kind of warm, friendly, hardworking and innovative person who can shine in front of our customers and fit comfortably into a hard working close team.

contract hours vary from 7.5hours to 22.5 hours. overtime is often available up to full time

dee8c3dd9dc2c028.description:
To successfully launch and market Canon’s Office offer and drive business growth in line with MTP.
To manage all product related activities as product/market expert including appropriate value propositions and applications.
What we give
With Canon, you'll get the support and encouragement you need to grow, from people who share your ambition. We'll invest in your professional development to help you learn and progress in your role with us. You'll find leaders who give you the freedom to explore new things and a team where knowledge is shared openly.
Manage the full product lifecycle marketing and revenue supporting/boosting activities for the office segment.

Support new product launches and ensure go-to-market readiness addressing the whole value chain from direct and indirect sales through to customers, working in alignment with the Office Product Planning, Business Planning, and other division; orchestrate the creation of new collaterals and assets linked to a B2B buying cycle, working with the Marketing functions. Ensure alignment with Product Planning in product administration activities including data set-up, product set-up, documentation and updates. Contribute to the pricing and channel strategy development driven by Business Development and Product planning including pricing models based on sales targets, cost drivers, pricing benchmarks, competition pricing. Plan and conduct market and competitor analysis and elaborate competitive advantages.
Support the selected product portfolio by clearly understanding and promoting how our technology adds value to customers and partners alike; improve product awareness and education into the sales channels through the NSOs/RSOs by creating engaging and compelling content about the benefits of our technology; manage and update marketing and sales tools such as product guides/brochures, sales tools, press releases, direct mailings, and web content to ensure maximum impact of content; work with other division as a subject matter expert to execute relevant applications and vertical specific initiatives; create and deliver marketing activity plans to support defined business unit objectives and strategies.
Support product marketing activities of related divisions through sharing ideas and assets with other regions and acting as a window between central HQ and local NSOs, and being the interface for product launch and sales activities. Gather and apply market insights; the voice of the market, sales channels and customers to help feed into future technology development, and marketing strategies.
Events management – Support delivery, and communications of both internal and external events and working with Sales, Marketing and Corporate functions.
What we ask

The successful candidate will have extensive marketing experience in a B2B technology, ideally professional printing segment.Able to demonstrate a high level of accuracy and attention to detail, well organized, able to plan effectivelyStrong interpersonal skills to engage with different stakeholders including technical and sales communitiesExcellent communication and presentation skillsGood working knowledge with Systems/Network/PC tools such as Excel, Power Point etc...Understanding of technology and passion for creative message delivery; to know how products, software and services come together to create and deliver a solutionCan gather and apply market insights, form, and apply strategic thinkingActs as a team player but is results drivenA Bachelors’ degree in a business or marketing discipline or higher
You will needCommunicate effectivelyPlan & Organise effectivelyFocus on the customerCreate insightAct as a team playerDrive for results
Further Information
Job Family: Product Management & Product Marketing
Grade: 11
Salary ramge: £39000 - £45,900
Canon is enriching lives and businesses in incredible new ways. You can play a part in shaping the future of a company that’s visionary, innovative and bold. As the world's best imaging company, we're living and working together for the common good.
