48548e44f3b40578.title: Tender Specialist, Italian
48548e44f3b40578.description:
Tender Specialist – Italian speaking
Why Us
By joining the EMEA Tender team, you'll join a culture fueled by innovation, collaboration and openness, helping change lives by driving advancements in life sciences, oncology, reproductive health, agriculture and other emerging markets. Your new colleagues are all deeply passionate about what they do, knowing that our work has the power to improve lives. You will coordinate, track and control multiple tenders which relate to Illumina's broad cutting-edge product portfolio.
Over the last few years, Illumina has experienced rapid expansion and this role is supporting our continued growth plans.
Why You
You will be a strong administrator, preferably with experience in tender coordination, who is fluent in business Italian. You will work on multiple tenders at any one time and thrive at meeting business critical deadlines in our fast-paced environment. You will have excellent attention to details and good communication skills as well as a collaborative style. You may have worked in life sciences or clinical diagnostics in an administration role and it would be a benefit if you have used Salesforce previously.
To be ideal for this role you will have a strong administrative background and preferably experience within bid management, marketing or business development.
As Italian speaking Tender specialist you will be a vital part of our Commercial Operations Team. You will work closely with our sales, service, finance and contracts/legal functions across EMEA and get involved in some truly exciting projects involving improving human health.
If you want to push boundaries and join a culture fueled by innovation, collaboration and openness, this role could be for you. If you want a brilliant, fast-paced, mission-driven environment, then Illumina is the place for you.
The Role
You will be responsible for administration of the full tender process, reviewing tender requirements, assisting with quotations, preparing submission documentation, and ensuring each proposal is reviewed and approved before submission. This role is based in our European Head Office in Cambridge.
Key responsibilities include
Undertake and complete PQQ, RFQ submissions and technical/compliance information to accompany tender bids and responses to expressions of interest
Download/upload tender documents via procurement portals
Manage clarification questions/responses
Maintain a library of frequently used documents and standard responses
Liaise with colleagues to gather supportive data and works information
Manage the approval process before the tender is submitted
Create and collate information as required including CVs, technical information, statistics and presentation slides
Create production of final documents
Review all tender documentation prior to submission, checking for errors/completeness
What can you expect
With Illumina you can expect a highly competitive salary accompanied by a market leading benefits package. You will be part of the global leader in the Sequencing industry where you will find robust growth opportunities and career development within Illumina.
Our team members are bright, energetic and dedicated - they are the driving force behind our innovation and impact. To attract the best and brightest, we offer a competitive employee benefits program. We view it as a smart investment in our people, one that recognizes the tremendous value they bring to our business every day. At Illumina, we push boundaries. We think beyond the conventional. We dream big. With the energy of so many bright and accomplished people, the opportunities are endless.
INDHP

03dd8c072a7be216.title: Regulatory Affairs Specialist
03dd8c072a7be216.description:
Regulatory Affairs Scientist
Johnson & Johnson Consumer Health EMEA R&D is recruiting for a Regulatory Affairs Scientist to be based in High Wycombe, United Kingdom.
Johnson & Johnson Consumer Inc., based in Skillman, N.J., is one of the world's largest consumer health and personal care products company. Our consumer companies produce many of the world's most trusted brands, among them JOHNSON'S® Baby, BAND-AID®, NEUTROGENA®, TYLENOL®, MOTRIN®, and LISTERINE®. Each one of our consumer businesses embraces innovative science to create products that anticipate consumer needs and create experiences that help them live healthy, vibrant lives.
The Regulatory Affairs Scientist will be accountable to ensure any product and activity related to Essential Health/Skin Health projects is within the framework of regulations, by anticipating, understanding, and managing situations with solutions respecting the internal values f the company credo. The role requires competence from early product development to commercialization at regional level (EAME) depending on brand size. This role draws on your scientific and technical regulatory expertise to ensure regulatory standards are met in line with best practices. This is a role that encompasses a number of responsibilities.
YOUR responsibilities & YOUR impact
Project Execution
To partner and support R&D and Franchise (Marketing) for cosmetics and/or commodity products throughout development up to commercialization and product lifecycle by:
deploying regulatory expertise for the EAME region
participating in cross-functional project teams and handle routine organizational processes
assessing the claims requested by the Marketing
supporting different departments from a regulatory perspective (e.g., quality, safety)
compiling and reviewing relevant documentation ensuring compliance with EU/UK and EAME requirements
ensuring compliance throughout the lifecycle of the products
assisting during inspections and/or challenges by Authorities and competitors
To support Product Registration by:
Ensuring the successful delivery of non-EU registration support to affiliates and distributors so that they can acquire the product registrations for launch.
Operating a centralizing registration documentation model and ensuring only relevant, compliant, and validated documents are issued to the local affiliates within the agreed timelines, by working collaboratively with other regulatory colleagues, manufacturing sites, other J&J departments and approved external partners.
Monitoring regulatory topics relating to cosmetic product registration and helps to maintain the relevant tools updated to support launch plans working in close collaboration with local regulatory.
Technical Understanding
Understand EU/UK cosmetics and general product safety relevant legislations
Other Duties
Understand global and non-EU legislative landscape
Financial acuity - Understand the business model and strategy
Maintain awareness of new and emerging legislations impacting our products and brands.

Qualifications

Required Minimum Qualifications and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Science, Engineering, Pharmacy
1-3 years related experience required
Knowledge and Skills:
Experience in EU and UK cosmetic regulations is required.
Experience in other EU product legislations (e.g. General Products, Medical Devices, Toys, Chemicals) is an advantage
Fluent written and oral English communication skills are required.
Fluency in French (written and oral) is an advantage.
Experience working with external manufacturing and technical project management is an advantage
Required Abilities:
Digital and Data Fluency: Using business metrics, analytics and internal and external data to generate insights.
End to End Thinking and Integrated Problem solving: Driving end-to-end Regulatory thinking to increasing innovation and deliver a functional, coordinated solution driven by smart compliance
Business Acumen: Understanding of the business context in which the organization operates incl. Business strategy, competition and how individual initiatives and activities relate to critical business drivers
Internal and External collaboration: Building and cultivating relationships internally, cross-functionally and externally. Collaborating openly across boundaries and acting as a great teammate. Communicating in a compelling way. Ability to work with complexity and ambiguity.
Learning agility and continuous development: Learning from experiences and failures and adapting to new situations. Being self-aware, developing self and others’ continuous learning and implementing new skills.
Adaptability and Agility: Ability to adjust thinking and behavior to changing situations – internal, external and inter-related aspects. Requires emotional intelligence and resilience to drive and adapt to change
Working Relationships
Internal
Marketing and Franchise, R&D, Medical/Safety, Supply Chain, Local Regulatory Affairs
External
Health Authorities, External Manufacturers
Who We Are!
Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) have been part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Our commitment to respect the dignity and diversity of all is embedded in our Credo.
We know that the success of our business depends on having the best talent in a workforce that reflects the diverse markets we serve around the world and an inclusive culture that values different perspectives and life experiences.
That is why we are working to create an inclusive environment where diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences are valued and each and every one of our people feel that they belong and can reach their potential. No matter who they are.
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Johnson & Johnson means “You Belong”!
Johnson & Johnson announced plans to seperate our Consumer Health business to create a new publicly traded company. The process of the planned seperation is anticipated to be completed within 24 months, and it will be subject to legal requirements including consultation with works councils and other employee representative bodies, as required, and other customary conditions and approvals. Should you accept this position, it is anticipated that, following conclusion of the transaction, you would be an employee of a new entity within New Consumer Health and your employment would be governed by New Consumer Health's employment processes, programs, policies and benefit plans. In that case, details of anyplanned changes would be provided to you by New Consumer Health at an appropriate time and subject to any necessary consultation processes.

United Kingdom-England-High Wycombe-

c671d0c6de5db432.title: Creative Content Specialist – HyperX EMEA
c671d0c6de5db432.description:
HyperX
HyperX is a leading brand within the gaming peripherals market and is part of HP, following an acquisition in June 2021. Every day, billions of people wake up, eat and fire up a game as part of their usual routine and at HyperX, we’re right there with them. We know that whatever they play, however they play, we’re all gamers – and our products are made to enhance their gaming life.
Introduction to Role
We are looking for a talented creative with a specialised skill set in videography and photography, who will play a key role in levelling up the established in-house content creation capabilities for HyperX EMEA.
This role will sit within the EMEA Creative Studio team, based in our Sunbury EMEA office. The team is a function of the EMEA Marketing department and provides an in-house design, artwork and video/photo production resource for the HyperX brand.
The EMEA Creative Studio works in collaboration with the EMEA and Global Marketing teams and selected agencies to help execute campaigns and marketing assets across all consumer touch points, ensuring that the brand look & feel is consistent and of the highest standard.
Reporting to the Creative Studio Manager you will execute a wide variety of exciting video and photo projects across all HyperX channels. This includes but is not limited to digital brand comms, ecommerce marketing and social media.
HP makes technology work for people – we succeed when we help our customers succeed. That is the essence of the HP story. And our global marketing team uses the latest best practices and a measured balance of online and offline strategies to share that story with HP’s external audiences. HP marketers work closely with the business units to ensure that all external activities align with the company’s overall business strategy. We do this by bringing our talents to bear in all phases of marketing, including strategic planning, branding, advertising, events, product and retail support, social media, the web, and analytics – all on a global scale.
Responsibilities:
Execute creative requests for the HyperX EMEA Marketing team to support business needs.
Support HyperX brand growth through digital content by creating engaging campaign commercials (brand and product), video content series, short-form social media videos, event content, internal/external showreels, POS/Retail content and photography-based assets.
Work collaboratively in a small and nimble in-house creative team to plan productions, execute shoots, edit, and deliver high-quality assets in a timely manner
Operate and maintain our in-house production kit including cameras from RED, Blackmagic and Sony, Lighting, audio and general studio equipment.
Use Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop and Lightroom to produce engaging video, photo, and design content.
Conceptualise exciting creative ideas based on briefs and within budget.
Identify needs for external resource, research, onboard and manage them for applicable productions.
Research and proactively test current cinematography and photography trends, including creative approaches in the gaming industry.
Arrange translations where required and localise text over content accordingly.
Support the Creative Studio Team with other tasks such as graphic design, resizes and product launch assets.
Education and Experience:
Typically, 5+ years of experience in creating professional video and photo content.
Established portfolio of professional work to demonstrate your experience.
Solid knowledge in the theory and practical processes involved in cinematography and photography. Including camera, lighting, sound, editing and grading.
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite and an expert understanding of post-production workflow and delivery.
Experience leading different roles on set, including directing, camera operating, lighting & audio.
Good leadership and organisational skills, ability to manage workloads, multitask and meet tight deadlines.
Desired Experience:
Background working with consumer lifestyle products and global campaigns.
Experience working within a wider marking team + and in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation.
Experience working with cameras from RED, Blackmagic and Sony.
Animation/Motion graphics.
Graphic Design.
Traits
Creative, enthusiastic and driven.
Desire to develop new projects, ideas and programmes
Team player that can credibly communicate with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders using strong verbal, written and interpersonal skills.
High attention to detail required with a high degree of accuracy.
Willingness to travel both within UK, EMEA and globally if needed.
#LI-POST
About HP


You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.


HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.


Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

eea628294e56a107.title: Communications Specialist
eea628294e56a107.company: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
eea628294e56a107.description:
You will help us to improve the care we deliver by telling our stories of continuous quality improvements, excellence, innovation and partnership working.

You will be comfortable taking the lead on projects and be able to act as an adviser to colleagues about the most effective way to communicate and engage, spanning internal, external and digital communications, media and stakeholder relations, digital communications and marketing of our services.

You will have strong project management skills to ensure work is completed to a high standard, within relevant timescales and costs and all activity is aligned to Trust priorities.

You will be the communications lead for Trust projects and be the Trust’s communications representative at multi-agency meetings.

You will support work across the Trust and with wider partners and stakeholders to reduce health inequalities and access to care in our communities.

As a key member of the communications team you will support and deliver:

Internal and external communications
Developing, commissioning and overseeing work with Trust colleagues and external partners, stakeholders and agencies to tell our stories of high operational standards, continuous quality improvement, clinical excellence, innovation and partnership working
Maintaining and enhancing our reputation with our patients, staff, partners and stakeholders through clear, concise, open and honest communications

Thank you for your interest in this role.

Sherwood is nationally recognised as being an excellent place to work and deliver care. We are rightly proud of the 5,500 colleagues who work here and we were the Health Service Journal’s Trust of the Year in 2020.

The Care Quality Commission rated King’s Mill Hospital Outstanding and Newark, and Mansfield Community Hospitals Good. Overall we are rated Outstanding for care.

For the last three years, we have been ranked as the best NHS Trust to work for in the Midlands and in 2020 we were the third best Acute/Community NHS Trust in England.

Happy colleagues deliver better care. Our teams work in a supportive, inclusive environment, which nurtures wellbeing and has opportunities for development and progression. We do not just care for our patients, we also care for you.

We would love you to join us.

Designing and delivering effective communications activity using the full communications and marketing mix to support service delivery and Trust priorities.

Supporting the Communications Team on external communications and media relations activity. This could include writing press releases, briefings for external stakeholders and co-ordinating visits, events and official openings.

Working in partnership with staff at all levels across the Trust (including the Trust Board and Executive Team) to advise, influence and support them on communications issues as required. This will include writing communications strategies for specific projects and advising on reactive and high-profile media issues.

Under the direction of the Head of Communications, provide and receive highly complex and sensitive information where co-operation and agreement will be required.

Developing media campaigns – for both external and internal audiences and directing on messaging, creatives and evaluation for these campaigns.

Working as a member of the wider-communications team to develop messaging for different audiences and stakeholders, including MPs, foundation trust members, patients, media, GPs/clinical commissioning groups, local residents and community.

Responding to media requests on issues which are often sensitive and highly complex.

Briefing and escorting journalists/photographers/film crews around the Trust in line with Trust policies.

Producing and presenting information (presentations / leaflets) on sensitive issues to staff, the media and other stakeholders.

Developing new and building on existing mechanisms for effectively communicating Trust-wide issues, key committee decisions and policies.

Contributing to the production of Trust publications by researching, writing and editing articles and providing photographs.

To commission work by in-house and external graphic designers and creative agencies for campaigns and other corporate communications priorities.

Helping to manage the strategic co-ordination of the Trust’s communications and marketing activity – contributing to a forward-planning grid for all channels.

Working with other members of the team to develop, maintain and promote effective and inclusive internal communications systems and mechanisms for staff recognition, involvement and engagement.

Providing advice to staff and patients on media handling and meeting confidentiality and consent guidelines.

Ensuring that all Trust information meets NHS corporate identity guidelines.

12788e831a2f340d.title: Legal Specialist
12788e831a2f340d.description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience working with commercial agreements in a non-attorney role.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience drafting and partnering commercial agreements.
Ability to interpret legal documents, discuss agreements, review marketing materials, advise business and product managers on legal and regulatory issues, and work with attorneys to complete agreements and launch marketing initiatives.
Demonstrated organizational and communication skills.
About the job
With a company growing at such fast speeds, every day another agreement is made to keep Google running. As a member of the Legal Contracts team, you review and revise contracts - often juggling several at a time. You develop practical and innovative ways to meet Google's needs and keep the company thriving, with the ability to affect Google's long-term goals.

As Legal Specialist, you will work closely with various Google teams. You'll discuss and draft sponsorship agreements, co-marketing agreements, inbound services agreements, statements of work, and other legal documents. You'll advise the Google teams on agreement interpretation, risk assessment and mitigation, and partnering strategy. You'll also review materials, and work cross-functionally with Compliance, Finance, and other Legal teams to ensure we are meeting our legal obligations. In addition, you'll work on the development of internal fallbacks, training, and policies to guide cross-functional teams, improve efficiency, and provide support to the Legal Operations team.
20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for working with some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you address unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.
Responsibilities
Review, draft, discuss, and manage commercial agreements.
Advise business customers on the legal issues and risks, complex agreement structures, approval processes, and company policies and procedures.
Create and improve agreement templates, fallbacks, trainings, processes, and other resources.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

4a1b20a0d7b07a29.title: Talent Marketing Specialist
4a1b20a0d7b07a29.description:
Talent Marketing Specialist

We're Celonis, the global leader in execution management and process mining technology, and one of the 50 most valuable private companies in the world. We believe that every company can unlock its full execution capacity - and for that, we need you to join us as a Talent Marketing Specialist.

The Team:
You’ll join our growing Global Talent Marketing team to help bring our employer value proposition (EVP) to life. Together, we’re focused on two key things: growing awareness of Celonis as a once-in-a-generation company to work for and showcasing our culture, people, and career opportunities to the right talent at the right time. A welcoming and supportive atmosphere is key for us. We connect on a regular basis to brainstorm ideas and share learnings. Diversity is super important to us and we truly believe in equality - in our team everyone has the same seat at the table.

The Role:

As a Talent Marketing Specialist, you’ll help us attract and engage with best-in-class talent globally. You’ll be responsible for talent marketing initiatives such as employee advocacy, content creation, recruiter enablement, events, and reputation management. Your work will impact the overall Celonis candidate experience and directly support the growth of Team Celonis around the world.

The work you’ll do:

Create content for various candidate journey touchpoints, including but not limited to job descriptions, collateral, email templates, newsletters, blogs, and social media posts
Coordinate and promote global recruitment webinars and talent brand events
Host TA Brand onboarding sessions and trainings for all new recruiters in EMEA
Manage TA Marketing’s employee advocacy program and platforms (Bambu and Glassdoor)
Work cross-functionally with the culture, design, and social media teams to promote career opportunities and what it’s like to work at Celonis internally and externally
Support special projects like hiring pushes or events as needed
The qualifications you need:

1 - 3 years of experience in marketing, recruiting, or human resources
Familiarity with talent brand platforms such as Glassdoor, Kununu, LinkedIn, and other job boards
Ability to create unique, persona-based content and messaging aligned to hiring needs
Project management and coordination skills
Fluency in spoken and written English

What Celonis can offer you:

The unique opportunity to work within a new category of technology, Execution Management
Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, mentorships, yearly development stipend)
Great compensation and benefits packages (stock options, 401(K) matching, generous time off, parental leave, and more)
Work from home support (mindfulness tools such as Headspace, monthly remote working stipend, flexible working hours, virtual events and workshops)
A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
Employee resource communities to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future

About Us

Celonis believes that every company can unlock its full execution capacity. Powered by its market-leading process mining core, the Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of applications, and developer studio and platform capabilities for business executives and users to eliminate billions in corporate inefficiencies. Celonis has thousands of global customers and is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York City, USA with 15 offices worldwide.

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.

6ab1c9ed13e2d3f3.description:
Application due 2022-03-29
Sales, Marketing & Product Management
Associate
Stockholm, Stockholm, Sweden | Willenhall, England, United Kingdom
We’re trusted by millions of people every day to keep what’s important to them safe. Their home, family, and belongings. Looking after our people is just as important to us.
When you join our Yale team, you’ll also be part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. You’ll have 50,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries. We’ll help you unlock your potential with a focus on personal development, regular feedback, leadership programs, and every chance to build an international career you can be proud of.
Are you interested in a challenge within brand & marketing, combining communications and technology in a dynamic team and business in growth phase? Do you love to produce engaging, brilliant digital content and campaigns that drives growth? If yes, then this role is what you’re looking for!
In this brand-new role, you will be part of a passionate and engaged global Brand Team, based in Stockholm (Willenhall in the UK may be consider as well). You will report to Global Brand & Marketing Manager for Yale.
What will you do as our Global Marketing Coordinator?
We are currently after a highly skilled and ambitious Marketing Professional with interest to support our marketing strategy and communications. This opportunity will help you to grow your expertise in marketing from different perspectives and challenge you with driving projects across different marketing levels and markets.
As the Global Marketing Coordinator for Yale, you'll be ensuring that the brand’s storytelling, experiences and campaigns and our marketing strategies are setting us up to speak to consumers in a way that builds the brand, improves consumer experience and grows the business.
You will also:
Support the development, implementation and measurement of the marketing plans across the divisions
Ensure consistency on all touchpoints both in print, in digital on brand, marketing and corporate level
Support the central development of brand campaigns and value-based online and offline content for implementation across the divisions
Support the divisions in their local development requests and drive consistency in product & brand marketing
Research and analysis of market trends
Be involved in global events, shows and webinars
Manage the Yale content in our brand portal and other marketing platforms
Co-ordinate with our divisions on social media excellence, providing guidance and content
The skills and experience you’ll need to succeed
We are looking for someone with:
2-3 years of experience in similar role in a global company/context
Understanding of branding and design with experience in creating great looking, inspiring PPT/presentations and training materials
Experience working with cross-functional, cross-cultural settings
Ability to work independently, thrive and be creative on your own
Proven track of B2C campaign co-ordination for complex products and solutions combining creativity and data to create customer centric campaigns and experiences.
Good organization and a strong attention to details
Experience from consumer goods industry is a plus
Experienced in copywriting and/or UX writing is a big plus
Fluent in English
We review applications as they come in, so apply today!
We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply, no later than the 29th of March.
To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Sara Vigliotti, Talent Acquisition Specialist at sara.vigliotti@assaabloy.com
When you join Yale, we open doors for you
We’re trusted by millions of people every day to keep what’s important to them safe. Their home, family and belongings. Looking after our people is just as important to us.
When you join our Yale team, you’ll also be part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. You’ll have 50,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
#LI-Yale

3aa850896d97a6bd.title: Student Information Officer
3aa850896d97a6bd.description: Student Information Officer – Permanent Full TimeThe University of Law (ULaw) is one of the world's largest law schools. With an impressive history dating back to 1876, we employ over 1,000 staff and have over 14,000 students studying on our undergraduate and postgraduate programmes, along with an alumni network in excess of 100,000. We were the first-ever independent institution to be granted degree awarding powers and in 2012 we gained university title. With a rich heritage and a reputation for innovation and contemporary teaching practices, we continuously focus on developing the best legal and business minds. In 2016, we opened our leading Business School, further enhancing our reputation as a full service legal, business and educational training specialist, operating from campuses throughout the UK, Berlin and Hong Kong and an Online campus.What really sets us apart from other universities is the guiding principle that future lawyers and business leaders should learn in a realistic, professional and contemporary context, with plenty of practical interactive engagement. That's why we keep our contact hours high and our teaching groups small.We are looking to recruit a full time Student Information Officer within our Manchester Campus Operations.You will be a key member of the Student Information team, providing exceptional customer service and first-class, front-line information, advice and guidance to students and staff across all programmes.You will act as first point of contact, providing general information on a range of non-academic queries and ensure students have a positive experience whilst at the University,The Student Information team also assists students in accessing specialist advice and support from other ULaw services including welfare, disability support and inclusion, employability and study skills.A key part of the role is also contributing to the delivery of a professional front of house service to students, including taking a lead on initiating and marketing on-campus events to enhance the student experience.We are keen to attract applicants with strong client-facing, customer service backgrounds from within Education and Tourism, as well as skills in co-ordinating and marketing events.*The role is full time, Monday to Friday with occasional Saturday work on teaching weekends.We offer an excellent range of competitive benefits including a generous annual leave allowance, private medical scheme, contributory pension scheme, life assurance, training and qualifications, and travel loans.Please note, CVs will not be considered and only application forms are accepted for this role.No agencies please.Some posts within the University are subject to a DBS check - you will be notified of this during the application process.We are one of the world’s largest law schools with an impressive history going back to 1876. We employ over 1,000 staff and have over 14,000 students studying law, criminology and policing, as well as business through our dedicated business school. ULaw has an outstanding reputation as a full service legal and educational training specialist, operating from 15 locations in 13 cities across the UK along with our international locations in Berlin and Hong Kong, plus additional global reach through online and virtual provision.What do we offer?We offer an inclusive and supportive work environment and are committed to developing our staff through a variety of means including educational sponsorship, discounted course fees and a range of in-house training. We also offer a generous annual leave allowance and private medical insurance.Our approachDiversity and Inclusion is central to everything we do. We are actively committed to promoting and participating in good practice in the way we attract and retain staff, as we appreciate the value and benefits of a truly diverse workforce. Aligned to this is the opportunity to join one of our three self-organised staff networks for Black, Asian and Minority staff, Disabled staff and LGBTQ+ staff.We celebrate difference and recognise the benefits that this brings to our inclusive culture, including age, disability, gender identity and expression, religion, race, sex, sexual orientation and socio-economic background. The University is committed to ensuring our workforce is reflective of our diverse student population and, therefore, we are striving to increase the representation of Black, Asian, Minority, Ethnic (BAME) backgrounds across all roles and at all levels. All appointments will be made on merit.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £22,000.00-£24,000.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to FridayReference ID: REQ000988
