9eaa154088d5a4f0.title: Marketing Operations Specialist
9eaa154088d5a4f0.description:
We're looking for a strong Marketing Operations Specialist to join our team in London and become an integral part of our Marketing function.
The Marketing Operations Specialist is the go-to person to drive operational excellence within the WSGN marketing team from the central Marketing Operations team by acting as a single point of contact to pre-empt operational challenges, create solutions and execute on them.
Working within the Marketing Performance & Automation, Content & Design teams, as well as external agency partners you will be responsible for:
Driving marketing campaign and programme execution
Translating strategic plans into operational workstreams
Ensuring internal and external milestones are met
Ensuring risk is mitigated and communicated to stakeholders
Managing resource shortage/conflict
Key Responsibilities
Initiating campaign/programme kick-off sessions with relative internal/external contributors and stakeholders across the business including but not limited to: product marketing, content, design, marketing performance & automation, data & agencies
Working with Data and Marketing Performance & Automation to ensure accurate data lists are defined and constructed in line with campaign or programme goals
Ensuring campaign delivery is on track with any blockers/slippage escalated
Providing regular periodic status reports tracking campaign/programme initiatives against deadline
Ensuring measurement framework is setup to track programme or campaign performance and that regular periodic reporting and dashboards are being shared with the appropriate audience(s) internally and externally
Scheduling and facilitating kick off meetings, status meetings, and Work in Progress meetings (Forecast vs. Budget.)
Ensure actions defined as part of the aforementioned meetings are captured and executed e.g. optimisation decisions, spend reallocation etc.
Co-ordinating agenda and interaction with agency partners, (briefings/debriefings/financial reconciliation) working closely with agency operational leads to expedite delivery while maintaining high standards of output
Ensuring creative and digital assets (included but not limited to: emails, display ads, social ads, landing pages, microsites, ATL ads, event collateral, webinars,) are delivered on time, on brand, and to specification to personnel/ 3rd parties responsible for activation
Digital asset production within Marketing Automation system
Working with the Central team to select a Marketing Resource Management (MRM) system over time that works within segment, centrally, and regionally
Working with the Central team to develop a framework for asset management and documenting learnings from programmes/campaigns. Ultimately collaborating to recommend a Digital Asset Management Library
Co-ordinating all deliverables relating to Quarterly Marketing Forums and Biannual budget submissions ensuring deadlines are met and outputs are in-line with requirements
Liaising with other Ascential Marketing Operations Managers, Design and Content Leaders and Marketing Performance & Automation leaders to maximise learnings across the portfolio as well as consistently improve our output and ways of working
Foster a dynamic industrious and delivery culture across the team. Drive celebration of our wins, and lessons to be learned from our losses
Your Experience
Strong, demonstrable experience in marketing, marketing operations; analytics or similar role
Familiarity with marketing to the B2B audience, particularly with advertisers, agencies and publishers
A data-driven mindset and the ability strategize with cross-functional teams and execute marketing campaigns
Exposure to direct marketing tactics, including email, webinars, sponsorships, trade shows, mobile and use of third-party data sources
Ability to lead multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment.
Technically capable, excellent communicator, and a desire to improve processes. Able to explain complex items to various stakeholders and understand projects that have different analytical goals and needs
What We Offer
Our benefits package incorporates what we’re passionate about – unlocking your future, overall well-being and sustainability – whilst giving you control over your benefits.
25 days of holiday per year – with the option to buy or sell between 1-5 days
Great learning and development opportunities
Pension, Private Medical and Dental Insurance plans
Life Assurance; Income Protection and Critical Illness covers
Option to opt into the Ascential Shares Scheme
Volunteering opportunities
Season ticket loans
In addition, we offer flexible benefit packages that include Cycle to Work; Retail Vouchers; Gourmet Card; Gym Flex, Health Assessments and Will Writing.
We also place great importance on health, lifestyle and wellbeing consistently, in which you will have the options to fuel up on free fruit, attend yoga sessions, join our running club, or perhaps taking up on a lunchtime massages.
Inclusive Workforce
At Ascential, our goal is to create a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel comfortable in bringing their authentic selves to work. We want all Ascential people to feel included and truly empowered to contribute fully to our vision and goals.
Everyone who applies will receive fair consideration for employment. We do not discriminate based upon race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.
For more information on our culture, visit Ascential.com.
About WGSN
We offer insights and inspiration from around the globe. We help our customers stay ahead and informed through trend forecasting and data science. We believe inspiration comes from the monumental and the mundane.
If you’re passionate about fashion and lifestyle this is a great place to be, giving you the opportunity to work with the world's most creative trend experts, designers, editors, account managers, marketers, product developers, customer service experts and much more in a meritocratic, high performance company.

341b84776a751f8e.title: Sales Support Specialist
341b84776a751f8e.description:
Job Posting End Date: March 18Who are we?We are Unum – one of the UK’s leading employee benefits providers.We’ve been around for 50 years, currently protecting over 1.7 million people, providing security and peace of mind to individuals and their families.With a Fortune 500, US parent company, we’re part of highly successful global organisation, sharing ideas and innovations across teams to create a collaborative work environment. We’re transforming our business, and we’re keen to increase our digital capabilities to evolve the way we work and optimise opportunities for growth.The roleWhat will you be doing?Working within our Dental business your primary roles will be supporting both new and existing business teams with servicing Key Brokers and clients to strengthen the relationships.What will you bring?Key Accountabilities: Supporting the Dental team including attending client benefit fairs, supporting with building and maintaining broker relationship activity and new customer onboarding.Producing and sending out dental and optical quotations. Working closely with the operational divisions across new and existing business.Manage the client renewal process against set targets within the business plan. Proactive in achieving a high retention rate and identify cross sell/upsell opportunities.Supporting the production of client presentations and request for proposals where preferred provider arrangements (PPA’s) are requested by brokers.Collecting and cleansing all quotation required information, analysing and assisting in producing terms subject to agreed delegated authority level.Supporting the team to ensure good pipeline management of new and existing opportunities.Support the tracking & production of monthly quoted & lost process.Working with marketing to support creation of new business sales campaigns. Implementing, monitoring and evaluating the outcome.Support the wider sales team if required and being the first point of call for the new and existing Business Sales Team within the business and wider Unum Group.Pipeline management on multiple systems including Saleforce.com. Working to develop this into full CRM systems to include: monthly projections/graded cases, pipeline, market feedback, trends and central marketing campaigns. Supporting the production of Management Information on both an ad hoc basis for both broker and client meetings and monthly internal reporting purposes.Competitor analysis to ensure a market leading product working closely with the proposition team. This includes support with SNAP meetings and documentation.Campaign Management: local and central campaigns are followed up and recorded on the activity tracker, utilise marketing initiatives and internal campaigns to ensure our intermediaries understand our proposition and any new developments.Utilise existing data to identify potential opportunities for cross-sell and scheme expansion. Extra attention is given whenever a shortfall in monthly projections arises. Relooking at lost cases and supporting a plan to win back this business.Act as point of contact for broker queries directed at the Dental Team and directing brokers to the relevant departments and promoting the service model, keeping the Dental Consultant involved as needed.Work in partnership with the Operational Team to ensure our Business Partners receive a consistent level of customer service in line with the principals of being Customer Experience.Support the retention of existing business in order to maximise revenue and enable block growth. Liaising internally where required and reacting to any sales or retention opportunities including the follow up of renewals and retests in conjunction with the Dental Team. Attend weekly meetings with the team discuss and review work positions, progress against targets and current sales drivers.Required Knowledge and Skills:Experience within a customer-focused environmentAbility to communicate confidently face to face, by phone and in writingGood time management with the ability to work under pressureWider industry knowledge and/or experience of working in sales office environment desirableExperience in technical aspects of insurance products preferredUse of appropriate systems: PowerPoint, Word, Excel & Outlook and Salesforce.com (desired but not essential)This role may involve some UK travelYou may be required to work outside of normal core hours from time to time.Why join us?

Our culture!


We aim to be the most inclusive, diverse and socially responsible company in the employee benefits market. With an agile and flexible way of working, we want to be a place where people aspire to work and where everyone can be themselves.
What will you get in return?We are passionate about our employee health and wellbeing and providing work-life balance that suits you.Our benefits include a discretionary bonus, 24/7 health support services (including a remote GP), income protection, health cash plan, 27 days annual leave, opportunity to participate in charitable events and more. However you see your future career, we’ll support and challenge you to be your best with a wealth of learning and development opportunities.If you need assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to UKTalentDevelopment@Unum.co.ukCompany:Unum UK

07b897977521a16c.title: Industry Technical Specialist - Accenture and Wipro
07b897977521a16c.description:
Job Description
Industry Technical Sales (ITS) role for key scale partners: supporting global system integrators Accenture and Wipro, for work done across UK, Germany, France, and EMEA-Territories. This role is to provide technical support for co-sell opportunities. Tasks include driving awareness and early adoption of Intel technologies, platforms, and products through trainings, formal presentations and demos. We jointly develop offers that strategically align to both companies, then bring it to market, capturing and supporting 'client 0' POCs and deployments, ensuring the best Intel technologies is included.
Knowledge of the following key areas are of focus in this region for Accenture is ideal (approx. 70% of time spend):
Network transformation: with a key focus on telco NFVI, edge computing (RAN, mobile private networks) and 5G. Lead the engagement with the local Accenture Cloud Innovation Center (ACIC) in Rome.
Cloud: working with cloud solution architects (CSAs) and other subject matter experts (SMEs) to enable the best Intel technologies deployed in public, private and hybrid cloud. Database /HPC workloads are current focus.
Intelligent Edge: support the success of the new CoE within the partnership, focused on computer vision workloads
Secondary areas include:
Security with SGX: to enable confidential computing and attestation for federated learning
Digital Workplace: support of the DaaS offer driving vPro capabilities and enabling EMA opportunities
Familiarity of Intel oneAPI a bonus!
For Wipro, knowledge of the following the key focus is as follows (approx. 30% of time spend):
DC Go Big program: support for HQ priorities while leads the VDI offer development engagement, ensuring the best Intel based solutions both on prem and in the cloud.
End User Computing: support on driving vPro, enabling EMA and winning on IA.
This wide range of focus areas requires the ITS to be able to articulate Intel value in spaces, and manage the right subject matter experts and TSSs for more in depth discussions. The desire and enthusiasm to learn every day and having a proactive mentality is fundamental. Given the broad offer portfolio, good planning skills and ability to manage multiple takes and projects simultaneously is also essential.
A successful ITS will need to be able to develop a working relationship with clients and partners, keeping in mind cultural differences. Strong presentation and clear communication skills between the BU and with the customer is a key part of the role, while working on a daily basis with the partner scale account manager (PSAM) to ensure alignment on KPIs and revenue targets.
Qualifications
5+ years’ of experience in Technical sales
Experience in developing technical relationships
Previous examples of virtual technical team leadership
Ability to to make complexity simple for customer to understand
Customer orientation & stakeholder mgmt. skills
Proven record of success influencing technical selling to key stakeholders
Problem solving, attention to detail and strategic thinking
Educated to degree level
What We Offer:
At Intel, you come to work in a collaborative, supportive environment, where your equally brilliant colleagues will push you to be your best. There's no fear of failure-we know that's how innovation happens. And you'll never be bored.
We offer competitive benefits and pay, opportunities for professional development and the flexibility you need to achieve balance. Intel fosters a collaborative environment allowing the brightest minds in the world to come together to achieve exceptional results.
Inside this Business Group
Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.

1e87619427fc1bdd.title: Trade Disposal Specialist
1e87619427fc1bdd.description:
About the role

BMW & Mini Oldbury is looking to recruit a Trade Disposal Specialist to join their fantastic and motivated team.

As a Sytner Trade Disposal Specialist, you will be responsible for photographing and marketing all Trade Cars at the dealership. You will update the Sytner Groups Electronic Auction site frequently and describe and sell our part exchanges effectively.

In addition to this, you will be responsible for the timely preparation of our retail used car stock through our aftersales department, arranging valeting and handling dealer transfer enquiries and all associated administrative procedures.

Sytner Trade Disposal Specialist's work a variety of flexible patterns which can typically include weekends to ensure we provide our customers with the highest possible levels of service.

About you

Previous experience in a similar role would be ideal, however, this is not essential.

We are looking for an individual with a strong interest in photography, marketing and the automotive world. You will be a good, clear communicator and have a customer service background.

You will have a keen eye for detail and the ability to describe things accurately and a desire to present Oldburys stock to our customers in the best possible manner. You will also be computer literate.

Why Sytner?

Sytner Group are delighted to announce our brand new and enhanced, industry-leading benefits package.
We are passionate about continuing to build an environment where everyone feels valued, appreciated and able to reach their full potential. Our new benefits package is designed to do just that:

Additional Holiday
Industry-leading Maternity, Paternity and Adoption Pay
Bespoke Flexible Working Solutions
Enhanced Long Service Awards
Discounted Car Schemes
High Street Discounts

At Sytner, we are passionate about diversity and inclusion. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. We have a working environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution, supporting our colleagues to thrive and achieve their full potential.

We are committed to creating an equitable environment and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles, unless operational requirements prevent otherwise.

Unsure? Read on…

We represent over 23 of the world's most prestige vehicle brands, across our 140 UK dealerships.

We pride ourselves on ‘Developing Talent and ‘Building Careers’ and our colleagues recently scored Sytner Group an outstanding 84% on our colleague engagement survey.

a3c4e8bbb98f3d82.title: Production Apprenticeship Fast Track - Wales
a3c4e8bbb98f3d82.description:
Job Introduction

What you’ll get
During your apprenticeship
A starting salary of £15,074
A flexible 35-hour working week, 25 days of annual leave days and a defined pension scheme. Plus discounted dental, health care, gym and much more.
A dedicated Team Manager and Scheme Specialist to help with your development.
Training and Mentoring by industry professionals.
Access to our in-house Academy, which hosts a range of internal and external courses.

At the end of your apprenticeship
A recognised Level 3 Production Apprenticeship with an established learning provider
The chance to apply for internal vacancies.
Lots of experience to help seek new challenges and work opportunities within the BBC and wider industry.

This Apprenticeship programme is part financed by the European Social Fund through the Welsh Government.
Main Responsibilities

Work with one of our exciting production teams across radio, TV or digital. You might be helping to come up with ideas and stories for content (editorial), or plan and organise the productions (production management), or you might be developing your technical skills and learning how to use equipment to capture content (craft skills). You might even be working in a post-production area using specialist software and technology.
Get BBC Academy industry training delivered by experienced trainers to learn skills on how to make content for programmes, research, planning & organising, operating technical equipment such as cameras, editing and lots more!
And you’ll study for your Production apprenticeship from a recognised provider, learning both on and off the job.
You will get the chance to create content for exciting productions across our TV, Radio or Online/Digital platforms. Alongside working on productions, you will also work towards a Level 3 Creative and Digital Media apprenticeship with our local learning provider Sgil Cymru.
Based in Cardiff, you could be working on our radio output, finding new guests and content for our radio programmes; or you could be working with big brands and campaigns, working within our marketing and audience teams where you could be delivering social and digital creative content whilst also making sure people know how and where to find it. Or you could be working across our BBC Studios TV output working on shows like Bargain Hunt, Weatherman Walking and X-Ray which we refer to as our Factual Entertainment productions as well as working on shows like BBC Young Musician, BBC Young Dancer, Cardiff Singer of the World and Children in Need which we call our Music and Entertainment productions.
During your apprenticeship you will be given a wide variety of tasks within the office, in studio and/or on location. Some of the tasks you may be expected to do is to provide administrative and logistic support; research for stories, locations, contributors (guests); come up with new, creative ideas for content; looking after crew and contributors on set; writing for online; filming and editing content and lots more!
We also have Welsh language placements available this year with Radio Cymru (places in Bangor and Cardiff) and BBC Wales Sport (Cardiff based). The ability to work through the medium of Welsh is essential for Radio Cymru and BBC Wales Sport placements. To apply for these Welsh language placements, please click here.
Are you the right candidate?

Who we’re looking for
To be eligible for an apprenticeship, you must:
Be aged 18 or over when the apprenticeship starts in September 2022
Be legally allowed to work in the UK

You’ll need to demonstrate you:
Passionate and curious about content, the production process and the BBC
Brimming with new ideas and fresh perspectives
A great team player and can deal with unexpected challenges
Enthusiastic and motivated
Flexible and adaptable approach to the pace of work

Don’t worry if you don’t have an extensive CV. We’re not looking at your qualifications. Instead, we’re interested in your passion to work at the BBC and to bring content ideas to life.
The scheme is aimed at non-graduates. If you have a degree and you’re interested in training for roles in production or production management at the BBC you should consider the Production Advanced or Production Management Advanced scheme instead.
About the BBC

We don’t focus simply on what we do – we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure you’ve read about our values and behaviours in the document attached below.
Diversity matters at the BBC. We have a working environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution, enabling all of our employees to thrive and achieve their full potential.
We want to attract the broadest range of talented people to be part of the BBC – whether that’s to contribute to our programming or our wide range of non-production roles. The more diverse our workforce, the better able we are to respond to and reflect our audiences in all their diversity.
We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles, unless operational requirements prevent otherwise.
To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please click here
Package Description

The headlines
Get experience of TV, radio or digital productions. You don’t need to have a degree - you’ll learn on-the-job as part of a BBC production team while working towards your Level 3 qualification.
Start date: September 2022
Duration: 18 months
Salary: £15,074
Apprenticeships available: 4
Locations: Wales (Cardiff)
Typically leading to: a role as a Runner, Junior Researcher, Content Assistant, Production Management Assistant, Team Assistant or Edit Assistant

360fe695f5f5da22.title: Email Marketing Specialist
360fe695f5f5da22.description: Change.org is searching for an Email Marketing Specialist to help us manage the email and social media experience for 18 million Change.org users in the U.K.We’re a social impact business (a public benefit company), and the world's largest non-profit owned tech platform focused on civic action with 80m monthly users, 50,000 campaigns launched on the site every month, and a revenue model that has grown by 500% in 2 years. We’re growing quickly, and our users win campaigns for change once every hour. From strengthening hate crime legislation in South Africa; calling for Racial Justice in the US; fighting corruption in Indonesia, Italy, and Brazil; to fighting violence against women in India.We are looking for an Email Marketing Specialist who is great at delivering user-first experiences at scale and has a passion for expanding our platform to mobilize millions of people to take deeper civic action in the UK.This person will serve as a major contributor in developing user engagement strategies in the UK. They will work closely and collaboratively with a variety of cross-functional teams at the company, including our campaigns, revenue, and communications teams, as well as product and user lifecycle teams. You can expect to be a key player in the future growth of Change.org in the UK, and part of a global team with shared values and ambitious goals.You will be based out of our London headquarters and report to our UK Communications Director. During these current times, we are currently working remotely for the foreseeable future, with flexibility for staff who have specific requirements.You’re a perfect fit for this role if your superpower is serving users with empathy and energy at every part of their journey with Change.org UK.Key responsibilities:Deliver a world class email experience for over 18 million UK users - helping drive impact and engagement in petitions and content across a broad spectrum of issues and campaigns;Draft and edit email content sent to users, ensuring high-quality storytelling and copywriting, and consistency in standards and brand;Track progress to goals - signatures, memberships, testing pipeline, and revenue from email - and report out and communicate regularly with the team about results, insights and learnings, using a suite of tracking tools;Represent UK email in meetings and on calls, serving as a point of contact for the email and social program throughout the company;Review recommended petitions for specific audiences, ensuring they adhere to our brand quality standards in the UK;Lead in the content direction and creation for our social media channels, working with campaigners to craft timely, engaging content experiences.The most important capabilities for the role are:Data savvy and highly numerate - able to work across formats with segmentation, analysis and reporting;At least two years experience in delivery of email/digital content to a significant audience;At least two years experience in storytelling and copywriting to distill and communicate complex issues in a compelling way to different audiencesWell versed in email marketing and digital advertising tactics and tools;Experience in creating and analysing engaging social media contentCompetent in Microsoft Excel/Google Spreadsheets;You have a 'can-do' attitude and are a self-starter not afraid to propose new ideas to test and implement;You have a keen eye for the power of story to help drive action and are a strong writer and communicator;Additional capabilities we’ll consider: Experience in either social business, nonprofits, campaigning or politics is a plus.Interested? Great! Here's what you should know: This is a full-time, 9-month role based in London, working remotely for the foreseeable future.Our team is high impact, low ego, and has an amazing culture to be part of.We are accepting applications until March 6, 2022.Change.org is a global company, and salaries are adjusted for cost of labour in each city. The annual salary for an Email Marketing Specialist is £32,500 in London. In exceptional circumstances, we may offer below the listed salary for high potential candidates with less experience, or above it for candidates with significantly more experience.We especially encourage applicants of different backgrounds, cultures, genders, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. We're actively working to increase the diversity of experience and perspectives on our team and are looking for someone who can help continue to lead that process.Change.org is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, or disability or veteran status.#LI-Remote #LI-MA1Job Type: Full-timeSalary: £32,500.00 per year

937e588a44fa57a2.title: Marketing Website Specialist
937e588a44fa57a2.description:
About IHG
IHG Hotels & Resorts is one of the world’s leading hotel companies with around 350,000 colleagues working across more than 100 countries to deliver true hospitality for good. Our diverse portfolio of differentiated brands are well known and loved by millions of consumers around the world.

We genuinely care for our entire IHG Hotels & Resorts family. All our colleagues are valued, and their wellbeing matters to us. We provide the support our colleagues need to succeed and recognise them for their hard work. Our diverse global community values different perspectives and cultures.

This role sits within the Employer Brand and Recruitment Marketing team and is part of the global HR function.
Your day to day
The Marketing Website Specialist will be responsible for managing the IHG Careers website including integrations with key partners to improve the candidate journey.

Ownership of the IHG Careers website including all content and pages, to support the Employer Brand and Recruitment Marketing priorities
Management of all updates, improvements, and enhancements to the website through the CMS platform to ensure that the candidate journey is fully optimised
Supporting departmental teams with landing page build and ongoing management, recommending design and layout best practice
Owning the candidate application journey with understanding and implementation of optimisation practices
Driving the SEO agenda for key business priorities
Day to day relationship with website hosting partner, identifying bugs and managing enhancements
Reporting on key website metrics to update stakeholders on campaign/priority progress and results
Lead the integrations with partners to improve the candidate application process – e.g. LinkedIn Apply

What we need from you

CMS (Content Management System) experience, ideally Umbraco.
Knowledge of HTML and the ability to amend basic code where necessary
SEO knowledge both from a technical and content perspective
Understanding candidate journey optimisation techniques
Experience and knowledge of website integrations with vendors, including ATS’s.
Video and picture editing skills, ideally with Adobe Premier Pro and Photoshop.

What we offer
At IHG we give our colleagues greater flexibility and balance – working in a hybrid way, blending remote and office working. Although we thrive on collaborating in person, we expect that you’re likely to spend time working remotely. Every role is different, and colleagues work with their team and their leader to determine how and when they collaborate in person. We like to believe we offer a unique culture where you have room to be yourself.

Alongside our great working environment, we’ll offer you a strong industry competitive package, including healthcare and incredible worldwide hotel discounts.

As an equal opportunity employer, IHG is committed to providing a working culture that values diversity equity and inclusion and is committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a barrier-free recruitment process and working environment.

Whilst this role will initially be based in our Denham head office location, by end of 2022 we will be relocating to our new Global Headquarters in central Windsor so you will need to be able to travel to Windsor as required in the longer term.


Closing date: 9th March 2022

#LI-NT1
Job Reference: EMEAA28437

665c416725f2153a.title: Field Clinical Specialist SCS Neuromodulation - South East / East Anglia UK Job
665c416725f2153a.description:
Field Clinical Specialist SCS Neuromodulation - South East / East Anglia UK Job
Remote Eligible: Field Based
Onsite Locations(s):
Hemel Hempstead, GB
Additional Locations: N/A
Boston Scientific's hybrid workplace includes remote and onsite roles. By applying to this position, you will have the opportunity to discuss your preferred working location with your Talent Acquisition Specialist.
Boston Scientific transforms lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of more than 30 million patients around the world each year.
We’re at the forefront of the medical device industry – leading, evolving it to address unmet and emerging needs in healthcare.
Our culture powers our performance and we turn our shared vision into value with the contribution of our 36.000 colleagues around the world.

Field Clinical Specialist SCS Neuromodulation - South East / East Anglia UK

At Boston Scientific you can take the first step towards a meaningful career by joining a passionate team and contributing to improve the health of people around the world. You’ll have the opportunity to grow and nurture your talent in an inclusive and innovative environment.
Choosing the right place to work is an important decision. Read all the details below and if it sounds like you, consider joining the team.

Starting your career with us gives you the opportunity to join a leader in the medical devices industry while having the opportunity to develop the experiences you need to grow both personally and professionally. Submit your application and take the first step towards a meaningful career.

About the role:

Promote Boston Scientific Neuromodulation through technical support and training/education of Spinal Cord Stimulation (SCS) products at current and potential customer accounts within the North of the United Kingdom.. Responsible for the day-to-day field execution and management of Boston Scientific clinical trials at selected clinical trial centres.
The focus of the role will be supporting SCS implants during which they will be a performing testing intraoperatively / post operatively with the patient awake / asleep. The role requires the FCS to attend and provide technical support to SCS nurses and pain consultants/neurosurgeons, including training sessions for those not familiar with the products. Routine trouble shooting is required in person but also over the phone. The role will also include help with training and education with workshops and new product launches.

Your Responsibilities will include:

Commercial Support: Under general supervision, serve as primary resource for clinical support consisting of tackling variety of issues relating to troubleshooting, programming, and patient follow-up for company products.
Educate customers on the merits and proper clinical usage of company products by giving presentations and demonstrations using appropriate formats and platforms (e.g., slides, manuals) to keep all customers abreast of the latest BSC products.
Attend unit implants in the labs and operation rooms of hospital accounts and perform patient follow-up to assure customer and patient success with the implanted products.
Team up with Sales Rep to meet existing and potential clients (e.g., physicians, physician office groups at hospitals) to identify their clinical needs, goals, and constraints related to patient care and to discuss and demonstrate how company products can help them to achieve their goals.
Keep on developing business relationships with hospital personnel (e.g., through casual conversation, meetings, participation in conferences).
Respond to customer needs and complaints regarding products and service by developing creative and feasible solutions or working with other related personnel (e.g., sales, clinical, research, marketing, technical support) to develop optimal solutions.
Clinical Trial Support: Managing and providing technical support for clinical trial activity within assigned territory by supporting the site authorization process and study procedures as defined in the clinical investigational plan.
Providing initial and continuous training, education and support for clinical centre personnel on clinical trial protocol, clinical process, products and features under investigation, and procedures involving those products and features.

What are we looking for in you:

Previous medical device experience is preferable, but not essential.
We will consider a Nursing background or industry placement experience from University (Graduate).
Be procedure and patient focused.
Be comfortable with working calmly in operating theatre environments and able to communicate with hospital staff.
Have a high level of technical acumen/ technically savvy.
Have exceptional communication skills with internal and external customers.
Previous experience with training/educating other is ideal, highly technical products would be beneficial.
Preferably located in the South East / East Anglia parts of the UK and willing to travel. Some work focus will be in Norwich, Basildon, Cambridge and Kent.
Be flexible with travelling during the course of the week.

Sounds like you? Apply submitting a cover letter and resume.

We, Boston Scientific, are an equal employment opportunity employer. We do not and will not make any personnel decisions (like recruiting, hiring, job assignments, and promotions) based on a person’s age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

#LI-Remote

Requisition ID: 522937

As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most – united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do – as a global business and as a global corporate citizen.

So, choosing a career with Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) isn’t just business, it’s personal. And if you’re a natural problem-solver with the imagination, determination, and spirit to make a meaningful difference to people worldwide, we encourage you to apply and look forward to connecting with you!

Job Segment: Clinic, Medical Technologist, Neurology, Medical, Patient Care, Healthcare

b7d592d29dbafb44.title: Modality Sales Specialist IGT
b7d592d29dbafb44.description:
Job Title
Modality Sales Specialist IGT
Job Description
Philips is a global leader in health technology, committed to improving billions of lives worldwide and striving to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation. Driven by the vision of a better tomorrow.
But it’s not just what we do, it’s who we are. We are 80,000, wonderfully unique individuals, with two things in common. An unwavering sense of purpose and a relentless determination to deliver on our customers’ needs. It’s what inspires us to create meaningful solutions – the kind that make a real difference – when it matters most.
The world and our customers’ needs are changing faster than ever before and while we are proud of what we do already, we know we can do more. That’s why we need you, to help us tackle increasingly complex challenges posed by ever evolving health and well-being needs.
In this role, you have the opportunity to make life better
Looking at the challenges the world is facing today Philips’ purpose has never been more relevant. So whatever your role, if you share our passion for helping others, you’ll be working towards creating a better and fairer future for all.
You are responsible for
Promoting Image Guided Therapy products, systems and services in customer visits, product and workstation demonstrations, seminars and trade shows
Execute marketing plan for Image Guided Therapy
Deploy programs (incl. Installed Base programs) to the districts to drive business
Drive the business through analysis, planning and execution. Review in close cooperation with the Regional Business Manager Imaging Systems. Execute corrective actions when required
Work as part of an account team to ensure results are reached according to account plans
Follow through sales processes applying appropriate sales tools, tactics and strategies in order to the Account Manager who can close the deal including Installed base activities / promotions
Provide input in the generation of the Imaging Systems order intake / sales forecast
Participate in the district sales planning exercise, supporting quality of funnel management
Provide information about market trends, competitor’s sales practices and potential projects to the responsible Business Manager
Ensure customer satisfaction by timely responding to all customer requests so that customers find it easy to do business with Philips Healthcare (PH)
Support new products launches
Responsible for quality and updated win / loss information in CRM-Tool
Update stakeholders with customer facing role (e.g. District Managers, Account Managers) on product and market developments
Responsible for reporting customer feedback according to applicable quality Standard policy and follow up relevant assigned quality and regulatory training in a timely manner
In return, we offer you a challenging, innovative environment with great opportunities for you to explore. Our benefits are very competitive and designed around your preferences, At Philips, we value that our people can be healthy and do well and that you feel cared for and listened to. We also believe that we are at our best as a company when you are at yours as a person. Thus, we offer competitive benefits, a flexible work schedule and access to regular local health & well-being focused activities.

This is in addition to:
A competitive salary, Car allowance and Bonus
Access to a wide variety of flexible company benefits, including matched pension contributions, and the option to purchase additional holiday
Philips University is available to all employees for learning and development opportunities.
25 days holiday allowance from the beginning, plus bank holidays
Family-friendly policies which offer enhanced maternity and paternity schemes
The Philips Employee Shop which allows employees to buy Philips products at discounted prices
An Employee Assistance Program is available for all Philips employees and their families. As well as being a confidential support line, it also offers practical financial and life management advice 24 /7 and is completely confidential
How we work at Philips
Our newly-adopted hybrid work concept fuses flexibility with collaboration to deliver great outcomes for our people and our customers. We are embracing an approach wherein we spend more time together than apart – which for full-time employees translates to an average of at least 3 days working from the office and up to 2 days from home – for our hybrid roles.
Hybrid work flexibility means people can meet the changing demands of work and home in the most balanced, productive, and healthy way. Hybrid work flexibility means people can meet the changing demands of work and home in the most balanced, productive, and healthy way.
Our hybrid working model is defined in 3 ways:
We believe in the importance of impactful collaboration: There's a certain energy when everyone’s in the same room that can heighten idea generation and creative friction needed for problem-solving.
We embrace flexibility: Choosing where, when and how to work can vary according to task and team schedules. Flexibility isn’t office or online, it means choosing the space that works best for you, your teams and our customers on a case-by-case basis.
We want to be at our best: The way we work and our workspaces are designed to support our well-being, offer career advancement opportunities, and enable us to be at our best.
Why should you join Philips?
Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on innovative, customer-first health technology solutions. Help us improve the health and well-being of billions of people, every year. Ultimately creating a career that no one could have planned for. Even you.
Equal opportunities
Philips are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

Should you require any reasonable adjustments to enable your participation in the interview process, please advise us of this in your application.

142273ecc8f39dfb.title: Communication Officer HEO
142273ecc8f39dfb.description:
Details
Reference number
181734
Salary
£35,700
The total package for this role at HEO is £35,700 per annum (non-negotiable).
Grade
Higher Executive Officer
Contract type
Permanent
Business area
Home Civil Service
Type of role
Communications / Marketing
Working pattern
Full-time
Number of posts
15

Location
London
About the job
Summary
The Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office pursues our national interests and projects the UK’s role in the world. We promote the interests of British citizens, safeguard the UK's security, defend our values, reduce poverty and tackle global challenges with our international partners.


The UK is at the heart of an unrivalled global network of economic, diplomatic and security partnerships and the FCDO’s Communication Directorate tells the stories that demonstrate the positive impact these relationships have for British businesses and British people.


Communicators in the FCDO deliver world-class activity that contributes to the department’s goals by influencing domestic and global public perceptions of the UK and the issues that matter most to us as a country.


Roles are available in strategic communication, internal communication, external affairs, branding, social media management, content design and creation, media handling, planning and counter-terrorism public communication. We are not recruiting for a specific vacancy, instead you will be placed into a role based on your skills and experience and our business need.

Job description
Roles and Responsibilities


The successful candidate will:


Work as a communication officer across our communication activity speaking to UK and international audiences in the fields of strategic communication, internal communication, external affairs, branding, social media management, content design and creation, media handling, planning and counter-terrorism public communication.


Work in close partnership with other government departments and the FCDO’s network of diplomatic missions across the world.


Build strong partnerships with internal and external stakeholders (domestic and international) to gain their insight and support for campaigns.


Provide communication support to Ministers and the FCDO out of hours, which will occasionally include evenings and weekends.

Successful candidates will become members of the Government Communication Service (GCS). GCS sets the professional standards and provides guidance to support communicators and quality assurance. Membership of this body boosts your career prospects and provides you with professional recognition for your skills and abilities. It also provides the support and shared experience of professionals in the government communication community and exclusive member benefits to add impact to your work every day.
Responsibilities
Person Specification


We are looking for ambitious communication professionals who can make a difference against the disciplines listed above.


It is essential in your application that you provide evidence and examples of your skills and how you meet the minimum criteria, the behaviours and relevant technical GCS professional competencies CS competency Framework. These responses will be further discussed with those candidates invited for interview.


Minimum Criteria


Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to deliver at pace to meet urgent deadlines.


Willing and able to work flexibly to provide communications support to ministers and the department out of hours, which will include evenings and weekends.

Confidence to brief senior colleagues and give communication advice.
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Communicating and Influencing
Seeing the Big Picture
Delivering at Pace

We only ask for evidence of these behaviours on your application form:
Communicating and Influencing
Delivering at Pace
Technical skills
We'll assess you against these technical skills during the selection process:
GCS Core and relevant specialist technical competencies are set out in the GCS Competency Framework.- Impact and Implementation.
BenefitsA Civil Service Pension.
25 days Annual Leave per annum.
9 days Public and Privilege holidays per annum.
Learning and Development tailored to your role.


See the attached candidate pack.
Things you need to know
Security
Successful candidates must meet the security requirements before they can be appointed. The level of security needed is developed vetting.

See our vetting charter.
People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.
Selection process details
This vacancy is using Success Profiles, and will assess your Behaviours, Experience and Technical skills.
Please see the attached candidate pack for the selection process details.

Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.
Nationality requirements
Open to UK nationals only.
Working for the Civil Service
The Civil Service Code sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles.
The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.
Apply and further information
Once this job has closed, the job advert will no longer be available. You may want to save a copy for your records.
Contact point for applicants
Job contact :
Name :
FCDO Recruitment
Email :
fcdorecruitment.grs@cabinetoffice.gov.uk
Recruitment team :
Email :
fcdorecruitment.grs@cabinetoffice.gov.uk
Further information
The FCDO’s recruitment processes are underpinned by the principle of selection for appointment on merit, on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission Recruitment Principles. If you feel your application has not been treated in accordance with the Recruitment Principles and you wish to make a complaint, you should, in the first instance, contact csc.recruitment@fcdo.gov.uk. If you are not satisfied with the response you receive from the FCDO, you can contact the Office of the Civil Service Commissioners.

3e77e30395926d2f.title: Social Media Specialist
3e77e30395926d2f.description:
Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek - so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.


As our new Social Media Expert, you will join our high-achieving and international Digital Media Team (11 people and growing across the globe). You will take responsibility over building and launching social media campaign across all product lines of Agilent wide portfolio of solutions working closely with internal stakeholders. You will work on assignments and develop market/product business plans and strategic marketing programs, while enjoying all the support and encouragement you need to build a far-reaching career.


Your main responsibilities will be:
Work within the internal digital media team to build and execute paid social media campaigns, with focus on paid LinkedIn and Facebook. Continuously monitoring and optimizing campaign portfolios across all social channels.Develop short-term and long-term strategies, campaign setup, deployment, monitoring and optimization.Provide monthly reporting, as well as expertise and guidance to internal teams on their campaign performance.
Act as a consultant to internal stakeholders, becoming a trusted adviser by sharing latest industry trend and, media recommendations, continuously educating internal stakeholders.
Work with Media Client Partners on brainstorming campaign strategy and design to provide high-level media plans.Provide insights from past campaign performance and learnings to internal team.
Identifying trends and analyzing results that help steer innovation — making recommendations to further drive awareness, growth, and engagement


This role can be based anywhere in the UK, or potentially another country in Europe where Agilent is based. You will have the opportunity to work fully remotely or on a hybrid model by working from one of our offices.

We are looking for a motivated individual with the following background:

Significant marketing experience with running paid social media campaign, in the B2B spaceIdeally a University DegreeExperience with LinkedIn Campaign Manager – knowledge of Facebook Campaign Manager is a plusFirst experience in the Life Science sphere or in a Social Media Agency is idealUnderstanding of Quickbase, Asana, Sprout and/or MS Office (and especially Excel) is a plus.


On a personal level, you are both autonomous & a team player. You like working in a fast-paced environment and to solve problems. You have great communications skills to interact with many internal and external partners at a high level.


Agilent Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other protected categories under all applicable laws.

a74a960933aac17f.title: Marketing Analytics Specialist
a74a960933aac17f.description:
Marketing Analytics Specialist
Make a difference every day!
Invesco is driven by a pure focus on investment. It’s all we do. We focus on doing work that matters and being a firm that gives a voice to every employee. In fact, we make a promise to our clients and each other to create greater possibilities together. We’re looking for people who have fresh perspectives. Who can come together to share ideas, listen and challenge each other to achieve better solutions for our clients.
Your team
Invesco EMEA serves a breadth of clients including financial advisors, pension funds, and insurers. Our customers have complex and unique investment needs, which we are uniquely positioned to deliver through 13 investment centres with expertise in equities, fixed income, and alternatives. Marketing seeks to connect client needs with our capabilities by creating effective, accountable, multi-channel communications which educate, inspire and support our clients.
The Analytics & Insights team enables this using research, digital & data analytics & marketing performance measurement to underpin the three pillars of know your clients, understand their journey & optimise performance.
Your role
The purpose of the role is to produce and deliver actionable insights to the EMEA Marketing Team to help maximise the commercial impact of marketing. This is a great opportunity for someone who is looking to get into data analytics or marketing analytics within the financial services industry.

Sound interesting? As the Analytics Specialist you will produce detailed campaign retrospective evaluation reports, work alongside the Marketing Analytics Manager to standardise campaign reports for overall marketing effectivess and engage with campaign and channel teams to share analysis of performance and deliver data supported insights.
You will represent the team on wider departmental/cross-functional projects and actively participate in improving the internal benchmarking programme. Our teams work across functions and this role is no different, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with other teams to test and validate hypotheses for ongoing optimisation and learning from marketing campaigns and website.

We are looking for you to bring experience in Marketing Analytics within a B2B environment, you will have a good understanding of working with different dataset across different sources and show experience working with Sales & Marketing planning technology such as Salesforce and Pardot. You will show an understanding of campaign analytics and the theory behind marketing measurement frameworks and methodologies.

Our teamwork in a fast-paced environment and we will look to the Specialist to be passionate, focused, driven and able to collaborate and communicate well.
The good stuff
We have an outstanding benefits package, which includes

Competitive salary and bonusCompany-provided healthcare26 days annual leave + bank holidaysGenerous pension provisionsIncome protectionHealth and wellness benefitsVolunteering daysEnhanced parental leaveLife insurance

Our commitment to you
We recognise that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone. As part of Invesco’s commitment to ensuring our teams have the broad range of experiences and backgrounds required to promote diversity of thought, and to maintaining a positive, engaging work environment, we champion flexible working.
Please feel free to discuss flexible working options with us.
Our commitment to the community and environmental, social and governance investing
We partner with charitable organisations globally to make an impact in the communities where we live and work. Our people are encouraged to support the charities they feel most passionate about. We are also committed to environmental, social and governance (ESG) investing. We serve our clients in this space as a trusted partner both on specific responsible investment product strategies as well as part of our commitment to deliver a superior investment experience.
Join Us
We’re proud to be a firm that achieves more together. One that is focused on doing work that matters. One that gives a voice to every employee. One that genuinely cares. By coming together to share our ideas, listen, and challenge each other’s perspectives, we get to better solutions for our clients.
Our ambition is high. By working smart and supporting one another, we can continuously push ourselves to grow. We all have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on our business, our industry and our clients’ lives.
Let’s create greater possibilities together!

People with disabilities:
We want to give all our candidates the best opportunity to shine. If you need any adjustments to be made during the application and selection process, please send an e-mail to (insert email address). Please include your name, the job you are interested in, and the type of adjustment you need.

Recruitment Agencies:
Invesco has an in-house recruitment team, which focuses on sourcing great candidates directly. Invesco will not accept unsolicited resumes from agency or search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired. When we do use agencies, we have a PSL in place, so please do not contact hiring managers directly.

7dffdbb69b821840.title: Security Specialist, GBB – Threat Intelligence and EASM
7dffdbb69b821840.description:
Are you passionate about helping customers build resiliency, reduce risk and embrace Zero Trust in the age of cloud migration and Digital Transformation?
Microsoft continues to invest over $1B per year in security and research to enable its customers to confidently move to the cloud and modernize their platforms. We deliver the security, compliance, and identity solutions they need to keep their data safe.
As a Security Global Black Belt (GBB) you will be a senior solution sales leader within our enterprise sales organization working with our most important customers and deals. You will lead a virtual team of technical, partner, marketing and engineering resources to advance the sales process and achieve/exceed solution sales and usage/consumption targets for related workloads in your accounts. You will help customers evaluate their applications, recommend solutions that meet their requirements, remove roadblocks to deployment and drive customer satisfaction.
Responsibilities
Identify new Threat Intelligence and Attack Surface Management deals through integrating into Microsoft’s XDR+SIEM/SOAR and multi-cloud security motions.
Land the full value of threat intelligence and external attack surface management with customers.
Drive complex and strategic deals in alignment with Security Solution Specialists and Area Sales Leads within assigned territory by setting and achieving monthly sales forecasts.
Act as subject matter expertise for Threat intelligence and attack surface management workloads, navigating industry and complex deal orchestration, supporting competitor displacement opportunities, and sharing proven practices with the field through readiness and coaching to accelerate sales opportunities.
Engage confidently at CxO level to articulate RiskIQ’s value proposition and how Microsoft can enable the modern framework for protecting critical infrastructure, minimizing future incidents, and creating a safer world.
Be the interface to the customer and orchestrate a v-team of resources to solve customer problems
Identify customer business and technology challenges and bring them to agreement on the business value of Security solutions for mega deals - including detailed relevant BDM, ITDM & Industry use cases, solution briefings and demos, and financial analysis.
Establish relationship with key partners to drive Security opportunities and showcase co-sell approach to field sellers.
Build competency and technical expertise in Microsoft security solutions by completing all required readiness training (Measure: Achieve expert level on assigned Majors).
Support key strategic deals aligned with Security Sales Managers, orchestrating key resources consisting of technical and partner roles across an extensive portfolio of products, escalating issues for internal business and technical teams, and providing updates on status of mega-deals for your territory.
Foster and expand Microsoft’s relationships with Customer Business Decision Makers and support sales teams to blockers to evaluation, contracting, deployment, and usage.
Mentor Security Specialist members of the team and lead the community to foster best practice sharing.
Scale impact by transferring knowledge and building local capabilities for the field.
Demonstrate advanced demo, business case and compete skills and share demoing practices with the SCIM community.
Stay sharp and assist Microsoft transform how we deliver value to customers
Continuously nurture and expand sales, business, technology, and competitive readiness.
Participate in internal Microsoft technical & sales communities and in the broader industry through events, Yammer, Teams sites, blogs, training, community gatherings and more.
Influence engineering and product groups with closed loop feedback supporting refining the sales process and product updates.
Qualifications
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
Skills, Experience, and Requirements:
A strong candidate will possess as many of the following skills and experiences as possible:
Strong technical background in security, compliance, and identity.
Fluency with cyber threat intelligence threats, trends, and developments.
Familiarity with Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs) used by common, well known cyber threat actors.
Understanding of cyber security roles and personas who will be consumers of Threat Intelligence such as Security Operations Center (SOC), Vulnerability Management, Incident Response, and Threat Hunting.
Technical understanding of how the internet works and functions.
Ability to talk effectively to both a technical and non-technical audience.
Exceptional problem-solving and strategic thinking skills.
Strong presentation and communication skills.
Proven competency to collaborate cross organizations, deal with ambiguity and drive impact without direct authority.
candidate should have good commercial acumen

03d3b4cdf9444589.title: Clinical Development Specialist (Electrophysiology) - South East UK
03d3b4cdf9444589.description:
A fantastic opportunity for an electrophysiology expert to join our growing team as a Clinical Development Specialist at an exciting time!

Following an internal move, we are recruiting for a Clinical Development Specialist within our Electrophysiology (EP) division. Reporting into the Clinical Development Manager, we are looking for a strategic, experienced technical specialist to grow EP market share in competitor accounts (South East UK). Your role will be to accelerate competitor users’ adoption of our mapping system and entrench this technology in alignment with the commercial strategy of each account.

Liaising in close partnership with the relevant Territory Manager, Regional Sales managers and wider sales support team, you will be responsible for engaging the adoption of our mapping system, to encompass install responsibility and offering clinical guidance and expertise during the trial to adoption phase. The CDS will also support the roll out of limited market release and ad hoc clinical projects.

Candidates are likely to be experienced Cardiac Physiologists with extensive EP NHS experience at band 6 or 7 level and ideally additional industry experience. Strong communication skills are essential, as this role will interact heavily with the commercial, sales support and marketing teams.

As you’d expect from a global healthcare company, we offer a fantastic range of benefits including competitive salaries and bonus potential, a superb defined contribution pension scheme, private healthcare, life assurance and a flexible benefits scheme.

365c80b28c7af08d.title: Marketing Specialist
365c80b28c7af08d.description:
PeoplePlus is a leading provider working across the adult skills, employability, and prison education markets. It is a purpose-led organisation with a commitment to making a direct difference to the lives of One million people by the end of 2022.
With the right people on board, we can smash that target. We focus on many activities such as helping people into sustainable work: building a skilled workforce for the future and developing careers and rehabilitating ex-offenders into society.
About the role
Working with the Head of Marketing and the wider team, this role will plan and execute exciting online and offline campaigns to both a B2C and B2B audience. Competent in all aspects of digital marketing, a creative thinker and a self-starter this role will market our employability division to potential customers, stakeholders, partners and employers
Key Performance Responsibilities
Develop and implement marketing plans and campaigns to support key business / strategic objectives and performance objectives
Run lead generating campaigns using digital techniques and social media
Manage and create content for the company social media accounts
Write engaging and compelling copy that tells the PeoplePlus story
Source and write case studies
Work with our Graphic Designer to produce engaging and innovative collateral such as flyers, posters and display advertising
Drive traffic to our website using email strategy, PPC and SEO techniques
Measure and report performance of all marketing campaigns, and assess against goals (ROI and KPIs)
Click HERE to find out what it’s like working for PeoplePlus!


What we are looking for
We are looking for someone who can demonstrate broad marketing B2B and B2C experience in a solutions-driven marketing environment as well as a strong track record in developing innovative marketing campaigns from cradle to grave.
What makes us unique?
We are extremely proud to have been awarded a one-star Best Companies accreditation, meaning we’re ‘very good to work for’. In addition, we are recognised as being one of the Top 25 Education and Training providers to work for. You can see our best companies profile here for more details https://www.b.co.uk/companies/peopleplus
For us here at PeoplePlus reward means far more than just pay. Your total reward package as a PeoplePlus colleague includes a variety of different benefits as well as incentive and recognition schemes.
Our generous and competitive benefits package includes; enhanced annual leave of 25 days, a paid PeoplePlus Life Event Day each year, a paid Volunteering Day each year, a Pension, Life Insurance, an Employee Assistance Programme to access help and support 24 hours a day every day of the year, the opportunity to buy shares in the company through our Sharesave scheme, Refer a Friend reward scheme, Cycle to Work scheme and access to our benefits portal Additions which gives you discounts on hundreds of products, services, shops and entertainment. We also have our “Simply Dreams Come True” offering all colleagues the opportunity to turn their dreams into reality making the possibilities endless.
You can get more information from the additional documents tab at the top of this page.

f3acf36f050b7943.title: Performance Marketing Specialist
f3acf36f050b7943.description:
About Distrelec:
Distrelec is one of Europe’s leading technical components distributors. Founded over 40 years ago in Switzerland, growth over recent years has made the Distrelec Group a leading distributor for electronics, automation, and measurement technology. With expert colleagues based throughout the European countries in which we operate, we are a truly diverse organisation which serves a global, ever-growing customer base.
In the last few years, we’ve rapidly digitised the business and developed our in-house marketing, technology, insight and marketing teams, adopted new and elevated existing ways of working, and embraced a product based approach and performance marketing strategy.
About the Performance Marketing Specialist position:
By managing our Paid Search activity, the Performance Marketing Specialist’s mission is to deliver optimal commercial returns for the organisation. The position is responsible for implementing campaign and BAU paid search activity; continually evaluating and improving the effectiveness of paid search by exploring new techniques and understanding the changing dynamics of the paid search landscape.
The Performance Marketing Specialist will deliver effective paid search programmes across multiple search engines with a main focus on Google, and will define campaign lead reporting; collaborating with the wider Marketing team and Business Insights team to share and communicate analysis and insight to colleagues across the business.
Day-to-day, the Performance Marketing Specialist will:
Manage high budget campaigns across different search engines (main focus on Google) for our European markets
Manage the evolution of the keyword & ad portfolio for both existing and new campaigns
Manage and improve Google Shopping campaigns incl. feedmanagement
Continually evaluate budget and seek to better apportion in line with agreed campaign and BAU goals
Analyse paid search KPIs and account management based on campaign performance
Define appropriate campaign lead reporting and work with analytics to deliver it
Mentor and support more junior team members

We require the Performance Marketing Specialist to have:
In-depth working knowledge of PPC techniques and best practice in an international environment
Hands on experience of working with Google Ads/ Merchant Center and equivalent products
A demonstrably broad understanding of eCommerce trading and eCommerce technology with up-to-date understanding of eCommerce trends and the latest online sales tactics/ best practice
The ability to manipulate relatively complex data sets using the MS Excel
A degree or equivalent experience in a business or technology related discipline
Advanced proficiency in English
European language skills desired but not a must

Personal competencies required for the Performance Marketing Specialist role are:
Excellent communication and presentation skills to senior stakeholders
An ability to work under pressure in a sales focused organisation
Strong analytical and logical thinking skills
Proactive work style and cooperation and contribution oriented

Most importantly, we offer:
Remote, hybrid working with two days in our unique Manchester City centre office
Minimum 25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Salary of up to £45,000 per annum
Flexible working hours with the option to work from home on days that suit you best
Personal development plans and tailored career paths
Great office environment with a pool table and games room, free tea, Nespresso coffee and fresh fruit
Company paid benefits including life assurance, income protection, private medical insurance, pension, etc.
Access to medical support services such as online GP appointments, medical second opinions and mental health support, and a 24/7 helpline providing support on issues such as health, money and work
Optional benefits include cycle to work scheme, restaurant card, gym discounts, online learning, shopping discounts, savings on everyday healthcare expenses (dentist, opticians, prescriptions), etc.

Diversity and Inclusion
To be engaged, you must feel included and valued. We strive to build and nurture an inclusive culture that encourages, supports and celebrates the diverse voices of our people. We offer a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies and practices, flexible working arrangements, employee engagement forums and office facilities and services to support employees from different backgrounds. We truly believe that diversity and inclusion fuels our innovation and connects us closer to our customer and the communities we serve.
