1e00abb7b8763c94.description:
We strongly encourage people of colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. Bumble is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes everyone to our team. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.
In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
Bumble is looking for an enthusiastic, creative and tech-savvy translator to work on a freelance basis. You will localise all of Badoo ’s content into Ukrainian , ensuring Badoo ’s voice feels and sounds natural to Ukrainian-speaking users.
You will be part of our Localisation team which focuses on globalising Bumble and Badoo through the adaptation of linguistically and culturally centred messages and concepts to move our international users’ hearts and minds. Our mission is to spread Bumble and Badoo’s word around the world, making our global users feel as if the products were designed within their culture.
You will need to be able to work remotely and deliver translations within our 24/48-hour SLAs (depending on the market).

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Localise content for web and mobile applications to reflect local jargon, phraseologies and nuances
Advise the team on unique regional requirements and cultural differences to maximise the impact of the products in the local market
Transcreate marketing and SEO/ASO copy
Review, proofread and test translations within the context of the application/feature to continuously improve copy quality

EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR
Fluency in Ukrainian and a good command of English
Degree qualification in Copywriting, Translation, Journalism or other similar language-related area; or equivalent work experience
Experience in copywriting and writing for the web or mobile applications
Understanding of local social media scene, dating industry and target audience
Highly committed Internet and mobile user

ABOUT YOU
You are deeply passionate about Bumble’s brand vision and values
You are comfortable in a fast-paced environment where you communicate daily with your manager and other translators
You are positive and committed with a 'can-do' attitude and a flexible approach
You are a problem solver and a forward thinker
You have excellent time management skills and you know how to manage multiple priorities, breaking large projects into manageable pieces
You have great communication skills, both verbal and written

7036662757166608.title: Head of Marketing and Communications
7036662757166608.description: LocatED, an Arms-Length Body to the Department for Education (DfE), which is responsible for buying and developing sites in England to help deliver much needed new school places for thousands of children, is looking to recruit a Head of Marketing & Communications.This role will lead the design, development and implementation of LocatED’s internal and external relations, communications, business development and marketing strategies with full budget management responsibility. The objective is to develop LocatED’s brand and position it as a leading commercial property company to clients, delivery partners and potential employees. This role will be subject to a basic DBS check.Main duties & responsibilities include:Ensuring that LocatED’s Management information System (MIS) contains up to date, high quality and accurate data by creating and maintaining steps for effective quality assuranceLeading the development and approval process for LocatED’s annual marketing and communication campaign planning and expenditure with the Department for Education and Cabinet Office followed by full management of this budget which is circa £94,000Overseeing and facilitating strategic stakeholder engagement opportunities with key external organisations, audiences and policy makers to support business development and corporate reputationProactively identifying and securing public and key sector engagement opportunities at corporate events, networks, forums, conferences, exhibitions and speaking events. This includes preparation of keynote speeches, presentations, exhibition stands and briefing all speakers and attendees from the companyCommunicating LocatED’s purpose and competitive commercial reputation to property audiences via tailored communications, internal and external events and media engagement. This will require facilitating the strategic stakeholder engagement opportunities with key external organisations, audiences and policy makers to support business development and corporate reputationCommunicating the impact of LocatED’s successes as a means of attracting new client groups and maximising our exposure in new markets as our remit develops furtherFacilitating and organising thought leadership opportunities for LocatED subject matter expertsActing as brand guardian; overseeing the consistency and development of corporate messaging, branded materials and communications to support LocatED’s identity through a period of growth and diversificationLeading a proactive internal communications strategy that focusses on positive employee engagement and advocacy, as well as utilising customer and client feedback to establish and implement necessary service improvementsActing as main point of contact for all communication activity with the Department for Education, this will include; DfE Press Office, for necessary approvals and agreement of messaging for joint responses and releases; DfE Central Communications Team, for campaign planning and major communications; LocatED Sponsorship team for corporate and statutory communications. This will include managing responses to media, public and parliamentary communications functions within agreed timescales, including handling of Freedom of Information requestsManaging the overall relationship with any project specific PR specialists or external partner’s marketing teams to support planning applications and/or our property developments; this includes quality assuring messaging, oversight of media engagement and public consultationMonitoring and reporting on marketing and communications performance across all channels to assess the overall effectiveness of LocatED’s activities. Using results and insights to assess whether agreed objectives are being met, drive improvements and inform future communications tacticsAdhere to a structured corporate communications publishing cycle that meets transparency obligations and statutory requirements, this will include supporting the preparation, design and publishing of the LocatED annual report and accountsLine management of the Communications Manager ensuring that the role has well defined objectives and receives regular assessment against those objectivesMaintaining oversight of the media and political landscape; keeping abreast of developments in relevant education and property/estate initiatives and identifying key policy and/or funding changes and disseminating these updates and messagesKey skills & requirements:To be successful in this role you will need:To have a relevant degree or equivalent qualificationSubstantial experience in devising, implementing and evaluating marketing communication campaigns, underpinned by insight, in complex environmentsTo be able to demonstrate a robust understanding of what excellent stakeholder engagement entails. Use this expertise to lead innovative stakeholder engagement strategies, working with executive teamsTo have experience of leading a team and using organisational insight to advise senior leaders on relevant and targeted employee communication strategiesExperience of leading the development of integrated communication strategies and delivering insight-driven campaigns across a range of marketing communication channelsThe ability to anticipate and spot breaking news stories and drive the team to issue swift, robust and appropriate responses.To be able to oversee and prepare media handling advice on sensitive, complex and high-profile issuesThe ability to summarise and simplify complex ideas and information, which may be highly detailed, technical or specialist, for the general reader or target audiencesOutstanding verbal and written communication skillsTo be highly competent with full Microsoft Office suite; special expertise required in Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPointTo be an expert at managing corporate social media accounts; LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram.In return we offer:A basic salary of up to £70,000 depending on experience25 days annual leave increasing with service up to 28 days plus statutory holidaysA matched pension scheme for contributions up to 6%Opportunity to earn up to 10% of salary in an annual performance related pay schemeAbility to access training and other continuing professional development opportunitiesVarious discounts with popular retailersAbility to work from home – this is a hybrid role with a requirement to be based in our London office for at least 2 days most weeks. The rest of the week would be homebased.Equality, diversity and inclusion is fundamental to the continuing success at LocatED. We actively encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds and all sections of the community, regardless of race, religious beliefs, political opinions, colour, ethnic origin, nationality, marital/parental status, gender, age, sexual orientation or disability. We also support applications from those returning from a career break or from other roles.The closing date for applications is 16 March 2022.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: Up to £70,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Performance bonusBenefits:Flexible scheduleWork from homeSchedule:Monday to Friday

27cf4ee6e0b4750d.description:
Job Title: Content Marketing Principal Consultant – Life Sciences
Hours: Full Time
Location: UK Preferred (Belgium, Netherland, Germany optional)
Travel: Up to 40%
Want to Join a Leader?
Strong AI and workflow capabilities are just a couple of the reasons why Forrester names Aprimo Leader in Digital Asset Management (DAM) for customer experience. Download the 2022 Forrester Wave report to read more. #customerexperience #ai #digitalassetmanagement
https://www.aprimo.com/the-forrester-wave-digital-asset-management-for-customer-experience-q1-2022
Aprimo is currently seeking a dynamic, energetic professional with experience delivering value-added/strategic services to or within the life sciences industry (bio-tech, pharmaceutical and medical device).
The role is part of the Customer Success consulting team supporting the success-management of existing accounts as well as supporting new-name sales initiatives of the Aprimo platform, tools, and services. The role also forms part of Aprimo’s Life Sciences Centre-of-Excellence (CoE).
This role will help formulate decisions on marketing technology developments within Aprimo as well as be responsible for coordinating with staff from other departments to assist with advancing sales opportunities in conjunction with the Aprimo sales and alliances organizations.
COMPANY SUMMARY:
Aprimo is a pioneer of the marketing resource and digital asset management space, with a continually evolving SaaS solution that pushes the industry forward. But, more than that, Aprimo is dedicated to delivering innovative, helpful, cutting-edge software to help marketing teams efficiently collaborate and execute their strategies.
Aprimo helps enterprises unleash the power of their content by providing a marketing automation software and digital asset management software that manages the behind-the-scenes activities involved in marketing. Our product allows companies to manage content planning, creation, and distribution all in one place, store content and media in a shared repository, and receive in-depth insights into how content performs.
APRIMO CULTURE, BENEFITS & WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE:
Forward-thinking, progressive, and employee-first culture
Casual environment and relaxed dress code
Innovative, agile, and collaborative team environment that values multiple perspectives and fresh thinking
Competitive commissions structure
Diverse environment that promotes DEI efforts and includes Aprimo HELPS, an employee resource group (ERG) that is dedicated to giving back to our local communities
What you will be responsible for:
Evangelizes Aprimo platform best practices within the Life Sciences industry, with specific focus around content centric initiatives within marketing and compliance focused roles within our customer base
Acts as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for both promotional and non-promotional content approval within the Life Sciences Industry.
Develops relationship with assigned clients, which includes increasing adoption, ensuring retention, identifying upsell potential, and driving customer satisfaction
Supports the sales process as part of the wider Aprimo Life Sciences Centre-of-Excellence team.
Develop a trusted advisor relationship with customer sponsors such that all activities are closely aligned with the customer’s business goals and strategy
Serve as the customer advocate internally at Aprimo, ensuring that all of our resources are being focused and optimized to best serve all our customer’s needs
Work closely with the Aprimo executive sponsor and Account Director for each strategic account to ensure a consistent and close executive relationship
Participate in quarterly business reviews (QBR’s) ensuring customer satisfaction and value attainment
Become certified on the Aprimo platform and related Marketing
About You
Preferred Qualifications and Skills:
The ideal candidate will have demonstrable experience in the Life Sciences Sector, ideally dealing with large pharma and/or med-device players
Have significant exposure the Sales/Marketing content creation process, the supporting technologies and roles that participate in the end-to-end process within heavily regulated industries such as Life Sciences.
Demonstrable experience (5+ years) with SaaS software serving Life Science industry is preferred.
7+ years of professional services, account management, sales, or customer success experience
Enterprise software experience a plus
Experience developing strategies on assigned accounts to fully leverage technology and grow the lifetime value of the account
Experience building trusted relationships with executive sponsors at major brands
Marketing or MarTech experience a plus
BS/BA Degree or equivalent work experience
What you’ll need to be successful:
Having worked within the digital arena for a Life Sciences company or technology vendor in the digital asset management or Medical, Legal and Regulatory approval space, the ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate a penchant for problem solving, value-add consulting and domain evangelism to help drive results in this growing space.
Successful candidates will be responsible for contributing to Aprimo’s customer journey efforts. As a key member of the Centre-of-Excellence team, this position provides subject matter expertise at the right point in the customer journey. The candidate helps to drive a positive user experience for clients, delivers best practice presentations and product demonstrations, and also serves as a trusted resource to the sales organization as well as to prospect organizations.
The successful candidate will possess:
 Strong initiative and positive attitude
Professional, organized, efficient and accurate
Resourceful and creative troubleshooting skills
Strong negotiating, presentation, and communication skills
Strong collaboration mindset & capabilities
Commitment to quality
Desire to learn, generally curious, and excitement to make customers happy
Self-starter mentality with the ability to work independently
Ability to work autonomously with an entrepreneurial approach
Excellent listening and probing skills
Ability to demonstrate understanding of digital landscape and importance that marketing agility can bring
English speaking. Additional languages a plus
 Physical Requirements:
 Must be able to remain in stationary position 50% of time
 Must be able to move 50% of time
 Must be able to lift up to 30 lbs. on occasion
 The worker is required to have close visual awareness to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading.
 Ability to receive detailed information through oral communication at normal speaking levels
 Must be able to convey detailed or important spoken instructions to others accurately, loudly, or quickly
 This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines.
 EEO
Aprimo provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Aprimo complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.
ADA
Aprimo is required to make a reasonable accommodation to the known disability of a qualified applicant or employee if it would not impose an "undue hardship" on the operation of the employer's business. Undue hardship is defined as an action requiring significant difficulty or expense when considered in light of factors such as an employer's size, financial resources and the nature and structure of its operation.

68538c6e21765863.title: Benchtop NMR Spectroscopy Product Specialist
68538c6e21765863.description:
At Oxford Instruments, we enable the world’s leading industrial companies and scientific research communities to image, analyse and manipulate materials down to the atomic and molecular level. With a sixty-year history, and fourteen Queen’s Awards for Enterprise, our world-class products and technologies are helping our customers to address the greatest challenges of the 21st century.

We are looking for an experienced scientist with knowledge of NMR to join our growing NMR instrumentation business and significantly contribute to our continued success. We are looking for an individual that can develop key relationships with our customers, understanding their current and future requirements, managing aspects of the product lifecycle, and contributing to the development of our products. If you have a strong background in applications of NMR, then we would love to hear from you.

The opportunity

In this role you will share responsibility for strategically growing NMR products, focusing on critical market segments, key accounts, and “vertical” applications. To achieve this, you will develop a deep understanding of customer requirements and applications for benchtop NMR spectroscopy and other research products, to identify new opportunities, develop and verify new applications and present proof of concept and commercial business value justification. As part of this role, you will establish and nurture customer and key account collaborations. You will generate high impact marketing content and contribute to conferences and peer reviewed publications. You will additionally make a significant impact in product road mapping, delivering customer demonstrations and sample measurements, as well as providing technical support to the sales process.

About you

To be successful in this role, you will most likely have a degree and/or PhD in a relevant subject or the equivalent in industrial experience. It is essential that you have a strong background in applications of NMR in Analytical, Organic or Pharmaceutical chemistry. Experience gained in industry would be desirable. Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills are a must, and it would be advantageous if you have an applications knowledge of complementary laboratory analytical techniques, such as FTIR, Raman, Chromatography and GC-MS. A desire to develop new advances in technology and contribute to publications, together with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills is also essential.

Benefits

In addition to a competitive starting salary, Oxford Instruments offers flexible working hours and a half-day on Fridays. We also offer 25 days annual leave, private healthcare, a share incentive plan, a defined contribution Group Personal Pension Plan, and a flexible benefits package that you can tailor to your own requirements. We also invest in our talented employees by supporting them in their ongoing career and development so that they reach their full potential. We care and work hard to provide a workplace where you can grow and learn. #LI-JR1

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.

Note to recruitment agencies: Oxford Instruments operates a Preferred Supplier List, and we do not accept unsolicited agency CVs. Please do not forward candidate details in response to this advert, or to any Oxford Instruments employees or other company locations. Oxford Instruments is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited CVs.

a0ee7299f3b414ca.description: Job Purpose: The Digital and Software Vendors Marketing Specialist owns and drives the Vendor & Divisional marketing activity aligned to a Business Unit.They liaise between the vendors and the Business Managers/Vendor Managers to create marketing campaigns designed to drive growth and deliver the maximum Return On Investment (ROI) for their Vendors and Tech Data.Develops and implements Tech Data's electronic marketing communications, including but not limited to Web advertising, online communications, e-newsletters and webinars, which support Tech Data's and the vendor's goals and objectives.Responsibilities: Build strong relationships within our vendors and with Tech Data Business Units.To develop and manage a quarterly marketing planning cycles for the vendors/ Business Units.Creation and delivery of quarterly marketing campaigns developed from within the planning cycle for the business unit.Negotiation with vendors for funding of marketing activities.Measured on ROI of campaigns.Measured on the effectiveness of driving growth within the business.Knowledge Skills and Experience>1 to 3 Years of relevant work experience is required.Required Education: Bachelor's Degree in Business, marketing or other relevant subjectAble to work effectively in a multi-tasking and pressured environment;Able to communicate clearly both orally and in writing;Able to evaluate and make recommendations to enhance campaigns, service offering and process;Able to interact openly and directly with others;Able to manage suppliers and internal customers;Possess a high degree of creativity and initiative;Experience using Google Marketing solutions and tools (Analytics, Datastudio, Tag manager, Adwords, SEO).Experience of working in IT distribution environment, or Marketing Agency or similar would be an advantage;Good working knowledge of MS Office tools (Outlook, Excel, Word).Job Types: Full-time, TemporaryEducation:Bachelor's (preferred)

b10626d8710389dc.title: Social Media Executive (Remote Working)
b10626d8710389dc.description:
We are looking for fresh and innovative thinking for our social media team, the ideal candidate would be someone who already has all the skills necessary to thrive in the role while being adaptable and willing to learn. You’ll possess all the right skills to build on our target audiences across all our social touchpoints.

Given the nature of social media and how it’s constantly evolving, this role requires you to stay on top of best practice and spot trends. You’ll be joining a team with a real buzz, who bounce ideas around, to support the growth of RSK Group. So, if this sounds like your type of challenge, then this could be the role for you.

We can offer:
A collaborative, intelligent and friendly team in an excellent working environment

A challenging workload that will stretch your mind and make the most of your skills

Development and training to facilitate your professional growth

The freedom to push boundaries and use all your expertise

The day-to-day tasks include:
Create social media posts/stories including: RSK group news, Insights, Projects, Events, Job vacancies, Selfies on site and further ad hoc posts such as businesses reposts, social media days

Drive effective and creative social media campaigns, working cross-functionally with design, copywriters, and specialists across the group to curate social media posts

Scheduling social media posts across multiple platforms including, LinkedIn, YouTube, Facebook, TikTok, Instagram, and Twitter using Sprout Social and similar tools

Present content in an engaging and accessible manner

Supporting teams across RSK Group with content on social media to reach business goals such as: recruitment drives, brand awareness, thought leadership, event campaigns

Source content for use for social media days/events (e.g., Invasive Species week, Earth Day etc

Experience:
Minimum of two years managing social media accounts for business

Degree or equivalent in a related subject (desirable)

Experience working with Sprout Social - scheduling and reporting (desirable)

An understanding of social media platforms including LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, Vimeo and TikTok for business purposes

Confident using Canva as a content creation tool for social media posts, stories, and videos

Passion for social media marketing for businesses

Salary and benefits:
£20,000 - £26,000 depending on experience

Contributory pension scheme

Life assurance

A flexible benefits programme including the option to buy additional holidays, health cash plan and discounted gym membership

Please see the full job description under documents.

RSK Group is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

66d219d1e325db60.title: Reference Materials Specialist
66d219d1e325db60.description:
A career at our company is an ongoing journey of discovery: our 58,000 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in Healthcare, Life Science and Electronics. For more than 350 years and across the world we have passionately pursued our curiosity to find novel and vibrant ways of enhancing the lives of others.


United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.


Your role: our Inside Sales Specialistis responsible for developing the sales of the Reference Materials portfolio in the assigned territory (France and UK) to achieve quarterly and annual targets. To achieve this, you will build and maintain relationships with customers by telephone ande-mail, sendingquotes, contracts & tenders. You will also attend exhibitions and visit customers (usually quarterly) to drive our business forward. Other core duties include attending sales exhibitions, implementing campaigns driven by Marketing, researching new sales opportunities in active and new accounts and developing and maintaining detailed customer / prospect records in our databases (i.e. SFDC), to ensure that the relevant mailing list and databases are updated.


Who you are:

Minimum Bachelor in Science (chemistry, biology or other related subject) - some scientific background is necessary to quickly acquire good knowledge of companyproducts and applications
Fluent in written and verbal English and French, along with natural interpersonal skillsand confidence in creating and delivering presentations
Previous sales experience is highly desirable; however, candidates would be considered from a similar 'results driven' background.
Highly motivated by sales and self-directed
Excellent time management and organisation skills


What we offer: With us, there are always opportunities to break new ground. We empower you to fulfil your ambitions, and our diverse businesses offer various career moves to seek new horizons. We trust you with responsibility early on and support you to draw your own career map that is responsive to your aspirations and priorities in life. Join us and bring your curiosity to life!


Curious? Apply and find more information at https://jobs.vibrantm.com


We are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive workforce. Applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief and marriage and civil partnerships.

b3e9afb3a7239f68.title: Digital Marketing Manager
b3e9afb3a7239f68.description:
We're on the hunt for a talented Digital Marketing Manager to lead our digital marketing activity at Barnardo's. It's an exciting time to join Barnardo's as our need to deliver first-in-class digital marketing campaigns, user journeys and experiences grows each year.

Leading a team of two, you will work on planning, delivering and evaluating paid digital fundraising campaigns, marketing campaigns for our children's services and in addition, high-value brand campaigns. You'll work alongside our Brand Marketing, Family Placement (adoption and fostering), Creative and Fundraising teams to launch strategic campaigns that reach diverse audiences with multiple touchpoints.

A specialist in planning and managing complex paid digital campaigns, you'll be expert in integrated channel planning, including programmatic display, remarketing, paid social media, search and SEO. You will lead on our email strategy, paid search strategy and models of engagement for digital marketing, working with colleagues across the organisation to ensure smooth and effective digital journeys.

You will also gain exposure to senior leadership across the organisation as you support the Head of Brand and Marketing in the development of a new Brand and Marketing strategy and will manage high value projects with leading creative and strategic external agencies.

You'll join a team of ambitious marketing specialists, fundraisers and creatives who are passionate about protecting and supporting children and young people. You'll also benefit from our 'work from anywhere' policy which allows you to work from home, with the option to work from one of our office hubs as frequently as you would like.

Interview dates: 21st and 22nd March (online).

When completing your application please refer to your skills knowledge and experience in relation to the Person Specification, Job Description and Additional Information document (if applicable). This should be done with an understanding of the context of the service described.

About Barnardo's
At Barnardo's, we believe in children. Our purpose is to transform the lives of the UK's most vulnerable children, young people and their families.

We've come a long way since our founder, Thomas Barnardo set up a ‘ragged school' to help disadvantaged children in 1867. Now we're helping hundreds of thousands of children, young people, parents and carers across the UK each year.

We believe in children regardless of their background or experience. We listen to them, fight for their rights and do whatever it takes to protect and support them – because we believe that all children have the right to a happy and healthy life.

At a time when more young people need specialist help with complex issues like sexual abuse, mental health problems and serious violence, our work is more vital than ever. Times have changed and we've changed with them, but our belief in the potential of every child remains.

Barnardo's is committed to having a diverse and inclusive workforce for staff and volunteers. We actively encourage applications from disabled, Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic and male candidates as they are under-represented within Barnardo's.

7d22a0817ae6c039.description: Who We Are:  M-Files is an award-winning, next generation intelligent information management platform. a27b71eb62afa0c8.title: NEMEA Marketing Specialist (12 month fixed term contract)
a27b71eb62afa0c8.description:
WHAT IS BOX?

Box is the market leader for Cloud Content Management. Our mission is to power how the world works together. Box is partnering with enterprise organizations to accelerate their digital transformation by creating a single platform for secure content management, collaboration and workflow. We have an amazing opportunity to further establish ourselves as leaders in the space, and we need strong advocates to help us achieve that goal.

By joining Box, you will have the unique opportunity to help capture a majority of this developing market and define what content management looks like for the digital enterprise. Today, Box powers over 100,000 businesses, including 70% of the Fortune 500 who trust Box to manage their content in the cloud.

WHY BOX NEEDS YOU?

You will be responsible for scaling the NEMEA marketing function; with two teams and 10+ AEs, NEMEA is by far the largest region in Europe with the largest targets. Moving into FY23, we will see the re-emergence of physical events. This role will support the NEMEA marketing leader to execute a full program of activities and events across each target vertical and segment. They will also support the execution of an in region CxO engagement strategy and enable the NEMEA marketing leader to team with enterprise AEs on focus account strategies.

What you'll do:
Work with the Regional Marketing Manager to build and execute the regional marketing strategy and activities

Support or drive third party events, working with Sales, PR, Brand and external vendors on timely planning, execution and follow-up; Building strong relationships with regional field and channel sales teams will be crucial to that

With oversight from the Regional Marketing Manager, own the social programs for the regions for inbound and outbound engagement

Work with the Marketing Operations team to monitor reporting on all conversion metrics owned by this function and recommend tweaks and improvements based on your analysis.

Support the Customer Marketing Manager with regional customer reference programs, assisting with case study creation

Own all regional administration processes, including regional teams communications (weekly updates to Sales), events and launch calendar, purchase requests and vendor on-boarding.

Who you are:
Solid verbal and written communication skills in English

BA/BS (or equivalent) from a top tier university, ideally in Marketing or a related field

Student placements or work experience at a SaaS or relevant technology company are preferred, but not required

A hard-working individual who’s not afraid to roll-up their sleeves and delve into new challenges

Team player - organizing and managing with multiple stake-holders and groups contributing who likes to work with a fast-paced environment

Resourceful and creative with an ability to manage multiple projects at once

Overwhelming desire to kick-ass and grow in your career

Inspired by working with a fun, ambitious team

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

For details on how we protect your information when you apply, please see our Personnel Privacy Notice.

9685e2b7d48cd634.description:
Job Description Summary
GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.


As the Cardiology Product Sales Specialist you’ll create and win sales opportunities as the clinical expert for ECG, Stress, Holter, Archiving, and Invasive System products.
Are you clinically trained in cardiac physiology and looking for a customer focussed, commercial role? Join GE and help provide clinicians with incredible GE products!
Job DescriptionMaintain up to date detailed knowledge of the product portfolio.Understand customers’ changing clinical issues and challenges.Present and discuss the technology and clinical benefits to customers.Differentiate and promote assigned product offerings using GE marketing resources.Create viable product solutions which meet customer needs and achieve optimum profits.Identify and create new opportunities and work with Sales Leaders and Account Managers.Create territory plans including opportunity development, strategies and targets.Drive sales process including needs qualification, vendor selection, quotation and closure.Achieve product orders and sales target for the region while ensuring pricing compliance.Estimate delivery date to customer based on GE production / delivery schedule knowledge.Build strong customer relationships; ensure needs are met and maintain contact records.Grow and maintain a network of key stakeholders.Contribute to account plans at accounts covered by Account Managers.Educate account team members on Cardiology product portfolio.Share and follow-up identified leads for other product lines.Forecast orders and sales within the sales funnel tools and provide reports for the products.Track and communicate market trends.Represent GE at medical conferences / technical exhibitions to promote product and GE.Adhere to and uphold highest standards of compliance.
Qualifications and experience
Clinically trained and experienced Cardiac Physiologist, Cardio Nurse or equivalent.Commercial experience or desire to work in a customer facing role.Fluent in EnglishValid driving license and able to travel extensively in the region.
Desirable skillsExcellent organizational, communication, presentation and negotiation skills.Able to discuss complex issues and communicate these in simple messages.Enthusiastic with a positive can-do attitude and strong customer focus.
Inclusion and Diversity
GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.
Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.
About Us
GE (NYSE:GE) rises to the challenge of building a world that works. For more than 125 years, GE has invented the future of industry, and today the company’s dedicated team, leading technology, and global reach and capabilities help the world work more efficiently, reliably and safely. GE’s people are diverse and dedicated, operating with the highest level of integrity and focus to fulfil GE’s mission and deliver for its customers.

0c23f40953e1c026.description: At Zoopla we want to help everyone make intelligent home buying decisions. Our Commercial team is at the heart of this mission and responsible for one of it’s most important elements - our customers.Our commercial and executive management team has decades of experience from some of the world’s leading companies including Amazon, Photobox, Microsoft and Dyson. We are creating an exciting, inclusive and dynamic culture, and are looking for ambitious team members to join us for a once-in-a-career opportunity to re-imagine an entire industry.The Sales Executive - Property Marketing is an important new role responsible for both the qualification and distribution of inbound enquiries, as well as proactive outbound activities to our existing customer base to introduce them new products or across the UK.Working in alignment with the territory account management teams and the specialist product support team this role will ensure that our customers are aware and have access to our portfolio of products as well as partnerships and reach products.The role is a varied one and needs the individual to become master of conversing with independent estate agency businesses. It will require someone to be structured in their approach managing both new project sales as well as inbound lead queues.Other duties include responding to incoming customer calls & queries, minimising cancellations, securing payment for outstanding debtors and maintaining accurate and up to date records.RequirementsManage the qualification and distribution of inbound sales enquiriesDeliver revenue growth across Zooplas portfolio of products (property marketing, CRM software, website products and marketing reach products) as appropriateProactive outbound calling as well as dealing with incoming calls and queries - and ensuring the highest conversion of inbound leads where applicableEnsure the territory client engagement coverage model is in place to engage with all customer and prospect accounts on a scheduled basis for all allocated accountsDemonstrate quality customer engagement as well as maintain a high degree of business acumen and product awarenessEnsure that you maintain client records in Salesforce with accurate, high quality informationContinually develop your product knowledge to ensure you are comfortable discussing Zoopla’s entire product suite. Attend internal/external training sessions as and when appropriate to increase your skill set. Be responsible for continually updating your product, market and competitor knowledge and pro-actively and regularly provide clients and sales people with relevant industry and business information,Maintain effective communication links with all other teams & departments across the business and communicate effectively with internal & external customersTo handle customer complaints or enquiries when appropriate and own the enquiry to completionTo act as an effective, professional ambassador for the company at all external events, conferences and presentations when requiredParticipate in special projects as and when requiredEssential skillsExperience in B2B sales, working in a consultative sales roleOutstanding organisational and time management skills that allow you to manage your own time effectively and work to tight deadlinesAbility to be flexible and comfortable in a fast-moving performance-led environment, adapting quickly to changeSelf-motivated and results-orientated – with the ability to work on own initiative; demonstrate consistently sound judgement and creative thinkingExposure working in digital transformation environments helping customers to understand the value of and how to unlock their digital potentialCommunicating effectively with both internal and external customers and engaging constructively in team meetings etcDesire to be part of and contribute to the success of a fast-growing organisationMinimum intermediate IT skills in Google Slides/Sheets or Powerpoint/ExcelDesired skillsKnowledge of property, software or digital media backgroundProven track record of working cross channel with a varied product portfolioTo be successful, you will:Be willing and able to work as part of a teamBe passionate about delivering positive customer experiences whilst driving results in a sales environmentDemonstrate personal commitment to improving one’s own knowledge and sharing best practice with colleaguesJob Type: Full-time

9e4a4dcbd5194f53.title: Trainee Agronomist
9e4a4dcbd5194f53.description: An opportunity has arisen to join our team in Aberdeenshire on a permanent full-time basis.Our Agronomists play a key role in facilitating our business on farm by building outstanding customer relationships, providing a comprehensive advisory service, and maximising crop production for the farmer while increasing sales for the business.We are now strengthening our on-Farm team by recruiting for a Trainee Agronomist.For the right candidate, if you are more at trainee level full training will be provided and there is the potential to offer an apprenticeship.Ideal candidateWe are looking for candidates who are already working as an Agronomist or someone who has worked in agriculture and have a good understanding of the sector; experience of working in farm management or a similar field would be highly desirableFACTS and BASIS qualifications (while not essential) would be a great advantageA strong desire to develop a career in AgronomyStrong commercial acumen and awareness with previous success dealing with farmers (while not essential) would be a great advantageAbility to build outstanding professional relationships with customers and colleaguesExcellent interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal)A high level of initiative with strong planning and organisational skillsGood attention to detailGood working knowledge of Microsoft including Excel and WordThe personal ambition, tenacity and resilience to succeed in a sales roleThe role – Key responsibilitiesTo provide an integrated and comprehensive service on all aspects of Crop Production for our customers, including Crop Nutrition and Crop Protection advice, and guidance on current agricultural legislationHave knowledge of end markets and be able to provide advice on the most appropriate management strategy for these end marketsWorking collaboratively with stakeholders and other teams to fulfil customer orders and ensuring excellent customer serviceBuilding a comprehensive knowledge of Frontier’s products and services in order to achieve the best commercial, quality and relationship outcomes for customers and the companyCrop walking regularly; establishing a strong relationship with the customer and understanding their on-going needsBuild strong relationships with the Trials teams and Technical Support Team, supporting initiatives and developing own product and customer knowledgeBuild relationships with experienced commercial managers, building commercial understanding alongside technical knowledgeLiaising closely with colleagues to identify opportunities with new customers and develop relationships with existing customers, supporting a joint working approachUnderstand environmental factors and schemes and be able to work with customers to manage these at farm levelSuccessful management of customer relationshipsWork with the Local Regional Sales Manager to create and achieve a business plan for the designated areaActively engage in prospecting customers for FrontierWhy work for Frontier?At Frontier, we believe in rewarding our people for a job well done. As an employee you will have access to the following benefits:BUPA Health CareCompany carOpportunities for flexible workingHelping you plan and save for the future with a contributory pension plan offering you a choice of contributing levels of up to 7% which is matched by usWe know that time out is important for us all that’s why as standard we offer 25 days holiday (per annum) in addition to bank holidays with the opportunity to purchase up to an addition 5 days holiday per yearBenefits supporting you and your family such as Life Assurance of 3x SalaryYou and your friends and family (up to five people) will have access to our Employee Assistance Programme which provides 24hour support and advice on a variety of topics including financial and wellbeing.Access to money saving discounts at selected retailers through our Employee Discounts Programme and our Cycle to Work schemeWe have dedicated Learning and Development specialists to ensure our commit to your ongoing developmentAccess to free eye tests across all rolesComplimentary parking on siteAbout UsFrontier is a successful and growing business. It is the largest crop production and grain marketing company in the UK, with over 1,000 employees and a turnover of more than £1.5 billion.With a vision to be the first-choice partner for crop production and grain marketing, and the first choice employer in UK agriculture, Frontier is committed to delivering a culture where people are at the heart of success.Our business approach is underpinned by our core values – Integrity, customer focus and expertise, these values support our whole philosophy and ways of working,Award winning for our commitment to people, we have been recognised by Great Place to Work since 2012 and we are proud to have been ranked in the top 30 UK best large places to work.Our business approach is underpinned by our core values – Integrity, customer focus and expertise. These values support our whole philosophy and ways of working and we are always looking to attract talented individuals with either industry knowledge or specialist skills that will help us deliver consistently to these values.Commitment to Diversity and InclusionAt Frontier we have a clear commitment to equality of opportunity and diversity encouraging fairness and equality of treatment for all and as such we would encourage applications from backgrounds outside the agriculture sector.We recognise the value of a workforce in which people from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to introduce fresh ideas and contribute to the business goals.We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive environment, inclusive employment policies and flexible working arrangements are in place to support this.Job Type: Permanent

47d25a9d9d2c1d72.title: Business Applications Specialist - Professional Services
47d25a9d9d2c1d72.description:
The Field Specialist leads our most valued customers into the digital age. Embracing a challenger mindset, the successful Field Specialist drives, orchestrates and closes opportunities with customers that produce transformative business outcomes.
The Field Specialist drives complex and high-value deals in selected customer accounts within a Territory. They partner with Account Executives (AEs) to identify large/strategic deals in the territory and then in conjunction with qualified partners, drives the opportunities to closure. Also, Field Specialists should have extra focus on engaging with customers that are interested in digital transformation initiatives and who are potential customers to adopt our cloud offerings.
Health & Wellbeing
In SMC we live digital and embrace flexible working as a core principle of reinventing productivity. You’ll be welcome to work from home, our offices around the country, customer and partner sites, or your favourite coffee shop next to the gym – wherever and however you feel is best for you to get your job done. We are committed to supporting your health and wellness, because we understand that to bring our best selves to work, we need to be looking after ourselves at home. That’s why currently every week, on ‘Wellbeing Wednesdays’, we give you back 2 hours to spend time doing the things you love – exercise, mindfulness, family time, hobbies, or even a long lunch.
Benefits
Microsoft employees enjoy a competitive compensation package. This includes: base salary, bonus, car allowance, stock awards, plus strong flexible benefits; including pension scheme, private medical cover and more!
Microsoft sees the whole person and looks to support your wellbeing on every level, by providing world-class benefits to enable your family to thrive. You can build a benefits package tailored specifically for your family’s needs, no matter what stage in life you find yourself. This includes private medical healthcare, travel insurance, workplace nursery and Microsoft CARES, our Employee Assistance Programme which offers tools and information to help you manage life’s predictable events – as well as the unpredictable ones. These are just some examples of how our culture puts the success of our people at the heart of everything we do.
Personal & Professional Development
From a personal development perspective, you will work with your manager on a personal development plan which is unique to you and your life goals. We offer mentorships and shadowing as well as formal training opportunities, and we actively encourage a focus on continual learning and development. As a global company with presence in more than 120 countries, you’ll have the opportunity to not just work within a global community but to think about roles outside of the UK should that interest you.
Diversity & Inclusion
We firmly believe that to go far, you have to go together. In SMC, we celebrate diversity and inclusion in everything we do. Our mission itself is deeply inclusive: empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. We expect each of us – no matter what our level, role or function is – to play an active role in creating environments where people of a diverse range of backgrounds are excited to bring all of who they are and do their best work. We know that our unique experiences and perspectives connect us and help us all to achieve more. Allyship is a core value in how we work with each other, customers, and partners, and we actively encourage engagement with communities inside and outside of Microsoft within our nine Employee Resource Groups.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, colour, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.
Responsibilities
The Field Specialist core responsibilities include:
Ownership of full sales cycle, to deliver cloud customer acquisition and revenue for business applications (Dynamics 365 and Power Platform) against aligned territory.
New business applications (Dynamics 365 and Power Platform) customer adds/logo acquisition.
Manage large cloud opportunities within the sales territory.
Build close relationships with customers and partners, to drive mutual success.
Lead and plan across a virtual team of resources, to enable your territory to exceed targets (both revenue and customer satisfaction). These resources can be internal to Microsoft, or from within Microsoft’s Partners.
Ability to identify, nurture, and drive digital transformation projects with customers.
Robust pipeline management to deliver on revenue accountabilities, in a predictable way.
Qualifications
Line of Business applications sales experience, business process consulting or automation, ERP, CRM, Employee Performance Management (systems and processes).
Demonstrated ability to consistently exceed quota by driving deals within a partner ecosystem.
Expertise in solution selling techniques and selling cloud-based solutions.
Knowledge of the 3 Microsoft Cloud Solutions and their value proposition and differentiation.
Experience in building collaborative customer relationships with line-of-business and technical roles.
Ability to navigate a customer through sales negotiations and technical presentations in person and remotely.
Solid knowledge of the business, customers, partners, Microsoft strategy and how they work together.
Able to qualify sales opportunities and position partners in the overall sales process.
Demonstrated business communication skills in the local language.
Passion for technology as an enabler for a company’s growth.
Complex sales training (e.g., Miller Hyman, Spin, Michael Bosworth, Challenger, Holden, Krauthammer, etc.), extensive presentation skills, effective marketing tactics, negotiation, financial analysis.

e0335e16136ccc3e.title: Field Marketing Specialist - East Midlands
e0335e16136ccc3e.description:
Red Bull are recruiting for a Field Marketing Specialist for the East Midlands region.
You will be responsible for growing sales and consumption of Red Bull through field marketing in your region. You’ll spend your days working in locations and communities across your region, growing brand visibility, product availability, brand experiences and product consumption in key moments when people need energy. You will increase product consideration through initiatives that grow trial, availability and visibility using Red Bull’s four key pillars of the field marketing mix (Consumer Collecting, Sports, Culture and Communications). This isn’t your average 9-5 office job as you will be out in the field ensuring Red Bull is relevant and present in the right places on any day of the week and at a time when people need energy.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Areas that play to your strengths
All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:
Expand all
Support Strategic Direction
Work closely with the Field Marketing Manager on the creation of the field strategy, defining ideas to build brand image and increase understanding of product functionality on a local level.
Drive relevance across a variety of moments of need through when people need energy, through tailored messaging, amplification of occasion campaigns and activating the right big moments in the region.
Work in conjunction with the local sales team to build mental availability hand in hand with physical availability within image driving outlets, On Premise, Off Premise and new business environments. Ensuring the product is readily available in every field marketing activity.
Set clear goals together with the Consumer Collecting Manager and Field Marketing Manager to drive trial that engages new users, offering the right product mix to expand the consumer base to seize all opportunities in your region especially among students.
Use programme tools and reporting features to track performance, find opportunities for improving targeting and other important strategic input (e.g. consumer perceptions), which will help to drive a smarter programme.
Implementation of Regional Marketing Plan
Activate national and international best practices with students encompassing the core programme objectives.
Incorporate in-direct sampling initiatives into the plan to broaden reach in occasions which are difficult to sample and where we can surprise our consumers.
Ensure the delivery of the sampling programme for the region by leading your team of Student Marketeers to success.
Deliver brand activations at 3rd party events within the region. Adding value by determining the appropriate level of Red Bull brand support & visibility with the objective of increasing brand attribution and product usage in relevant scenes.
Build and activate relationships with key opinion leaders and important local networks within key sport and cultural scenes for the region.
Secure, manage and activate new distribution points within the region for Red Bull through premium and relevant image led outlets that will buy Red Bull and sell it to their visitors.
Execute the Event Vehicle programme to excite & surprise consumers.
Support national teams & Field Marketing Manager in organizing events by taking over defined parts of bigger projects and realising small scale regionally important titled events where appropriate.
Bring national marketing assets such as brand campaigns, titled events, student projects, athletes and media house projects closer to consumers in your region by implementing activation plans set by the Field Marketing Manager.
Maximize opportunities to create consumer touch points in earned and owned media through creating locally relevant stories/experiences and having a superb media network.
Marketing Innovation
Support the Field Marketing Manager in developing, owning and executing new ideas that are locally relevant, complementing the activation of global and national initiatives.
Identify and selectively support cross-marketing (with sales, marketing & Red Bull Media House) opportunities with integrated 360 plans that fit the needs of the region.
Lead the creative process with Student Marketeers for a constant flow of new ideas to build loyalty within the student audience.
Organizational Capabilities and Enabling Structure
Act as a role model and display the Red Bull values with a consistent tone of voice that is motivating and inspiring.
Ensure you have the right programme set up, in the right areas to reach your target group, be flexible with resources so that we are always aligned with business opportunities.
Maintain consistency with other field marketing regions regarding recruitment, on-boarding and training.
Source and hire with no compromise the best, highly diverse Student Marketeers who have the right skills & attitude towards all business priorities.
Set every new Student Marketeer hire up for success with a dedicated and consistent onboarding process.
Train and lead Student Marketeers with an ‘empowerment’ approach so they take ownership of their own targets that impact the business and give opportunities for development to the shining stars.
Lead and inspire Student Marketeers by sharing the strategy and explaining how they fit into it, spend time in the field coaching on the job and inspiring them to focus on building brand and can love.
Maintain a growth environment and coach Student Marketeers towards development.
Plan and conduct regular idea generation sessions, planning sessions and team building activities.
Driving Efficiencies
Manage the regional budget with the support of the Field Marketing Manager.
Support the national operations team to manage product stock with discipline.
Maintenance and management of programme tools, Point Of Sales Materials, cars and other branded items in a premium manner.
Regularly review the environmental impact of your marketing activity working with the wider field marketing team to develop a year round plan and new initiatives to keep it to a minimum, ensuring we leave the playgrounds we operate in better than we found them.

EXPERIENCE
Your areas of knowledge and expertise
that matter most for this role:
Previous experience having built and sustained personal relationships in local scenes (e.g. University, Culture, Sports, etc.).
Previous work experience in the sports and or culture industry, events or marketing agency having an in-depth understanding of the sport and or culture landscape (ideal).
A strategic thinker who takes initiative and ownership and “makes things happen”.
A ‘connector’ who has excellent communication and networking skills, who can open doors and excite people of an idea.
Strong ‘can do’ attitude, strives for perfection and love for the detail in every project.
We value experience over formal qualifications.
Fluent in written and spoken English.
Travel 50%

fb34f30866425a48.title: Social Media Specialist - Beauty
fb34f30866425a48.description:
We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Social Media Specialist to join our Brand Marketing team here at QVC UK.

Alongside the Social Media Manager this role will be responsible for the development & execution of the social strategy for the Beauty categories across primary and secondary social platforms. This role is critical to driving social media KPIs across a number of QVC social media platforms to drive engagement, reach, and brand awareness. The role will interact with social media communities to promote QVC brand, events, etc and will build an editorial calendar and related compelling, consistent and meaningful content on all social media platforms.

Responsibilities:

Responsible for the brand identity across all social platforms, working directly with the social media production team and other content teams to ensure all content is brand right and meets platform best practices

Implement and execute social media strategies that build brand awareness, generate engagement, traffic and sales

Stay up to date with social media trends and best practices and share these with the wider business

Oversee overall social media and content strategy across QVC’s social platforms

Provide continued direction on the creative considerations for social media content

Develop engaging, on-trend & consistent campaigns to align with wider QVC campaigns and promotions

Close co-operation with the Social Video Specialist to develop a multi-platform social media video & content strategy which works to service YouTube, IGTV, and Facebook Live

Implement a cross channel social marketing plan (including content strategy)

Develop and deliver social media optimization (SMO)

Build and maintain the editorial calendar

– Responsible for daily posting and creation of content across QVC’s social platforms including but not limited to Facebook, Twitter, Instagram & YouTube

Generate, edit, publish and share content daily, ensuring consistent communication with our social media followers

Collaborate with other departments to manage company reputation, coordinate promotions, and increase reach

Manage social commerce opportunities in partnership with Digital Store team

– Partner with external vendors & partners to coordinate engaging campaigns to drive business KPIs

Create weekly and monthly reports to keep wider QVC business up to date with social media statistics and coverage

Analyze analytics reports in coordination with Customer Analytics team to gain insight on traffic, demographics, effectiveness to drive improvements in traffic / engagement

This role reports solid line to Market Social Media & Community role.

INDCOMM

98ae63c3679b10a5.title: Creative Strategist (Remote in EMEA)
98ae63c3679b10a5.description: NOTE: To be considered for this role, you must be physically located in the EMEA region.WHO ARE WE ON THE LOOKOUT FOR?As a Creative Strategist at Ladder, your mission will involve:Coming up with cool new ideas and strategies (and the obligatory slide decks) to help us grow our clients.Managing a diverse portfolio of clients. Including, helping to define creative strategy to build and protect their brands through various stages of creative development.Keeping a close eye on the quality of ads we put out. Yep, that means consistency with the brand and creative strategy again.Putting your thinking cap on to research who would be interested in buying what our clients are selling.Working as part of the team to assess a company's strengths and develop brand positioning.Keeping that thinking cap on when you research and develop creative ideas for new creative campaigns.Diving into the performance data to see which ads are working. Then, breaking it down to see which creative routes are doing the best, and for which personas.Being a real part of the team - contributing ideas to improve the department, be it new services, internal processes or other initiatives.Joining client calls to listen and learn, building an idea of the brand through participation in workshops.Problem-solving. Issues with briefs, delivery, resourcing crop up. Take a look at the problem and either work with other teams (social, search, digital strategy) to resolve, or know when to escalate.Housekeeping - Keeping a close eye on the planned work for the creative department vs the number of creative hours available.You’ll do great if you combine the following experience, skills and attributes: An eye for good copy and design (and, maybe more importantly, for bad copy and design).Impressive powers of persuasion (through storytelling).A portfolio that shows you can tell a brand’s story through great campaigns.Intimate knowledge of digital - that means you’ve written and/or reviewed social media paid ads, landing pages, email copy, whitepapers etc.As the role progresses presenting to clients/ other stakeholders will prove very useful.Comfortable looking at data to determine the performance.Mad PowerPoint/Google Slides skills.(Nice to have) Experience as a copywriter or designer.(Nice to have) Experience with a variety of companies (sizes and industries).High Emotional IQ -The ability to deliver tough feedback in a constructive manner - protecting the delicate creative ego whilst telling them it is all wrong is a true skill.Team player - make decisions that are for the good of the group - we’re in it together.Own it - Whether it’s something you're really proud of or something you’d rather forget (we all make mistakes). We want to be a place where we win together, lose together - and that starts with each of us taking responsibility for delivering the best we can. All-day. Every day.Perks that will come with your role at Ladder: ✅ Opportunity to work from anywhere you'd like in the EMEA region,✅ Working with exciting start ups and world-class companies,✅ Collaborating with amazing specialists in digital marketing,✅ Competitive salary based on your experience,✅ Paid holiday leave as well as extra days off during the Christmas period and Mental Health Days✅Flexible working hours and early leave Summer Fridays ️✅Work From Home equipment budget✅E-gym membership, e-lunch benefit and weekly company yoga sessions✅Profit Sharing Scheme✅ Extensive training opportunities: Access to ConversionXL Courses, Company Library, LAD Academy, Audible subscription, seminar and training budgets, additional non-work-related training budgetDo you speak our language? Send your application over to us and we’ll walk you through the recruitment process. We can’t wait to meet you!﻿﻿About Ladder: We’re specialists in Growth Marketing, experts at unlocking the power of data and making the best decisions to reach our clients’ growth goals. Through our data-driven testing process, we unlock the true growth potential of our clients all over the world.Our client portfolio is diverse. We've worked with emerging startups to SMEs, scale ups to Fortune500 companies including some big names such as Nestle, Booking.com and Facebook to name a few. Our clients span business models from B2B to E-commerce, Mobile Apps to SaaS, as well as industry sectors including FinTech, consumer products, business intelligence, and more. Join our distributed team based in the UK, USA, Poland and Greece to gain unrivalled experience within our world renowned agency.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: From £30,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Bonus schemeBenefits:Additional leaveCasual dressCompany eventsFlexible scheduleGym membershipProfit sharingReferral programmeSick payWellness programmesWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayNo weekends

683b98e3f3f2f8de.title: Marketing & Communications Officer
683b98e3f3f2f8de.description:
This is a great opportunity for an enthusiastic marketing and communications person to join our teams at Wentworth Castle Gardens and Nostell. As Marketing and Communications Officer, you will be responsible for promoting these special places creatively and effectively.
In the last two years we have seen just how much local people value space to walk, relax with friends and family, and appreciate beauty, nature and history.
You will connect people to our places through creating content for our website, engaging social media posts and targeted email marketing, as well as identifying and sharing news-worthy stories with the media and our partners. You'll help to achieve our business and charitable targets by driving the marketing and communication plan.
As part of a dynamic and energetic team you will have the opportunity to play a part in making a difference every day, using your specialist knowledge, skills and experience to share content both internally and externally.
What it's like to work here:You’ll be working with teams of staff and volunteers across two sites, as well as regional consultancy colleagues, who all have a shared passion for the work of the National Trust.
Wentworth Castle Gardens
Working together with Barnsley Council and Northern College, this estate, rooted in rivalry, provides a space to bring people together.
Royal diplomat Thomas Wentworth was outraged when a cousin inherited his family home in 1695 and was determined to outdo him, creating what was once known as ‘the finest garden in England’. Today it is South Yorkshire’s only Grade I-listed landscape, with acres of parkland and gardens to explore. There are surprises along every avenue, including a castle that is not what it seems.
The National Trust only took over the running of the site in 2019. We are now welcoming 120k visitors a year, inviting them to enjoy seasonal garden highlights, explore fascinating stories and celebrate art and community initiatives.
Nostell
Welcoming 150k visitors a year, Nostell is home to one of the great treasure houses of the north. The house is a Georgian architectural masterpiece, where generations of the Winn family employed the best architects, craftsmen and artists to create a showcase for fashionable design.
Inside, we tell the stories behind a world-class collection furniture, textiles and wallpaper supplied by Thomas Chippendale, historic paintings, a treasured Georgian dolls' house, Robert Adam interiors and a rare John Harrison clock.
The whole estate includes parkland, meadows, lakes, a working kitchen garden, orangery and Menagerie Garden, with seasonal highlights including snowdrops, magnolia, bluebells and Rose Garden.
What you'll be doing:Day to day, you’ll manage and help develop our annual marketing plan to help achieve our ambitious targets, helping us to reach out to new audiences. This will include defining advertising activities and creating promotional materials and updates (across all media platforms, including social media), writing and distributing press releases and representing us on location filming and broadcast media when you need to.
We're looking for someone who can help us reach larger and more diverse audiences for our places and our digital content. You'll work as part of a team to make sure that we're sharing the best stories we can. Spreading the word about places to visit in the great outdoors, and raising awareness of our conservation work is key to what we're about.
Please also read the full role profile, attached to this advert.
Who we're looking forTo deliver this role successfully, you will need to have;
A good understanding of marketing techniques, including websites as well as digital and social media
Work with teams of staff and volunteers across two sites
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent digital and social media skills
Strong customer service skills
Advanced IT Skills (including Microsoft Office)
Problem solving skills, and ability to work on own initiative
The packageThe National Trust has the motto ‘For everyone, for ever’ at its heart. We’re working hard to create an inclusive culture, where everyone feels they belong. It’s important that our people reflect and represent the diversity of the communities and audiences we serve. We welcome and value difference, so when we say we’re for everyone, we want everyone to be welcome in our teams too.
Wherever you’re from, and whatever your background, we want to hear from you – and it doesn’t matter if you’re jam first, cream first, or even if you don’t like scones at all. Everyone is welcome.
Benefits for working at the National Trust include:
Flexible working whenever possible
Free parking at most locations
Free entry to our properties for you, a guest and your children (under 18)
Substantial pension scheme of up to 10% basic salary
Requirements :Compliance.Eligibility to Work in the UK

43d01927a7c6975f.title: Sales and Marketing Manager
43d01927a7c6975f.description: MYgroup is a UK based recycling and sustainability company dedicated to making waste into resource and setting up remanufacturing ReFactories, around the UK, Europe and beyond.A key element into our new movement within our ReFactory concept is Education, helping build and deliver educational systems to eliminate, reduce and recycle waste where ever possible. Leading the way in helping set up a sustainable future.Part of our drive into this is focused on schools and establishing environmental education into a school environment using interactive methods of actual recycling in school and at home. In 2020 we launched our SchoolCycled Scheme, a fully integrated educational process with the full benefit of specialist recycling and manufacture.We are now seeking a Sales/Marketing manager to take lead with this concept and deliver this country wide. The position will require a dedicated and ambitious individual that has experience in sales and marketing, driven around education and sustainability. While being able to offer this concept to large scale global brands, local businesses and councils in order to achieve funding routes for the SchoolCycled concept to be delivered to schools nationwide.The ideal candidate will have skills in field sales, marketing and basic media, be able to engage and support the marketing team to design and deliver the correct media and marketing materials. They should be experienced in generating leads and following these up to the highest level.Main duties: -· Present SchoolCycled to businesses to gain sponsorship· Support the delivery of SchoolCycled into schools and education· Interact with businesses to ensure their connection with the scheme· Design and implement media and marketing materials alongside the team· Represent SchoolCycled across social media platforms· Research and apply for funding via various sources· Business development· Working alongside the team to deliver workshopsThe position allows working from home, but the role will also require a lot of travel up and down the UK and the possibility into Europe at times. Applicants can be from anywhere within the UK. You will be expected to attend site, based in Hull, East Yorkshire for at least 1 day per month to work with the team.Salary - £30-32k per annum depending on experience (based on a 40hr week)Bonus – 1.5% of delivered project values paid quarterlyTravel allowanceJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £30,000.00-£32,000.00 per yearBenefits:Company pensionOn-site parkingWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftExperience:Business development: 1 year (preferred)Sales: 1 year (preferred)Work remotely:Yes
