ideally in tech or media industriesThe successful candidate will be analytical, hardworking, creative, curious, and interested in people and ideas and a collaborative and strategic thinker who can help to can tell great stories on social mediaExperience writing social copy across all channels (Facebook, Twitter & LinkedIn)Experience educating the client on social media tactics in a way that is clear and understandableSelf-starter, very detailed oriented and can multi-task, meet deadlines, quickly process information, and maintain confidential informationExperience working with content creation & management platformsOutstanding organizational, written, and verbal communication skillsStrong interpersonal skills, demonstrated empathy and commitment to clients’ and agency’s businessOur OfferIn return we offer the opportunity to make a difference as part of a successful company that prides itself on forging long lasting individual partnerships and let’s try it attitude.Applicants MUST be eligible to work in UK.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, FreelancePart-time hours: 1 - 10 per weekSalary: £300.00-£500.00 per monthAdditional pay:Performance bonusBenefits:Employee discountFlexible scheduleWork from homeSchedule:Day shiftEducation:A-Level or equivalent (preferred)Experience:Digital marketing: 3 years (preferred)PPC Campaign Management: 2 years (preferred)E-commerce Marketing: 2 years (preferred)Reference ID: taox001

81199faa3612d964.title: Marketing Assistant - Content Specialist
81199faa3612d964.description:
WiFi SPARK is looking for an Assistant to support the Head of Marketing. This is an excellent opportunity to join a nationwide company headquartered in Exeter, with an excellent history of growth and very ambitious plans for the future.


Reporting to the Head of Marketing, you will be responsible for promoting entertainment services to end users in hospital. As the Head’s right hand, you will create, design, promote, nuture, develop and manage a wide range of content and tasks, ultimately contributing to business growth.


The opportunity to progress in this role will see promotion to Executive level, and then potentially to Management level. You will agree a ‘Scorecard’ with the Head of Marketing where you are responsible and accountable for goals over the year. This is reviewed quarterly.


The role is UK Based. Only applicants with the right to work and reside in the UK will be considered for the role.
JOB DESCRIPTION
WiFi SPARK is looking for an Assistant to support the Head of Marketing. This is an excellent opportunity to join a nationwide company headquartered in Exeter, with an excellent history of growth and very ambitious plans for the future.

Reporting to the Head of Marketing, you will be responsible for promoting entertainment services to end users in hospital. As the Head’s right hand, you will create, design, promote, nuture, develop and manage a wide range of content and tasks, ultimately contributing to business growth.

The opportunity to progress in this role will see promotion to Executive level, and then potentially to Management level. You will agree a ‘Scorecard’ with the Head of Marketing where you are responsible and accountable for goals over the year. This is reviewed quarterly.

Duties & Responsibilities
Select programs to promote on patient entertainment platforms for bedside units (BSU) including sporting fixtures, and popular programs
Design adverts, banners and screen savers for the programs for BSUs and deploy them via the system
Create and own a content schedule with approval from the Head of Marketing
Run polls and surveys on the patient entertainment platform and coordinate with Hospital Trusts
Organise site visits for Product Managers & Area Service Technicians
Create content, blogs, opinion pieces and conduct interviews for copy
Align with the company’s Digital Marketing Agency, Digital 22, for keywords, social scheduling through HubSpot and Pay Per Click advertising.
Report on BSU utilisation weekly and monthly
Be the first port of call for ad-hoc requests that come in from Trusts
Work across departments such as with Marketing and Service Desk
Inform Service Desk of content schedule on a regular basis
Aid in the planning of a customer loyalty program
 Skills & Experience


Essential

Must have excellent written and spoken English (at high-grade GCSE and above)
Must have excellent communication skills and be comfortable presenting to teams and customers
Must have experience in managing social media
Must have a flair for design
Must be highly IT and digitally literate with experience using Microsoft 365
Must have good organisational and timekeeping skills
Must have excellent attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy
Must be confident, ambitious and willing to take ownership and responsibility

 Desirable

Will need to be creative and be comfortable putting forward new ideas and initiatives to support the business
Experience in interpreting data and reporting on marketing activity
Capable in Adobe Creative Suite, specifically InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop
Experience using HubSpot
Marketing experience in a similar role 1 year +.
Experience running Marketing campaigns of any kind
What We Offer

This is a permanent part-time role blending home working and office attendance from our Head Office in Exeter. The working hours will be 9-3pm so may suit candidates with families.

Following completing a 6-month probation period, you will be eligible for the following additional benefits:


Holidays: 22 days + 5 days (Bank holidays) to allocate at your leisure + 3 days for Christmas Boxing day and New Year = 30 Days holiday per year including bank holidays.
Company laptop
Company healthcare scheme
Life assurance
Death in Service Benefit
Bonus scheme
Gym membership
Company pension scheme
Flexible working
Home working equipment will be provided

Above all, we will offer you the chance to work in a vibrant and exciting company that is undergoing a period of rapid growth and success. Our culture is supportive and collaborative. We like challenges and work hard to deliver excellent results for our customers. Everyone is respected, acts professionally, and is recognised for their contribution. We have fun and enjoy our work.

We describe our Company culture with the following descriptors:
Excellence of Service; Consistency & Accuracy; Knowledge Sharing; Commitment; Adaptability; Supporting & Communicating; Continuous Improvement

The WiFi SPARK values are:
Honesty; Respect; Professionalism; Loyalty; Positivity; Welfare; Fun; Opportunity

If you would like to apply, upload your CV and cover letter above.

8e6ade346c2b91dd.title: Localization Specialist | Japanese
8e6ade346c2b91dd.description:
Jamf, the standard for Apple in the enterprise, extends the legendary Apple experience people enjoy in their personal lives to the workplace. Jamf's cloud software is the only solution of scale that automates Mac, iPad, iPhone and Apple TV deployment, management and security. We help organizations, businesses, hospitals, schools and government agencies, connect, manage and protect Apple products without ever having to touch the device— anytime, anywhere.


We are a group of curious, self-starters with a passion for helping people make sense of technology – freeing nurses to care, teachers to teach and businesses to thrive. We take pride in making meaningful impact for tens of thousands of customers around the globe. We have over 2,000 employees worldwide with offices in the U.S., Europe, Japan, and Australia. To learn more visit: https://www.jamf.com/careers.


Remote work allowed for this role. Jamf operates as a choice-based office model. Choose an assigned desk, a shared desk, or work anywhere you work best. Jamf thrives where you do.
What you'll do at Jamf:

At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work.The Localization Specialist transcreates, proofreads, and localizes Jamf Marketing content in Japanese. Reporting to the EMEIA Content Marketing manager and working in close collaboration with the Translation Marketing Specialist, this role regularly works with content marketers in teams in EMEIA, APAC and the US to understand the purpose and use of localized content. A Localization Specialist is expected to transcreate and localize content from English (US) to Japanese using region- and industry-specific knowledge. The role consists of both translation and proofreading (human translation), equally.

Responsibilities:

Transcreate Marketing collateral (e.g., e-books, White Papers), communications (e.g., emails, social media posts) and sales enablement material (e.g., pitch decks, Outreach emails) and Marketing enablement material (e.g., webinar presentations, event invite email sequences) in Japanese
Proofread in Japanese and improve the quality of the translations by sending detailed feedback to the translators and filling-in score cards
Ensure that the localized content published under your supervision is clear and engaging
Develop and maintain a consistent brand voice
Maintain the translation memories and termbases (glossaries)
Translate, review, and perform language tests in a CAT tool
Adjust translation layout in Adobe InDesign
Collaborate with the Marketing Translation Specialist on localization projects, identifying and implementing process improvements
Ensure that content translated from English (US) effectively conveys original meaning in the target languages, applying cultural knowledge of common business and marketing communication in the target markets
Work with localization agency to ensure a consistent quality across your languages
Collaborate with Digital Marketing and Web Team to improve existing content on localized versions of website and Channel platform
Continuously develop knowledge of Apple, Jamf products and offerings

Skills & Requirements:

Relevant experience working in localization (required)
Perfect writing skills (native level) in Japanese (required)
Business level proficiency in English (required)
Experience with XTM (or other CAT tool) (preferred)
Proficiency in Adobe InDesign (required), Photoshop and Illustator (preferred)
Ability to work effectively in, and collaborate with, cross-functional teams (required)
Ability to manage multiple tasks and project deadlines simultaneously (required)
Software or technology industry experience (preferred)
Affinity and passion for Apple technology and the latest Apple

How we help you reach your best potential:

Recently named a Best Workplace in Technology, Fortune Magazine 2021.
We know that big ideas can come from anyone, so we empower everyone to make an impact. Our more than 90% employee retention rate agrees!
You will have the opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact for more than 50,000 global customers with the best Apple device management solution in the world.
We put people over profits – which is why our customers keep coming back to us.
Our volunteer time off allows employees to support and give back to our communities.
We encourage you to simply be you. We constantly seek and value different perspectives to ensure Jamf is a place where everyone feels comfortable and can be successful.
23 of 25 world's most valuable brands rely on Jamf to do their best work (as ranked by Forbes).
Over 100,000 Jamf Nation users, the largest online IT community in the world.

You are the right kind of Jamf if:
You go above and beyond for others, you are genuine and willing to help, always. You support the team around you, you don't point fingers or pass blame. You value different perspectives, in how you work and how you learn. You are naturally inquisitive, like to create and be creative. You are a problem solver, curious and resourceful, self-driven and constantly improving. You roll up your sleeves and dig in. You are excited by not knowing what may lie ahead. You are willing to take risks, try new things, even fail just to do it better next time. You're not a jerk. You are someone who just wants to do the right thing.


Why Jamf?

Let your individuality shine at Jamf! All voices are critical to the innovative and collaborative work that we do to propel Jamf to be a leader of equality and fairness in the workplace. In the spirit of our values of selflessness and relentless self-improvement, we seek to learn, engage and grow, so that all of our Jamfs feel comfortable being their truest selves at work. Our Employee Resource Groups help empower employees to make real, actionable differences at Jamf. We are actively working every day to get better; our commitment on becoming a more inclusive and diverse work force is never done.


Get social with us: Instagram, LinkedIn, Facebook or follow the conversation at #OneJamf

#LI-REMOTE

4810930daf180214.title: Social Media Growth Specialist
4810930daf180214.description: Fancy joining our embarrassment? (that’s a group of pandas, by the way). Empowered by the idea of being able to save the world? Could you be our social channel superhero?We are looking for a social media guru to take the reins on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook to create content, conversation and rapidly grow our community.The Cheeky Panda is a fast-moving business with a dedicated pack of followers, but now is the time to turbocharge our presence and impact on social media.Our team love bold, creative thinking that cuts through busy spaces and empowers people to implement their ideas, while rewarding them through development and progression.We are looking for someone with a proven track record of building and engaging communities, content creation, social strategy and reporting and the planning and execution of socially led campaigns. And of course, a self-confessed social nerd who will understand the latest technologies, algorithms, platforms and build plans based on data and insights.A passion for pandas, sustainability and being an eco-friendly Earth-lover is a big plus, too. If you can make loo roll look lovely just about anywhere, then you’re halfway there.Responsibilities· Define the social media and community vision and strategy to increase brand fame and love through our platforms and community channels· Lead on social activations to come up with big, cut-through ideas for social-first campaigns that communicate who we are and help increase our reach· Responsible for all content planning, creation, delivery, and community engagement. This is a hands-on, empowered environment where people get stuck in· Develop ways to work with influencers, partners and other channels to increase our audience size and help drive revenue· Find new and exciting ways to engage our community via social media channels to drive awareness, conversation and affinity· Have fun with The Cheeky Panda social channels – get us loved and talked about even more!· Conduct social reporting and analytics tools to ensure the strategic approach is effective· Ensure best practices are followed on reporting and measurement to drive impact against objectives such as Retail support, ecommerce sales, & product launches· Oversee the strategy for The Cheeky Panda’s International channels to grow presence; both in existing markets and future launch locations· Manage budgets and tools effectively· Significantly increase our social and community followingAbout you· 4+ years of hands-on experience within social media and managing platforms/ brands globally· Full understanding of all social metrics and ability to analyse and recommend new approaches· Ability to create different forms of content; graphic, photography, dynamic· Excellent writing abilities and a strong, adaptable tone of voice· Experience in scheduling tools (preferably Hootsuite), Adobe Photoshop (other Adobe Creative Tools a big plus) and Canva· Passionate about sustainability with a desire to help engage consumers on this topic· Exceptional knowledge and understanding of social media, as well as emergent trends· Passionate, creative thinker and energetic presenter and storyteller· You are hyper-organized and communicative about deadlines, project management and bandwidth.· Proven experience working in a start-up environment at a consumer goods brandA growth hacker and proven track record growing social followers and community by 100K+ in relatively short period of timeWhat you’ll get· The opportunity to join a rapid-growing company that cares about people, the planet as well as profit· You’ll be a part of an energetic, excitable marketing team passionate about using comms to tell our story of sustainability· As much loo roll and wipes as you can smuggle into your bag· Free gym membership· Pension includedWe encourage remote working, but you would be required to come into the office 1-2 times a week, usually on Wednesdays with the rest of the marketing team.We’re all about inclusion and diversity here at The Cheeky Panda – we believe in equal opportunities, and we celebrate diversity. All are welcome in our Panda Posse.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £35,000.00-£55,000.00 per yearBenefits:Company pensionFlexible scheduleGym membershipPrivate medical insuranceWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftExperience:Social Media Marketing: 4 years (required)Instagram: 3 years (preferred)Facebook: 3 years (preferred)Youtube: 3 years (preferred)Twitter: 3 years (preferred)Tiktok: 1 year (preferred)LinkedIn: 3 years (preferred)Community management: 3 years (preferred)Growth hacking: 3 years (preferred)

3c546fbe8e211fdf.title: Trade & Partnerships Marketing Specialist
3c546fbe8e211fdf.description:
Job Title:
Trade & Partnerships Marketing Specialist
Requisition ID:
R007670
Job Description:
Job Title: Trade & Marketing Partnerships Specialist
Reporting To: Distribution & Partnerships
Department: Commercial & Partnerships
Location: Soho, London
Contract Term: 12 month fixed-term
Your Platform
Activision Blizzard plays a centralised role in the creation of epic entertainment by supporting our interactive gaming brands and studios with a diverse range of career opportunities across Franchise product management, corporate functions such as Marketing, Communications, Legal, Human Resources, Finance and Supply Chain.
Based in Soho, the cultural heart of London’s West End with a vast array of classic record shop and leading film companies, media offices and great restaurants. Regent’s Park is close enough for a lunchtime run, as are the delights of Piccadilly Circus and the shopping mecca of Oxford Street. It is conveniently walking distance from a number of London tube stations and mainline train stations.
To learn more, check us out at www.activisionblizzard.com or on at @ATVI_AB.
Your Mission
We are looking for a Trade & Partnerships Marketing Specialist to join the team. In this position you will act in a supporting role across the Franchise(s) and Franchise Team. Working cross functionally to aid the team in delivering commercial results as well as growth goals, optimising the teams outputs by supervising project actions and as the need arises, program manage large pieces of work and departments results.
In a company that serves and engages millions of players across EMEA, you will contribute to building the most sophisticated data-driven and player-centric marketing practices, and to reinventing communication with players by extending their epic entertainment experience with us beyond our games.
Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities:
EMEA Trade Marketing:
Support the Distribution Manager in Trade marketing development and implementation through EMEA territories
Asset management & retail implementation – handle the retail marketing toolkit
FSDU design and retail launch
Digital at retail project management
Evaluation of retail campaigns
Franchise Brand Partnerships program delivery:
Centrally support discussions with 3rd Party brand partners across all territories for Activision and Blizzard franchises and support development and execution of Brand Partnership marketing campaigns with brand partners at a global, regional, and local level.
Collaborate with EMEA territories and cross-functional teams to implement compelling integrated campaigns that broaden audience reach to achieve brand and commercial objectives via Brand Partnerships
Support 3P team to project manage and co-ordinate campaigns with new and existing brand partners as well as agencies across the EMEA region: supervising GTM activation as well as being responsible for the asset development and approval process
Co-ordinate cross functional support globally and regionally across Brand, Product, PR, Legal, Digital / Social, Creative Services, Marketing Technology to ensure effective planning and execution
Co-ordinate and implement Brand Partnership campaigns in collaboration with the 3rd Party Partnerships team that crossover into Commercial Retail partners to unlock incremental Commercial opportunities
Own the development of the Brand Partnership Toolkit for regional and partner teams
Support with collating presentation decks for global review, partnerships meetings, or agency pitches
Handle the collation of partnership campaign evaluations/case studies with global and regional teams
Player Profile
Experience:
Hold a bachelors degree or equivalent work experience
Gained professional work experience since graduating
Able to give examples of project / campaign implementations.
Trade marketing experience with national retailers is crucial
Additional experience with Brand Partnerships is preferred but not essential
Knowledge & Skills
Data driven with a keen eye and ability to turn data into insight. Working with many different data points and reporting requirements
Experience of working in a matrix organisation
Previous knowledge of the gaming or entertainment industry, either gained through previous work experience or through experiencing ours and other gaming products from a player perspective is a bonus.
Attributes
Shown experience of being a self-starter. Due to the multifaceted nature of this role it’s important that the right candidate can demonstrate they work on their own initiative
Ability to work across an organisation. This role is not for someone who likes hard lines and will be important that this individual is able to play a cross team role
Effective time management and prioritisation skills needed
Our World
Our mission, to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment has never been more important. Through communities rooted in our video game franchises we enable hundreds of millions of people to experience happiness, thrill and achievement. We enable social connections through the lens of fun, and we foster purpose and a sense of accomplishment through healthy competition. Like sport, but with greater accessibility, our players can find purpose and meaning through competitive gaming. Video games, unlike any other social or entertainment media, have the ability to break down the barriers that can inhibit tolerance and understanding. Celebrating diversity is at the core of our culture and ensures we can build games for players of a diverse group of backgrounds in the 190 countries our games are played.
As a member of the Fortune 500 and as a component company of the S&P 500, we have an outstanding track record of delivering superior shareholder returns for over 30 years.
Our enduring franchises are some of the world’s most popular, including Call of Duty®, Crash Bandicoot™, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Hearthstone®, Diablo®, StarCraft®, Candy Crush™, Bubble Witch™, Pet Rescue™ and Farm Heroes™. Our sustained success has enabled the company to support corporate social responsibility initiatives that are directly tied to our franchises. As an example, our Call of Duty Endowment has helped find employment for over 80,000 veterans.
The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this position may be changed as advised by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.
Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

b4f39e1326201564.title: Digital Marketing Intern
b4f39e1326201564.description: We are looking for a Digital Marketing Intern specialist in :SEOFacebook AdsGoogle AdsJob Types: Full-time, InternshipContract length: 3 monthsEducation:Bachelor's (preferred)Experience:Digital marketing: 1 year (preferred)

0caa6e4d159df2e5.title: Digital Sales Specialist
0caa6e4d159df2e5.description:
A career at our company is an ongoing journey of discovery: our 58,000 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in Healthcare, Life Science and Electronics. For more than 350 years and across the world we have passionately pursued our curiosity to find novel and vibrant ways of enhancing the lives of others.


Our role:


An exciting new opportunity has arisen to join our company as Digital Sales Specialist in our Lab Water Division Team in the UK and Ire. A Digital Sales Specialist supports the field sales organization byfocusing on a defined geography, with the objective of meeting or exceeding set sales targets, through growing existing accounts and creating additional business or finding new accounts.


The Digital Sales Specialist will utilize call planning, pipeline management, lead creation and qualification, proactive sales calling and performance monitoring to drive the business and achieve the set sales targets. You will also be required to collaborate very closely with your corresponding Lab Water Field Sales Specialist and the Lab Water Inhouse Technical Team as well as with colleagues from other business units and functions such as Field Service, Field Marketing, Account Managers and Field Sales Specialists from other divisions of Life Science, in order to leverage the greater organization and open further business opportunities for both them and you.


Who you are:


Requires a bachelor's degree or equivalent certification in area of specialty, preferably in Chemistry, Biology or similar
Customer and Result oriented.Good organization skills. Strong communication and sales skills
Team-working
Experience in sales is a plus


What we offer: With us, there are always opportunities to break new ground. We empower you to fulfil your ambitions, and our diverse businesses offer various career moves to seek new horizons. We trust you with responsibility early on and support you to draw your own career map that is responsive to your aspirations and priorities in life. Join us and bring your curiosity to life!


Curious? Apply and find more information at https://jobs.vibrantm.com


Job Requisition ID: 241970


Location: Gillingham


Career Level: B - Recent University Graduate(<1>


Working time model:


Careers during Covid-19
Thank you for visiting our careers website, we are always looking for curious minds to join our teams. We understand how much the world is being impacted by the Covid-19 crisis and we want to assure you that your safety is very important to us. To ensure that everyone's health is protected, instead of a standard face-to-face interview, it is likely that you will be offered alternative digital interview options.


US employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date unless an accommodation is granted by the Company. The Company uses the definition of "fully vaccinated" assigned by the Centers for Disease Control & Prevention for purposes of considering satisfaction of this requirement which is a condition of employment.

North America Disclosure
The Company is committed to accessibility in its workplaces, including during the job application process. Applicants who may require accommodation during the application process should speak with our Candidate Services team at 844-655-6466 from 8:00am to 5:30pm ET Monday through Friday. If you are a resident of a Connecticut or Colorado, you are eligible to receive additional information about the compensation and benefits, which we will provide upon request. You may contact 855 444 5678 from 8:00am to 5:30pm ET Monday through Friday, for assistance.

Notice on Fraudulent Job Offers
Unfortunately, we are aware of third parties that pretend to represent our company offering unauthorized employment opportunities. If you think a fraudulent source is offering you a job, please have a look at the following information .

Job Segment: Field Sales, Sales

905f9211b81c858f.title: Field Marketing Specialist
905f9211b81c858f.description:
MathWorks has a hybrid work model that enables staff members to split their time between office and home. The hybrid model provides the advantage of having both in-person time with colleagues and flexible at-home life optimizations. Learn More: https://www.mathworks.com/company/jobs/resources/applying-and-interviewing.html#onboarding.
MathWorks is seeking a marketing professional who will play a key role in developing and executing the marketing program for one of our strategic industry segments in EMEA and North America. The role will focus on increasing awareness and usage of MathWorks tools and solutions amongst end users and executives.

The responsibility of the Field Marketing Specialist role is to collaborate with industry marketing and customer face sales teams to build and execute integrated marketing communications plans. Typical activities include support for prospecting efforts, awareness building of solutions, and lead generation for the market segment. You will also work at the account (Account Based marketing or ABM) level for specific key accounts. In this job, you will

Build an integrated marketing communications plan for specific market segments and accounts in support of agreed-upon account/business objectives
Work with Industry and Product marketing on driving the content generation process for marketing material including customer user stories
Enable Sales with coaching on social selling techniques, supporting prospecting efforts and gathering insights from the industry
Increase awareness of our solutions by promoting new developed marketing material, coordinating webinars and events, facilitating the production of short new videos and lead promotion, identifying and scoping “partnership” opportunities with industry bodies
Leverage existing and pilot new marketing tactics via tailored marketing programs to enhance engagements with the external stakeholders within selected key accounts

Minimum of 5 years of experience working in a B2B technology marketing environment, preferably as part of a complex sales and marketing team comprised of multiple roles
Demonstrated knowledge and experience planning, building and executing multi-tactic marketing campaigns with an extended team
Demonstrated ability to build highly effective working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders with complex B2B sales environment
Background/interest in the Finance sector would be a bonus
Hands-on at both strategic and tactical level
Based in the UK but required to travel nationally/internationally 20% of the time

A bachelor's degree and 7 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree and 5 years of professional work experience, or equivalent experience) is required.

7d48491148e06b2a.title: Technical Specialist - Business Applications
7d48491148e06b2a.description:
Microsoft is a company where passionate innovators come to collaborate, envision what can be, and take their careers to levels they cannot achieve anywhere else. This is a world of more possibilities, more innovation, more openness, and sky's-the-limit thinking - a cloud-enabled world.
At Microsoft we have unique capabilities to meet the needs of both individuals and organizations. We care deeply about taking our ideals and vision around the globe, and to make a difference in peoples' lives and organizations in all corners of the planet. Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet.
Are you insatiably curious? Do you embrace uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from your mistakes? Do you collaborate well with others, knowing that better solutions come from working together? Do you stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve, and are you motivated every day to empower others to achieve more through technology and innovation? Are you ready to join the team that is at the leading edge of Innovation at Microsoft?
The reinvention of business processes is a growth engine for Microsoft cloud services. The mission of Microsoft Business Applications is to help our customers digitally transform their businesses to drive new sources of revenue, create new and engaging ways to serve their customers, and to transform the way in which their business runs driving new levels of profitability for their organization.
Are you ready to join a double-digit growth cloud business? Microsoft Business Applications cloud is recognized by analysts as a leader in the CRM, ERP and application platform space. Trusted by global businesses as their platform of choice, Microsoft Business Applications uniquely enables customers to optimize their operations, engage their customers, empower their people and transform their products. It’s a new data-driven world, and Microsoft is the only platform in the industry built from the ground up with data and intelligence at the center. Microsoft Business Application solutions include virtually unlimited data sources from customers’ applications including legacy, first and third-party, vendor, customer and many more. This unified approach to data and intelligence enables customers to make informed proactive business decisions with deep insights powered by AI and industry-leading analytics (Power BI) resulting in the following key customer benefits:
Create impact faster: Deliver more impact in less time by quickly deploying solutions, or augmenting existing ones, to enable teams to accelerate business results and increase time to value.
Break through barriers: Take a data-first approach with unified data that leverages Microsoft AI to deliver insights & actions that help create better customer experiences.
Adapt to anything: agility to react and respond to new business priorities, market conditions and customer opportunities with rapidly deployable solutions.
Innovate everywhere: Solve problems with powerful solutions only possible with the Microsoft Cloud enabling interoperable solutions across multiple lines of business.
As a Business Applications Sales Executive you will be an industry-aligned, outcome-driven business process transformation enabler within the Microsoft specialist sales organization working with our most important customers helping them with their end-to-end business transformation needs by envisioning solutions and mapping capabilities with associated business value to business decision maker persona pains/needs. You will execute with excellence the entire sales process by owning and orchestrating a virtual pursuit team of technically intense workload (solution) experts including presales, co-sell partners, and Independent Software Vendors to provide customers with solutions aligned to their end-to-end business transformation needs using Microsoft Business Applications’ portfolio of offerings. You will use the Microsoft Catalyst Sales Methodology to enable customer digital transformation journey focusing on the business value and outcomes from Microsoft Business Application solutions.
To learn more about Microsoft’s mission, please visit:Culture | Microsoft CareersCheck out all our products:https://careers.microsoft.com/
Responsibilities
To excel in the Technical Specialist role you must have the following traits and abilities:
Technically Intense Workload Expert - Deep functional, technical and process-level knowledge and extensive demonstration experience in your workload.
Strategic & Proactive Pursuit Team Member - Strategic thinker with proactive engagement throughout the pursuit sales cycle; removes blockers, challenges the status quo, unblocks design/technical stalemates, brings clarity from ambiguity displaying a growth mindset.
Technical Team Collaborator – Collaborates with a pursuit team of technically intense workload experts including Technical Specialists with expertise other than yours, co-sell partners and Independent Software Vendors to design and demonstrate a solution that maps business value with the end-to-end business transformation needs of the customer.
Customer-centric Solution Designer - Employs Design Thinking principles centered on customer business outcomes.
Differentiated & Business Value/Outcome driven Demonstrator - Expert in demonstrating solution capabilities and associated business value addressing customer business decision maker persona needs/pains. Demonstrates differentiation and the value of Business Applications workload solutions.
Job Responsibilities
The Technical Specialistis a key member of the Business Applications sales pursuit team and is a strategic thinker, proactive problem solver, sales & technical roadblock resolver displaying a growth mindset with deep functional and technical knowledge in the workload.
The following are the role responsibilities for the Microsoft Business Applications Technical Specialist:
Assist Business Applications Sales Executive in RFP Response and in Envisioning Solution
Assist Business Applications Specialists in delivering compelling RFP/RFI response, in envisioning solution using ISV components, by assembling and collaborating with a technical pursuit team that includes partner and ISV resources.
Design Customer-centric Solution Aligned with Envisioned Solution & Business Value
Secure a customer agreement to a Solution Design built with alignment to the customer-agreed digital transformation journey by partnering with the technical pursuit team ensuring alignment to envisioned solution and business value.
Deliver a Customer-centric Demonstration
Receive a standing ovation by delivering a compelling solution demonstration emphasizing business value aligned to the designed solution.
Ensure demonstration follows Tell-Show-Vision model and has an end-to-end view building opportunities for seeding and expansion after initial sale.
Work with Customer Success/Partner Team on Deployment Plan
Assist Business Applications Specialists (if required)in reviewing licensing proposal. Collaborate with Customer Success team and Partner to ensure the customer agreed deployment plan maps to Key Performance Indicators(KPI)
Qualifications
Experience:
Applicable workload expertise with one or more of the following: technical presales, post-sales consulting or relevant company/customer IT application implementation or management
Driving and designing a solution strategy as part of the overall opportunity lifecycle
Extensive collaboration with technical pursuit teams designing cloud-based customer solutions
Success working with customers/stakeholders in presales or consulting engagements related to business applications workloads
Proven success demonstrating differentiated solution value and competitive advantage
Delivering customer-facing technical workload demonstrations to enterprise decision makers
Desirable but not required –workload certifications/degrees
Deep understanding of:
Business solutions(CRM/ERP)workload expertise in one or more of the following: Sales, Marketing, Customer Service, Field Service, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Retail/Commerce and/or Finance and how these solutions help customers achieve their desired business outcomes
Business value selling methodologies and practices mapped to customer persona pains/issues to uncover customer’s stated and unstated needs
Commercial cloud offerings, ideally Microsoft’s cloud platform,as well as competitive knowledge of other business applications solutions and related ecosystems
Desired skills:
Excellent presentation and communications skills across various customer stakeholders; experienced storyteller.
Customer-centric mindset with demonstrated passion for delivering customer value
Ability to bring innovative technical solution ideas to customer problems
Experienced problem solver able to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Growth mindset, insatiably curious, always learning and welcoming of challenges for the opportunity to grow
Bachelor’s degree or relevant work experience
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

3e25da0e093f73d0.title: Head of Marketing
3e25da0e093f73d0.description:
Head of Marketing
Remote/Hybrid working model
55-60,000 base + Car/ car allowance + 15% bonus
Are you a Marketing Manager or Head of Marketing with experience in the staffing industry? Randstad is currently hiring for a Head of Marketing with resource and leadership responsibility for our UK and Ireland business. In this role you will be backed by market-leading marketing technologies and creative innovation across a diverse mix of channels, in both B2B and B2C markets. Drawing on expertise from Randstad's team of global marketing specialists, you will be a part of a connected network of more than 300 marketing professionals in 38 countries. You will be working closely with board members and senior operational stakeholders to deliver marketing strategies and oversee operational marketing plans, focused on driving revenue and profit for our core branch business. You will have direct and indirect responsibility for a team of 6 Marketing Managers and execs, giving breadth of influence across the business.
Making an Impact
Develop marketing strategies, closely aligned to the sales/engagement goals, that will generate demand from clients and candidates across our key markets
Quickly establish strong rapport with senior stakeholders, including those at Board level, to understand their business plans, commercial priorities and where marketing needs to deliver most impact
Think strategically and creatively
Lead, inspire and direct your team to deliver on strategy
Make effective use of premium client assets such as Clipper, Saracens and other hospitality to support client retention and business development
Work closely with team colleagues in 'specialist' cross-market roles (digital, design, content, communications, social media, enterprise client solutions) to unlock synergies with their marketing and brand plans
Drive and enthuse a high performance culture: building team capability through our in-house and global learning & development programmes, diversity and great conversations to exceed short and long term goals
Manage marketing budgets for costed tactics thought to measurable ROI
Ensure we achieve strong awareness for our CSR and inclusivity and wellbeing work, including with VSO and other corporate charity partners
If you are interested in this position please apply here and our Talent Acquisition team will be in touch
Randstad is committed to equal opportunities for all and will not discriminate based on an individual's sex, race, disability, gender reassignment, pregnancy and maternity, marriage and civil partnership, religion or belief, sexual orientation or age. We are an inclusive employer and should you require any reasonable adjustments in order to complete any aspect of the recruitment process, please contact us on itauk@randstad.co.uk

a6942a2d3a86fd91.title: RFP Specialist
a6942a2d3a86fd91.description:
RFP Specialist
Make a difference every day!
Invesco is driven by a pure focus on investment. It’s all we do. We focus on doing work that matters and being a firm that gives a voice to every employee. In fact, we make a promise to our clients and each other to create greater possibilities together. We’re looking for people who have fresh perspectives. Who can come together to share ideas, listen and challenge each other to achieve better solutions for our clients.

Your team
Invesco EMEA serves a breadth of clients including financial advisors, pension funds, and insurers. Our customers have sophisticated and unique investment needs, which we are uniquely positioned to deliver through 13 investment centres with expertise in equities, fixed income, and alternatives.
Marketing seeks to connect client needs with our capabilities by crafting effective, accountable, multi-channel communications which educate, encourage and support our clients. Content Marketing enables this by producing editorials, product marketing, agency-designed creative, and new business requests, while delivering them within the customer journey.
The EMEA RFP team delivers the best of Invesco’s global investment and servicing proposition to institutional and retail clients by supporting distribution and marketing content servicing needs.

Your role
The purpose of the RFP Specialist is to support and coordinate responses to RFP client servicing requests.
Sound interesting? We will be looking for the Specialist to lead the completion of new business and client servicing questionnaires. You will develop client focused investment and firm RFP content and build strong relationships with the sales contacts to assist you in producing client focused RFP responses.
The Specialist will support client internal information requests, including the review of investment consultant database information across Invesco’s products and services.
We are looking for someone who is keen to learn and has a passion for growth and development. You will bring experience in the financial services industry, preferably in a RFP or investment/marketing comms or client services position. We will look for someone with strong IT skills and excellent verbal and written communication skills and a sense of responsibility and ownership.
The good stuff
We have an outstanding benefits package, which includes

Competitive salary and bonusCompany-provided healthcare26 days annual leave + bank holidaysGenerous pension provisionsIncome protectionHealth and wellness benefitsVolunteering daysEnhanced parental leaveLife insurance

Our commitment to you
We recognise that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone. As part of Invesco’s commitment to ensuring our teams have the broad range of experiences and backgrounds required to promote diversity of thought, and to maintaining a positive, engaging work environment, we champion flexible working.
Please feel free to discuss flexible working options with us.
Our commitment to the community and environmental, social and governance investing
We partner with charitable organisations globally to make an impact in the communities where we live and work. Our people are encouraged to support the charities they feel most passionate about. We are also committed to environmental, social and governance (ESG) investing. We serve our clients in this space as a trusted partner both on specific responsible investment product strategies as well as part of our commitment to deliver a superior investment experience.
Join Us
We’re proud to be a firm that achieves more together. One that is focused on doing work that matters. One that gives a voice to every employee. One that genuinely cares. By coming together to share our ideas, listen, and challenge each other’s perspectives, we get to better solutions for our clients.
Our ambition is high. By working smart and supporting one another, we can continuously push ourselves to grow. We all have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on our business, our industry and our clients’ lives.
Let’s create greater possibilities together!

People with disabilities:
We want to give all our candidates the best opportunity to shine. If you need any adjustments to be made during the application and selection process, please send an e-mail to (insert email address). Please include your name, the job you are interested in, and the type of adjustment you need.

Recruitment Agencies:
Invesco has an in-house recruitment team, which focuses on sourcing great candidates directly. Invesco will not accept unsolicited resumes from agency or search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired. When we do use agencies, we have a PSL in place, so please do not contact hiring managers directly.

68ac95c7114c6c06.title: Marketing Specialist - Freelance (remote)
68ac95c7114c6c06.description: About UsAt Masabi, we are helping to make cities better places to live, work and visit, by enabling seamless, frictionless journeys on public transport systems. We are a SaaS company, building a fare payments and ticketing platform that allows passengers to simply tap and ride using mobile phones, bank cards and smart cards to travel.Proving ourselves as true innovators and industry leaders, we launched the Justride SDK - a first for public transit - allowing urban mobility providers, like journey planners* (*Transit) and bike and ride-sharing services (Uber), to integrate our market-leading mobile ticketing platform into their applications, connecting services together for a seamless user experience.Our platform, Justride, is deployed in numerous cities around the globe, including New York, London, Boston, Las Vegas, The Hague, Los Angeles, Sydney and many more, with an exciting industry-first SDK deployment with Uber in Denver enabling the purchase of public transport tickets right within the Uber application.Come join us on this exciting ride as we build the transit technology ecosystem of tomorrow.*The Role*Masabi is looking for an experienced Freelance Marketing Specialist to help us provide first class marketing campaigns to our clients, prospects and partners within the Italian and Spanish market, while delivering local marketing initiatives to raise our brand profile, driving growth. The Freelance Marketing Specialist will play an important role in the delivery and applications of marketing plans to drive pipeline generation and conversions as well as revenue goals in the Spanish and Italian markets. Please note: the role can be either for one person that’s fluent in Spanish and Italian to look after the Italian and Spanish markets or for two different individuals (one fluent in Spanish to look after the Spanish market, the other fluent in Italian to cover the Italian market).The Freelance Marketing Specialist will report to the Marketing Manager. Full fluency in English, Spanish and/or Italian is required.*Responsibilities will include: *Deliver marketing campaigns with full production (including emails, blogs, case studies, social media posts, website updates etc.) to help drive sales.Develop and execute email nurturing campaigns and programs when required.Source and develop case studies that address customer pain points as well as identify industry trends and topicsMonitor customer trends, industry press, and competitor activity, in order to evaluate our messaging and positioning and capitalise on opportunities and develop marketing assets.Support the sales team through the creation of sales enablement content and collateral to drive customer acquisition, retain existing customers and maximise revenue.Optimise in-bound marketing channels and automation efforts.Plan, execute and support trade events in Italy and/or Spain and LATAM as well as customer events, seminars and webinars partnering with key players of the fare collection industry.Help build messaging and consistent branding across marketing campaigns.Running social media campaigns with regular posts on social media platforms.*Required skills and 0e2747b66b9dbdc2.title: Communications Specialist
0e2747b66b9dbdc2.company: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
0e2747b66b9dbdc2.description:
We are looking for a dynamic Communications Specialist with a ‘can do approach’ to join our busy communications and marketing team.

Applicants will need to be educated to degree level, or equivalent and have extensive experience of working in the field of communications/public relations/ journalism or marketing.

You will need excellent writing skills, a high degree of creativity and the ability to produce accurate work to tight dead-lines. We are looking for a team player who is able to work on their own initiative and remain calm under periods of pressure.

You will play a key role in supporting the Director of Communications and Marketing to deliver the organisation’s communications and marketing strategy. The role involves producing high impact internal and external communications/marketing materials, fostering productive media relations and delivering engaging digital and social media campaigns. A key aspect of this role will be to help develop engaging content for a new dynamic intranet site and websites.

You will be working for an organisation which values and respects all of its staff and the community it serves. The Trust is a leader in the NHS and research sectors and provides excellent benefits for its staff. This includes commitments to professional development but also many policies to support employees in balancing their personal and professional lives.

Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust (STH) has a clear vision to be to be recognised as the best provider of health care, clinical research and education in the UK and a strong contributor to the aspiration of Sheffield to be a vibrant and healthy city region

The principal aims of the Trust are:

Deliver the best clinical outcomes
Provide patient centred services
Employ caring and cared for staff
Spend public money wisely
Deliver excellent research, education and innovation

Please read through the Job Description and Person Specification for further details of the post. When completing your application please ensure that you clearly demonstrate and evidence how you meet each of the job criteria.

The principal aims of the Trust’s communications strategy are to:

Ensure patients are well informed about the quality, safety and availability of clinical services delivered by STH so that they are empowered to make an informed choice about what treatment/care they chose to have and who they want to provide it.
Ensure access to information is given the same priority as enabling people to access our services. A primary reason to do this is to increase understanding of how they can be involved in improving their own health and wellbeing.
Create a dynamic culture of staff engagement supported by two-way effective communications at directorate/department level and horizontally across the Trust.
Embrace patient and public engagement as standard practice as outlined in the Patient and Public Involvement strategy.
Bring about deep understanding of the Trust’s vision, values and objectives to support patient care, staff wellbeing and the efficient use of resources.
Ensure all staff are fully engaged in the Trust’s commitment to deliver high quality safe care, by keeping them informed about what is changing, why change is needed and most importantly involving them in the decisions that affect them.
Ensure GPs, Commissioners and Regulators are well informed about the services delivered by STH, and that the Trust is clearly aware of the priorities and requirements of those who refer to, purchase or regulate acute care.
Develop the brand and reputation of the Trust through proactive and reactive media management, marketing, high quality patient information, and effective engagement so that staff, members and patients want to be ambassadors of the Organisation.
Ensure patients, staff, partners, stakeholders, members, governors and the public understand Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust vision, and the part they can/need to play in achieving it.
Nurture new and existing relationships to enable partners to be engaged and involved in transforming services, delivering care and shaping future developments.
Ensure STH plays an active part in the community leading debate about the healthcare it delivers, the strategy for healthcare in Sheffield and South Yorkshire, health promotion and prevention.
Recruit and retain a vibrant, representative and active membership for the Trust

7abbb5b725238f58.title: Talent Acquisition Specialist II - Pharmacovigilance - Europe
7abbb5b725238f58.description:
Company Description
PrimeVigilance, an Ergomed Group company, was established in 2008 by Dr. Miroslav Reljanovic together with co-founder Dr. Elliot Brown. PrimeVigilance oﬀers holistic, top quality, cost-eﬀective, innovative safety services for pharmaceutical, generic and biotechnology companies. Our founders and leaders have an unrivalled reputation in the sector with a network of expert associates across the world.

Job Description
Due to growth, we are recruiting for an experienced Talent Acquisition Specialist to support our PrimeVigilance businesses across Europe.
Provides an effective recruitment service across the business.
Responsibilities:
Liaising with hiring managers to understand their requirements to effectively manage the end-to-end recruitment process.
Building a robust pipeline of talent consisting of both active and passive candidate pools through a variety of recruitment methods, including social media, headhunting, referrals and networking. Creating sourcing strategies in line with industry trends.
Designing and implementing recruitment strategies including contributing to job description development and candidate requirements, preparing job adverts, sourcing, shortlisting, interviewing and screening candidates.
Ensuring timely feedback and an all-round positive experience for the candidate and hiring manager.
Negotiating offers and managing offer letters.
Ensuring process are followed, including accurate candidate tracking in the ATS.
Educating hiring managers/interviewers on the candidate market, best practices, interview techniques and ATS use.
Working closely with HR to determine salary ranges.
Marketing activities both internally and externally.
Being aware of external market factors as well as new best practices/trends affecting recruitment.
Keeping updated with industry news.
Supporting the Director, Talent Acquisition in ongoing projects.

Qualifications
Requirements
Demonstrated experience or knowledge in pharmacovigilance recruitment from a pharmaceutical company, CRO or agency.
Experience recruiting across multiple countries.
Hands-on experience with full-cycle recruiting.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to liaise with internal departments and develop hiring strategies.
Experience in creating awareness of the company brand and establishing professional relationships with candidates.
Able to negotiate terms of employment effectively.
Proficiency in following process and keeping up with industry trends.
Experience of leading recruitment of a wide range of roles, from individual contributor to senior management.
Ability to work on a number of different roles at one time and work to tight deadlines.
Able to influence, build relationships and manage multiple priorities.
Able to work independently and add value.
Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.
