e8033805f832ba29.title: Specialist Global Marketing Procurement: Data Analyst
e8033805f832ba29.description:
Location: Europe Flexible Location
Travel: Estimated minimal global travel annually, may be required to travel in market for events and supplier meetings
ROLE LOCATION: The location of the positions and whether relocation benefits are provided will be discussed at the time of offer. In instances where relocation is provided, current mobility policies will apply. All policies are subject to amendment, revision, or discontinuance at the sole discretion of the Company.
Position Overview:
The Marketing Procurement Data Analyst (s) role will be the key point of contact and central co-ordination for all Global activities for TCCC as part of the Global Marketing Procurement Operations team. The role (s) will work closely with the marketing procurement team and cross functionally at global and OU level supporting data and analytics reporting and change initiatives.
The primary focus of the Data Analyst (s) is to support all data and analytics requirements by maximizing efficiencies and effectiveness of process, standards, technology, and reporting contributing towards market opportunities to strengthen the business. The Data Analyst (s) engages on multiple projects simultaneously and works closely with team members to develop analytics and insights that support sourcing strategies. In addition, the Data Analyst (s) is responsible for projects aligned with the marketing procurement operational strategy and represents data and analytics expertise in various process setting meetings.
This newly created role is a key role in the new marketing procurement organisation. The role reports to the Global Procurement Director Marketing Operations.
Organisational Impact:
Responsible for functional or operational areas, processes, or programs, which may include dotted-line or matrixed management, can manage projects or processes
As an individual contributor acts as an experienced professional working independently with guidance in only the most complex situations
As a people manager typically supervises professional level employees (entry and established) setting goals and objectives for achievement of operational results
Problems and issues faced are difficult and may require understanding of broader set of issues / having a broader perspective to identify solutions
Innovation & Complexity
Responsible for making improvements or recommended enhancements of processes, systems or products to enhance performance of the job area
Problems are typically solved through drawing from prior experience and analysis and interpretation of issues internal or external issues to come up with recommendations / best practices
Communication & Influence
Explains facts, policies, practices and procedures of the job area to others within and outside of the organization
Communicates with contacts typically within the department on matters that require consolidating, explaining and interpreting information in order to reach agreement
Works to justify and gain cooperation of other parties on practices, policies, and procedures
Behaviors
The ability to build trusted relationships quickly
Act Like an Owner: Deliver results, creating value for our brands, our customers, and key stakeholders.
Inspire Others: Inspire people to deliver our mission and vision, demonstrate passion for the business and give people a reason to believe anything is possible.
Active: Makes things happen, gets things done, runs a tight ship
Team player – always supporting the bigger picture
Develop Self & Others: Develop self and support others' development to achieve full potential.
Drive Innovation: Generate new or unique solutions and embrace new ideas that help sustain our business.
Able to challenge well and own uncomfortable conversations without alienating partners
Skills & Experience
Ideally the candidate will have knowledge and hands on experience of: Structured Query Language (SQL), Microsoft Excel (BI), Critical Thinking, R or Python-Statistical Programming, Data Visualization, Presentation Skills
Ideally has worked in an organisation managing varied sources of data and compiling insights based reports
Ideally they will have knowledge of marketing and /or experience working in a marketing organisation.
Ability to work as part of a virtual global team to collaborate across geographic and organizational boundaries to deliver better business results and share best practices
Ability to use data and apply robust analytics to model various business scenarios and analyze resulting cost, impact, risks, and benefits to inform and recommend business solutions.
Knowledge of sources for competitive analysis including supplier and industry data to build competitive intelligence, inform business planning and optimize decision-making. Includes the ability to create and analyze industry cost models order to assess suppliers' competitive capabilities.
Education & Experience Required
University Degree (Bachelor) or equivalent experience
At least 4 years of prior relevant experience
Has specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline or function
Skills:
Corporate Purchasing; Materials Resource Planning; Database Management; Customer Service; Food And Beverage (F&B); Contracts; Logility; Microsoft Office; Mathematics; Analytical Techniques; Communication; APICS Certification; Procurements; Negotiation; Manufacturing Process Controls; Cost Analysis; Global SAP
Our Purpose and Growth Culture:
We are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors – curious, empowered, inclusive and agile – and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. When we collect your personal information as part of a job application or offer of employment, we do so in accordance with industry standards and best practices and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.

adb29feca82f6cdb.title: Digital Marketing Specialist
adb29feca82f6cdb.description:
We are looking for an enthusiastic, self-motivated and creative digital marketing professional with strong team spirit to join our busy Marketing and Communications Team.
You'll be responsible for shaping the digital marketing strategy for the whole organisation, providing strategic advice on the best digital channels to use, how to track them and ensure ROI and delivering creative campaigns to meet set objectives.
As a key position within the team, the role requires someone who can manage multiple projects, meet deadlines, has a keen eye for details and deliver outstanding customer service.
You’ll need to be comfortable with data, copy and content.
To be considered for the role, you’ll need an understanding of all aspects of digital marketing and how they’re best used to deliver a required result, a sound background in marketing and a relevant qualification.
In return, your hard work and commitment will be rewarded with:
28 days holiday, leading to 30 days after 5 years’ service, plus bank holidays
a career average pension with Local Government Pension Scheme
a discount rewards scheme at a host of retailers exclusively for Gateshead College employees
free gym membership at Baltic Campus
travel support including on-site parking, discounted public transport scheme and a cycle to work scheme
a flexible and agile approach to working
dedicated mental health support
24/7 confidential support helpline and counselling support
hair and beauty discounts at our onsite salon, Botanica
company sick pay
Why Gateshead College?
If you’re looking for an opportunity to shape students’ lives and take pride in what they achieve, we’d love to hear from you. We have a workplace culture that sets us apart. We pride ourselves on the very highest standards and look to recruit people to join our team who share our passion for ensuring that our students enjoy a top quality education and the real world skills they need to get on in life. A unique combination we call education with employment edge. We know that a qualification alone isn’t enough to ensure our students are successful, so whether you’re a member of our teaching team or part of our support staff, everyone at Gateshead College has the potential to positively influence our students’ lives. It is this clear purpose that sets us apart from other colleges and makes us such a rewarding and enjoyable place to work.
Please apply online for this position, telling us all about yourself and why you think you’d be perfect for this role.
Gateshead College take all reasonably practicable measures to reduce the risks presented to employees undertaking business-driving duties as part of their role to an acceptable level as required under the Management of Health and Safety at Work Regulations 1999. If you are required to drive as part of your role, it is essential that you provide us with a copy of your Business insurance certificate, and a copy of your driving license and vehicle check.
The deadline for applications is midnight Sunday 20th March 2022.
Interviews will take place week commencing 28th March 2022.
Gateshead College is committed to equality and diversity and safeguarding the welfare of children, young people and adults at risk.

15f1ee675288447f.title: Clinical Specialist - DePuy Synthes - South West
15f1ee675288447f.description:
For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) have been part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Our commitment to respect the dignity and diversity of all is embedded in our Credo.
We know that the success of our business depends on having the best talent in a workforce that reflects the diverse markets we serve around the world and an inclusive culture that values different perspectives and life experiences
That is why we in the UK are working to create an inclusive environment where diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences are valued and each and every one of our people feels that they belong and can reach their potential. No matter who they are.
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Johnson & Johnson means “You Belong”!

Who are we?
Profound Change Requires Boldness. Johnson & Johnson is the largest and most broadly-based healthcare company in the world. We’re producing life-changing breakthroughs every day and have been for the last 130 years. The combination of new technologies and your expertise enables amazing things to happen. Teams from J&J’s consumer business are crafting digital tools to help people track the health of their skin. Those working in medical devices are 3-D printing artificial joints personalized for each patient, while researchers in pharmaceuticals use AI to discover lifesaving drugs. Imagine what the rest of our team of 134,000 people at 260 companies in more than 60 countries across the world is accomplishing. We redefine what it means to be a big company in today’s world.

Johnson & Johnson – DePuy Synthes
DePuy Synthes is the largest, most innovative and comprehensive orthopaedic and neurological business in the world. DePuy Synthes offer an unparalleled breadth and depth of products, services and programs in the areas of joint reconstruction, trauma, spine, sports medicine, neurological, craniomaxillofacial, power tools and biomaterials.

We have an exciting and challenging role within our team as a Clinical Specialist covering the Southwest.

Purpose of the role
You will be responsible for maintaining an existing customer base and developing sales in strategic accounts across a number of UK sales territories. In this role, you will become an integral part of the sales team by providing support to a number of territory managers in servicing their customers and accounts.

What to expect:
You will provide in theatre support to consultants and nursing staff regarding the use of products
Providing accurate information regarding all products and their indications (i.e. surgical techniques) for use to orthopaedic consultants and nursing staff
Provide first class service and seamless supply to customers including training, stock checks, timely deliveries and supporting the theatre team to ensure the operation proceeds successfully.
Assist in the promotion/correct use of DePuy products through regular, organised customer education meetings and training sessions
Develop business opportunities across the portfolio in Key Focus Accounts, communicate to the Territory Manager, and assist in the successful conversion of these business opportunities.
Provide support to DePuy Medical Education Events
Achieve Business goals in line with CREDO Values
Promote use of portfolio and services to Orthopaedic Surgeons, Theatre Staff
Maintain and grow the business as defined by the individual business plan and Key Opinion Leader targets.
Proactively build and develop relationships with Clinical stakeholders
Develop a portfolio of territory Key Opinion Leaders across the product portfolio
Cover surgical cases as required to support regional colleagues

Who will you be working with:
Reporting into the Regional Sales Manager, you will work closely with the following people:
Orthopaedic Surgeons
Theatre Staff
Hospital Clerical/Administrative Staff
Sales team
Marketing team
Commercial team
Medical Education
Supply Chain/Logistics

Qualifications

Who are we looking for?
To excel in this role, you will have experience of orthopaedics/sports medicine
Working Knowledge of theatre Environment and the NHS
Relevant experience in health sciences/anatomy and/or arthroscopy
Clinical qualification, e.g. ODP, RGN, Physiotherapy or a degree in science/sports science discipline/business/technology

What type of mark will YOU make?
By joining Johnson & Johnson you will find boundless opportunities to craft your path & amplify your impact inside & outside our walls. And with our commitment to be the world’s healthiest workforce you can strengthen your body as well and your mind. When you work at Johnson & Johnson you can touch over a Billion lives worldwide every day. And when you apply your talent to our collective purpose there’s no end to the lasting impact we can make together. And that changes everything.

What’s in it for YOU?
It’s important to us that you feel you can bring your whole self to work; at Johnson & Johnson we provide an environment for you to fulfil your career aspirations as well as promoting your physical and mental wellbeing. As part of our offering, you will receive a competitive compensation and benefits package as well as benefits that can be tailored to what is valuable to you throughout different stages of your life. Examples of this include: online Digital GP, private healthcare, Retail Vouchers, Discounted & Subsidised Gym memberships and you can get to support community projects as part of our global Corporate Social Responsibility programme.

Primary Location
United Kingdom-England-Cornwall-
Organization
Johnson & Johnson Medical Ltd. - fka -Ethicon Ltd. (7355)
Job Function
Sales
Requisition ID
2206014156W

8e42b7dd5e98f1dc.title: Subscriptions Engagement, Specialist
8e42b7dd5e98f1dc.description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn't just the Best Place to Play — it's also the Best Place to Work. Today, we're recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, PlayStation™Now, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.
Role overview:

Our team operates within the wider 'Services Commercial' group who are dedicated to driving growth of PlayStation's subscription services. This wider group strives to maximise new subscriber acquisition, maximise subscriber retention and provide a compelling reason for people to return to the service year after year. Our products, PlayStation Plus and PlayStation Now, are critically important to PlayStation's vision and strategy. PlayStation Plus is subscribed to by most PlayStation users and PlayStation Now has seen huge growth since re-launching in October 2019.

This role specifically sits within the 'Customer' team who are accountable for bringing together a wide variety of stakeholders (Marketing, Communications, PR, Merchandising, Product, Engineering) and driving a cohesive approach to the customer experience. We strive to ensure that every PlayStation subscriber gets the most out of their membership, has an enjoyable and fun experience, can access their benefits easily and develops a loyalty with us which makes them want to maintain their subscription in the years to come.

Focusing heavily on customer engagement is a new direction of focus for PlayStation Services and we'll need someone with ambition, ideas, a can-do attitude, and the ability to see things through the eyes of the customer to achieve our challenging vision. You will be joining a sub-team purely focused on customer engagement. You will be managing plans for engagement activities, working collaboratively to deliver the team's strategy on how to maximise customers' perceived value, drawing inspiration from other subscriptions and competition, and contributing to the engagement story to provide a depth of insight and understanding in our performance – all the time focused on data-driven decision making.

The Customer team are on a growth journey – the business is putting more and more emphasis on tracking, understanding, and influencing how customers engage with our platform, benefits and products. We're expanding our team significantly, and we want you to help us with that journey.

What you'll be doing:

Becoming an expert in how our subscribers use their subscription
Using self-service tools to drill into Customer Engagement data and working with Insight/Analytics teams to optimise those self-service reports
Organising and managing the delivery of tests vs. control groups
Briefing analysis on the performance of those tests/activities and drawing conclusions and recommendations
Supporting the implementation an engagement plan to maximise level and frequency of benefits usage
Working with our delivery teams to align on and prioritise engagement activities
Project manage campaigns for both mass-market and targeted audiences
Performing competitor and industry reviews on best practice

What we are looking for:

Early Career or Entry Level candidate
An understanding of Gaming and Subscriptions customers and their needs
Experience of relationship building to deliver projects
Strong organisational skills, structured thinker
Ability to manage and prioritise multiple requests at the same time
Experience of drawing conclusions from data
A desire to push yourself and show your value to the business
Skills in Excel and PowerPoint
Bonus: Subscription model understanding
Bonus: Experience with self-service data tools, or even direct data access

Benefits:
Discretionary bonus opportunity
Private Medical Insurance
Dental Scheme
London Allowance (if applicable)
25 days holiday per year

On return to the office:

On Site Gym
Subsidised Café
Free soft drinks
On site bar
Access to cycle garage and showers

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

c6a2aec624bcdb8c.title: Creative/Creative Team - Sky Creative
c6a2aec624bcdb8c.description:
Want to do the best work of your life? With 24 million customers in 7 countries, make your mark at Europe’s leading media and entertainment brand. A workplace where you can proudly be yourself; our people make Sky a truly exciting and inclusive place to work.

As a Creative or Creative Team, you’llconceptualise and execute campaigns to promote Sky Cinema, Sky Sports and Sky TV Products. You’ll put your ideas into action on a variety of platforms including TV, print, out-of-home and social media to make anything from the Premier League start of season to Sky Glass to the Christmas Cinema campaign awesome.

What you’ll do:
Respond to creative briefs with unique ideas that push our brands forward!Tackle a variety of projects from large nationwide campaigns to smaller own-channel activity, anything from TVCs, print, OOH, digital, and social.Work alongside Account Management and Planning to build presentations and ideas to sell the work.Help guide production, shoots, and post-production.Support the Senior Creatives and Creative Directors.Be a brand guardian, ensuring work conforms to our Sky Masterbrand values.Perform highly against a clear set of agreed business and personal objectives.

What you’ll bring:
Strong conceptual and ideation skills, a flair for execution and an eye for detail.Experience in creative origination and execution across all channels.Solid copy writing / art direction experience.A knowledge of production, shoots, and post-production.A love of problem solving and a desire to find solutions.Ability to take and work with criticism in a positive, pragmatic way.High levels of personal motivation.German or Italian fluency is desired but not essential.A love of TV and technology!

Team Overview

As part of Sky’s Consumer Group, Sky Creative Agency provides Advertising, Brand Design and Broadcast Creative for multiple partners across the business. We have recently integrated Sky Works, Sky’s in-house Trading agency to create a fully integrated 360 through-the-line operation.

Our work is varied, from Broadcast Design teams embedded in Sky News to specialist digital performance marketing teams, brand Advertising and Master brand ownership. We are leading the way in an industry wide trend for in-housing and day in day out we are relentless in raising the standards of our work.

Our ambition is to drive excellence in Sky’s advertising and to help build Europe’s leading entertainment brand. We are committed to diversity, inclusivity, and as Europe’s largest in-house agency, believe we can be role models for our industry.

The rewards:

There’s a reason people can’t stop talking about #LifeAtSky. Our great range of rewards really are something special, here are just a few:
– Sky Q, for the TV you love all in one place
– A generous pension package
– Private healthcare
– Discounted mobile and broadband

Where you’ll work:

Osterley

Our Osterley campus is a 10-minute walk from Syon Lane train station. Or you can hop on one of our free shuttle buses that run to and from Osterley, Chiswick Park, Gunnersbury, Acton Town and Ealing Broadway tube stations. There’s also plenty of parking, bike shelters and showers.

On campus you’ll find six subsidised restaurants and a Waitrose. You can keep in shape at our subsidised gym, catch the latest shows and movies at our cinema, get your car washed and even get pampered at our beauty salon.

Inclusion:

Recognised as an ‘Inclusive Top 50 Employer’ and a ‘Times Top 50 Employer for Women’, we’re working hard to ensure we’re a truly inclusive place to work. This means we don’t just look at your CV. We’re more focused on who you are and the potential you’ll bring to Sky. We also know that everyone has a life outside work, so we’re happy to discuss flexible working.

And we’ll do everything we can to support you during your application. If you need us to make any adjustments to our recruitment process, speak to our recruitment team who will be happy to support you.

Why wait?

Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can’t wait to hear from you.

To find out more about working with us, search #LifeAtSky on social media. A job you love to talk about.

Just so you know: if your application is successful, we’ll ask you to complete a criminal record check. And depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions you may have, we might have to withdraw the offer.

0e3c50b4f372ae9b.title: Communications Manager
0e3c50b4f372ae9b.description:
Main Purpose of Post:

Develop and deliver innovative and effective marketing, communications, PR and media management strategies and campaigns to support and promote the work of the Commission and its programmes. These will typically include public stakeholder events that may involve highly complex and sensitive information, where circumstances may be emotional or sensitive.
Continue to build on the current developments for the Bevan Commission website and social media and manage all the day-to-day activities.
Develop, maintain and manage strong and effective working relationships with a range of partners, communications leads and stakeholders including citizens, patients and carers, other Local Health Boards/Trusts, voluntary sector, private sector, Welsh Government and internationally.
Interpret highly complex elements of the Commission’s work to produce appropriate communication material for multiple different audiences and stakeholders.
Manage and oversee the delivery of all communications, media/communications campaigns, taking personal responsibility for the co-ordination, writing and distribution of press releases, newsletters and other promotional materials.
Provide advice, guidance and briefings to the Commission and partners on communication issues and the most effective approaches to successfully managing internal and external communications.
Work closely with the Vice Chairs, the Director and Commissioners to engage externally with patients, public, local communities, senior management in the NHS, Welsh Government, Local Authorities, Third Sector, and any other local and national patient groups.
Protect the reputation of the Bevan Commission by pre-empting negative news stories and manage misinformation from external sources, devising and taking appropriate action to rectify and diffuse confrontational issues with members of the press and public.
Work with the team and the Commissioners to maximise the Bevan brand, ensuring that the vision and values of the Bevan Commission and are highly visible throughout communications. E.g. by producing corporate and statutory publications/literature, annual reports, briefings and newsletters, providing advice and support to others on the brand in line with, equality and accessibility guidelines and cost effectiveness etc.
Financial management for communications as a budget holder, with responsibility for working closely with the Business Manager or equivalent for managing the budgets and complying with the University’s financial and procurement policies.
Responsible for developing and running an effective system for monitoring media coverage, analysing performance of internal and external communication, and recording and analysing all patient/public feedback to drive engagement and public affairs for the Commission to ensure performance targets and strategic objectives are met.
Devise and deliver or arrange for specialist engagement and communications advice and training as necessary (including marketing, media, corporate identity, reputation management, consultation best practice and legal duties on engagement in respect of the work) to address the needs of staff, the Commissioners, the Bevan Innovators, Hubs and others as identified.
Be politically aware and understand the complex NHS, academic and political issues and changing strategic situations.

Job Reference: AC05162

d019fb89e2de9a6f.title: Creative Project Manager
d019fb89e2de9a6f.description:
Why us?
£19-27k salary on a full time, permanent contract

 Edinburgh office or fully remote working from anywhere in the UK!

 33 Days Paid Leave

 Working with globally recognisable brands in US Entertainment

 High-end, fast computer

 All the latest software and productivity tools you’ll need
Summary
Storm Ideas work with globally-recognised clients in the US TV industry on extraordinary digital and marketing projects. Every day we produce work that is innovative, challenging and enjoyed by millions of people!

We are looking to expand our team with an enthusiastic, intelligent and talented individual who is interested in project management, social media and creativity.

If the idea of a fast-paced, dynamic role with tonnes of opportunity for change, responsibility and innovation sounds exciting to you, then read on!
About us
Founded in 2008, we are an international team with our home office based in Edinburgh, that works with incredible clients all over the world, particularly in the US TV industry.

Whether it’s developing our own products, producing engaging social content en masse, or designing and delivering services to help our clients work more efficiently, our work is varied, exciting and at the very forefront of the latest technology and trends.

Currently, we are a growing team of 100+ people but still looking for new colleagues who make an impact and believe in the same ideas and values as we do.
Responsibilities
What can you expect?

Reviewing never-before-seen TV episodes before they’re released
Learning all there is to know about our clients’ TV shows, the content, the talent and the fans
Brainstorming engaging and funny video ideas
Collecting and cataloguing content references and innovating based on new social media trends and your own creativity
Downloading and organising footage as well as briefing other team members on creative tasks
Leading quality control on content delivered to clients to ensure consistency and adherence to branding guidelines, as well as offering creative feedback
Liaising with clients via email to pitch ideas, receive feedback and deliver content
Developing your own technical skills by learning from other team members and through independent research
Becoming an expert in social platforms as well as Storm Ideas products to suggest strategy and content that will engage our clients’ audiences and achieve their overall goals
Qualifications
What's important to us:

A 2:1 Bachelor’s degree or higher
Excellent written and communication skills
Confidence in managing fellow team members
Strong organisational skills
Ability to work well under the pressure of deadlines while maintaining accuracy
Unparalleled attention to detail
A strong creative flair and sense of storytelling
Ability to adjust well to feedback and changing priorities
High work-ethic and self-motivation
Basic understanding of Adobe Premiere Pro and Photoshop (this is not essential, but a willingness to learn is!)

The above list is just a guide for what the ideal candidate will look like. As long as you possess smarts, enthusiasm and some experience, please still apply.
Your working environment
Agility & Openness for Ideas

We actively encourage the entire team to share their ideas, with that in mind we regularly adopt and implement suggestions across the company, you’re the specialist here!

Operating with the agility of a high growth start-up, alongside the support you can expect from a larger organisation means we encourage quick decision making and a responsive, adaptive culture.

Outstanding People

We believe that great teams are built by a mixture of personality, skills and a passion for what people do. The Content Production team is 20+ people strong and made up of video editors, motion graphics specialists, project managers and graphic designers. We’re looking for people with a passion for what they do - just be yourself!

We’re an international team with more than 100 people onboard and we come from a mix of the biggest names in tech, to innovative start-ups and everything in between.

Forefront of Technology and Industry

Our culture is deeply embedded in harnessing technology and we're always at the forefront of the latest capabilities and trends. If you’re interested in the possibilities that technology can bring to both the way we work and how our clients communicate with their audiences, then we’d love to hear from you!

Top-notch Equipment

We’ll provide you with a high-end M1 Max MacBook Pro or PC equivalent as well as top of the range monitors, headphones, a keyboard, mouse and whatever you need to feel comfortable at work.

Flexibility

We’re a remote-first company and support 100% remote working for this role. We have flexible working hours so you can start your day anytime between 9am and 10am.

To best serve our US clients, we are looking for people who can work at least one late shifts (1:30pm-10pm) per week. So, some days you’ll need to be flexible to work later if there’s a key delivery to a US client, but any time can be taken back.

Joining us means becoming an integral part of the whole team no matter where we’re physically working, we have a number of initiatives to create a team environment regardless of geographic location.
Salary
£19 - 27k per year, depending on experience and skills.
Employment type
Permanent / Full time. Either in our Edinburgh office or remote within the UK.
Benefits
IMMEDIATE BENEFITS

33 days’ holiday
High end laptop of your choice, Mac or Windows it’s up to you!
Your own choice monitors, headphones, keyboard, mouse and gel rests
Paid training on the job
Annual Flu Inoculations
Team outings and monthly meets

AFTER 3 MONTHS

Up to £700 to spend on a chair, desk or any other necessary workspace equipment to kit out your home office.
£625 budget every two years to choose your own mobile phone + monthly mobile contract paid for
Enrolment in workplace pension scheme with matched employer contributions
Money towards glasses with Specsavers

AFTER 1 YEAR

Performance Related Pay Scheme giving an annual bonus of up to 100% of monthly salary whenever Storm Ideas is in profit
Access to the Cycle to Work scheme
Recruitment process
There is only one recruitment step - a meeting with Nina and Ciara, Content Production Managers (60 minutes via Zoom). During the meeting, they get to know you a bit better and try to understand if you’d be a good fit for the role, and at the same time answer all your questions.

And that’s it!

We deliver the hottest styles at lightning-fast speed. Wherever our customer is, we are committed to bringing them the trends they love at the prices they love.About The RoleGuapi LLC is on the hunt for an amazing Influencer Marketing Specialist to bring the best that Guapi LLC has to offer, to millions of followers across Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Facebook, Snapchat, Twitter and other platforms. 340d7d18125052aa.title: Specialist – Risk Reporting (Bulks)
340d7d18125052aa.description:
Company Description
-You’re talented and adaptable. That’s why you’ll fit in.
As well as discovering, mining and processing many of the essential raw materials that enable, support and enhance modern life, our global business is involved in selling and marketing products – copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore, coal, nickel and diamonds. Through our Marketing Business, we are able to offer innovative solutions to meet our customers’ specific challenges. This includes physical products, logistics and technical support, as well as pricing and financing solutions.
Job Description
-What you’ll do
The Risk Specialist is responsible for preparing and analysing a suite of risk reports to ensure that all trade, market risk exposures and mark to market P&Ls are known and monitored against the Company’s appropriate governance frameworks and limits. This role is responsible for ensuring the integrity of the data in the systems that support risk reporting. The role will focus on a range of commodities, (in particular bulks commodities with focus on Freight, Iron Ore and Urea Trading) and financial instruments.
The Risk Specialist is the primary Business partner for Front Office on day to day risk reporting matters.
Performance & Delivery
Generate (daily, weekly and monthly for senior management reporting) risk reports, including P&L and Exposure/Position using the implemented risk system. Ad-hoc reporting as requested by the Risk Reporting Manager or Head of Risk, Governance and Compliance.
Acts as the main focal point with Traders and Finance on day-to-day issues, responsible for creating solutions and maintain good customer relationships. This role will be the primary Business partner for Front Office on day-to-day risk reporting matters.
Analyse trading results, including P&L and volumes. The analysis can require a very high degree of technical competence, requiring advanced Excel and SQL knowledge.
Validate and manage the accuracy of trade and reporting data in Aspect and Veslink (CTRM) and interfaces to the existing risk systems. Review and address reconciliation results from trade repositories as well as handling of failed reports, errors and exceptions.
Monitor compliance of Front Office activities with the Marketing Risk Policy and escalate breaches of limits to the Marketing Risk Committee. Assist in the reporting of credit risk and operational risk.
Validating prices that go into the risk systems, to ensure accuracy of reporting and invoice value. Perform calculation of Risk Metrics including, but not limited to VaR, Stress Testing and Back-testing for the physical and financial portfolios.
Interface with Risk team members in other regions as part of a seamless interface to the business and support follow the sun operations.
Qualifications
-What we’re looking for
Degree educated with a qualification in finance, business or economics. Quantitative disciplines such as in engineering, mathematics etc will be viewed favourably as well.
Risk Control experience in a commodity or energy trading environment (preferably LNG), which should include knowledge of commodities markets, P&L reporting, exposure/position reporting, Value at Risk (VaR) reporting and risk modelling experience in Excel/Access using VBA.
Experience with Power BI is preferred.
In-depth knowledge of the calculations behind P&L and exposure calculations for both physical and financial commodity trades which includes options.
The ability to build/review/amend Excel/VBA models, generate data warehouse queries in SQL. SQL experience is beneficial.
Experience/understanding of bulks physical commodities market, such as Coal, Iron Ore, LNG or Shipping will be preferred.
Excellent communication skills and ability to communicate with multiple stakeholders across a global organization
Additional Information
-Who we are
Anglo American is a global diversified mining business. Our portfolio of world-class mining operations provides the metals and minerals that make modern life possible. We use innovative practices and the latest technologies to discover new resources and mine, process, move and market our products to our customers around the world.
As a responsible miner – of diamonds (through De Beers), copper, platinum and other precious metals, iron ore, coal and nickel – we are the custodians of what are precious natural resources. We work together with our key partners and stakeholders to unlock the sustainable value that those resources represent for our shareholders, the communities and countries in which we operate and for society at large. Anglo American is re-imagining mining to improve people’s lives.
What we offer
Competitive salary and benefits package
Amazing opportunities for learning and growth - from technical training to leadership programs, we bring out the best in our people
We’re a large, successful multinational company and there are plenty of opportunities internally to move onwards and upwards too
Inclusion and Diversity
Anglo American is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to promoting an inclusive and diverse workplace where we value and respect every colleague for who they are and provide equality of opportunity so that everyone can fulfil their potential.
Covid Vaccination Intent
Since safe and effective COVID-19 vaccines have become widely available this year, we have strongly encouraged employees to get vaccinated at the earliest possible opportunity. However, as vaccines have been proven to be a very effective and safe way of protecting people and reducing Covid-19 transmission, we have now announced our intent to introduce a policy that requires Covid-19 vaccination for access to all sites and offices. This policy would apply to all new joiners to the company as well as existing employees and contractors.
We are in the process of undertaking a comprehensive engagement process with all our stakeholders about our intent. This is so we can tailor our approach in each country, including ensuring what we do is lawful. Once this is complete, we will look to implement the policy. There may be differences in how and when it is implemented due to local context and legal requirements.
How to apply
To apply for this role, please complete our online application form. You will have the opportunity to upload your CV and other relevant documentation as part of this process.

ce6f4514a87801c2.title: Business Development Manager - South Tyne
ce6f4514a87801c2.description:
Title: Business Development Manager,

Location: Field based role based in and around South Tyne (North Durham to Sunderland up to South Shields and Gateshead)

Salary and benefits: £42 - £55k, base depending on experience plus bonus, Bupa medical cover, double matched pension (up to 10% of base salary), Company Car (electric and hybrid options available), Bonus, Laptop, iPhone, 35 days holiday (option to buy more), broad online and course development opportunities and award-winning benefits. Plus, a monthly case of our delicious products!

We’re Building Britain’s Best Pub Company

HEINEKEN has a long-held belief that pubs are an integral part of British culture and that well-invested pubs run by skilled operators can prosper and thrive. We’re a passionate supporter of the Great British Pub and since 2012 have invested more than £100m in our pubs to broaden their appeal, which we combine with flexible leases and market-leading support. We seek the best and most innovative licensees and work together to create successful pubs at the heart of their communities.

So let’s get straight to it. We’re on the hunt for a Business Development Manager who will support some of our fantastic pubs and bars in the North East area which covers the geography, including but not exclusive to, North Durham to Sunderland, up to South Shields and Gateshead

The Role
The Business Development Manager role within Star Pubs & Bars is considered a true commercial generalist, you’ll be supporting 34 pubs and utilising the specialist skills and knowledge of a wider support team. The role is at the forefront of our relationship with our customers and pivotal to the success of Star Pubs & Bars, responsible for working collaboratively with a virtual team, including Pub Operations, Estates Manager and Property Team as the key support roles.

Overall, this role is about collaborating with your pub operators and lessees to create a great retail experience for the consumer. To achieve this you’ll create a unique Business Plan for each Pub in your remit, encompassing recruitment of new lessees, reviewing commercial terms, and delivering Brand/Marketing Plans. With a deep understanding of retail or hospitality already, you’ll be able to draw from an arsenal of resources to help design, innovate and implement the best retail solutions for each of the pubs in your remit.

Experience in the pub sector would be advantageous but we are also open to hearing from candidates who have the skill sets required above but gained outside of the pub industry, who are as passionate about consumers and customers as we are.

If this sounds like an opportunity you'd like to explore then apply today!

Application closing date: Thursday 10th March @ 17.00

We warmly welcome applications from any industry and all backgrounds

What have you got to lose by applying?

We are extremely proud of the progress we have made on our I&D agenda. We’ve reviewed our policies, introduced smarter working principles, and created colleague taskforces focusing on LGBTQ+, Race & Ethnicity, Disability, Age and Gender. Research shows that some of us in these groups are less confident to apply for roles when we don’t have all the experience required. If you’re passionate about this role then we’d very much encourage you to apply, telling us why you see such a good fit in your covering letter, and let’s see what happens next!

b924dd505cd37c27.title: Market Research Specialist, Marketing
b924dd505cd37c27.description:
About ActiveViam
ActiveViam, a global leader in Big Data analytics and Fintech, is a premier software development firm with offices in New York, London, Singapore, Hong Kong, Sydney, Paris and Toulouse, and is looking to add to its growing staff. Our customers are some of the largest banks, hedge funds and asset managers worldwide.
Our exclusive technology, Atoti+, offers a unique answer to the challenges of risk management, real-time data analytics and complex decision-making, while our commitment to service ensures our solutions are delivered with the same outcome of quick and precise results. Our community edition software is used by data scientists in a variety of other verticals building industrialized solutions in Python and Jupyter notebooks.
About Your team
The Product Strategy team shapes and coordinates the efforts of the R&D, Business Development and Marketing teams to define ActiveViam’s product strategy, and as such is has a critical role for the success of the company. It comprises UX research, market research and product marketing roles.
The Role
We are looking for an experienced Market Research specialist to analyze the High Tech and Fin Tech markets we operate in, keep track of our competitors and help make better informed investment decisions.
Key Duties
Manages quantitative and qualitative analysis of markets and competitors, creates and updates industry, competitor and customer models (e.g. market share, growth projections and trends, etc.).
Manages identification and collection of customers, competitors, market, financial and/or operational data and research, provide recommendations on acquiring new sources of data research
Performs systematic analysis of key industry trends the general social and economic environment regulatory issues customers current and emerging competitors.
Responsible for market and competitive intelligence needs of strategic planning recommends key intelligence items that require further consideration (data hunting and gathering).
Responsible for market and competitive intelligence needs of internal business customers (product management, customer success, partners channels, marketing), including ability to design and implement primary direct research projects utilizing external vendors.
Oversees execution of projects in support of ad-hoc, proprietary information requests.
Maintains strong relationships with key internal customers to identify emerging needs and business challenges.
Builds industry knowledge so as to be recognized by internal constituents as the go-to source of expertise with respect to data and research sources, market trends, competitive developments, etc.
Supports and contributes to culture of information sharing within the company (i.e. create, maintain, facilitate internal use of shared repository).
Participate in other projects or duties.
Occasional business travel may be required.
Your profile
Required:
Strong problem solving and analytics skills particularly in translating data and research into consumable analysis insights (visual storyteller)
Strong written, communication presentation skills ability to contribute to executive-level discourse.
Strong understanding of market competitive data research sources in software tech industries
Strong customer focus and organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects under tight deadline constraints.
Ability to network effectively at all levels and influence without direct management oversight.
Ability to follow standard practices and procedures to resolve the most complex issues.
Knowledge of statistical packages and commitment to learn more (e.g. SPSS, R, Python) a plus
Ideally you also will have:
Bachelor’s degree required in Business, Economics, Political Science or Communications Minor
Concentration in Data Analytics, Statistics,
Math a plus
MBA a plus.
Ten (10) plus years of experience in Marketing, Market Research or Consulting-oriented role(s) within (or primarily related to) SaaS software industries.
Experience with research analysis methods tools related to data manipulation, visualization, etc.
Or equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
What we offer
Bright, genuinely sociable and friendly working environment in London’s West End
Regular social events, lunches, annual winter seminar (skiing) in French Alps
Private health insurance, group pension scheme, life insurance, cycle to work scheme
Competitive salary + discretionary annual bonus
Hybrid WFH policy in place

5f847a4330f80085.title: Enterprise Sales Specialist, Google Workspace
5f847a4330f80085.description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in enterprise IT sales.
Experience building relationships and delivering results in a cross-functional/matrixed environment.
Preferred qualifications:

Experience with a SaaS or Digital Workplace business.
Experience in New Ways of Working and Cultural Transformation.
Ability to plan, present, and execute a territory business strategy.
Ability to engage with C-level IT and business leaders and influence decisions at the executive level.
Excellent strategic and analytical thinking skills.
About the job
As a member of the Google Cloud team, you inspire leading companies, schools, and government agencies to work smarter with Google tools like Google Workspace, Search, and Chrome. You advocate the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative, and mobile. Your guiding light is doing what’s right for the customer, you will meet customers exactly where they are at and provide them the best solutions for innovation. Using your passion for Google products, you help spread the magic of Google to organizations around the world.

As an Enterprise Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for cultivating the market success of Google Workspace.
You will work with Sales, Partners, Marketing, and Product Management to define and achieve strategic goals. You will work with Marketing to build campaigns, tailor business assets and tools to the needs of the market segment, and provide Sales teams the support they need for customers’ engagement.
Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.
Responsibilities
Achieve Google Workspace business objectives both for new business and existing accounts.
Define and execute a holistic business plan, aligning cross-functional stakeholders to grow pipeline and maximize the reach of Google Workspace.
Advocate for Google Workspace within the Google Cloud region/segment.
Coach team members to drive opportunities partnering with the Google Cloud Sales team, from initial prospect engagement to closing.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

fe35a538d872a245.title: Activations Specialist - UK (Mandarin/Cantonese speaking)
fe35a538d872a245.description:
Activations Specialist - UK (Mandarin/Cantonese speaking)
About Flipdish

Flipdish is a hyper growth technology company (3rd in the 2020 Deloitte Fast 50) who puts hospitality brands of all sizes in control of their business growth with a digital ordering and marketing system that builds brands, grows profits and turns customers into regulars.

With a branded website, app or self-service kiosk, powered by Flipdish's world-class technology, hospitality brands can directly accept digital orders without having to list on aggregator platforms, at a lower cost and with more control over the customer experience.

Why do we exist?: To empower a world of diverse, independent food businesses.
What do we do?: Provide food businesses with the best-in-class tools and support they need to win.
Where will we be?: We will process more digital on-demand food orders than any other company.
Role:
Due to our continued and exciting growth, Flipdish is seeking an experienced Activations specialist for the UK.
You will work in partnership with our customer success team ensuring that our clients are set up for success with the Flipdish platform.
Instrumental in influencing future lifetime value through higher product adoption, customer satisfaction, and overall health scores
Manage key metrics that feed into team-based goals around customer retention, growth, and advocacy
We want you to bring new ideas and knowledge to Flipdish as that will help our customers and Flipdish succeed
There are excellent opportunities for growth within the company and success will only be limited by the ability of the candidate.
Candidate profile:
Fluent in either Mandarin and/or Cantonese
You will be a high-achiever with experience in a client-facing activation, account management, or project management position.
Flexibility - being able to adapt to changing priorities and excellent communication skills, both internally with the Flipdish team and externally with our clients, are essential.
People person! You love working with people
You're a foodie with a passion for technology.
Must be results-focused with a can-do-attitude
Excellent verbal and written communication skills - you will be talking to our customers after all!
Desire to work in a high growth, dynamic startup environment.
Career achievements
You have been successful in a hyper growth environment.
Understand how a SaaS business operates and ultimately how to improve processes
You have managed an on-boarding and activation process in its entirety
Prior experience working with clients and internal teams like sales, operations, and menu to provide a seamless and positive onboarding experience for Flipdish customers
Familiarity or awareness of the Flipdish product
Ideally at least one year of experience in client activation, account management, or customer service


Benefits

Too many to list on this job post! We are a growing startup that understands that only amazing incentives will attract the best talent. This obviously includes ESOP because we want all of our best employees to have skin in the game. In addition to a long list of incentives, we provide unparalleled opportunities for growth and development. If you are smart, ambitious and hard-working, we will do whatever it takes to convince you to join the Flipdish rocketship!


No business embodies diversity like the food business. And at Flipdish, we're all about empowering those diverse, local, independent businesses - all over the planet. For us, diversity isn't a checkbox. It's embedded in how we work. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills - all working together in an open, honest and transparent culture. Because our strength comes from embracing our differences: differences that reflect the diverse customers we serve.

Please note that for this role we only accept applications from candidates directly. No recruitment agency assistance is needed.


About Flipdish

Flipdish is a hyper growth technology company (3rd in the 2020 Deloitte Fast 50) who puts hospitality brands of all sizes in control of their business growth with a digital ordering and marketing system that builds brands, grows profits and turns customers into regulars.

With a branded website, app or self-service kiosk, powered by Flipdish's world-class technology, hospitality brands can directly accept digital orders without having to list on aggregator platforms, at a lower cost and with more control over the customer experience.

Started in 2015 by technology entrepreneurs James and Conor McCarthy, Flipdish is headquartered in Dublin with a team of 280+ digital food retailing enthusiasts, 7000 active clients across 20 countries with teams in Ireland, UK, Spain, France, Germany and the US.


Flipdish Mission Statement: "To provide food businesses with the best-in-class tools and support they need to win."

832e4237d358ac37.title: Principal Customer Marketing Specialist, UK based covering North Western Europe
832e4237d358ac37.description:
Careers that Change Lives

At Medtronic we are working to improve how healthcare addresses the needs of more people, in more ways and in more places around the world. As one company, we can accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team!
Our Ear, Nose and Throat (ENT) Operating Unit consists of a comprehensive product portfolio and therapies designed to treat ENT disorders. To continue developing our business unit in North Western Europe, we are looking for a fulltime Principal Marketing Specialist to support the continuous success in the ENT business contributing to North Western Europe and Western Europe regions.
Reporting to ENT NWE Business Leader, and as a member of the NWE ENT leadership team, you will be responsible for developing, planning and implementing the strategic marketing activities including ENT market insights and analysis, customer and product segmentation and launches including relevant market development programs.
You will collaborate closely with the Sales Managers and Teams in UK&I, Benelux and Nordics, the Marketing Specialist in Benelux, Training and Education and Sales Force Excellence teams to drive proper execution and with Digital team to integrate strategy according to digital plans.

A Day in the Life
Responsibilities
Contribute and drive establishment of the NWE ENT marketing vision, strategy and objectives built on market insights and market assessment opportunities
Design and implement marketing programs maximizing customer and community engagement
Identity, establish and implement key Market Development programs
Drive synergies with Training & Education team members to ensure the delivery of a holistic T&E plan in line with marketing plan
Ensure strong link and collaboration between NWE Region and ENT EMEA Marketing team to ensure efficient launch and follow up on programs and new product launches
Keep on-going communication with the NWE countries to understand their needs and challenges and keep them informed on the marketing priorities
Establish network with Key Opinion Leaders in the countries and beyond, to ensure market recognition of marketing activities and therapy value propositions
Marketing activities and budget planning, execution, follow-up including congress, in line with overall strategies
Design and lead local social media strategies Collaborate with Digital central hub and EMEA countries for the roll out and implementation of the communication and digital strategy, ensuring strong understanding and adoption.
Must Have: Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's Degree + successful professional experience in biomedical or related industry
Strong developed experience in marketing management
Marketing leadership responsibilities working with Regional/European teams in a global company preferably in Health Industry,
Experience in launching new products in varying market conditions
Solid understanding of Digital Marketing channels and processes
Experience in the design, development and execution of digital marketing campaigns including lead management

Nice to Have
Proven ability to effectively communicate, written and verbal, at all levels
Strong drive for execution, highly motivated, strong “win and can do” attitude
Positive approach and strong team player, easy to work with
Resilience mindset, courage and risk taking + ability to see opportunities in difficulties and problems
Excellent analytical and project management skills
Proven ability to operate in a matrix environment and work effectively with sales teams and customers

Your Answer
Is this the position you were waiting for? Then please apply directly via the apply button!

About Medtronic
At Medtronic, you will find a diverse team of innovators who bring their unique backgrounds and their individual life experiences to work every day. We work hard to cultivate a workforce that reflects our patients and partners, we believe it’s the only way to drive healthcare forward. We want to attract a diverse workforce, regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state or local law. Join us and bring the power of your point of view to our culture of collaboration and innovation. It is through strong diversity, inclusion, and engagement that we can remain a leader in medical technology and solutions. And by embracing everything you have to offer — your unique perspectives, talents, and contributions — we can live up to the promise of our Mission.


Physical Job Requirements

The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)
Travel
No

26b23c8c337ea955.title: Internship: Corporate Reputation
26b23c8c337ea955.description:
About Edelman:
We are a leading global communications marketing firm helping business and organisations evolve, promote, and protect their brands and reputations. We are independent and family owned, which allows us the freedom to deliver original thinking and invest in our clients.

In the UK, there are more than 600 employees based in our offices in Victoria. We create award-winning creative communication programmes for our clients that include Microsoft, Disney, Mars Wrigley, Nissan, PayPal and FedEx.

We have deep expertise and advise on consumer trends, research, analytics and insights, corporate reputation, health, technology, capital markets, crisis, energy, and government affairs.

About the Corporate Reputation team:
We are London’s leading Corporate Reputation team. We create commercial value by delivering creative communications campaigns and advisory work for companies and brands that operate in the full glare of the public spotlight and whose reputations shape their businesses.

We have capabilities across functions and advise clients on reputation campaigning, integrated media strategy, digital and content production, crisis planning & response, litigation & legal affairs, employee engagement & advocacy, research & analytics, capital markets and government affairs.

The team includes around 90 consultants specialising in all areas of corporate reputation and includes former journalists, senior in-house practitioners, government advisors and industry specialists as well as dedicated sector experts.

We take pride in delivering exceptional work for our clients but, at our core, we are a non-hierarchical team who like to spend time together in and out of the office. We are relentlessly collaborative and supported by leadership who champion and celebrate our collective achievements.
About our internship:
The Edelman Corporate Reputation practice is looking for motivated and enthusiastic candidates to join our 2022 Summer Internship Programme and work alongside our award-winning team. The 8-12 week internship starts in June and will provide an unforgettable experience in a fast-paced, creative, and international environment; a comprehensive introduction to the work of a global communications firm and help you develop a core skill set that will be integral to a future career in communications.

Your contribution to the team:
At Edelman, interns are an integral part of our team, and work closely with our highly experienced consultants to implement strategic campaigns for corporate social responsibility and external and internal stakeholder engagement. Throughout the programme, you will have the opportunity to get stuck into a broad range of campaigns and communications programmes for some of the world’s leading brands, learning how to:

Develop creative activations for clients, partnering with our creative and strategy teamAssist in event planning and actively participate in conversations with organisers
News monitor for client and write comprehensive summaries to inform their business strategyDevelop media lists, pitches and build relationships with journalists
Curate content for social channels and support channel management
Develop communications and content reports that analyse the success of campaignsDraft briefing material for executives
Support with research tasksWork with junior team members to ensure accurate account administration
About you:
We don’t expect you to have all the answers today. This internship is designed to show you every aspect of how a global communications consultancy operates, enabling you to build your knowledge and experience. We are however, looking for candidates who are passionate about pursuing a career in communications and are:
Curious about current affairs and like to keep on top of the news agendaKeen learners, who like trying new things and are open to new challengesTeam players who are always ready to lend a hand
Dynamic problem solvers who tackle challenges with a growth mindsetOrganised, self-starters
Familiar with Microsoft Office – Word, PowerPoint, ExcelFamiliar with social media platforms – Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, TikTok
What we offer in return:
Competitive salary
Hybrid working set-up based on the latest government corona-virus guidelines
Exposure to the work of some of the largest and most innovative brands including Shell, Nissan, Unilever, Heineken and IKEA
A line manager who helps you to set objectives that empower you to achieve your goals for the internship
A buddy who helps you find your way around (and takes you out for lunch on your first day!)
Informal 1:1s with senior members of the team to discuss career pathways
Software workshops to develop a proficiency in PR tools and databases
Training sessions that include: media relations 101, How to draft material for the press, The basics of social media communications, How to deliver extraordinary client service, and Health and wellbeing in the workplace
Several social activities such as daily free breakfast, Thursday team social and junior team meetups
An opportunity to network with team members across all communications specialisms at Edelman
Note: Successful candidates will be invited to an interview at Edelman’s London office.
#LI-SD1
Edelman is a global communications firm that partners with businesses and organizations to evolve, promote and protect their brands and reputations. Our 6,000 people in more than 60 offices deliver communications strategies that give our clients the confidence to lead and act with certainty, earning the trust of their stakeholders. Our honors include the Cannes Lions Grand Prix for PR; Advertising Age’s 2019 A-List; the Holmes Report’s 2018 Global Digital Agency of the Year; and, five times, Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work. Since our founding in 1952, we have remained an independent, family-run business. Edelman owns specialty companies Edelman Data & Intelligence (DxI) and United Entertainment Group (entertainment, sports, lifestyle).
For more information please visit: www.edelman.com

d65a3647825fc3cf.title: MBSE Product Specialist EDA
d65a3647825fc3cf.description:
We are seeking a dynamic and professional technical expert, who enjoys multi-tasking in a fast paced environment. In this position you will be focused on the technical advancement of leading-edge solutions for systems design, modeling and requirement verification management in the electronics domain. You will work closely with customers to demonstrate a mixture of products to solve their enterprise level challenges to digitally transform. You will need to be engaged with multiple customers and issues concurrently, and be very effective at building trusted, high credibility customer relationships. The customer interaction is all level of design engineers as well as higher levels of management. You will align with account teams to establish thought leadership and highly differentiated positioning for the EDA product portfolio. Sales support roles include product demonstrations, evaluations, and competitive benchmarking. You will play an active role in account planning and working as part of the account team. The team develops new classes of solutions to customer problems based on their insight into the customer needs that ultimately result in revenue.
Your new area of responsibility - challenging and future-oriented
You will support a broad breath of tools to realize MBSE driven design and verification workflows. In your role you will support the EDA products in solution flows with other Siemens DISW offerings, identifying and determining revenue generating possibilities.
The primary objective is to work with customers to realize the implications of digital transformation and guide them to a new paradigm of continuous decomposition of design and verification.
You will function as technical representative for Siemens EDA supporting revenue generating activities, while promoting customer and market realization of the best-in-breed digital engineering technologies and solutions of DISW.
Leading business and technical relationships with Siemens EDA’s existing customer base are part of your daily business
You will deliver technical presentations and demonstrations to a range of audiences, from users to managers to decision-makers
You will identify current and emerging design challenges. You’ll connect these challenges with Siemens EDA’s technical solutions and you'll drive market feedback to product development and marketing teams to evolve the next generation of methodologies and solutions
Coordinating or leading resources in the sales and product divisions is part of your role to accomplish above responsibilities
Your Qualifications
You’re ambitious, commutative and comfortable in a sales and applications environment
You have experience with multi-board electronic system design, as well as the IC, FPGA and packaging design and verification flows.
You understand physical and electrical characteristics of all layers of electronics implementation
Developing a network of technical relationships at a peer-to-peer level with both our customers and the Product engineering teams is easy for you
You have scripting programming experience
You’re flexible and open to business travel
Remote Work Ok
In contrast to a typical AE that might focus on local accounts with an established product line experiencing either market share growth or a strong market position, the Product Specialist is a Product/flow expert assuming responsibility for a region (Americas/Japan/PacRim/Europe), tasked with growing market share by introducing new products into the market to add new revenue streams. The role often requires significantly more Field/Factory collaboration, travel, and leadership in engagements that last longer than an annual quota cycle for products to be deployed and show appreciable return.
We are looking for one position based in North America and one position in Europe.
Siemens Industry Software Inc. is a technology supplier to the United States Federal Government. Recently The White House issued an Executive Order requiring most federal workers, contractors and subcontractors who do business with the government to get vaccinated against COVID-19 unless granted an accommodation due to a disability or sincerely held religious belief or practice. The Company has decided to pause enforcement of the vaccine mandate for the time being while the issue is addressed by the courts. We will be monitoring the situation closely and may lift the pause if required to do so in order to be in compliance with federal law. If this pause is lifted, you will be expected to be vaccinated against COVID-19.
At Siemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow’s reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds
#LI-MGRP
#LI-JE1
#AEmgc
Organization: Digital Industries
Company: Siemens Industry Software Inc.
Experience Level: Experienced Professional
Job Type: Full-time

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.
