5286a91a0040b4c7.title: Email Marketing Executive
5286a91a0040b4c7.description:
We are looking for an Email Marketing Executive with knowledge of e-commerce, online sales and marketing principles, to join our hardworking, fun and inclusive marketing team. To help look after the end-to-end process of building templates and creating/proofing content through to delivering our email marketing campaigns for our brand. Your focus will be on testing and analysing email performance and maximising engagement and conversions.
You will need to be able to use email service platforms with an understanding of both traditional and digital marketing. The successful applicant will be supported to learn and develop new skills, platforms and have the opportunity to challenge themselves with new tasks.
About Us
Established in 2002, ATD Travel Services operates a number of brands focused on the pre-purchase of attraction tickets, experiences and theme park hotels and packages. Our flagship consumer brand – AttractionTickets.com - operates from the UK, Ireland and Germany and is the leading broker for the major theme parks in each of those territories. Our trade brands are DoSomethingDifferent.com and ThemeParkBeds.com which sell via agents, operators and OTAs in the UK and Ireland.
We are passionate about service and our success is based on being the best in our sector in everything we do. We are an exciting, privately owned, financially secure and entrepreneurial company with ambitious plans for 2022 and beyond.
What’s in it for you?
A working culture that values your strengths, prioritises your personal development and does not micromanage. We trust our people to do their best for the company and our customers by Adding Happiness in everything they do. Whilst we run a serious business with sales of well over £100m, we don’t take ourselves too seriously and believe in kindness, honesty and having fun. You’ll be able to tap into a network of talented people and witness the development and roll out of new initiatives as we grow into more source markets and expand our product range.
Opportunities to learn are extensive and there is nothing we love more than a go getter. You will have the chance to travel and experience the amazing attractions that we sell.
What more?
Our founder and CEO also runs an in-house charity called Play It Forward (www.playit-forward.org). We run regular events such as quiz nights, cake sales and sports days to raise money for the charity. There is also an annual trip to Southern Zambia to see the education, nutrition and health projects that the charity operates.
For this role, we offer a hybrid working solution where you can work from our office in the centre of vibrant Brixton and from home
The main activities and responsibilities for this role are:-
To work with the Senior Email Marketing Specialist to create, plan and analyse performance of the email campaigns across our B2B and B2C brands.
To work closely with the Marketing Executives, Content team, Design team and external partners to meet the objectives of our email campaigns.
To support our Senior Email Marketing Specialist to deliver our regular email campaigns and lifecycle journeys as well as key partner dedicated campaigns within strict deadlines.
Continuously test, analyse and optimise campaign and channel performance and share results with the wider team and external partners.
Show a strong interest and understanding of our overall marketing strategy and activities across all channels.
To ensure that all customers are aware of any relevant special offers that we’re running and that we maximise the opportunity of each campaign through our email marketing.
To ensure that the brand distinction / positioning is maintained at all times.
Strategy
Help create and develop multiple email journeys based on customer booking history, demographics and behaviour.
To identify new opportunities to increase sales, improve customer service and inspire through email marketing.
To always look for new ways of growing and segmenting our email customer base.
Help develop and improve our browser and basket abandonment email triggers, making sure they’re providing us with the best ROI possible.
Building Campaigns
Use HTML/CSS and our modular templates to build emails. Basic understanding of HTML/CSS is required and training will be provided.
Create responsive, dynamic and personalised email campaigns with customers’ wants and needs always at the forefront.
Create content that inspires, educates and engages customers on our product offering and always promote the value of pre-purchasing.
Keep within ATD’s tone of voice and always proof content, making sure it is at the highest standard possible.
Work closely with the Conversion Rate Optimisation team to make sure email persuasion/urgency messaging continues on the website once a customer clicks through.
Produce personalised, real time content such as countdowns and product recommendation blocks using Fresh Relevance. (Previous experience with the platform or similar is an advantage but not essential as full training will be provided).
Always look for new and innovative ways to build email campaigns, testing different formats, content and imagery.
Delivering
Ensure that email campaigns are delivered on time, to the relevant audiences and are communicated within the wider business.
Deliver email campaigns up against strict and sometimes very tight deadlines.
Set up multiple trigger and recurring campaigns that are part of targeted customer journeys and always make sure these are kept up to date.
Analysis & Reporting
Help analyse the success of all email campaign formats, content and delivery to make sure we’re optimising our email performance.
Report analysis to the rest of the team and the wider business on the performance of the email marketing platform for each of the direct brands on a monthly basis.
Other
To help other colleagues as and when necessary to ensure that the operational objectives of the Company are met.
To partake in overseas travel where necessary. Job may involve travel to the USA / Europe.
To maintain a happy & positive approach at all times!
Salary range from £30,000 - £35,000 per annum dependent on experience.

fd48166b523327ea.title: EMEA Graphics Marketing Specialist
fd48166b523327ea.description:
Job Description
This is an exciting new role to drive marketing for Intel's growing line-up of graphics products.
Responsible for:
EMEA-wide marketing strategies, product positioning and messaging to deliver against business unit sales goals - this includes graphics in consumer markets as well as GPU for data center and AI.
Responsibilities can be in a wide variety of marketing areas including: brand marketing; assessment of potential markets; product life cycle planning; development of local Go-To-Market strategies; definition of promotional activities; event management (in-person, virtual and hybrid); and product launch.
You'll also need to manage a budget effectively, plan and execute media tactics that align and support the sales and marketing goals, collaborate with and influence HQ teams effectively and create local case studies and content.
You'll join a team of passionate professional marketers who are fun, frank and fair, and a company that offers great opportunities for growing your career.
Qualifications
+5 years experience with proven success in marketing, with successful planning, budgeting, and execution of multiple marketing campaigns
Deep understanding of B2C and B2B markets
Strong interest in new technologies
Entrepreneurial mindset, creativity and ability to challenge the status quo, while focusing on results to apply the test and learn that will help to build efficient marketing plans delivering business results
fantastic communication with strong interpersonal skills and strong ethics in order to facilitate cross team collaboration. We love agile, self-motivated, entrepreneurial, innovative and collaborative personalities
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects and manage expectations of all groups affected.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in relevant subject
5+ years experience in marketing
Fluency in English
Preferred Qualifications:
Fluency or proficiency in at least one other major European language would be an advantage.
Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research.
What We Offer:
At Intel, you come to work in a collaborative, supportive environment, where your equally brilliant colleagues will push you to be your best. There's no fear of failure-we know that's how innovation happens. And you'll never be bored.
We offer competitive benefits and pay, opportunities for professional development and the flexibility you need to achieve balance. Intel fosters a collaborative environment allowing the brightest minds in the world to come together to achieve exceptional results.
Inside this Business Group
Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.

71576d9d755bb941.title: Lead Strategic Marketing Specialist
71576d9d755bb941.description:
Would you like to shape our marketing & business strategy for the future of energy?
Would you like to make a difference to our analytic and operational processes?
Be part of a successful team
Consisting of 19 product lines, including 6 unique brands that provide distinct expertise to their customers' applications. Digital Solutions has deep domain expertise in oil & gas, power generation, renewable energy, automotive, electronics, aviation, and many other industries. We bring 120+ years of combined knowledge into every solution we deliver.
Partner with the best
The Lead Strategic Marketing Specialist is a key role in Digital Solutions’ HQ Marketing team, being the champion for the business’ long-term strategy and critical growth initiatives. You will be responsible for the company’s strategic planning process, including the business support, during strategy execution.
As Lead Strategic Marketing Specialist, you will be responsible for:
Supporting HQ’s strategic marketing team in key activities around market intelligence, competitive intelligence, customer intelligence & data analytics, and value proposition.
Supporting and providing the contents relevant for the Growth Strategy Plan (GSP) and annual operating plan with a sound business strategy based on market trends and competitive environment.
Leading market intelligence around macroeconomics, top 20 end-markets, and key technologies - provide market dynamics, trends, size (TAM/SAS), opportunities and risks to the business.
Leading yearly market size (SAS) review process, in coordination with regions and business units.
Leading competitive intelligence around top 10-15 competitors and supporting business units in developing their own intelligence while encouraging adoption of new intel online platform.
Supporting business units in developing business plans and entry strategies for new product introductions (NPIs) in existing and adjacencies markets as well as new white spaces.
Fuel your passion
To be successful in this role you will:
Have a Bachelor’s Degree in business, marketing or relevant field.
Have proven experience in a similar role.
Possess effective and professional verbal and written communication skills - both with internal and external customers.
Possess IT skills including MS Office and Outlook (SFDC a plus).
Work in a way that works for you
We recognise that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:
Working remotely from home or any other work location
Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit in everything in and work when you are the most productive
Working with us
Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.
Working for you
Our inventions have revolutionised energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritise rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:
Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
Comprehensive private medical care options
Safety net of life insurance and disability programs
Tailored financial programs
Additional elected or voluntary benefits
About Us:
With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we’re committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we’re always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.

Join Us:
Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.

Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

b19263a91d02bd46.title: Business Applications Technical Specialist - Retail
b19263a91d02bd46.description:
Microsoft is a company where passionate innovators come to collaborate, envision what can be, and take their careers to levels they cannot achieve anywhere else. This is a world of more possibilities, more innovation, more openness, and sky's-the-limit thinking - a cloud-enabled world.
At Microsoft we have unique capabilities to meet the needs of both individuals and organizations. We care deeply about taking our ideals and vision around the globe, and to make a difference in peoples' lives and organizations in all corners of the planet. Our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet.
Are you insatiably curious? Do you embrace uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from your mistakes? Do you collaborate well with others, knowing that better solutions come from working together? Do you stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve, and are you motivated every day to empower others to achieve more through technology and innovation? Are you ready to join the team that is at the leading edge of Innovation at Microsoft?
The reinvention of business processes is a growth engine for Microsoft cloud services. The mission of Microsoft Business Applications is to help our customers digitally transform their businesses to drive new sources of revenue, create new and engaging ways to serve their customers, and to transform the way in which their business runs driving new levels of profitability for their organization.
Are you ready to join a double-digit growth cloud business? Microsoft Business Applications cloud is recognized by analysts as a leader in the CRM, ERP and application platform space. Trusted by global businesses as their platform of choice, Microsoft Business Applications uniquely enables customers to optimize their operations, engage their customers, empower their people and transform their products. It’s a new data-driven world, and Microsoft is the only platform in the industry built from the ground up with data and intelligence at the center. Microsoft Business Application solutions include virtually unlimited data sources from customers’ applications including legacy, first and third-party, vendor, customer and many more. This unified approach to data and intelligence enables customers to make informed proactive business decisions with deep insights powered by AI and industry-leading analytics (Power BI) resulting in the following key customer benefits:
Create impact faster: Deliver more impact in less time by quickly deploying solutions, or augmenting existing ones, to enable teams to accelerate business results and increase time to value.
Break through barriers: Take a data-first approach with unified data that leverages Microsoft AI to deliver insights & actions that help create better customer experiences.
Adapt to anything: agility to react and respond to new business priorities, market conditions and customer opportunities with rapidly deployable solutions.
Innovate everywhere: Solve problems with powerful solutions only possible with the Microsoft Cloud enabling interoperable solutions across multiple lines of business.
Responsibilities
The Technical Specialist is a key member of the Business Applications sales pursuit team and is a strategic thinker, proactive problem solver, sales & technical roadblock resolver displaying a growth mindset with deep functional and technical knowledge in the workload.
The following are the role responsibilities for the Microsoft Business Applications Technical Specialist:
Lead with insight and curiosity
Lead with Industry experience and be curious in understanding your customers industry, strategy and uncovering their challenges
Assist Business Applications Sales Executive in Envisioning Solution
Assist Business Applications Specialists in delivering compelling solutions: in envisioning solution using ISV components, by assembling and collaborating with a technical pursuit team that includes partner and ISV resources and deliver compelling RFP/RFI responses.
Design Customer-centric Solution Aligned with Envisioned Solution & Business Value
Secure a customer agreement to a Solution Design built with alignment to the customer-agreed digital transformation journey by partnering with the technical pursuit team ensuring alignment to envisioned solution and business value.
Deliver a Customer-centric Demonstration
Receive a standing ovation by delivering a compelling solution demonstration emphasizing business value aligned to the designed solution.
Ensure demonstration follows Tell-Show-Vision model and has an end-to-end view building opportunities for seeding and expansion after initial sale.
Work with Customer Success/Partner Team on Deployment Plan
Assist Business Applications Specialists (if required)in reviewing licensing proposal. Collaborate with Customer Success team and Partner to ensure the customer agreed deployment plan maps to Key Performance Indicators(KPI)
We are looking for creative individuals, compelling storytellers who are able to create and contribute to marketing quality assets and industry propositions. Natural collaborator who will partner with teams internally and externally to drive results. Some who is able to identify and differentiate through business value selling. A thought leader and community contributor showcasing excellence in industry and technology innovation with key stakeholders and community groups.
Qualifications
Experience:
Applicable workload expertise with one or more of the following: technical presales, post-sales consulting or relevant company/customer IT application implementation or management
Driving and designing a solution strategy as part of the overall opportunity lifecycle
Extensive collaboration with technical pursuit teams designing cloud-based customer solutions
Success working with customers/stakeholders in presales or consulting engagements related to business applications workloads
Proven success demonstrating differentiated solution value and competitive advantage
Delivering customer-facing technical workload demonstrations to enterprise decision makers
Desirable but not required –workload certifications/degrees
Deep understanding of:
Business solutions(CRM)workload expertise in one or more of the following: Sales, Marketing, CDP, eCommerce. Low Code Platforms and how these solutions help customers achieve their desired business outcomes
Business value selling methodologies and practices mapped to customer persona pains/issues to uncover customer’s stated and unstated needs
Commercial cloud offerings, ideally Microsoft’s cloud platform,as well as competitive knowledge of other business applications solutions and related ecosystems
Desired skills:
Excellent presentation and communications skills across various customer stakeholders; experienced storyteller.
Customer-centric mindset with demonstrated passion for delivering customer value
Ability to bring innovative technical solution ideas to customer problems
Experienced problem solver able to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Growth mindset, insatiably curious, always learning and welcoming of challenges for the opportunity to grow
Industry experience in any of Retail, Travel & Transport, Hospitality, CPG industries
Bachelor’s degree or relevant work experience
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

4dcaf5a6090b5e4a.title: Email Marketing Intern
4dcaf5a6090b5e4a.description:
BAT is evolving at pace - truly like no other organisation.
To achieve the ambition, we have set for ourselves, we are looking for colleagues who are ready to live our ethos every day. Come be a part of this journey!
BAT UK IS LOOKING FOR AN CRM INTERN
FUNCTION: Marketing

ROLE POSITIONING AND OBJECTIVES
What are the key objectives and expectations from this role?

Reports to: Line Manager

WHAT YOU WILL BE ACCOUNTABLE FOR

Weekly email performance analysis as well as monthly competitor analysis

5453717125614369.title: Internal Communication Specialist
5453717125614369.description:
The Job on Offer

Capgemini Global Insights & Data business line is a market leader in the data, platform, and analytics across all regions and cross many sectors (including financial services, consumer products, manufacturing & life sciences). Our offerings include end-2-end data integration to cloud platform, complete suite of AI engineering capabilities and a category of sector-based advanced analytics / AI solutions.


Capgemini global Insights & Data business line requires an experienced Internal Communications Specialist who will be involved in all aspects of employee-focused communications, primarily storytelling by smart copy writing for the Insights & Data GBL (I&D). You will report to the People Communications Leader and will be part of the Global I&D M&C team.


This a permanent role that could be based either in the UK or India, where travel could be expected when safe to do so.
Your Role
Deliver engaging, high-quality copy and other relevant formats through an engaging and inspiring storytelling approach – relevant to the target audience.
Actively contribute into the internal communications strategy, plan and calendar supporting the business priorities of I&D, ensuring maximized information flow and engagement
Implement an “Hypermedia-First” principle across all internal GBL communication to maximize interest and engagement across target audiences and platforms (e.g., videos, infographics, podcasts, live-events).
Design, build and run internal campaigns – seamlessly working with I&D Marketing and in close collaboration with I&D Leadership, HR, and Portfolio.
Deliver the Internal Communications plan, pro-actively liaising with contributors, stakeholders, and subject matter experts
Support the planning, running and evaluation of global internal events (e.g., webinars, live webcasts, Yam Jams)
Be the webmaster for I&D Talent hub and relevant internal channels to keep them updated with latest news & information
Master and leverage all Group Communications tools, including social media tools with a proactive, innovative approach to test new ways of working.
Your Profile
Very high standards of both spoken and written American English
Experiences in global internal communication across regions and in a multi-cultural environment.
Strong skills and hands-on experiences in hypermedia (digital) communication strategy and execution
Strong project management and networking skills
Marketing & Communication skills, trends, and technologies
Education = Degree/Diploma in marketing, journalism, media studies or a related discipline
Working Flexibility

At Capgemini, we strive to deliver excellence for our clients whilst also creating an environment where our people can thrive, develop, and enjoy a positive work-life balance. Flexible working allows us to be agile in how we deliver to our clients and by offering more freedom in where and how our people work, contributes to a better employee experience.

All UK employees are eligible to request flexible working arrangements, which can be either informal or formal. Your manager will discuss your request with you and review it to ensure any arrangements work for you, your clients, your team, and our business.

About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of 270,000 team members in nearly 50 countries. With its strong 50 year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fuelled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported in 2020 global revenues of €16 billion.


Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

78cf1f6cd3a50fd4.title: EMEA Influencer Marketing Specialist
78cf1f6cd3a50fd4.description:
TINDER BACKGROUND
Tinder started on a college campus in 2012 and broke down the barriers - geographic, historic, cultural - that limit who we meet. We went from 1 swipe to 1 billion swipes a day, in 2 years. No technology grows that fast unless it fills a powerful, unmet human need. Today, Tinder is the world’s most popular app for meeting new people. The app is available in 190+ countries and 40+ languages, it’s been downloaded more than 450 million times and led to 65 billion matches, and is the highest-grossing non-gaming app globally.
BRAND MISSION
As the world becomes more “connected,” we have also become more isolated. At Tinder, we want to keep the magic of human connection alive because few things are more exciting than meeting someone new. Whether it’s a conversation, a date, hiking buddy, tour guide in a new city or something longer lasting, our connections make our lives richer and more interesting. Our goal is to bring more spontaneity into people’s lives and to open up a whole new world of possibilities with others.
This role in a nutshell:
You will be responsible for managing influencer, creator and celebrity relationships while supporting brand marketing campaigns for Tinder EMEA. This role is the right match and a brand new position that will suit a passionate, positively creative and motivated individual. One who will make data-led and insight-driven decisions to build our network of influencer and creator partners while ensuring brand equity is maintained. We’re now expanding our brand marketing efforts across EMEA to increase brand awareness. This role includes developing an influencer marketing function to assemble an ambassador (influencers + creators) network, attract new potential ambassadors and harness the increasing power of influencers and creators. Our team in France and Germany has established a thriving influencer + creator program in recent years. We have an opportunity to build on this success across EMEA and even globally! As the first hire into this new function, you will lead the development and execution of the influencer program. This role includes influencer recruitment, ongoing relationship management, briefing campaigns, reporting on performance, leading negotiations and managing payments.
A day in the life:
Building solid relationships with key influencers and creators – both new and existing – and negotiating rates and added value packages with them
Setting dynamic commission models to drive key metrics, customer segments and product categories
Developing and executing the influencer marketing strategy for EMEA whilst supporting local market overarching strategies
Developing content ideas alongside the Comms and Marketing teams to drive outreach and gifting campaigns around key cultural, brand launches and focuses within the marketing and product road map
Enlisting influencers and creators in our brand marketing calendar to amplify upcoming campaigns, product launches, social activity and events
Identifying and building relationships with prominent influencers, creators and thought leaders within the industry
Working closely with the Brand Alchemist to ensure influencers and creators adhere to brand guidelines and core processes to maintain brand equity
Supporting the local markets, Strategy team and Analytics team in developing reporting structures to evaluate Influencer performance
Budgeting and negotiating Influencer and creator agreements alongside the legal team
Supporting in ownership of the Influencer and creator budget for EMEA
Attending relevant events for networking and research purposes to be a thought leader for the functional within Tinder
Keeping ahead of the influencer landscape (e.g. tech, legislation) to ensure our activities remain best in class
Providing direct support to the Brand Alchemist and establishing activity-specific goals and actions from the Brand strategy for EMEA and making recommendations based on expertise
Researching and collating potential influencer, creator and celebrity partnerships and collaborations relevant to Gen-Z
Developing and presenting talent decks and content plans proactively and on a project-by-project basis
Capitalising on vital cultural moments, enlisting and briefing influencers and creators to jump in the conversation / react to moments
Cross-functional team working sessions with BD, Partnerships, Comms, Marketing, Legal, Product
Retaining competitive advantage by ensuring the Influencer Marketing strategy is well-positioned as a category and market leader
What are we looking for:
Minimum 2+ years (in-house or agency) within Influencer Marketing with a tech brand (preferred but not essential)
Previous experience in developing influencer marketing strategies for a brand(s)
High level of interest in Influencer Marketing and understanding of the online dating industry
Experience utilising influencer campaign management and reporting tools
Strong organisational skills with the ability to prioritise ruthlessly and focus on what matters
Natural communicator, able to form relationships with stakeholders at all levels (both internal and external)
Entrepreneurial spirit and the desire to continuously innovate to achieve great results
Skilled in developing long term strategic plans for influencer marketing and able to put plans into action
Experienced in handling conversations around contracts and negotiations
The hunger to make quick opportunistic wins and the patience to work long cycles
Experience in driving influencer relationships and long-term engagement
Ability to work to tight deadlines and juggle multiple projects at the same time
A natural networker comfortable attending events and communicating with potential celebrities, influencers and creators
A natural at writing creative briefs for influencers, creators, agencies, legal teams etc.
An individual who is enthusiastically curious about youth culture, technology, innovation and media
As part of our team, you’ll enjoy:
The hustle of a startup with the impact of a global business
Tremendous opportunity to solve some of the industry’s most exciting problems
Working with an outstanding team of intelligent, creative, fun and highly motivated people
A place where you can be your true authentic self
Comprehensive health coverage, competitive salary & bonus
At Tinder, we don’t just accept differences — we celebrate them, support them, and thrive on them for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. Tinder is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

c5d44b70f23c76cf.title: Head of Marketing
c5d44b70f23c76cf.description:
The Future Forest Company
Do you want the most meaningful job of your career? The Future Forest Company are on a mission to tackle the greatest challenge of our time: climate change. We are a fast-growing for-profit business that is already one of the biggest carbon removal companies in the world. But this is only the start - we have ambitious plans aligned with great funding, excellent people and an inclusive team. You too could make your mark and be part of something huge.
About the role
The Marketing Director will have responsibility for developing and delivering communications strategies for all growth projects, future transformation and change projects. This role will create and deliver effective PR and media relations strategies to enhance our profile and have significant experience of managing both proactive and reactive media relations, as well as being confident at managing crisis communications.
The main areas of responsibility include but not limited to:

Develop key customer personas based on the buying behaviours of large corporates who need to offset their carbon footprint
Establish and drive a strategic, multi-channel communications strategy.
Manage the communications budget, allocating resources strategically.
Identify PR opportunities and lead on major media campaigns
Define and shape the narrative around different carbon technologies and the brand
Manage presence at industry events, trade shows, and conferences
Responsible for a coherent and planned approach to producing external publications
Within an overall strategy for communications; research, write and publish news stories about the company and promote to key audiences
Moderation of the website, including: Serving as Editor, managing a moderation process which will include other users. Ensuring alignment with overall communications strategy Content creation
Being a specialist advisory to internal departments on how to carry out web projects and how this fits in with overall marketing aims Create and curate digital content including writing, digital photography and video

Develop and deliver a PR strategy with the agency, ensuring alignment between the agency and FFC vision and values
Responsible for the day to day management of the contract and arrangements with the PR agency
Develop and manage media relations in collaboration with the PR agency
Promote and be a brand advocate and influence the business to align


About you:
You will have strong planning and project management skills, and a good understanding and experience of using digital communications and developing digital platforms is also essential
Essential:

Strong leadership and team management/development experience
Strong brand management experience, specifically in developing and launching new brands
Strong experience in effectively managing a B2B marketing team
Considerable line management and/ or project management experience and of working strategically within a communications role
An ability to build trust with, and influence, senior internal stakeholders
Able to deliver transformation and change programmes, with strong planning and project management skills
Experience of managing both proactive and reactive media relations
Advanced communication and collaboration skills across a range of audiences
Relationship management skills to facilitate the buy-in and progress of the communications strategy across the range of parties involved
Knowledge and experience of managing digital content management systems.
Experience with social media platforms and management suites.
Experience of writing, editing and producing written communications for targeted audiences.
Degree required (preferably in mass communications, marketing, journalism, public relations or related field)
Solid professional experience required including experience producing digital content and managing social accounts for a small to medium sized organisation.
Good eye for design and a demonstrable understanding of targeting different audiences and conveying messages effectively across a range of communications channels

3126ddbec7033a9b.title: Content Strategy Specialist (UK)
3126ddbec7033a9b.description:
About The Association
Combining the strengths of the American Institute of CPAs and the Chartered Institute of Management Accountants, we empower the world’s most highly-skilled accountants – CPAs and CGMA designation holders – with the knowledge, insight and foresight to meet today’s demands and tomorrow’s challenges. We drive a dynamic accounting profession that works every day to build trust, create opportunity and grow prosperity worldwide.
Summary of Role
Day to day support of content strategy team, including assisting across all phases of development of delivery plans; manage handoffs across content supply chain; manage smaller requests that come into the system; scheduling.
Accountabilities & Responsibilities
Assist content strategy team in supporting value proposition leads, providing day-to-day updates an dinformation as needed to keep projects on track and leads informed
Manage the delivery of the content plan hand off to the production process, keeping the senior content strategists and value proposition squad leaders updated on performance
Perform content audits, gap assessments and generate new ideas
Manage templates
Research and best practices monitoring support
Provide regular reporting and reviews to allow monitoring with internal stakeholders ensuring partner’s objectives are met and improvements made.
Monitor content performance in alignment with value proposition and update senior content strategist
Schedule meetings for project initiation, project check ins and performance, preparing agendas, all meeting materias and other documents
Support the writing of content plans as needed by the content strategists
Assist in assessing content objects for quality and effectiveness

Supervisory Responsibilities
None

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Required
Strategic thinking
Knowledge of content marketing, production, dissemination and distribution techniques and methods.
Knowledge of content lifecycle across the planning, creation, distribution, and measurement for all major content types
Total knowledge of all content objects and their ongoing performance
Project management skills
Strong communication (verbal and written) and organizational skills.
Strong collaboration skills; liaise with subject matter experts and staekholders to inform content strategy
Ability to synthesize and distill complex information into easy-to-understand material
Knowledge of agile practices
Knowledge of matrix management
Required Experience, Qualifications & Education
Bachelor’s Degree
Minimum 3 years in marketing, digital content management, digital content development or related field
Experience in user centered content design
Experience with multiple forms of content channels and deliverables, i.e. social media, blogs, videos, working with search engine optimization (SEO), etc.

Preferred Experience, Qualifications & Education
Experience with professional associations management and working through governance issues

Why Work for Us?
At The Association, you are part of a global, diverse and talented group of colleagues. You have opportunities to innovate and collaborate in a leading organization that impacts individuals and businesses. You’ll have opportunities to progress while enjoying an exciting work environment that supports and celebrates individual achievement, development and professional satisfaction.
Together, we will lead the most influential body of professional accountants and create the future of the global accounting profession.
We offer competitive benefits, PTO, flexible working principles, and a supportive, collaborative team environment.

7392bfe056862feb.title: Regulatory Affairs Specialist
7392bfe056862feb.description:
Introduction to role
The successful candidate will be joining the Regulatory Affairs & Pharmacovigilance Directorate, who are responsible for Regulatory Affairs, Market Access, Pharmacovigilance and Medical Information including management of Porton Biopharma’s licenses and marketing authorisations. As a Regulatory Affairs Specialist for Porton Biopharma, the post holder will take a leading role in all regulatory activities in relation to marketing authorisation applications, labelling activities, clinical trials applications, variations, and other regulatory submissions. This will include preparation and review of submissions and associated technical documents, and also acting as the Regulatory team representative on project teams. In addition, review of change controls from a regulatory perspective will be required.
Key Responsibilities
Generate, review, and otherwise contribute to submissions required for filings to regulatory authorities, including labelling activities
Act as the Regulatory representative on project teams and provide appropriate input, advice, and guidance to those teams
Contribute to the review of change controls from a regulatory perspective
Contribute to project/programme activities to ensure that projects meet established scientific, business, and other targets
Personal Specification
Have current right to work in the UK.
Degree in life sciences, chemistry, or pharmacy
Excellent communication skills at all levels.
Evidence of Continuing Professional Development
More than 5 years’ experience in the pharmaceutical industry, and more than 3 years’ experience in Regulatory Affairs
Strong IT skills, always being ahead of new technologies
Energetic, highly motivated, with an enquiring mind and passion for excellence and innovation in pursuit of business growth and success
Ability to work under pressure, consistently meeting tight deadlines and able to offer practical solutions

cb5a3c7924868a74.title: Investment Marketing Specialist
cb5a3c7924868a74.description:
Develops marketing plans for competitive Vanguard products that contribute to key business priorities and desired outcomes.
As part of the new Investment Marketing team you will be responsible for ensuring more investors find success with Vanguard’s world-class investment management capabilities and products. Your role will be to ensure products and capabilities are clearly described, well positioned and adequately supported throughout the sales funnel, and across market cycles and distribution channels.
The ideal candidate will have strong communication & marketing (positioning) skills, relationship management and the ability to persuade and influence across multiple stakeholders. You will have experience promoting products in both the face-to-face and digital environment.
This is a truly collaborative role that intersects across product research and development, channel marketing, editorial, and sales. Turn your passion for marketing and investment products into a world of opportunity at Vanguard!
In this role, you will:
Develop and manage marketing activity to drive the health and commercial success of Vanguard’s funds, ETFs and model portfolios.
Independently initiate and/or lead investment marketing programs, initiatives, promotions, or research projects to improve the positioning and uptake of your designated products.
Work with editorial, digital and production teams to create new marketing documents, insights, sales materials, communications and digital journeys to ensure products are supported throughout the sales funnel in both face-to-face and online channels.
Ensure accurate and timely quarterly reporting of performance and commentary for your product area, as well as managing other periodic updates.
Support the launch of new products with clear positioning and key take-to-market collateral, announcements, and training materials.
Create materials to educate crew and clients on the features, benefits, and associated messaging for all products and ensure these are consistently applied across all client segments.
Work with the channel marketing and distribution functions to ensure that product materials and insights are used effectively based on Seismic and web data.
Manage legal, compliance and subject matter expert signoffs to ensure materials are compliant and appropriate.
What it takes
Minimum 5 years related work experience in asset management
Undergraduate degree in Marketing or equivalent experience required.
An ideal candidate will have experience in strategic product positioning and communication with strong written communication and presentation skills.
Experience of index funds & ETFs, multi-asset, model portfolios, active funds or ESG required
Experience in delivering cross-departmental projects with strong project management skills.
Strong interpersonal communication skills (assertive, consensus building). Ability to persuade and influence stakeholders to achieve a coordinated process with optimal outcomes.
Experience with financial advisor and wholesale investment professionals an advantage.
German or Italian language an advantage but not mandatory
Special Factors
Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.
About Vanguard
We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.
For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader.
We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.
Inclusion at Vanguard
Vanguard’s continued dedication to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”
We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.
When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.
Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.
Future of Work
During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely.
As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.
When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).
The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.

f3dbb39e72f2a7bd.description: Your imagination. Your ambition. Your Creativity. At Shields, there are no boundaries to your potential and the impact you can make for our Brand. c8f07c97ab1f8898.title: Marketing Specialist Placement Year (Start: July 2022)
c8f07c97ab1f8898.description:
Are you up for an epic journey with one of the world’s most influential tech brands and award-winning marketing campaigns?
Across blended reality technology, immersive computing, commercial PCs, tablets, notebooks, printing, and leading innovation in 3D printing that will revolutionize the manufacturing industry like never before, we engineer experiences that amaze.
We are seeking ambitious students to join our Marketing Internship Programme and win alongside our remarkable team. Somebody who is ready to face challenges and most importantly learn, develop and grow within business.
This is a placement year opportunity which will take place for 13 months, from July 1st 2020 until July 30th 2021. We have roles within:
Digital Marketing
Business Marketing
Marketing Operations
Channel Marketing
Events Management
For more information on the key responsibilities and tasks that you will encounter if successful, please refer to the bullet points below.
Responsibilities:
Support and run marketing campaigns.
Provide operational support for all marketing divisions.
Create material to facilitate sales departments.
Manage assets and improve online executions.
Manage UK & Ireland social media accounts.
Organise and host internal, partner and client events.
Education Required:
To be eligible for our Internship Programme you must currently be an undergraduate student at a University in the United Kingdom.
You must be enrolled into a degree which allows you to work for a year in industry as a placement year.
Preferred degrees, but not essential, include Marketing, Communications and Business Management related courses.
Over 13 months, we’ll use our powers to give you a real experience of the most iconic technology global company, how to create, execute and celebrate business wins. Joining the team, you may play a role in managing budgets for social media campaigns, running cooperation with media partners and assisting with video adverts on new HP products. You will become the Marketing Guru everyone would want to have on their side.
Beyond that, you will train, practice and have fun, alongside your intern peers, HP’s best professionals, learning also from senior managers that can help you take your career forward. Internal global competitions and games will expand your international network and cross-cultural experience.
At HP, we believe in the power of ideas. And we believe that ideas thrive best in a culture of teamwork. We trust anything can be achieved if you really believe in it, and we will invest in your ideas to change lives and the way people work.
At HP, the future is yours to create.
About HP


You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.


HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.


Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

ac00d431a4dacd34.title: Marketing Specialist - 1 year contract
ac00d431a4dacd34.description:
Company: FedEx Express EU
Job Requisition Number: RC458716
Locations:
Atherstone Headquarters
Atherstone, United Kingdom

Time Type: Part Time
Scheduled weekly Hours: 18.75
Worker Type: Temporary
Posting Date: 28-February-2022
Closing Date: 13-March-2022
Job Family: FXE-EU: Marketing Specialist (ID)
Position Summary:
Hours: 18.75 per week.
Contract: Temporary - 12 months.

Every day at FedEx, over 450,000 team members, over 180,000 vehicles, and over 650 aircraft serve millions of people in 220+ countries and territories around the globe. Our work is more than the delivery of packages; we connect both our customers and our team members to solutions and possibilities. Join us in this effort, and discover how we equip and empower our people to deliver exceptional experiences and outstanding service.

As a FedEx Marketing Specialist you will manage local and centrally driven marketing activities and develop and deliver an on-going activity plan that ensures revenue and volume goals are achieved.

Key responsibilities:
Lead the development and implementation of local marketing projects and campaigns.

Provide subject matter expertise upon content development, marketing communication, brand management, event and hospitality management, digital automation and e-commerce.

In co-ordination with communications deliver a customer communication programme that addresses the needs of our key audiences.

Develop and deliver the marketing activity plan that will inform and maximise revenue obtained from each key customer group.

Create a multi sales channel framework of appealing and engaging online content.

Manage the event calendar and oversee event planning and delivery from end to end, ensuring all contributors collaborate towards the delivery of high-quality events.

Optimise the use of marketing agencies by ensuring that the work they produce is of the desired quality, meets the objectives set, and is delivered within corporate guidelines.
The ideal candidate will have:

Degree in Marketing, Communication, or a related field is preferred.

Significant experience in Marketing and Online-Marketing.

Demonstrated experience of project and event management.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Good vendor management skills.

Ability to work independently.

Good PC & Microsoft office skills (especially PowerPoint and Excel).
What we offer:

FedEx offers employees a competitive benefits and reward package including a wide array of formal training and on the job learning opportunities.

FedEx is one of the most admired companies and trusted brands year after year

In joining FedEx, every team member commits to our Purple Promise — to make every FedEx experience outstanding—for the customer and for our fellow team members.

Being a part of FedEx means you are a part of a global network of solutions that only continues to strengthen its capability to deliver what our customers need anytime, anywhere.
FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all
Our Company
FedEx Express is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.
Our Philosophy
The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.
Our Culture
Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

7ddbe8d8a110953e.title: Brand Manager - Vaccines
7ddbe8d8a110953e.description:
Brand Manager - Vaccines
London
Competitive Salary & Benefits
Closing Date: 14th March 2022
Do you have expertise in, and passion for implementing a brand stategy? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact the Vaccines sector in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you!
AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven BioPharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world's most serious disease. But we're more than one of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies.
We are on a journey to bring life-saving medicines to patients. Our role in contributing to decreasing mortality rates globally is clear – shaping the future by spotting a scientifically-led commercial opportunity and acting now to operationalise and scale it.
Our UK Marketing Company (AZUK ) is responsible for the marketing of our medicines in the UK. Here you'll also find colleagues from AstraZeneca's corporate functions and our European and International regions' sales and marketing teams As a member of the Association of the British Pharmaceutical Industry (ABPI), all of our sales, marketing and communications activities are subject to the ABPI Code of Practice. Are you looking for an exciting role within an outstanding Marketing team? Then please read on and apply.
What you’ll do
You'll join a passionate and talented marketing team supporting the development and implementation of the UK vaccines brand campaign, through branded and non-branded materials that are designed for delivery through remote and digital channels.;Working with key clinical advocates including Specialists, and lead GPs to ensure implementation of brand strategyCollaborating with key partners including area lead market, medical teams, cross functional team, channels and sales teams to implement brand campaignsDelivering key marketing campaign items e.g. promotional campaign material, remote detail material, service items, training support, meetings support material, materials development, approval, production and distribution.
Assessment of brand deliverables to understand what had worked well and what has not
Leads on market research to get insights to understand key opportunities
Essential skills and experience:
Significant pharmaceutical commercial experience with a strong performance track record
Strong sales/marketing leadership with a successful track record of growing market share
Creative marketing capabilities together with rigorous commercial business sense
It is mandatory for the performance of this role that you achieve nominated signatory status within 18 months of commencing the role. You are also required to pass re-validation testing every 12 – 24 months or as requested
Desirable:
Good experience of the UK market, with its unique NHS system
Experience within Vaccine space
Why AstraZeneca?
At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare.
So, what’s next?
If you are inspired by the possibilities of science to make a difference and ready to discover what you can do by joining us on this exciting journey and believe you can contribute to this bold ambition – join us!
Where can I find out more?
Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn
Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook
Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram

f180ab375a3eadde.title: Marketing Executive
f180ab375a3eadde.description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a Marketing Executive to join the team and support our growing business. Reporting to the Marketing Manager, the Marketing Executive will be play a major part in helping deliver the marketing strategy and ongoing development of Priory’s healthcare and adult care service range.
This role is based at our Cheadle offices.
Marketing Executive duties include but are not limited to:
Ensure the effective implementation of national, regional and local multi-channel marketing campaigns, including developing end-to-end email communications to our target audiences. This will involve working closely with specialist colleagues from within marketing, business development and site level leaders, as required.
Identify areas of improvement and synergy across all marketing platforms supporting Priory locations, and deliver actionable plans to drive awareness, increase engagement and improve conversation for the Priory healthcare and adult care divisions.
Support the co-ordination and development of national, regional and local marketing collateral across the two divisions, along with associated website copy changes.
Development of engaging online content for promotion to key audiences, including support with video production and graphics.
Report and manage the performance of campaigns and marketing activity, and make recommendations to further develop our approach, and continually improve ROI.
To support the business development team in their external discussions through the provision of key sales support tools.
Liaise with an external designer and in-house digital team, to ensure information is up-to-date across the different online and offline channels.
Liaise across the Priory supplier network e.g. marketing agencies, printers and designers, to ensure effective, timely and costly delivery of requirements.
Support with the delivery of the healthcare and adult care marketing activity schedule, ensuring timely and effective implementation.
Build relationships with key internal stakeholders, including across key Priory sites and the business development team.
To support other Priory Marketing activity requirements as necessary

What we would like from the Marketing Executive:
A good education, ideally to degree level or the holder having a CIM Professional Diploma in Marketing is required
A good understanding of the key principles of marketing, particularly email marketing, both in terms of campaign development and execution.
Excellent command of English with the ability to develop effective and compelling copy is essential.
A strategic, commercially aware and creative mind set
Excellent organisational skills, the ability to multitask and deliver simultaneous projects on time
Comfortable working with senior colleagues across the business and demonstrate excellent networking and stakeholder management skills.
Experience of working with Business Development / Sales teams, in a supporting capacity to assist them with their marketing needs

Further details can be found on the attached job description.
What we would like to give you:
25 days annual leave + bank holidays
Online benefits and cash back rewards
Cycle to work scheme (qualifying period)
Technology Scheme (qualifying period)
Employee Referral Scheme
SMART Pension
Access to Career Pathways scheme

Please take the time to familiarise yourself with the attached job description prior to making an application.
We reserve the right to close this advert early if we find a suitable candidate.
Disclosure
All roles will be subject to a successful disclosure at an appropriate level from the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS), Access NI or Disclosure Scotland. We are an equal opportunities employer. Priory will cover the cost of a DBS.

314a33fac81da40a.title: Production Coordinator
314a33fac81da40a.description:
Launched in March 2020, Disney+ is an SVOD service curated to appeal to wide audiences. The portfolio of content covers series and movies across a selection of brands, that range from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars to Fox & National Geographic. Within the service, there is the opportunity to stream the latest blockbuster movies through to nostalgia driven series from the 1980s and beyond. All content is available to be streamed on multiple devices and in an on-demand manner that reflects the subscriber’s expectations.

Disney+ is an important strategic priority for the company, this role will give the successful candidate the opportunity to drive growth of the service across Europe.

The Production Coordinator will support & co-ordinate the production management aspect of projects, working with Director/s of Production Management, Production Execs, Production Coordinators and the needs of the wider team. The role will provide internal production co-ordination support for scripted projects both in development and those that are commissioned. The post will need to carry out research work as requested related to R&D of potential projects, as well as mentor and train up Production Intern/s as assigned.

The successful candidate will be responsible for the overseeing of the portfolio of original scripted production shows, throughout all key stages of development / greenlight / pre-production / filming / delivery / wrap & overseeing contractual budget, timeline & technical quality of all series.

Although this role primarily will focus on UK productions, admin support and communication with other European Disney hubs may be required.

The candidate will interact and provide support for producers directly, as well as liaise with Disney counterparts, specialists & partners both internally and externally. Specifically, the Production Coordinator will need to interface with Disney stakeholders to facilitate updates on productions and manage access to assets for Postproduction and mastering, PR / Marketing / Social Media / Talent management (adults and minors) and approved platforms.

Working with the Production Assistant, the candidate will need to maintain trackers and have good working knowledge of production software’s such as Pix, Scenechronize and Smartsheet, to provide updates and training to production companies.

Responsibilities :

Maintain regular communication with production companies, and vendors who are creating Disney+ content – 30%
Maintain daily communication with Disney+ stakeholders regarding the status of projects and sharing of content and updates – 30%
Working with the Production Assistant in maintaining internal and external handbooks and workflows – 20%
Working to assist local markets with questions, and communicate new and updated templates/workflows/handbooks- 10%
Booking Disney Staff travel and producing travel call sheets/travel packs- 10%

Basic Qualifications :

Experience working within the scripted production space, having had experience during prep, shoot, post and delivery stages.
Extensive knowledge and understanding of Production Management and production processes, including the postproduction workflow.
Knowledge and hands on experience using production tools such as such as PIX’s, Scenechronize and Smartsheet.
Experience work with minors in production and the licensing process for UK and overseas.
Experienced in role for filming on location and studios (Overseas work extremely beneficial).
Proficient in Keynote (for Mac) and Microsoft Office (including Excel, Word and PowerPoint).
Good understanding of health & safety in production and the risk assessment process.
Good understanding of production insurance requirements & risk assessments.
Understanding of music reporting requirements (Disney use Sound mouse) and the rights clearance process.
Comprehending the significance of reading schedules, daily production reports, call sheets, post schedules.
Arranging location travel requirements for PM and executive leads.

ce3706576f307c50.title: Content Marketing Specialist (Email)
ce3706576f307c50.description: What started as the result of a hackathon in 2014 is now the world’s #1 Instagram marketing platform. Later was built on the idea that social media management should be easy, quick, and affordable. Our mission is to help small businesses and entrepreneurs create and grow their businesses online. Six years and millions of users later, we’re still going strong.We’re looking for people who can help us build something great for our customers — from content writers, designers to developers. So if you’re the kind of person who really cares about making something meaningful, then keep reading.*Our Values*Our core cultural values are manifested in our practices and processes every day. We highly value transparency and fairness in everything we do. We look for people who like to move quickly, are ambitious yet humble, and have a great sense of humor. If you have a mischievous spark of fun, that’s even better.*What you will be doing*Later is the all-in-one social marketing platform for the top social networks.Later is looking for an excellent communicator and strategic thinker to join our content marketing team as a Content Marketing Specialist dedicated to our email channel.If you have strong writing skills, a drive to build an online community through email, and a deep understanding of how to optimize email strategy, this is the job for you!The Later team has grown immensely in the last year, and we’re looking for someone to help scale our newsletter and email channel with awesome, relevant, and educational content. We’re looking for someone who can communicate the value of social media to our audience, promote our Later library of online articles and resources, and use engaging copy to convert newsletter readers into loyal Later customers.Part of the Content team and reporting to the Editorial Manager, the Content Marketing Specialist (Email) will plan, create, and edit engaging newsletters for the Later audience.Later’s bi-weekly newsletter has an audience of over 1.5M dedicated readers, who rely on our content to help build their social strategy. Your role will require you to take the newsletter strategy to the next level, build a hyper-engaged email community, and deliver best in class content as part of the wider marketing strategy.You will also be responsible for strategically building conversion-orientated email campaigns to help reach Later’s traffic and conversion goals. As part of the role, you will be creating content for different email segments that support specific goals. You will also look at historic email performance to make data-driven content strategy recommendations.This is a great growth opportunity for a strategic thinker with strong writing and email marketing skills who is looking to gain experience in content marketing.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and own the execution of Later’s newsletter strategyCreate engaging email content for our Newsletter marketing, and own the copy creation of email nurture funnels for wider marketing tacticsWork closely with the Editorial Manager to connect with audiences with timely and topical content based on the Content team’s production calendarCollaborate with wider marketing teams to communicate other business priorities (eg. live events, product launches etc) with our newsletter audiencePartner closely with the Email Marketing team to execute lead nurture and wider email marketing campaignsDevelop personalised content that speaks to core Later users for segmented audiencesLead the creative briefing process for newsletter marketingWorks closely with the Creative Team to ensure smooth and timely delivery of email assetsCoordinates with Email & Editorial team leads on Newsletter Content Calendar executionTest, QA, and optimise Newsletter Campaigns ensuring communications to our audiences are on-brand, relevant and informative.Build detailed reports on Newsletter performance and present learnings to Editorial Manager, and senior managers and stakeholders.Supports Email, Content Marketing and wider Marketing teams with key projects to drive business objectivesAbout You3+ years of experience creating, writing, editing and testing engaging email marketing content (newsletters, email campaigns, nurture funnels etc)You have a strong and strategic understanding of email marketing and how to use it to grow an online community and reach traffic and conversion goals.You have a solid understanding of social media marketing and know how to translate detailed information into bite-sized copy suitable for email audiences.You are quietly obsessed with email marketing best practices and have a hunger to test and analyse content performanceYou are able to juggle multiple tasks to keep on top of a busy content calendar and meet deadlinesYou are a creative thinker who is comfortable working both independently and in a team environment.You embrace feedback and have a constant desire to learn and improveHow small businesses use social media is your jam - you love to see SMBs and creators grow in social and you’re quick to spot a new trend or growth tactic on email and socialBonus if you have experience writing for SaaS companies!How to ApplyWe want to see your awesome email marketing in action, so please apply with your resume and links to various writing samples or your online portfolio.We are looking for a strategic, conversion-oriented email content marketer, so please try to include those types of examples.A Note About Later’s Remote CultureOur marketing team is primarily remote, with team members working in California, Florida, Vancouver, Toronto, London, Singapore, and Dublin.For this role, we will only be hiring within Later’s hubs of Toronto, or London, UK. Your manager will be based in London, UK.We have a Later HQ in Vancouver, Canada but due to COVID-19 restrictions, the entire company will be working remotely so you should be comfortable communicating with your team over Slack and video calls. By the end of 2022, our goal is to move to a hybrid working model to offer the flexibility of working remotely from a hub city and connecting in person.*Culture/Benefits*We are passionate about learning and development, providing opportunities through lunch and learns, training and workshops. We also provide each employee with a $3000 per year Education & Conference budget.We provide our employees with a monthly Wellness Spending Account, to help cover costs related to fitness equipment, personal training, gym memberships, or health and wellness practitioners.We provide our team with a generous technology bonus and provide the tools you need to succeed in your role.We offer a comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, vision, and an Employee and Family Assistance Program to support the wellbeing of you and your family.We offer flexible working hours & schedules so you can work around school and home commitments.We offer parental leave top-ups, family forming support, and a life-transitions program to ensure you and your family are well supported when returning to workWe provide a variety of workshops, meditation, and yoga at our monthly Wellness Wednesday events to help our team perform at their best.All departments have quarterly department team building activitiesWe fly all employees in or out to join us at our fun-filled annual company retreat.Later values diversity of thought; we are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability, or age.Job Type: Full-time
