2d08a7e1cbaa6ee3.title: Marketing Technology Specialist
2d08a7e1cbaa6ee3.description:
Since the year 2000, OEC has grown globally to more than 1,000 employees with a double-digit revenue increase nearly every year. We provide a lively culture, employee rewards and recognition, and the opportunity to develop and implement innovative technology solutions.

Job Summary:
Combines technology with marketing skills to create a better process for ensuring marketing strategies are in line with our trade clients overarching goals.

Key Responsibilities:

Campaign integration activities to ensure correct synchronizing and routing of leads and contacts. between Marketing Automation platform and CRM.
Devising and optimising campaign canvases and logic to align with nurture goals.
Assist in the technical side of data standardization, automation and orchestration to improve segmentation and data flows.
Integration of new platforms to provide added insights to marketers and optimise campaign performance.
Managing lead flows, alignment and assignment to Business Development Rep and Team Members.
Management and optimization of the EMEA Marketing organisation budgeting tool.
Documentation of processes.

Education:
An undergraduate degree from an accredited college or university with a focus in marketing, communications, or related discipline; or in the absence of a degree, directly related job experience in marketing analysis and strategy, where several years and proven knowledge may offset the degree requirement.

Experience, Skills and Key Competencies:

Up to 5 years’ experience managing MarTech tools and platforms.
HTML / CSS / Javascript / MongoDB knowledge ideal.
APIs / Servers / Databases experience.
Risk and opportunity recognition and solution creation abilities.
Self-motivated, positive attitude, strong work ethic, excellent organisation and ability to build cross functional relationships.
Essential experience with Hubspot or similar (Hubspot Certification is a plus).
PPC ad network implementation and planning.
Marketing Automation campaign implementation and planning is desirable.
Knowledge and experience of data integration, standardisation and orchestration platforms – with preference for Data Studio.
Strong Excel skills.
Experience of web analytics, as well as reporting experience.
Flexibility and adaptability to work on varied projects, interacting with different teams and in different environments, and the ability to prioritise.

Please note CV's will be kept for up to one year.

We have updated our Privacy Policy to comply with the new European Union data protection law. Please note that OEC is a US-based company, as such, your personal information supplied during the job application process may be sent to the US. By applying for this role with one of the companies in the OEC Group, you are consenting to the processing and retention of your personal data in accordance with the company’s data protection policies. Please click here to refer to our Candidate Privacy Policy for more information.

557c01e21c999400.title: Digital Marketing Manager
557c01e21c999400.description:

4 ½ -day Week (half day Friday), Hybrid working and an Employee Ownership Scheme.

Experience in strategizing and developing the vision for business growth.

Experience with CRM systems such as Salesforce for example.

58abf133b00e6924.title: Director of Corporate Affairs and Marketing
58abf133b00e6924.description: Job title: Director of Corporate Affairs and MarketingLocation:  Glasgow with home working optionsSalary: CompetitiveHours: Full time with flexible working options consideredStatus: PermanentJob ref number: R00218Closing date: 06 March 2022We’re seeking a bold and brilliant communications and marketing specialist with a passion for the public sector to enhance our brand, increase our visibility and promote our organisation with the same sparkling creativity and innovation that is so abundant in the businesses we support.As Director of Corporate Affairs and Marketing, you'll be a visionary leader and communicator who is as comfortable strategising on campaigns and messaging as you are networking and liaising with politicians, the media and key stakeholders. Under your guidance, we'll have a vibrant and effective internal and external communications strategy.The post reaches across Scottish Enterprise and beyond. It requires the post-holder to build relationships and influence across domestic and international Scottish Enterprise teams and across organisations. This includes, but is not limited to, the Executive Leadership Team (ELT), the Board, Scottish Government ministers and senior officials, enterprise and skills agencies, and Brand Scotland.Leading a 50-strong team across Corporate Affairs, Marketing and Employee Communications, you'll support the development of a positive organisational culture where excellent ideas have the space to flourish. The entrepreneurial spirit of the talented businesses we work with will inspire you to take brave, insight-driven and evidence-led decisions to champion Scottish Enterprise. You'll also manage, coach and lead your direct reports to do the same.This is a highly specialised and unique leadership role, so we’re seeking someone with a deep understanding and experience of using internal and external communications and marketing to build an organisation’s reputation and brand. You’ll have experience of working in or closely with the UK or Scottish Governments, a recognised professional qualification in communications and/or marketing, and strong political acumen and policy antenna for maximising marketing and communications opportunities.A well-practiced leader, your coaching, mentoring and motivational skills will be finely tuned to encourage dynamic thinking and exceptional performance in those who work with you.Find out moreFor further information or for a confidential conversation, contact our recruitment partner Badenoch + Clark Executive on +44 (0)141 220 6460 or email ScotlandExecutive@badenochandclark.comYou can learn more about the role by visiting our dedicated recruitment website.How to applyTo apply for this post, please send your tailored CV by email, highlighting in the subject heading Director of Marketing and Corporate Affairs, to scotlandexecutive@badenochandclark.comClosing date for applicationMidnight Sunday 6 March 2022.Our valuesBeing part of Scottish Enterprise means being open to new ideas and trying different ways of working. We support each other to reach our full potential. We celebrate shared success and learn together when things don’t go so well. And we always treat each other fairly, with respect and understanding. Together, we are the difference.Apply now to keep building your future with usAt Scottish Enterprise, we’re proud to celebrate difference. Diversity of experience and thought is vital to the success of our vision for the future of every community across Scotland. c1f3595860f49a97.title: Digital Sales & Marketing Intern
c1f3595860f49a97.description:
About You
You want to develop the required skills for Digital Marketing (Search, Social, Commerce)
You are eager, proactive and have strong skills in digital, verbal and written communication
You are curious, a self-starter, and keen to learn and develop new relationships
You are a team player and dedicated to working hard
The Role
For our fast-growing international Incubeta Maze-One team, we are looking for an intern who wants to learn more about sales and e-commerce on marketplaces such as Amazon.
Marketplaces like Amazon have been growing quickly and can no longer be ignored in the daily lives of consumers. Incubeta Maze-One ensures that Brands from a broad spectrum of product categories can act optimally to this. During your internship you will learn all the intricate details of how marketplaces like Amazon function. You will assist the account team in developing and delivering customer solutions. As a Sales & Marketing Intern, you will be part of a team of experienced online Marketplace Specialists.
Alongside the Account Management you will focus on the relationship management of the customers of Incubeta Maze-One. Additionally, you will be expected to engage in the process of identifying and generating new business leads and contribute to winning new customers. Consequently, you will learn and see how a young start-up grows and becomes successful from winning, managing and retaining client business.
Key activities:
Learn about the opportunities that exist with marketplaces like Amazon and translate this into concrete customer solutions
Proactively identify new business opportunities to gain new customers
Participate in the weekly team meetings, where existing customer accounts and current tasks are discussed and established upon
Using Data tools we have, provide feedback to the team with your insights and your findings so we can service our clients even better
Contribute to the weekly and monthly reports of the results we deliver to customers
Assist the team in making presentations for customers
Provide input, data and research to the Lead generation process
You will of course be well assisted and guided in the above activities.
What we offer
You will have the opportunity to do an internship in one of the fastest-growing global digital marketing agencies that is also one of the first to specialize in e-commerce marketplaces like Amazon
You will work on some blue-chip Brands such as BrewDog, Solgar and Marks&Spencer and develop yourself every day
You will also be given the time to carry out any continuous Study assignments
In these times, your place of work is flexible, and the teamwork a minimum two days a week from our lovely new offices in Shoreditch, a dynamic and inspiring environment, as well as at home if practical
We pride ourselves on our flat organizational structure that ensures open communication and short lines of communication
About Us
Incubeta UK is an award winning digital marketing group with over fifteen years of experience.
We are ranked as one of Campaign magazine's Best Companies to work for in 2021
We are part of a global business, based in Old Street, London, with two US offices and locations all over the world.
We operate as a minimum of 2 days a week in the office flexi-work policy, meaning you will be able to work from home for up to 3 days a week and have flexi-hours to make those commutes that little bit easier!
What Do You Do Next?
We’re hiring right now, so hit the Apply button this minute!!
You’ll answer some questions that are related to your day-to-day job. Your answers will go through our sift process: all answers will be anonymised, randomised and then reviewed by a panel of reviewers.
If you are shortlisted, we’ll invite you to the next step, which includes two or three interviews. Also, we love giving feedback, so at the end of the application process, we'll inform you on how well you performed on skills that we test throughout the application process.
We are an equal opportunities employer
We are committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, age, disability, religion, belief, sexual orientation, marital status, or ethnicity, or is disadvantaged by conditions or requirements which cannot be shown to be justifiable.

13ffd8c8f6cc5661.description: Offer Plus Ltd is a UK based Education Consulting Agency that specialises in providing UK Master’s Degree and PhD Admission Specialist Consulting services to Chinese students who either intend to study in the UK or are already studying in the UK. Our aim is to increase student’s chances of being admitted to prestigious UK Universities and to realise their full potential by offering exceptional, bespoke services to students.We also partner with various Education experts who have extensive UK admissions work experience and also people who have first-hand experience of studying in various prestigious UK universities to offer more insightful and helpful application support.In order to expand our services and reach more Chinese students, we are seeking an experienced Marketing and Sales manager who can quickly enhance our marketing and sales capacity.Key objectivities include targeted social media campaign, pipeline build-up, sales performance drive, and long-term strategy implementation.Responsibilities1) Make strategic planning with students2) Provide application support to students3) Interview training/ Mock interviews4) Assess essays and provide feedback5) Conduct routine quality check of other mentors’ work6) Keep track of students' progress with regular adjustments if needed7) Prepare business reports/ updates to management8) Address and resolve queries, feedback, and complaints from studentsRequirements1) Bachelor’s degree or above2) In-depth knowledge of UK education system and academic cycle3) Strong academic background4) Excellent verbal and written communication skills5) Strong problem-solving skills and good attention to detail6) Fast learner and a good sense of humorWork remotelyYesJob Types: Part-time, PermanentSalary: £18.00-£22.00 per hourBenefits:Work from homeSchedule:Monday to Friday

ad0e24db6673ee6a.title: Digital Marketing Specialist
ad0e24db6673ee6a.description:
Company Description
For more than 265 years, JACOBS DOUWE EGBERTS (JDE) is inspired by its belief that it’s amazing what can happen over a cup of coffee or tea. We are fuelled by our purpose of unleashing the possibilities of coffee and tea to create a better future. Today, our coffee & tea portfolio is available in more than 100 developed and emerging markets, through a portfolio of over 50 brands that collectively cover the entire category landscape led by leading household names such as L’OR, Jacobs, Senseo, Tassimo, Douwe Egberts, Old Town, Super, Pickwick and Moccona.
JDE is part of JDE Peet’s, the world’s largest pure-play coffee and tea company, headquartered in The Netherlands.
What’s it like to work at JDE?
We are proud of our passionate, driven associates that challenge the status quo and pursue mastery in everything they do. Our goal is simple and ambitious – JDE: A coffee & tea for every cup.
At JDE, we're Made to Stand Out. Every day we are progressive in outlook, ambitious in nature, resourceful in action and decisive in approach, bringing coffee and tea moments to everyone around the world.

Job Description
If you see a Kenco, L'OR or Tassimo advert chances are THIS role had a part to play in getting it there! If you want a role that puts you at the front of driving national brand campaigns then this is the perfect role for you!
The Digital Media Specialist is at the forefront of our brands identity for our consumers working with the marketing teams, to manage and drive our campaigns through our media agency partners!
Digital Media is a crucial part of JDE’s Marketing Mix, spanning Consumer & Customer Channels & taking a multi-million-pound investment across the company’s power brands of Kenco, L’OR & Tassimo. This role is responsible for media plan delivery & driving excellence in JDE's Brands!
The Media Specialist coordinates media buying activities across key JDE retail brands, managing the operational media budget alongside internal & external stakeholders. The role encompasses implementational media planning & delivery focused across consumer channels (Programmatic Video & Display, Social Platforms, OOH etc) to drive impactful brand communications for JDE.
Key Responsibilities;
1. Media Campaign Coordination
Implementational media planning
Media Campaign set-up across digital channels
Digital creative Transcreation & Optimisation
Campaign tracking, optimisation & reporting
2. Guardian of digital media content across paid & owned channels
Building & optimises creative content across locally owned Brand Websites, Social & Ecommerce brand pages
Guardian of UK creative media asset library
Digital creative optimisation by Consumer Decision Journey & Channel
3. Operational Media Budget Management
Coordinates media budgets across UK brands ensuring campaign spends in line with plan and phasing
Prepares media PO’s for media agency partners & manages invoice queries
4. Competitive Media Spend & Creative Reporting
Sources & coordinates competitive media spend reporting
Brings share of voice & competitor communications insight to internal stakeholders

Qualifications

A passion for coffee and experience working with Brand, maybe as an internship, recent graduate role!
Some experience within a marketing role
An understanding of the different media channels used to market products
Strong Project management skills
Strong (verbal) communication skills: able to confidently interface with a broad set of stakeholders & lead external agency partners
Additional Information
*Known Internally as the Digital Media Specialist*

e1ee2acc2dcf740e.title: Health and Wellbeing Specialist
e1ee2acc2dcf740e.description:
Health and Wellbeing Specialist- Remote, UK
Description-External
UnitedHealth Group is dedicated to helping people live healthier lives and to help make the health system work better for everyone.
About the Role:
As a Health and Wellbeing Specialist, you will be the face of Optum Workplace Wellbeing to the client and their employees. Your strength lies in your ability to motivate and engage members in their journey toward better health. You will help the client build and enhance their wellbeing culture, deliver engaging health promotion activities, and increase employee health ownership. You will also use data and population feedback to identify opportunities for driving lifestyle and behavior change through increased population engagement.
Responsibilities:
Assesses population health needs using audit tools, feedback from employees, and the client to develop and deploy appropriate wellbeing solutions and programming.
Coordinates, develops, and delivers a range of health interventions to educate members on wellbeing, including an annual calendar of health improvement activities.
Partners with the client, vendors, and community resources to execute on a workplace wellbeing strategy that will result in improving the health and resiliency of the employee population.
Ensures familiarity with integrated products, programs and services in order to connect the employee population to their next best action.
Builds, leads, and expands the client’s international network of Wellness Champions to localize & expand programming to other locations and departments.
Coordinates health and wellbeing marketing and communications relating to the workplace’s physical and virtual spaces to promote healthy behaviors and health care engagement.
Reports on engagement, referrals, workplace wellbeing initiatives, and results to demonstrate improvement in baseline metrics.
Handles and stores all data in compliance with relevant data protection laws and policies (e.g. GDPR, HIPAA,etc).
Responds to client suggestions, concerns, and complaints in a timely, professional, and consistent manner while providing the gold standard in customer service.
Implements and follows all Optum Workplace Wellbeing and client policies and procedures.
Completes all assigned education coursework and trainings within the first 30 days of date of hire.
Performs any other projects and responsibilities as required.
Required Qualifications:
Degree-level qualification in a related field (e.g., health promotion, health education, occupational health, public health, or related health emphasis)
Strong experience working in either health promotion or wellbeing positions
Demonstrated understanding of delivery to national/international/multiple business locations.
Excellent influencing skills and strong stakeholder management skills at all levels, internal and external, with the ability to establish credibility and build relationships
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to present information in a clear and compelling way
Demonstrated ability to prioritise, work independently and manage own time, with limited supervision
Competent with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Preferred Qualifications:
Previous experience of working within service delivery to the highest details and standards
Experience in a similar role with national/international remit and multiple business locations
Experience of the creation and delivery of wellbeing initiatives and campaigns on an organization-wide level and across multiple locations
Sound knowledge of multiple communication channels, digital and physical, curating messaging to suit the audience
Ability to influence without direct management
Please note you must currently be eligible to work and remain indefinitely without any restrictions in the country to which you are making an application. Proof will be required to support your application.
Careers at UnitedHealth Group. We have modest goals: Improve the lives of others. Change the landscape of health care forever. Leave the world a better place than we found it. Such aspirations tend to attract a certain type of person. Crazy talented. Compassionate. Driven. To these select few, we offer the global reach, resources and can-do culture of a Fortune 6 company. We provide an environment where you're empowered to be your best. We encourage you to take risks. And we offer a world of rewards and benefits for performance. We believe the most important is the opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

47499b86dde400a5.title: Continuous Improvement Specialist
47499b86dde400a5.description:
Would you like to bring your expertise of crafting business processes to The LEGO Group?
This role will provide you with an excellent opportunity to influence decisions at all levels both around our business, specifically digital consumer engagement. With the aim to drive business process improvement through data analysis, agility and collaborative working.
Core ResponsibilitiesSupports e-commerce growth by helping to implement market expansions and other shopper improvements (e.g. new payment features) through identifying and driving necessary changes to processes and technology configuration primarily in the area of Consumer Shopper Engagement.Identifies and acts upon ongoing incremental improvement opportunities to current shopper journeys and/or related processes via a combination of team member input, available data and continuous improvement methodologiesCollaborates with product managers to assist in prioritising backlogs, estimating sprint efforts and implementing agreed changes – including coordinating testing resources when vitalActs as a workstream leader, planning and coordinating Digital Consumer Engagement activity required as part of larger e-commerce initiatives (e.g. those driven by LEGO Retail).Works with other internal and external partners to analyse end-to-end customer journeys, determining obstacles and opportunities for improvement for both online and offline experiences.Acts as continuous improvement ambassador to Digital Consumer Engagement, seeking cross-platform and cross-team harmonies, wherever possible
Play your part in our team succeeding
Business Improvement is part of the Product and Marketing Business Unit. The purpose of the global team is to improve the process for customers and the wider business, specifically in the Digital Consumer Engagement arena. Our mission is to build meaningful two-way long term relationships with our consumers by developing and maintaining efficient and effective tools and processes and to bridge business needs with IT solutions. You will be based in London and join a distributed team of 9.
Do you have what it takes?Bachelor’s degree or equivalent preferredExperience with continuous improvement - including root-cause analysis, end to end journey mapping, group facilitation, enhancement design and implementation (including basic change management)Excellent written and verbal skillsExperience with stakeholder management or close collaboration with related teamsExperience in agile ways of working, including Kanban boards – JIRA a plusLEAN Six sigma qualifications (green belt) preferredIntermediate-level competency in MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel and MS Teams
Join the global LEGO® team
What’s in it for you? Here are some of what to expect:
Family Care Leave – We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.Wellness – We want you to be your best self, so you’ll have access to the Headspace App and lots of wellbeing initiatives and programmes run by local teams where you are basedColleague Discount – We know you'll love to build so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.Bonus – We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached, you’ll be rewarded through our global bonus scheme.Your workplace – Our offices will be your primary workplace with flexibility to work from home during your working week. Your People Leader will discuss the principles of our hybrid work model, role eligibility and frequency with you.
Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of e.g. race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.

6f91083b9ef4c007.description:
BOC Limited, a Linde company

Marketing Campaigns Specialist

Woking, United Kingdom｜req6577
What you will enjoy doing
As a key member of our team you will develop and implement marketing communication campaigns to support the strategic objectives of BOC’s Industrial Gases business. You have a digital first mind-set, are passionate about marketing and delivering campaigns which drive ROI.
Use your knowledge and expertise to develop integrated marketing campaigns which focus on building awareness and driving sales leads through the most appropriate digital and offline channels
Expertly managing campaign plans, external agencies and budgets whilst continually optimising activity to meet marketing and business objectives
Work with manager and stakeholder group to establish goals and KPIs that align with business priorities and regularly report back on results
Develop close working relationships with subject matter experts to create engaging, interactive media and rich content to amplify engagement
Apply knowledge of marketing automation to set up an deploy scheduled, automated and trigger emails
Use your marketing best practice knowledge in digital marketing to inform campaigns and ensure activity meets GDPR regulations
What makes you great
You will have proven B2B marketing campaign experience with a digital focus but include traditional channels across a wide variety of media
Comfortable managing multiple concurrent campaigns and ensuring delivered on time and on budget
Experience of email marketing, marketing automation and CRM platforms ie. Salesforce Marketing Cloud
Strong analytical skills with proven experience of measuring and monitoring campaign performance i.e. Google Analytics
Digital-first mindset; strong understanding and proven record in developed digital campaigns for demand and lead generation campaigns
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Team Player with solid interpersonal and collaborative skills and the ability to develop good working relationships with people at all levels
Why you will love working with us
BOC Limited, a Linde plc company is known as a world leader in gases, engineering and healthcare operating in more than 100 countries across the globe. 5b124f1c9b210851.title: Cupra Specialist
5b124f1c9b210851.description: Cupra Sales SpecialistCUPRA Specialist. Not your usual job.With a dynamic spirit and passion for redefining the customer experience, CUPRA is more than just a car brand. CUPRA is a lifestyle and a mindset. That’s why we’re looking for people with a different outlook. Bold but with a proactive approach towards life, socially well connected with their finger on the pulse.CUPRA Specialists are accountable for providing an exceptional level of service to customers from the first point of contact, through to post-sale care. Some of your responsibilities will include: Being responsible for generating sales leads and prospects for new and pre-owned CUPRA vehicles, you will increase brand awareness by organising events to attract new customers and through producing engaging social media content. Working with the Retailer Marketing team, and CUPRA HQ, you’ll devise and manage monthly communication with customers. The successful applicant will be driven to achieve both new and pre-owned CUPRA sales targets. Helped in part by having the highest quality new CUPRA vehicle display and by sourcing the very best pre-owned CUPRA products from various sources. Delivering an exclusive and bespoke customer experience, you will be able to highlight the key features and benefits of CUPRA products, and tailor the sales experience for the customer. Customer care does not end once the sale is complete – you will be responsible for excellent post-sale care, driving customer loyalty and retention.We are looking for customer service experts rather than just looking for someone from the automotive industry – so previous experience in a dealership is not essential. Full training and support are provided to help you immerse yourself in the CUPRA values.CUPRA Specialists will be working independently, so excellent organisation and self-motivation will be needed to meet targets. You’ll be trusted to make decisions autonomously so someone with a bold approach to their work will fit right in with the CUPRA Tribe. This role could be right if you: Demonstrate previous experience providing fantastic customer service Are passionate about motor sports or the automotive industry Understand how to reach out to potential customers in the digital age.Working on-site at CUPRA Reading, you will be flexible to work full time hours between Monday – Sunday on a rota basis. Competitive base salary and benefits commensurate with role and experience plus a bonus scheme which rewards performance against targetsReference ID: CUPRA001Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £40,000.00-£68,500.00 per yearJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £30,000.00-£68,500.00 per yearAdditional pay:Commission payBenefits:Company carCompany eventsCompany pensionCycle to work schemeSchedule:Day shiftAbility to commute/relocate:Reading, RG4 8UA: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)Experience:Sales: 1 year (preferred)

6ac4fb742ebab5e0.title: CCG Partner Marketing Specialist
6ac4fb742ebab5e0.description:
Job Description
As an ingredient brand, Intel's co-marketing efforts with and through partners are essential to our go-to-market strategy and key to hitting our marketing objectives. In this role you'll join a team of committed, expert marketers to influence many kinds of customer (OEM, System Integrators, Retailers, Resellers and more). You'll ensure that Intel branding and messaging effectively reaches consumer and commercial customers through a wide range of activities including media campaigns, events, workshops, digital marketing, and much more.

Building co-marketing campaigns from scratch:
Account Planning with specific marketing objectives and KPIs with Sales Teams. Collaboration and agreement with partner buy-in
Integrate Intel narrative with key focus products
Supporting content/assets/journey mapping etc.
Tracking and reporting metrics with partner on regular cadence
Co-marketing campaign consultancy:
Expert resource to be called in to support existing co-marketing campaigns w/supported partners
Provide guidance and input on content/messaging/audience journey (CTAs etc.)/brand usage and guidelines
Monitor campaign reporting and performance. Support areas to optimise and keep campaign fresh etc.
Identify and integrate partners in Intel outbound campaign:
Develop and use Intel campaign knowledge to identify opportunities to integrate partners within UK CCG campaign. Bring proposals to campaign lead
Some opportunities can take advantage of existing funding support within Intel co-marketing programs. Others require campaign funding support e.g. case studies/stories etc.
Qualifications
Minimum qualifications are required to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.
Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research.

Minimum Qualifications:
3+ years experience in a sales and marketing environment
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in a relevant subject
Proven track record to project manage and collaborate with internal and external customers and partners
Demonstrable experience with B2B and B2C audiences
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working within co-marketing programs
What We Offer:
At Intel, you come to work in a collaborative, supportive environment, where your equally brilliant colleagues will push you to be your best. There's no fear of failure-we know that's how innovation happens. And you'll never be bored.
We offer competitive benefits and pay, opportunities for professional development and the flexibility you need to achieve balance. Intel fosters a collaborative environment allowing the brightest minds in the world to come together to achieve exceptional results.
Inside this Business Group
Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.

1baac9e1bd5dc2b4.title: Communications Specialist
1baac9e1bd5dc2b4.description:
The travel landscape has changed beyond recognition and our customers demand and deserve the very highest standards of service from us. We are recruiting for a Communications Specialist (Customer) to work closely with the Customer Communications Manager, Customer Experience and Operational teams to ensure that everyone who travels with us feels confident, cared for and ready to fly. Our aspiration is to become the number one preferred travel brand across all markets in Europe, which means we never stand still.
You`ll be delivering improvements to our customer communications through the end-to-end journey, mapping our customer journey identifying what’s working and what can be improved, developing messaging to ensure customers are informed of operational or policy-related information in the right way, and co-ordinating the implementation of the communications plan. You`ll write clear briefs, working closely with our external partners and internal channel owners to deliver the communications plan at the right time to the benefit our customers, the business, and our operations.

JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES
You`ll work closely with the Customer Experience and Operations teams to develop and execute messaging for customer policies and services across all relevant touchpoints
Develop and execute messaging for operational or bio-security changes to ensure customers arrive for their journey prepared and ready to fly
Working closely with channel owners you will lead on the co-ordination of the communications plan, ensuring it is delivered in the right time, through the right channels and in the right tone of voice
Help to map and monitor the effectiveness of the end to end customer communications across each stage of the customer journey, looking at opportunities to continuously improve our communications
Utilise our customer insight from customer surveys and operational feedback to identify customer pain-points and drive improvements
Ensure clear processes are in place to create, record and retain an auditable record of all our customer communications
Represent the easyJet Tone of Voice across the business to ensure it is understood and embedded in communications, behaviours, policies, and experience design

Requirements of the Role

A confident and clear communicator, you will be brilliant at making the complex sound simple and writing in an engaging way that everyone can understand
A self-starter, positive, flexible, and adaptable, you will be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and can inspire those around you
You will be experienced in working with stakeholders and taking the reins on co-ordinating communications for key strategic projects
Successful track record of managing multiple stakeholders and delivering projects that achieve or over-deliver on objectives
Organised with excellent attention to detail and accurate written English
Experienced in analysing results and customer insight to drive continuous improvement
Knowledge of the communications discipline through previous Customer Communications, Marketing, Digital or PR – and/or airline operational experience highly desirable
What we offer:
At easyJet, our goal is to inspire a whole generation of travellers to say “yes” to new experiences and opportunities. Our people are at the heart of our success and we think it’s important that we share the benefits of our success with them. You’d expect us to offer great travel benefits, but in addition to being able to climb on-board our flights at heavily reduced rates, you’ll also benefit from discounted rates on holidays, car hire, hotels and even get a free easyJet Plus! card.
This is a vibrant place to work. Our pace makes us exciting. Join us and you’ll share in the fun!

322189bd6cf15d82.title: Marketing Specialist
322189bd6cf15d82.description:
UK Remote
Marketing
Job Requisition Number: UKMKT56
Sophos is a worldwide leader in next-generation cybersecurity, protecting more than 500,000 organizations and millions of consumers in more than 150 countries from today’s most advanced cyberthreats. Powered by threat intelligence, AI and machine learning from SophosLabs and SophosAI, Sophos delivers a broad portfolio of advanced products and services to secure users, networks and endpoints against ransomware, malware, exploits, phishing and the wide range of other cyberattacks. Sophos provides a single integrated cloud-based management console, Sophos Central – the centerpiece of an adaptive cybersecurity ecosystem that features a centralized data lake that leverages a rich set of open APIs available to customers, partners, developers, and other cybersecurity vendors. Sophos sells its products and services through reseller partners and managed service providers (MSPs) worldwide. Sophos has major hubs around the globe. More information is available at www.sophos.com

The position for Sr. Marketing Operations Specialist provides key services to corporate and field marketing teams. Services include a range of marketing operations and marketing automation activities, with a focus on marketing campaign execution. Includes email marketing, forms creation, landing page creation, event invites, surveys, nurture programs, Martech system management and other campaign-related activities.

This role also supports core Marketing Operations functions and requires a high-level of collaboration within Marketing Operations and across several other Marketing teams. This role will focus on 90% regional activity (primarily focused on EMEA Marketing) and 10% global activity.
You will be a great fit for this role if:
You are tech-savvy, self-starting, resourceful, entrepreneurial, endlessly curious, and highly ambitious.
You have effective time management and organization skills, strong communication and interpersonal skills, a positive attitude, and a growth mindset.
You show up on time, pay attention to details, think on your feet, ask for help when you need it, and consistently demonstrate respect for others.
You are capable of handling fast paced work in an environment that challenges you to be your best.

Duties and Responsibilities

You’ll work with Field Marketing teams to develop and execute successful marketing campaigns to increase the interaction between Sophos and our target audiences
You’ll oversee the scheduling, coordination, and execution of regional email marketing campaigns
You’ll be building landing pages, surveys, webinars, and helping with events related to EMEA Marketing efforts
You’ll evaluate the performance of marketing campaigns and work with regional marketing teams to improve
You’ll need to be data savvy and a whiz in Excel as you provide reporting on activities and dig into data issues in SFDC, Eloqua, Splash, Taxi, Qualtrics, or other systems we manage.
You’ll drive split-testing initiatives with email marketing campaigns, providing feedback and recommendations to campaign owners
You’ll oversee ongoing management of Marketing Automation and CRM contact databases, updating unsubscribes, eliminating duplicates and otherwise improving contact data quality

Skills and Experience
Native or Fluent English Speaker
4-5 years’ experience in campaign execution
4-5 years’ experience with marketing automation (Eloqua, Marketo, etc.)
4-5 years’ experience working in a multi-national company serving multiple countries
Experience working in various systems for email, landing pages, events, chat, webinars, surveys, etc.
Excellent organizational skills
Ability to work in a time sensitive environment and multitask
Project, task management abilities (I.e. JIRA, Asana)
Proficient using Microsoft Office products including Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook

What’s Great About Sophos?
Our people are what makes Sophos special – we demonstrate shared vision, talent, innovation, and creativity, all of which are accompanied by a great sense of fun and team spirit.
Employee-led diversity and inclusion groups that build community within Sophos and provide internal education and advocacy (eg. Sophos Women in Tech group to improve gender parity, encourage gender-balanced leadership, and support career progression at Sophos)
Sophos Environment Network and employee challenges to contribute to sustainability and reduce our environmental footprint
Annual commitment to charity and fundraising across our global sites and volunteer days for employees to give back to local communities
Global trivia competitions to keep our minds sharp
Global Mental Health days off work for all Sophos to help employees relax and recharge
Monthly employee wellbeing webinars and training to support employee health and wellbeing
Employee rewards and thanks, such as our free annual subscription to Calm

Our Commitment To You
We’re proud of the diverse and inclusive environment we have at Sophos, and we’re committed to ensuring equality of opportunity. We believe that diversity, combined with excellence, builds a better Sophos, so we encourage applicants that can contribute to the diversity of our team. All applicants will be treated in a fair and equal manner and in accordance with the law regardless of gender, sex, gender reassignment, marital status, race, religion or belief, color, age, military veteran status, disability, pregnancy, maternity or sexual orientation. We want to give you every opportunity to show us your best self, so if there are any adjustments we could make to the recruitment and selection process to support you, please let us know.

Data Protection
If you choose to explore an opportunity, and subsequently share your CV or other personal details with Sophos, these details will be held by Sophos for 12 months in accordance with our Privacy Policy and used by our recruitment team to contact you regarding this or other relevant opportunities at Sophos. If you would like Sophos to delete or update your details at any time, please follow the steps set out in the Privacy Policy describing your individual rights. If you have any questions about Sophos' data protection practices, please contact dataprotection@sophos.com.
At Sophos, we want every organization to be protected by innovative, next-generation IT security, even those who don't have a huge IT staff. We protect organizations of all sizes, all around the world by making enterprise-grade security that is simple to deploy, manage, and use. It is our passion, and something we are truly proud of.

NTU is a great place to work. We take care of our colleagues with flexible and competitive packages, and the opportunities for genuine professional progress. 02f671f890c735ad.title: Brand Manager - CVRM
02f671f890c735ad.description:
Brand Manager - CVRM (Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolic)
London
Competitive salary & benefits
Closing date: 24th March 2022
Do you have expertise in, and passion for implementing a brand strategy? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact the Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolic sector in a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? Then AstraZeneca might be the one for you!
At AstraZeneca UK, we bring life-changing medicines to patients across England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland. As a member of the Association of the British Pharmaceutical Industry (ABPI), all of our sales, marketing and communications activities are subject to the ABPI Code of Practice. If you’re inspired by the possibilities of science to make a difference and ready to discover what you can do – join us!
Our move to Pancras Square offers us the strongest possible platform to transform the lives of patients in the UK, as the country’s leading biopharmaceutical company. It will bring AstraZeneca UK closer to our customers, partners and stakeholders in the UK’s healthcare environment, as well as foster greater collaboration with the wider AstraZeneca footprint.
Business Area
AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven BioPharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious disease. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies.
We are on a journey to bring life-saving medicines to patients. Our role in contributing to decreasing mortality rates globally is clear – shaping the future by spotting a scientifically-led commercial opportunity and acting now to operationalise and scale it.
What you'll do
Supporting the development and implementation of the area brand campaign in the local market, through sales team and channel working
Working with key clinical advocates including Specialists, and lead GPs to ensure implementation of brand strategy
Collaborating with key partners including area lead market, medical teams, cross functional team, channels and sales teams to implement brand campaigns
Delivering key marketing campaign items e.g. promotional campaign material, remote detail material, service items, training support, meetings support material, materials development, approval, production and distribution.
Essential skills and experience:
Significant pharmaceutical commercial experience with a strong performance track record
Strong sales/marketing leadership with a successful track record of growing market share
Creative marketing capabilities together with rigorous commercial business sense
Desirable:
Good experience of the UK market, with its unique NHS system
Why AstraZeneca?
At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare.
So, what’s next?
If you are inspired by the possibilities of science to make a difference and ready to discover what you can do by joining us on this exciting journey and believe you can contribute to this bold ambition – join us!
Where can I find out more?
Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn
Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook
Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram

38a418c6c6cef5ed.title: Marketing Operations Specialist/Marketing Data Analyst
38a418c6c6cef5ed.description:
Marketing Operations Specialist/Marketing Data Analyst
Location: The Speechmark, London, Southwark (blended working)
Salary: Competitive + Excellent benefits
Hours: Monday - Friday, 37.5 hours
Safety Notice: To ensure candidate and employee safety, we are continuing with our virtual hiring and onboarding processes until further notice.
Be a part of Vodafone UK Consumer where digital is at the forefront of everything we do. From the way we interact with our customers, to how we communicate in our campaigns and create data-driven propositions.
What will you be doing?
As a Marketing Data & Technology Specialist, you will have a key role in our marketing tech stack, ensuring that our digital marketing operations run smoothly, efficiently, and with a high degree of data sophistication.
In this role you’ll be working on Customer Data Platform (CDP) and Data Management Platform (DMP) to ensure we have the right breadth and depth of data, data quality, models, attributes, and segments for our digital marketing campaigns. You will also ensure our Multi-Touch Attribution (MTA) solution, Neustar, is delivering high quality insights and performance data across the digital marketing team. You will be our multi-touch attribution champion, ensuring we maximise the value from this platform.
As part of our Marketing Ops team, you will also work with other parts of our MarTech stack, including our adserver, bid management tools, data visualisation platforms, analytics, and personalisation solutions.
Who are we looking for?
Strong prior operational experience of a DMP or CDP, preferably Adobe Audience Manager and/or Tealium Audience Stream
Strong prior operational experience of Multi Touch Attribution (MTA) solutions, preferably Neustar
Strong experience working with marketing or customer databases, and intermediate or advanced knowledge of SQL and Python
Strong experience in delivering models and segments based on first party data for activation via personalisation or paid marketing

What’s in it for you?
An excellent remuneration and bonus package with 28 days holiday entitlement, in addition to bank holidays and paid leave for charity projects. We offer an extensive and flexible benefits package that can be tailored to suit you and your family. We’re proud to provide a Reconnect programme with flexibility for individuals returning to work after a career break. From our market-leading parental leave policies through to employee discounts, retail vouchers, pension plan and share schemes we are committed to supporting you throughout your career with Vodafone.

Together we can
Vodafone UK are regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority and all offers of employment for this role are subject to background checks, including criminal (DBS) and financial checks to meet the regulators standards.
Vodafone UK’s blended working approach means you’ll come to your contracted hub location office as and when needed to get things done for your role and for tasks that require it, otherwise you will be able to work from home. Our ‘Office in a Box’ home-working kit will be available for all who need it during your onboarding journey.

The Marketing Fashion Specialist will own direct communication with fashion brands on sample requests and brand coverage and support product selection for onsite content and editorial shoots.

To apply for this Marketing Fashion Assistant job in London, please contact Aquent today.

Aquent is a leading talent services company, providing marketing and creative talent, managed services, extended workforce benefits, project management, and professional development. Founded in a dorm room in 1986, Aquent now employs 10,000 people each year across eight countries. Aquent is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are valued and where everyone can contribute, grow their careers, and thrive.

Despite being primarily digital, their aim is to be the most customer-centric company in the world.

We want to make a world of difference, so it matters to us that we hire differently. Aquent is dedicated to improving inclusivity and is proudly an equal opportunities employer.

Our heritage is important to us, and we remain true to our founder’s approach of: “buy the best.”We have continued to build our brand in the UK and across our global e-commerce channels in Europe, Asia, and the US. We have an exciting growth plan, and if you’re ambitious, passionate and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, then this is the place for you.We’ve been living our luxury products for over 130 years so why not join the adventure and apply today.Job Purpose: Own the end to end delivery of all email communications to achieve the commercial objectives of the business whilst maintaining 904280e55e3e3561.title: Children's Book Marketing Lead
904280e55e3e3561.description:
About us
✋ HELLO ✋Bright Little Labs (https://www.brightlittlelabs.com/pages/about-bright-little-labs) is a kids' media company. We make kids' books, games, and products that promote critical thinking, computer science and equality. We launched on Kickstarter in 2015, and partnered with Warner Media (https://www.turner.com/pressroom/turner-international-and-bright-little-labs-sign-strategic-equity-investment) in 2018, but we're still a tiny company. We're passionate about the power of storytelling and value diverse identities and experiences, and we're proud to bring a different sort of story to kids all over the world.
Our flagship story is about Agent Asha and the Children's Spy Agency. Agent Asha is about 11-year-old Asha Joshi, a coder and secret agent for the Children's Spy Agency. Agent Asha teaches kids how the internet works and secretly covers all the computing concepts from KS1 and KS2 (more here (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ja2WXzOtBy0)). We have built an immersive spy world around Agent Asha, including activity packs (https://www.agentasha.com/collections/all-products), apps (https://apps.apple.com/gb/app/csa-spy-world/id1494104203) and a CSA website (https://www.csa.world/) so that kids can join the CSA and carry out their own top-secret missions.
THIS IS IMPORTANT: Our character - Agent Asha - is a third-generation British Indian girl from Wembley, London. We want to work with people who believe in authentic character creation and we're actively looking to work with people with lived experience of our characters and her family.
The Role: Children's Book Marketing Lead
We launched the first in our Agent Asha spy book series - Agent Asha: Mission Shark Bytes (https://www.waterstones.com/book/agent-asha-mission-shark-bytes/sophie-deen//9781406382723) - with Walker Books in the heart of lockdown during 2020. The second book in the series - Agent Asha: Operation Cyber Chop - is due to be published in June this year.
All planned publicity for our first book launch were postponed. Now that life is opening up again - including schools, bookshops, and festivals - we are seeking a children's book marketing specialist to make this book launch a success and help us engage and grow our Agent Asha audience.
Agent Asha has already been well received, paving the way nicely for the next in the series. We've been Shortlisted for the Little Rebels Award (https://www.instagram.com/p/CP8AohHHhcz/) (radical fiction for young readers) and Nominated for the CRIMEFEST Award for Best Crime Novel for Children (ages 8-12) (https://www.crimefest.com/awards-cf/#child) and have a growing fanbase of kids, parents and teachers, so there's a great springboard for the right person to spread the word.
What you'll do
With support from our team and a healthy launch budget, you will….
Devise the marketing, social and digital strategy for launch…. And then execute!
Organise and help to run key events; including a launch event with our partners at Kidzania and smaller events around the UK.
Manage PR outreach to schools, booksellers, blogs, online news/newspapers
Manage content creation across social media channels (e.g. Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn) to enhance audience engagement
Create newsletter campaigns that tie in with wider social and digital output
It's a bonus if you're comfortable working with Canva to repurpose content and manage digital campaigns, but it's not a dealbreaker.
About you
You love Children's books, especially those which have an educational or philosophical value.
You're goal oriented. You know if your ideas have worked because you've measured them.
You have at least three years experience in planning and promoting children's books campaigns
You will have a flair for writing great copy and press releases, an ability to deliver campaigns across print, digital, and great interpersonal skills.
You have very good communication skills and solid marketing skills, including digital
You're full of unusual and fun ideas around brand building and audience engagement.
If you've worked on kids products before, or if you were a kid once, that's a huge bonus.
You have experience organising events, especially with schools/community
You are well organised, and have good attention to detail.
Experience of working in a publicity team or the book industry is helpful.
Experience of multi-tasking and prioritising a busy work-load with competing demands on your time
Contract details
4 month contract, working on average 2 days per week. £200 per day, to start ASAP
We're flexible and outcome focused - we're happy to work remotely and flexibly around you.
You will be working directly with the author and the Bright Little Labs team. If successful, there may be further work going forwards. Here are a few perks:
Impact - we're small - you'll have lots of autonomy and the opportunity to shape your role
Exposure - we're a high-ish profile project and we work with exciting people and partners
Feel good - you'll be working on a project at the heart of equality, education and technology.
Fun - we're building a top-secret spy agency. If we told you more, we'd have to kill you.
Are you ready to apply?
Great! Send us a CV and covering letter telling us why you'd like to work with BLL.
Submission deadline 11pm BST 17th March
Stage one zoom interviews, and stage two shortlisted interviews will take place between 21st-25th March.
Final decision made on 28th March 2022.
Please note, we value smart people over experience and qualifications. If you're not sure you have the “right background” or are the “right fit” but you know you'd be great at the role — we'd love to hear from you.

9dabb6e813943354.title: Digital Marketing Specialist - Rider - Paid Social
9dabb6e813943354.description:
Why Deliveroo?

Why Deliveroo? When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting great food to your house in less than half an hour. Awesome right? But behind the scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challenges and an enormous opportunity ahead of us.

We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We're a technology driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world, so come and join us for the ride.

And we're just getting started

The scale of the opportunity ahead of us is immense. The global food market is valued at £7.7 trillion but only 1% of it is currently online. Contrast that with the digital disruption of countless other industries - from banking and travel to retail and communications - it's clear that our journey in the food sector has only just begun.

We are already a multi-billion pound company that has grown rapidly. Deliveroo came top in the FT's list of Europe's fastest growing 1000 companies in 2018, and we were the first company ever to win Deloitte's 'UK Top 50' two years in a row. Yet most of the extraordinary value this company will generate lies ahead of us.

We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We're a technology driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world, so come and join us for the ride

As a Digital Marketing Specialist at Deliveroo you will be a key member of the Performance Marketing team, helping to accelerate international growth.

Reporting to the Paid Social Manager, you will be responsible for executing rider focused campaigns across multiple social platforms to achieve both brand and conversion based KPIs. You'll be collaborating with local operations teams in EMEA and APAC to maximise rider acquisition and brand awareness in their respective markets.

What you'll be doing

Build and optimise campaigns to drive rider acquisition globally using social media channels (with a view to expand across other digital marketing channels as we grow).
Effectively leverage bidding/targeting strategies to ensure we meet applicant and efficiency targets
Work closely with the Strategy and Planning team to execute campaign briefs across digital channels
Analyse results, identify data trends and recommend strategic improvements
Build strong relationships with central and local marketing teams and rider operations teams.

Requirements

Experience with Facebook Ads Manager
Track record of launching best-in-class campaigns quickly and efficiently
Proficient in running A/B tests to determine effective variants
Extremely data driven with high attention to detail
Confidence operating in a fast-paced environment
Strong Excel skills

Preferred, but not required:

Experience with Smartly.io
Experience with Snapchat and TikTok
Experience with Display, Online Video, Affiliates, PPC
Experience with data visualisation tools e.g. Looker
Experience running brand or conversion lift studies

Workplace & Diversity

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth and relocation.

We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing startups in an incredibly exciting space.

913ea1733cc2a7fa.title: Senior Content Marketing Manager
913ea1733cc2a7fa.description: iTech is a high growth marketing and product development company. We build products that inform and entertain a global audience, providing unparalleled insight and guidance in the highly competitive world of iGaming and branching out into other industries - watch this space!Our story is unique! We are a bootstrapped company, having grown to 300 people today and are looking to grow to 1000+ employees by 2025. From truly epic company parties to dedicated time and resource for personal development - we strive to give you the greatest experience of your working life while producing the best work you have ever done. We are looking for the most engaged, innovative and sharpest people to build the best digital teams in the world. From our offices in London and Warsaw we bring to life a network of over 150 products across 50+ countries and 21+ languages.Will you be part of our journey?We’re looking for a talented, passionate and experienced leader to head up our content marketing / digital PR team. This is a brand new role offering you scope to develop and grow the team to achieve even more success.With a servant based leadership approach, you’ll coach and guide our four specialists to deliver high-performing campaigns and build relationships with journalists.What we absolutely need from you: Define the service offering for the Chapter and establish key processesDeliver industry leading insight and ways of working into the ChapterOverseeing multiple international digital PR campaigns, maintaining a strong overview of active campaigns, working closely with the team to optimise strategies and guide deliveryWork with the Heads of SEO and product teams to ensure Digital PR and link building activities are aligned with product objectivesUndertake audience and competitor research to identify campaign themes and formats that appeal to products target audience and online publishers to establish outreach targets.Lead on a range of tactics such as campaign-based link-building, newsjacking, social media seeding etc. to secure links and coverage for our brands.Own the performance of output, evaluate campaign success and report impact back to stakeholders.Deciding on Digital PR team member progression and suitable paths within the company together with Global Head of SEOMonitor capacity and resource levels - work with the Talent Acquisition team to ensure the right levels of team growthTicket to play: Extensive experience in a similar role leading digital PR/content marketing teams.Considerable experience managing and growing high performing teamsA strong command of the media landscape, digital PR processes and creative campaign contentAn understanding of SEO from a previous role.Team player mentality. d5e168dd05bce64c.title: Marketing - Propositions & Messaging
d5e168dd05bce64c.description:
Marketing - Propositions & Messaging Specialist
London
As a Barclays Marketing - Propositions & Messaging Specialist, you will be defining and communicating our flagship customer value propositions, in a way that differentiates us in market, and drives customer acquisition and value. You will be putting the ‘voice of the customer’ at the heart of our communications, by articulating the value that our propositions (our unique solutions and experiences) bring to customers’ lives. Ensuring the narrative is consistently communicated across audiences.
Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.
This opportunity is location flexible. We will consider requests for locating the role at an alternative Barclays’ key UK office from that advertised.
What will you be doing?
• Responsible for defining & articulating our new, complex or high-profile customer value propositions, to maximise our impact in market
Creating a ‘propositional framework’ for internal stakeholders, including; customer insights, competitor & market context, over-arching proposition and high-level narrativeConsolidating multiple sources of customer and market insight from inside & outside of the business, to create a ‘single source of truth’, to inform our proposition developmentCollaborating with multiple stakeholder teams, to understand our business opportunities and obstacles and to create propositions that will support our commercial objectivesManaging briefings with senior stakeholders across Barclays Group (including CEO and MD level relationships), and work in close collaboration with their management teams, often as part of a project team or PODIdentifying how our solutions meet customer needs, compare with competitors, and to package our solutions & experiences into high class propositionsAssisting to better understand customer questions & opportunities as we take our propositions to market. Also working with the Corporate Bank, Business Bank and BUK, to add power to our Payments propositionsProviding a well-defined value proposition that clearly articulates what we are offering, to whom, and why

What we’re looking for:
• Extensive background in client or agency side proposition development, strategic planning or communications planning
Proven experience in designing & taking customer value propositions to market, working with product and sales teams to drive commercial successAbility to make sense of multiple research & data sets, extract insight, and tell a story to the businessCreative mind-set and ability to work as an integral part of a Marketing team, and to assess creative concepts against a strategic brief
Skills that will help you in the role:
• Background in B2B and/or Financial Services is an advantage
Solid experience in heading multiple teams and stakeholders across large, complex matrix organisationsIndependent self-starter, excellent networker, and ability to hold their own at all levelsOutstanding verbal and written storytelling skills, able to articulate an idea to inspire others
Where will you be working?
In the heart of Canary Wharf, our headquarters at Churchill Place boasts onsite amenities such as; a gym, staff restaurant and deli bar, and is easily accessible by tube and bus links. With a population of around 5000 staff the atmosphere is second to none with a real buzz being created around the offices within.
