6e9047f021783399.title: Specialist, Industry Marketing
6e9047f021783399.description:
WHAT MAKES US A GREAT PLACE TO WORK:
We are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world's best places to work, a champion of diversity and a model of social responsibility. We are currently ranked the #1 consulting firm on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work list, and we have maintained a spot in the top four on Glassdoor's list for the last 12 years. We believe that diversity, inclusion and collaboration is key to building extraordinary teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive both professionally and personally. We are publicly recognized by external parties such as Fortune, Vault, Mogul, Working Mother, Glassdoor and the Human Rights Campaign for being a great place to work for diversity and inclusion, women, LGBTQ and parents.​

WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH:
The Specialist, Industry Marketing will support several industry practices (e.g. Retail, Financial Services, Consumer Products, Transportation, etc.) and work closely with our Industry Marketing Practices leaders to develop comprehensive marketing strategies that support Bain’s commercial objectives.

The Specialist will be part of a very dynamic team deploying the practice strategies, and collaborating with centers of excellence as needed (e.g. editorial, branding, CRM/email, PR, digital campaigns, events, etc.). The role will also require close collaboration with peers in the industry, capability, and account marketing functions.

WHAT YOU’LL DO:

In conjunction with Leadership, support execution of Industry Marketing strategies
Support draft iterations of practice strategy
Support industry practice content strategy execution
Coordinate Industry Practice IP creation (e.g. briefs, graphics) for industry practice's most relevant topics within region
Monitor and coordinate the identification of key stakeholders for the practice (e.g. promoters, clients, prospects, influencers, alumni, reporters, etc.)
Provide ad-hoc support to the Manager on global Practice strategy development and refinement
Assist Industry Practice Manager in operational activities such as budget and annual planning (e.g. data collection, analysis, coordination, etc.)
Provide strategic input to the Industry Practice Marketing budget and planning process
Execute recommendations as needed
Execute Industry Practice Marketing activities across campaigns
Implement campaigns working with relevant Centers of Excellence and Market reputation teams
Execute campaigns with optimal marketing mix
Support development of marketing light assets mainly but not restricted to social media (posts, short videos, etc.)
Working with Conferences & Events CoE / Market reputation teams. Identify timing, location and target audience to supervise best in class and premium events across the region
Maintain Marketing tools including webpage, content distribution platform, and bios
Nurture and support 3rd party partnerships, sponsorships, and conferences/events
Ensure activities reach key client decision-makers (e.g. promoters and influencers at clients, alumni with decision-making/influencing power, and other influencers) by leveraging all available channels
Provide analytical support as needed (e.g. reporting, data analysis, tracking) including monitoring KPIs and performance to provide a comprehensive view of the current state of industry Marketing
Track marketing budget to ensure it stays on target
Monitor and analyze campaign KPIs (e.g. click rates, leads)
Work collaboratively with Industry Marketing team and other functions
Focusing on, but not exclusively with, Capability and Account Marketing to ensure plans are aligned / complementary and to achieve Bain Marketing’s goals, provide input to continuously improve processes and effectiveness
Success will be defined by close collaboration with many different stakeholders: Practice teams (PPK), core marketing functions (including primarily account marketing, Capability Marketing, some Centers of Excellence’s, market reputation.)
Support an innovation focused function
Proactively suggest improvements in ways of working
Ensure flexibility and constant focus on innovation to adopt relevant technology and tools. Embrace the use of digital tools and data to constantly improve job efficiency

ABOUT YOU:
Required


An undergraduate degree in Marketing / Communications or business
3-5 years of relevant B2B marketing experience with a proven track record in digital marketing, campaign management, and project management
Expertise and previous experience in marketing programs and processes
Demonstrated ability to take a lead on coordinating and executing distinct projects and/or large and regional events, including managing the budget, contributing to objective/goal definition, etc.
Demonstrated ability to understand relevant industry practice marketing objectives and priorities, as well as content
Ability to proactively conceive and suggest new approaches and solutions
Effective written and oral communication skills, ability to liaise as knowledgeable Bain marketing representative with stakeholders of various seniorities with minimal input from Manager
Client-centric mindset, problem-solving and detail-orientation
Ability to remain calm and composed under pressure
Highly collaborative, enjoys successful teamwork
Flexibility and openness to adapt
Ability to meet deadlines and deal with confidential information required
Preferred:
Professional services experience
Previous experience working with an international team
Applicant must have received, or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine, and be fully vaccinated (established 2 weeks following final dose) by date of hire to be considered for U.S. based job subject to required accommodation process.

WHAT MAKES US A GREAT PLACE TO WORK:
We are proud to be consistently recognized as one of the world's best places to work, a champion of diversity and a model of social responsibility. We are currently ranked the #1 consulting firm on Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work list, and we have maintained a spot in the top four on Glassdoor's list for the last 12 years. We believe that diversity, inclusion and collaboration is key to building extraordinary teams. We hire people with exceptional talents, abilities and potential, then create an environment where you can become the best version of yourself and thrive both professionally and personally. We are publicly recognized by external parties such as Fortune, Vault, Mogul, Working Mother, Glassdoor and the Human Rights Campaign for being a great place to work for diversity and inclusion, women, LGBTQ and parents.

d369fb0703316f6e.title: Marketing Influencer Specialist - HyperX
d369fb0703316f6e.description:
With 68% of the population gaming on a weekly basis* and a large percentage of those gamers following Influencers, it’s no surprise that in this day and age influencer marketing plays an important role in reaching a wider audience and authentically promoting products and our brand within gaming. HyperX supports a wide array of Influencers and Content Creators globally, from grassroots level to some of the largest streamers in the world. The HyperX Influencer Specialist is responsible for the planning, organisation and execution of activations with the HyperX EMEA gaming talent roster and will manage the day-to-day relationship with various Ambassadors.
The role sits within the HyperX Partnerships team and works closely with the larger Marketing and Sales teams. In this role you would play a pivotal role in creating additional awareness by helping the Influencer Marketing team curate and manage the ambassador roster for EMEA. Do you have a love for all things social media, influencers, gaming, live streaming and TikTok? If you can answer yes to all (or most) of these points then you might be the perfect fit for our team of passionate professionals.
HP makes technology work for people – we succeed when we help our customers succeed. That is the essence of the HP story. And our global marketing team uses the latest best practices and a measured balance of online and offline strategies to share that story with HP’s external audiences. HP marketers work closely with the business units to ensure that all external activities align with the company’s overall business strategy. We do this by bringing our talents to bear in all phases of marketing, including strategic planning, branding, advertising, events, product and retail support, social media, the web, and analytics – all on a global scale.
Key Responsibilities
Research, qualify and manage the day-to-day relationship with the HyperX EMEA gaming influencer roster and affiliates.
Build strong relationships with gaming influencers across the gaming industry.
Create and execute bespoke marketing plans and campaigns aiming to increase the visibility of our brand and products with a wider audience.
Manage product launches for the partnerships team and own any relevant product seeding lists.
Oversee negotiations, contract drafting and tracking of deliverables for each contracted Ambassador.
Manage, Purchase Orders and shipments of products and goodies.
Manage and oversee larger activations, including any livestreams, photoshoots, meet and greets, physical events, press days, etc.
Manage the IP Usage rights, including tracking usage and informing relevant stakeholders when any rights are about to expire.
Manage the Creative for each Ambassador, including assets, content plans, bios, hero graphics as well as ensuring the Ambassadors follow our Brand Guidelines.
Support other marketing disciplines with any Influencer requests where possible, such as Channel, Digital, Social, PR, Creative, Events and Product Marketing.
Keep track of proof of execution and post activation reporting detailing the learnings of Ambassador activities.
Ensure all stakeholders are informed about the current roster (maintain an up-to-date overview) and upcoming plans with relevant regions and teams.
Support the HyperX Mission, Vision and strategies.
Ensure our Influencer roster reflects our key Target Audiences.
Continue to build the roster to be more diverse and to represent all types of gamers, in line with our vision that WE’RE ALL GAMERS.
Assist wider Partnerships team where necessary.
Education
BA or BS in Communication, Marketing or Business Management preferred.

Knowledge and Skills
Typically, 5+ years’ experience working in the Influencer Marketing for a Brand, Agency, Esports team or other related gaming industry background.
Excellent written and verbal English language abilities.
Fluency in at least one other European language (French, Spanish or German) highly preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365 Suite.
Knowledge about gaming, influencers, esports and social media.
A strong network in the gaming industry.
Desire to develop new projects, ideas and programmes.
Team player that is able to credibly communicate with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders using strong verbal, written and interpersonal skills.
Organised with good planning skills.
Creative, enthusiastic, and driven.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience with managing budgets.
#LI-POST
About HP


You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.


HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.


Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

28276290cc39ac31.title: Clinical & Professional Marketing Specialist S&RC
28276290cc39ac31.description:
Job Title
Clinical & Professional Marketing Specialist S&RC
Job Description
Philips is a global leader in health technology, committed to improving billions of lives worldwide and striving to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation. Driven by the vision of a better tomorrow.
In this role, you have the opportunity to make life better
Looking at the challenges the world is facing today Philips’ purpose has never been more relevant. The world and our customers’ needs are changing faster than ever before and while we are proud of what we do already, we know we can do more. That’s why we need you, to help us tackle increasingly complex challenges posed by ever evolving health and well-being needs.
The purpose of this exciting Clinical & Professional Marketing Specialist is to drive professional recommendation of the product categories for the assigned internal region of the zone, contribution in developing and executing the professional marketing plans, in alignment with Clinical & Professional Marketing Manager S&RC, Clinical & Professional Marketing Managers for Categories and local Commercial Leader.
You are responsible for:
Improving the lives of people with sleep & respiratory disorders by providing innovative solutions and products
Increasing brand preference and customer loyalty with professional stakeholders (indirect channel partners, DME’s, homecare providers, …)
Contribute to profitable growth by driving prescriptions from clinical societies (medical community: physicians, nurses, technicians)
Engage & educate prof. & clinical societies, customers, and organizations representing patients
Establish trusted relationships with local stakeholders in clinical and professional societies (and DME’s, dealers and HCP’s) by bringing added value and clinical and technical support
Provide the clinical benefits of Philips products and technical advice
Product demos for clinical audiences (prescribers, organizations representing patients, local HCP)
Participate in local events, congresses, etc.
Understand local Mktg. needs (congresses, studies, etc.)
Provide toolkit requirements to Business and localize toolkits, enabling lobbying, KOL engagement and connected solutions
Collaborate with Clinical & Professional marketing Manager for Categories
Owns & prioritizes KOL/clinical relationship and drives KOL/clinical engagement
Education management
Set up education program for internal and external stakeholders
Drives professional recommendation of the brand (MOR) by executing marketing strategies
Consulted in the selection and organization of participation in events to engage with the professional target audience
Contribute to localization and publication in relevant media of clinical evidence as developed by Business.
Collaborates with C&PM Manager for Categories to ensure professional marketing communication as needed is in place, support execution of local marketing activation towards professionals together with local Clinical & Professional Marketing Manager for Categories and C&PM Specialist.
Takes lead in training local teams (clinical & professional marketers, key account managers, …) and ensuring sales force effectiveness and equipment with latest clinical evidence
Collaborates with &PM Manager for Categories to deploy locally relevant professional marketing deliverables, product portfolio, and business models
Contributes to Business innovation & New Business Development projects ensuring local market portfolio/innovation and business model needs are met
You are part of: Local SRC Organization
To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience:
Deep practical knowledge of clinical and health economics domains at the department level (Pulmonology, Neurology, ENT and Sleep or Cardio Clinicians) to understand impact on customers and patient outcome.
Ability to orchestrate the influence of KOL’s and drive market development through clinical and marketing activities.
Understanding of Care pathways, and ability to recognize and potentially facilitate removing barriers for future new clinical approach on them. This effort requires significant Clinical expertise to drive medical acceptance.
Outstanding business acumen; knows the industry, can quickly learn the Philips business model and value proposition, key competitors, and other marketplace factors/dynamics while effectively working in complex matrix organization
Financial Knowledge is recommended to understands revenue & margin management
Good practical ICT knowledge and experience in implementing and using digital solutions in the Connected Care environment. Able to support users of patient management platforms (like “CareOrchestrator”) for efficient patient management.
Bringing people together and aligning them around common goals; leverages the power of Philips independent from organizational structures and reports
Champion growth of marketing- and sales colleagues across the organization
Customer intimacy: driven by a strong external focus
Problem Solving capabilities. Able to find solutions to difficult or complex issues. Drives continuous improvement via Lean
In return, we offer you a challenging, innovative environment with great opportunities for you to explore. Our benefits are very competitive and designed around your preferences, At Philips, we value that our people can be healthy and do well and that you feel cared for and listened to. We also believe that we are at our best as a company when you are at yours as a person. Thus, we offer competitive benefits, a flexible work schedule and access to regular local health & well-being focused activities.
This is in addition to:
A competitive salary and annual incentive bonus and company car or car allowance
Access to a wide variety of flexible company benefits, including matched pension contributions, and the option to purchase additional holiday
Philips University is available to all employees for learning and development opportunities.
25 days holiday allowance from the beginning, plus bank holidays
Family-friendly policies which offer enhanced maternity and paternity schemes
The Philips Employee Shop which allows employees to buy Philips products at discounted prices
An Employee Assistance Program is available for all Philips employees and their families. As well as being a confidential support line, it also offers practical financial and life management advice 24 /7 and is completely confidential
Why should you join Philips?
We are 80,000, wonderfully unique individuals, with two things in common. An unwavering sense of purpose and a relentless determination to deliver on our customers’ needs. It’s what inspires us to create meaningful solutions – the kind that make a real difference – when it matters most.
Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on innovative, customer-first health technology solutions. Help us improve the health and well-being of billions of people, every year. Ultimately creating a career that no one could have planned for. Even you.
Visit our careers website to explore what it’s like working at Philips, read stories from our employee blog, find information about our recruitment process and answers to some frequently asked questions.
Equal opportunities
Philips are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.
Should you require any reasonable adjustments to enable your participation in the interview process, please advise us of this in your application.
#LI-EU
#LI-Remote

ebb5f7768d61c30b.title: Head of UK Funds Marketing
ebb5f7768d61c30b.description:
This is an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic, diverse team within J.P. Morgan's EMEA Asset Management Business. We are actively looking for exceptionally talented individuals who are collaborative, confident and motivated to provide a first-class experience to our clients. In particular, we are looking for an individual with a passion for marketing and innovation and who can help us continue to grow our funds business in the UK.
Team overview
The UK funds marketing team partners with the UK Client Advisors servicing prospects and clients including wealth managers, IFAs and platforms.
The UK funds marketing team sits within the EMEA wide marketing community. The team partner with cross-line-of-business teams and specialist marketing functions on the day-to-day and strategic projects to drive the continual enhancement of JPMorgan's client experience.
The Head of UK funds marketing will be a member of the EMEA Marketing management team and report into the CMO, UK, Global Insurance, Global Liquidity, EMEA Institutional. The role is based in London.
The UK funds marketing team is currently comprised of three distribution marketers who would report into this role.
Role overview
The Head of UK funds marketing will set and execute the marketing strategy for the region .
There is a focus on digital first communications across web, email, social, multi-media and data management as part of the on-going development of J.P. Morgan's client experience programme. Data and measurement are key components of our strategy.
The Role
In an environment that is continuously evolving, how can you help us to be both innovative and creative in a way that sets us apart from our competitors? We're looking for someone with a business-building mindset who is comfortable and experienced in taking creative risks. The Head of UK funds marketing is a critical role within the EMEA business. You will be responsible for overseeing and driving the UK funds marketing strategy and tactics, including creating integrated campaigns and collaborating with distribution teams. The Head of UK funds m arketing will be a senior Marketing team member with a highly visible and critical role of supporting the business in the UK . To be successful in this role, you must be a strong people manager, clear communicator and understand the asset management industry.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

P rimary Marketing contact for UK funds sales team , key product partners and other key stakeholders. This includes participating in relevant management team forums.
Being fully conversant in the industry landscape and trends
Partnering across Marketing to create and support high profile, creative and innovative product marketing campaigns that deliver bottom-line results.
Working closely with channel marketing and creative services partners, as well as product strategy and sales, to execute on product collateral and thought leadership.
Influencing and working effectively with a wide range of stakeholders across all levels, regions and distribution channels.
The role includes the management of a small team and coordination with marketing colleagues across multiple disciplines.

Qualifications

Experience in the financial industry with a demonstrated track record of success
Possess the strategic vision needed to evolve the function over the medium- to long-term and the management acumen to drive shorter-term success
Prior experience liaising with related functions, including regulatory and compliance, publishing, and digital marketing
Ability to build relationships and influence across a large, matrixed organization
Strong project management and editorial skills - able to manage multiple priorities, communicate progress and effectively track deliverables to completion
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team
Open minded, respectful, collaborative and supportive of J.P. Morgan's diverse and inclusive culture
J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

afdabc93dc6dfaae.title: Digital Marketing Specialist
afdabc93dc6dfaae.description: AVO Agency is a growing Digital Marketing Agency, made up of designers and marketers with an aim to help our clients grow.We look for the best people – positive minded, enthusiastic, bright and creative individuals. We value excellence. We support each other, but also expect drive from an individual. We are looking for a creative, results-driven person to join our team as a Digital Marketing Executive, where you will work on a variety of client projects delivering high performing ads across different social media channels, specifically Facebook, Instagram and Google.What makes our company unique is we only require employees in 4 days a week.Please do not apply for this job if you have no professional experience running multiple digital campaigns.Must Haves: 3+ years agency experience using paid Social Ads.3+ years agency experience using Google Ads.Experience in creating advertising campaigns on Facebook, Instagram and Google.Excellent written skill - specifically in social-first content.Experience of audience creation and segmentation.Experience of funnel buildingThe ability to analyse results and ROAS.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £25,000.00-£35,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Bonus schemeYearly bonusBenefits:Flexible scheduleWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftAbility to commute/relocate:Ingatestone, CM4 9EE: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)Education:A-Level or equivalent (preferred)Experience:Digital marketing: 3 years (preferred)Marketing: 3 years (preferred)

4b9defa447a7d22d.title: Integrated Marketing Specialist, EMEA & Canada
4b9defa447a7d22d.description:
Help shape the next generation of ecommerce for the next generation of consumer.
About the team

The Marketing Team at StockX empowers our customers to participate in the current culture marketplace by providing concise and captivating data and storytelling about the products, people, and communities that make StockX possible. Furthermore, we drive activation, engagement, and retention through a variety of growth and performance tactics from a global + local point of view.

Our collaborative team of marketing and culture professionals provides insight for our customers to engage with the full range of product categories, from their first experience to establishing long-term brand loyalty. From global and regional campaigns, segmented and data-driven customer retention, strategic planning, performance marketing, innovative community and brand partnerships, relevant editorial features and series, and outstanding design, we understand what matters most to our customers: authenticity. When you join the Marketing Team, you will work on the frontline of customer experience ensuring that our customers stay up to date and are ready to Access the Now. Interested in joining the team? Learn more about the world of StockX through our Magazine, IG, and live marketplace.


About the role

The Integrated Marketing Specialist is a highly driven, strategic and influential cross-functional liaison between marketing, product category, country managers, and creative teams. The core focus of this job is campaign and promotional planning support, content coordination & publishing while managing communication across key internal and external partners.

What you'll do

Work cross-functionally to determine how strategic promotions fit within a specified department's overall strategy and develop detailed plans to execute and recap the initiatives accordingly
Support the creation of innovative, integrated marketing plans that fulfill internal team needs by identifying key shoppable moments throughout the year and around the world
Develop, execute, coordinate, and measure select integrated marketing campaigns tied to core markets
Maintain a comprehensive cross-functional marketing calendar to help enforce timely campaigns and promotions
Coordinate our recurring European marketing meetings
Connect the customer mindset, industry timeline, and product initiatives through all marketing channels (i.e. promos, push, editorial, email, social, video, etc.)
Directly work with internal partners (merchandising leads, global marketing teams, country managers, etc) to understand marketing needs.
Engage internal resources and partners for project/campaign planning and work to keep all efforts working in a timely and efficient manner.
Draft campaign briefs based on our tiered approach
Run reports on post-campaign retros and provide regular look-backs to provide year over year learnings
Help to optimize strategic initiatives based on prior executions and learnings
Submit Creative Asset requests (Content, Banners, Products, etc): working with the Creative Team and the International team to coordinate banner requests for content, products, promotion, and other campaigns
Manage and coordinate translation requests with agency & global marketing partners


About you

3 years' professional experience in marketing or integrated marketing role
Ability to execute and monitor simultaneous projects with high visibility and competing deadlines
Demonstrated project delivery on a global/international scope highly preferred
Effective writing, editing, and presenting skills
Fluency in French, Italian, German, or Spanish is a plus
Familiarity with digital marketing platforms and opportunities
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Knowledge of e-commerce/retail seasons and consumer habits
A passion for fashion, sneakers & streetwear, or C2C marketplaces a plus
About Us

In a world where consumers increasingly value self-expression and individuality, the market for hard-to-find fashion, collectibles, and electronics has never been hotter. Our global platform offers unique access to current culture while our data-driven, bid-ask model provides buyers with the real-time visibility to know they're getting a fair price.

With key leadership and an inspiring vision in place, we believe we're poised for significant growth: into new product verticals, new audiences, and new geographies. To get there we're looking for flexible, all-in teammates who are excited by ownership and the opportunity to take on emerging challenges.

If you're a doer who's ready to solve tough problems with plenty of laughs along the way, we'd love to hear from you. We welcome, embrace, and respect all dimensions of diversity. We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members are valued, supported, and respected—and no, you don't need to know a thing about sneakers or fashion.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the job and the general nature and level of work performed by job holders within this job. However, this job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of qualifications, skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities or working conditions associated with the position. StockX reserves the right to amend this job description at any time.

456eb7dc6fc58391.title: Product Manager
456eb7dc6fc58391.description: Company DescriptionWe founded Fixter to bring car maintenance into the 21st century. Because we believe booking an MOT in this day and age should be as simple as booking a taxi, or ordering a takeaway. Simple, streamlined and stress-free. And completely on demand.Bringing together car industry specialists and state-of-the-art digital experts, Fixter provides a complete end-to-end service with a world-class customer experience, designed to liberate car owners from the stress of booking a high street garage service.Since our start 4 years ago, we have expanded our service to 50+ cities across the UK and are now about to launch in new European countries.Job DescriptionWe believe in creating the best experience for our users while being able to move fast and operate at scale. As a Product Manager, you will bring together engineering, design, marketing and operations to constantly improve the service we deliver to our customers, drivers and affiliated garages. This ranges from A/B testing customer acquisition funnels to adding new features and building new tools to support our garage partners.This role is crucial to accelerate the development of our company and spearhead our European expansion. Working hand in hand with the Head of Product and the co-founders of the company, your main duties and responsibilities will include, but will not be limited to:Defining, communicating and executing the long-term business strategy of your product lineGathering insights about our users and translating them into actionable opportunitiesIdentifying the right success metrics and tracking them over timeDefining and delivering quarterly roadmaps with our engineering team and all key stakeholdersProblem-solving with cross-functional experts in design, engineering, growth, data science or customer supportBuilding world-class product solutions with our in-house designersQualificationsWe understand that everyone has different experiences and skillsets and just because you might not fulﬁl all our requirements it doesn’t mean we won’t talk to you. The important thing is that you:Are an outstanding problem-solver, with strong analytical skills and a passion for digital productsHave a strong track record as a product manager in a product-driven organisationHave the ability to influence and partner with design, engineering, operations and growth expertsAre super organised - able to project manage complex processes with multiple stakeholdersKnowledge of web development technologies is a plus.Like everyone at Fixter, you are also:Ambitious, with a very high standard for what is good enoughSuper entrepreneurial - you care about getting stuff done. And when obstacles inevitably get in the way, you know how to hustleSomeone who’s a team player and a positive, motivating person to be aroundAdditional InformationBe an early team member of what we believe will be one of the most famous startups of the next 10 yearsBe part of a passionate, friendly and transparent culture: you will be part of discussions on tech, product, operations and global expansion.Competitive salary & benefits, Mac laptop, pension and private medical insurance.Flexibility if you prefer to work from our cool offices in central Paris, London or from homeJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £35,000.00-£65,000.00 per yearBenefits:Casual dressCompany eventsCompany pensionCycle to work schemeFlexible schedulePrivate medical insuranceSick payWork from homeSchedule:Day shiftMonday to FridayExperience:Product Management: 2 years (preferred)Work remotely:Yes

8b5abf0f88625e93.description:
OTE £100K+ - uncapped earning potential
Estate Agent - Dealing in Prime Property - East London
Prime East London
Fine & Country East London have immediate openings for Self Employed Partner Agents in various areas of Prime East London. Previous experience is required, and area knowledge preferred
Fine & Country East London Area
Are you an entrepreneur at heart looking to take on a new challenge and make big moves in your career in 2022 or an already experienced Estate Agent, Manager, Lister or Valuer?
Would you like the opportunity to earn over £100,000 per year selling luxury homes?
Fine & Country have immediate openings for Partner Agents in various areas of prime East London

So what next?

Are you interested to find out more?

This is your chance to take back control of your career, income and time whilst also getting to work alongside a multi-award-winning, visionary team and receive personal mentoring.

or calling Steve Barrett direct on 020 8709 4800 or 07711 781 235

c0b8a144d035b8e8.title: Digital PR Specialist
c0b8a144d035b8e8.description:
Salary: £28,000 - £37,000 p/a
Evoluted is an award-winning digital agency based in Sheffield that specialises in results-focused digital marketing, bespoke web development and digital design for recognised brands and SMEs across the UK.
With a number of new client wins a fantastic opportunity has arisen for an experienced Digital PR Specialist with experience in lead Digital PR strategies and campaigns to work across our growing portfolio of content marketing.
Reporting directly to the Head of Content Marketing, you will be planning and executing results-focused content and PR strategies on behalf of our diverse portfolio of local and national clients. You will be joining an experienced enthusiastic team operating at the top of their game, but will be expected to work independently towards ambitious targets.
We’re looking for someone experienced in Digital PR who can hit the ground running with client campaigns and strategies, and who is confident sharing their expertise with the team. There is a client-facing element to this role, so you should feel comfortable with clients, boasting strong communication skills and a proactive attitude to realise success.
If this sounds like you, keep reading to learn more about the role and the perks of joining Evoluted!
Why Join Evoluted?
Competitive salaries - We’re committed to offering great salaries which reflect our teams great work, including transparent annual reviews and progression opportunities.
Flexible working - Work from anywhere in the UK, at our Sheffield office, or do a bit of both!
Personal development - We care deeply about career development, offering training opportunities, our own library of the best reads and more.
Build your brand - Get a push through social media, opportunity to talk at our own events and via our growing network to make your mark on the industry.
Discover new passions - Learn about other marketing disciplines, project management, sales, development, operations and more by being part of a diverse, interconnected digital agency.
Annual leave - We offer 25 days annual leave plus all UK public holidays.
We’re a social team - From catered lunches and post-work trips to the pub, to board game nights and our annual Big Fat Evoluted Quiz, there’s plenty of time to get social as well as work.
Key Responsibilities
Managing a portfolio of clients to deliver results-driven Digital PR strategies and campaigns
Working closely with Digital PR Executives to build relevant and top-tier links and coverage
Monitoring journalist requests and newswires for sources, comments and opportunities
Maintaining calendars and roadmaps, and regularly monitoring the news to spot outreach opportunities
Establishing lasting relationships with publications, media, influencers and journalists in a wide range of industries
Producing a wide range of press assets including emails, on-site content and directing other teams to develop creative assets
Utilising a range sources to manipulate and analyse data to create stories and campaigns
Working closely with our Content and SEO Specialists to identify link building opportunities
Leading on ideation sessions and always looking for opportunities to enhance campaigns across multiple channels
Building strong relationships with clients where you are their key point of communication
Creating reports that provide clients with meaningful insights that are clearly explained in terms that relate to their organisation’s KPIs
Supporting new business initiatives including research, analysis, proposal writing and pitching to prospective clients
Contributing to Evoluted’s marketing initiatives including the production of blog posts and studies, organising Sheffield DM and more
Requirements
You should apply for this role if:
You want to create award-winning, exciting multimedia content that resonates both with your clients and their audiences
You have experience in consistently building links through Digital PR campaigns and strategies
You have passion for and demonstrable knowledge of content marketing, PR and the broader digital marketing arena
You have experience sourcing and analysis data for use in stories and campaigns
You have previous marketing experience working at an agency or as part of an in-house team
You understand SEO, the search landscape and the role of backlinks within Google’s algorithm
You can develop knowledge about a diverse range of markets, products and services
Your superb organisational and time-management skills are the envy of your office
You live in the UK and are able to travel to our Sheffield HQ or to client meetings if required (if you love working from home... it won't be too often, don't worry!)
If you feel you’d be a great fit for the Evoluted team, use the form below to apply - we can’t wait to hear from you!

4b0adbe33c00063b.title: Paid Media Specialist (Remote)
4b0adbe33c00063b.description:
Description
Do you thrive on studying, reaching and engaging huge audiences? Are you excited about thinking up new and better ways to drive behaviour at scale through advertising? Are you looking to join a 100% remote working team without having to return to the office?
We are growing our advertising team with multiple positions open to people who love paid media and want and environment where they can learn from each other, build and test their own ideas with huge consumer audiences, and aspire to define paid media best practice for the decade ahead.


Working with paid media team and client account managers, you will be responsible for the day to day management of ad accounts for entertainment and ecommerce clients, primarily across Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and increasingly, Tik Tok, Snapchat and other new platforms. You will have full ownership of paid media strategies and production on your accounts, with a fast track option to building a specialism in a dedicated channel or sector, or taking a management route and building your own specialist team.
About Us
We work with some of the most innovative entertainment, ecommerce and startup brands in the world. We’re little known but have big impact, generating tens of millions in revenues for clients every year and consistently rated 5/5 for service, expertise and ROI.
Our experience includes global campaigns for legendary music acts from Coldplay and BTS to Pink Floyd and Shakira. But it doesn’t stop at music; we work with best-selling authors, award-winning documentary films, iconic British retailers, and the fastest-growing startups in the UK.


About the role
You’ll get a chance to work on an exciting roster of media and ecommerce clients and collaborate with their teams, without having to move or commute to an office.
You’ll join a small, energetic team running global campaigns for an impressive and fast-growing client base. You’ll get front-line experience across the board and develop rare knowledge that will make you a remarkable growth marketer in any business context throughout your career.

In this role you will:

Join Account Managers on client calls to learn about their business and discuss your results

Design, manage, optimise and scale ad campaigns across paid social, search, video and display as you see fit

Write ad copy and brief external teams with creative and tagging/tracking requirements

Research, build and revise audience targeting across paid media

Analyse data both in-platform and in Google Sheets to find issues and opportunities

Propose ad budget allocations and control costs

Reporting clear insights and recommendations for our team and clients
Build relationships and collaborate effectively with other channel owners outside of Paid Media

Innovate new advertising strategies and techniques that push ad platforms to their absolute limits

Document and maintain winning processes, and train future staff in their use

Share what you learn in this role online and at events, promoting the expertise of both our company and you personally
About You

Minimum 2 years experience in online advertising

Passionate about driving real behaviour at scale and appreciating the responsibility of influencing large audiences

Big thinker who has real ambition in massive growth for their accounts, their personal development, and the wider company

Able to be both strategic in your thinking, and very hands on in your activity

The ability to be agile across multiple clients, being able to multitask is a must.

Interested in and appreciative of wider digital marketing channels and how they interact with paid media

A proactive approach to planning and scheduling with the confidence to solve problems as they arise

Exceptional communication and reporting skills

Actively improving your knowledge and up to speed on industry developments and opportunities
What You Get

Join a team with proven, repeatable results on big-hitting global campaigns

Working directly with, and learning from, a diverse team of expert staff, stakeholders and freelancers

The environment and encouragement to have big reach and economic impact without the red tape of bigger companies

Ongoing training internally plus budget for books and courses from ConversionXL and more

Flexibility around family needs - if you need to pick up the kids, no questions asked

Meetups with a group of colleagues who like to have fun and respect each other

Regular all-expenses paid meetups with the team
Benefits
The salary range for this role is £31,000 - £38,000 depending on experience.
We’re a small and relaxed remote team of experts, and growing fast so you can get in early with a seat at the top table and take part in our growth. And rewarded for it too!

33 days annual holiday

Your own MacBook plus second display

Life insurance worth 4x salary, company pension, free eye tests

Flexibility of working from home or wherever you like!

Run global campaigns for an amazing client base

Big focus on training opportunities and career progression

To apply, send us your CV, and an introduction to why you're right for this role. We'd love to start soon, so act now and if you're right for the role, we will get in touch to book a call.

ff10d3c3b8c29173.title: Digital Paid Media Specialist
ff10d3c3b8c29173.description:
Careers that Change Lives
Are you ready to play a key role in the transformation of the digital experience of our customers in the medical technology field? Join us and guide our marketing teams to amplify our omnichannel presence and paid media campaigns.

A Day in the Life
The Digital Paid Media specialist position is responsible for contributing to strategy and executing results-driven paid search, paid social and display campaigns. This role will lead paid campaign implementation and daily management, along with optimization and reporting of assigned campaigns. This position will assist in strategy and planning responsibilities including research and insights derived from past campaign performance and cross-client learnings. A critical eye for detail is a must.

Essential duties include, but are not limited to:
Execution, optimization, and management of paid media campaigns
Analyze campaigns and user data to identify opportunities
Keyword research, expansion and negative adds
Bid modification and optimization
Landing page testing recommendation
Quality score optimization
Be up to speed on the industry trends and able to make recommendations
Provide insight and feedback to internal clients and management to improve capabilities and offering
Conduct daily and monthly monitoring and reporting as needed
Support relevant new business pitches and related work
Ensure that campaign KPIs and objectives are met both near and long term
Manage budget allocations and bid parameters to deliver the most efficient results
Lead relationship with media buy agencies and vendors.
Own the Medtronic campaign managers accounts in Social Media channels (Eg, LinkedIn, Facebook and Google)
Identify of new and innovative promotion opportunities
Support in the development of client facing solutions and deliverables, including powerpoint pitches and competitive analysis
Qualifications
Must Haves
BA or BS in Communications, Marketing or Digital Marketing
3+ years of digital marketing experience
3+ years of media buying experience
3+ SEM and paid social media buying and execution
Strong experience in media buying on Facebook, Twitter, Google, LinkedIn and Programmatic
Skilled in setting up and managing advertisements
Entrepreneurial spirit
Excellent analytical, quantitative, organizational and prioritization skills
Understanding of desktop and mobile advertising ecosystems
Experience with digital metrics and analytics.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to understand and work within a matrix organisation
Ability to understand strategic positioning and put it in practice in the creative part of the job
Advanced Microsoft office tools knowledge

Skills/competencies
Comfortable working with technical devices/information technology
Ability to plan, organise and execute a project independently and on schedule
Capability to establish and use networks to acquire information

Your Answer
Is this the position you were waiting for? Then please apply directly via the apply button!

About Medtronic
Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.
 Whatever your specialty or ambitions, you can make a difference at Medtronic - both in the lives of others and your career. Join us in our commitment to take healthcare Further, Together.
